hits._id: Decentralised budget for MPs increased

_source.content:

Later Speaker adjourned the house until 3 o’clock in the afternoon.

Meanwhile, political party leaders’ meeting is held at this moment to discuss the Parliament sessions to be held on September 3rd.

hits._id: 93 Ministerial Portfolios in National Government; Opposition Objects

_source.content: A debate is currently in progress in Parliament to obtain approval for cabinet portfolios and other ministry positions of the new national government.  Parliament Secretary General Dhammika Dasanayake said that the resolution presented by Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe includes 48 cabinet portfolios and 45 State and Deputy Ministerial posts.  Accordingly, there would be 93 ministerial posts in the new government.  However commencing the debate, JVP leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake argued that cabinet should not exceed 30, since what will be formed is not a national government.  In response, Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe said that the resolution presented by him to Parliament is in accordance with the constitution.  JVP leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake, Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe, former opposition leader Nimal Siripala de Silva, MEP leader Dinesh Gunawardana, MP Jayampathi Wickramarathna and Opposition leader R. Sampanthan were among the participants in the debate.

hits._id: Cabinet to be Sworn in Today

_source.content:
The resolution moved by Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe to obtain approval for the extended portfolios of the national government was passed in Parliament yesterday. 143 votes were obtained in favour of the resolution and there were only16 votes against. 63 members were absent when the vote took place. Accordingly the resolution passed with an excess of 127 votes.
Meanwhile the cabinet of the new government is due to be sworn in before President Maithripala Sirisena this noon at the Presidential Secretariat. Premier Ranil Wickramasinghe too will be attending the occasion. 48 cabinet ministers and 45 state and deputy ministers are due to be sworn in today. Accordingly the total number of ministerial, state ministerial and deputy ministerial posts in the National Government will be 93.

hits._id: Empty budget; vote against it; says Opposition leader in Parliament.

hits._id: Finance Ministry calls for proposals for Budget 2018

_source.content:
Ministry of Finance is calling for proposals from all stakeholders including the general public to be included in the Budget 2018, to presented in Parliament in November this year.
 
The Finance Ministry said those proposals are essential for the Government to ensure its economic and other targets are achieved.
 
People are invited to submit their proposals to the Ministry of Finance, The Secretariat, Colombo 01, or to email: info@itmd.treasury.gov.lkbefore 15th of October, 2017.
 
The Minister of Finance and Mass Media Mangala Samaraweera will present Budget 2018 in the Parliament on 9th of November 09.

hits._id: Parliament Will Not Vote On Constituent Assembly Tomorrow

_source.content:
The Parliament will not vote tomorrow evening on the amended proposal for the establishment of a Constitutional Assembly to draft a new constitution.
The debate will be held this afternoon and tomorrow. Parliament will convene tomorrow morning and the vote will not be taken up in the evening.

hits._id: Update: 2016 Budget Passed With 2/3 Majority

_source.content:
The first budget of the 'consensus government' passed a short while ago at the Second Reading, with a two thirds majority in Parliament.
There were 159 votes in favour and only 52 against. 13 MPs were absent, including Ex- President Mahinda Rajapaksa.
As expected, the United National Party (UNP) Parliamentarians and Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) Parliamentarians supporting the government voted for the budget. The Tamil National Alliance (TNA) and Opposition MP Lakshman Seneviratne also supported the budget. Meanwhile, Arumugam Thondaman and Douglas Devananda also supported the budget.
The United People’s Freedom Alliance (UPFA) MPs in opposition and the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) decided to oppose the budget.

hits._id: President request specialist doctors not to migrate

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena requested specialist doctors and nurses not to migrate in order to preserve the standards of the local health service.

He was speaking during the committee stage budget debate on Sports, Health and Nutrition ministries in parliament today.

President Sirisena also invited Sri Lankan expatriate specialist doctors to return to the country.

Heated arguments were exchanged among house members today in connection with the tear gas attack on former local government members of the Joint Opposition near the entrance of the parliament last Saturday.

Joint Opposition leader Dinesh Gunawardana questioned the speaker to declare his stance, over the tear gas attack.

A tense situation erupted as parliamentarians from both the ruling and joint opposition intervened in the argument.

Meanwhile, JVP MP Sunil Handunnetti questioned about UNP MP Ananda Aluthgamage bringing a branch from a teak tree into the house chamber.

In addition, JVP MP Anura Kumara Dissanayake questioned when deputy speaker used parliament privileges to express his views as the Cricket Board chairman during the committee stage debate of the Sports ministry.

hits._id: UPDATE :Video:The highest budgetary allocation for next year for national security.

_source.content:
The appropriation bill which includes the estimate of the government expenditure for 2014 was presented to parliament today by leader of the house minister Nimal Siripala De Silva.
According to the appropriation bill the estimated government expenditure for 2014 is 1542.25 billion rupees which is an increase of 15.5% from last year’s government expense.
The total amount of government loans during last year stood at 1295 billion rupees and but has come down to 1100 billion rupees this year.
The highest expenditure has once again been reserved for defence and accordingly 253.9 billion rupees has been set aside for the Ministry of Defence and Urban Development while 283.9 billion rupees was set aside for defence last year.
38.8 billion rupees has been set aside for the ministry of education which is a 2% increase in comparison to last year.








UPDATE Tuesday, 22 October 2013 - 07:19 PM
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Appropriation Bill for 2014 presented to parliament.
Tuesday, 22 October 2013 - 04:20 PM
The government Appropriation Bill for 2014 was presented to parliament today.

As Minister of Finance, President Mahinda Rajapaksa will deliver the budget speech on November 21st.

The budget debate on the second reading will begin on November 23rd and continue for a week while the vote will be taken on November 29th.

-------------------------------------------------------------------
2014 appropriation bill presented in parliament today,253 billion rupees for defence
Tuesday, 22 October 2013 - 01:08 PM
Sri Lanka is kicking off the budget process for 2014 presenting spending limits or appropriations for ministries in parliament today.

In what is called the first reading of the budget Appropriation Bill for 2014 the administration is seeking parliamentary approval to spend 1,542 billion rupees, up 30 percent from a year earlier.

The total government spending does not correspond directly to the numbers presented in the annual budget table in the so-called second reading of the budget where the deficit and tax proposals to bridge are also outlined by the finance minister.

The appropriation bill also sets a borrowing limit of 1,100 billion rupees for 2014, down 15 percent, from the 1,295 billion rupees set in the appropriation bills for 2013.

The amounts may vary depending on the tenor and maturities falling due in any given year.

Among key spending amounts set for ministries include 253 billion rupees for defence and urban development down from 289 billion rupees a year earlier, ports and highways 144 billion rupees up from 131.4 billion rupees.

Figures presented in parliament showed the defence ministry getting its highest ever allocation for spending in 2014, marginally higher than the 249 billion rupees budgeted for this year.  Defence and police together account for nearly 12 percent of the governments total estimated spending of 2.54 trillion rupees in 2014, marginally lower than the 2.56 trillion this year.

hits._id: 11 Ministerial Posts & 15 Cabinet Portfolios to SLFP

_source.content:
Already 43 Ministers have been appointed in the national government and 42 among them swore in today (4th) before the President. Mangala Samaraweera swore in earlier as the Minister of Foreign Affairs. With him the total number of ministers appointed is 43.
11 MPs who swore in today are from the SLFP.

Nimal Siripala De Silva - Minister of Transport
S.B. Dissanayake - Minister of Social Empowerment and Welfare
W.D.J. Seneviratne - Minister of Labor and Trade Union Relations
 Anura Priyadarshana Yapa - Minister of Disaster Management
Susil Premajayantha - Minister of Technology, Technical Education and Employment
Mahinda Samarasinghe - Minister of Skills Development and Vocational Training
Mahinda Amaraweera - Minister of Fisheries and Water Resources
Ranjith Siyambalapitiya – Minister of Power and Renewable Energy
Duminda Dissanayake – Minister of Agriculture
Chandima Weerakkodi - Minister of Fuel and Petroleum Gases
Dayasiri Jayasekara - Minister of Sports

 President stated at the swearing-in ceremony that 15 MPs of the SLFP will be receiving Cabinet ministerial posts.  
The resolution for the appointment of 48 cabinet ministers passed in Parliament yesterday (3rd). Since President Maithripala Sirisena himself is holding a ministerial post only 4 cabinet ministers are yet to be sworn-in.
Premier Ranil Wickramasinghe addressed the gathering at the swearing-in ceremony. He said that solutions for the main problems in the country are expected from the national government established for the next two years.

hits._id: Special Parliamentary session underway

_source.content:
The special Parliamentary session to mark the 70th anniversary of Sri Lanka Parliament is now underway.
President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and other MP's are in the Chamber attending the session.
Meanwhile, addressing the session, President Maithripala Sirisena said a new Constitution which protects rights of the masses within a unitary state will strengthen the Parliament further.

hits._id: No intention to be the President again- former President

_source.content:
Even though the government has a two-third majority in parliament now, the situation could change considering the current political situation, former president MP Mahinda Rajapaksa said.
During a discussion with Foreign Correspondents yesterday, he said that his intention was to topple the government in 2017.
He explained that there is friction between the UNP and SLFP, and this would affect the country’s future.
The former president, replying to a question by journalists, said that he had no intention to be the president again.
He added that however he can govern the country without becoming its head.
When asked if he would serve as the Prime Minister under current President Maithripala Sirisena he replied saying if the current PM Ranil Wickremesinghe can he can also work with someone he knows since 1970.

hits._id: Today is the last day of the budget debate.

hits._id: New Zealand PM John Key Meets President

hits._id: Cabinet reshuffle within this week?

_source.content:
Cabinet reshuffle within this week?"Political sources say that a cabinet reshuffle will take place before the end of this week.
 
Sources say some of the key Cabinet portfolios would be changed.
 
Minister Sagala Rathnayake has already informed that he would quit the portfolio of Law and Order.
 
Meanwhile, the parliamentarians of United People’s Freedom Front and Sri Lanka Freedom Party yesterday (Feb. 19) decided to remain in government and back President Maithripala Sirisena.
 
Minister S. B. Dissanayake disclosed this following a meeting with President Maithripala Sirisena at the President’s Secretariat last afternoon.
 
It was revealed that President Sirisena has requested the MPs not to quit the government.
 
Meanwhile, former President Mahinda Rajapaksa responding to journalists at the Parliamentary Complex said that President Sirisena is protecting Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.
 
He pointed out if he wants he can use the executive powers to oust the PM.

hits._id: Final budget vote today

_source.content: The vote on the 3rd and final reading of the Budget 2018 will be held in Parliament today (09).The budget which was presented by Finance and Media Minister Mangala Samaraweera was debated for a period of one month. The estimated government expenditure for 2018 is 3,982 billion Rupees. The 2nd reading of the budget was approved on the 16th of last month where 151 voted for it and 58 voted against.The Joint Opposition and JVP voted against the budget. However, former President Mahinda Rajapaksa was not present at the time of the voting.

hits._id: Vehicle permits restored for ex. grade state employees

_source.content:
Vehicle permit concession to be granted for executive grade employees in the state sector once in 10 years and it would be restricted to maximum of two permits, Prime Minister (PM) Ranil Wickramasinghe informed Parliament a short while ago.
This comes amidst trade union action launched by Sri Lanka Administrative Service Association, the GMOA and other public services.
Wickramasinghe also said that under the new proposal, a maximum of two permits will be issued per person.
The government had earlier said that the vehicle permits would be abolished. However, amidst growing criticism, the government later said that it will offer Rs one million instead of the permit to buy vehicles.

hits._id: President and Ex-President meet

President Maithripala Sirisena and former President Mahinda Rajapaksha met today at Kotte Raja Maha Viharaya.
The Head of the State and Ex-President and UPFA MP met at a religious ceremony organized to celebrate the appointment of Rev. Kotapitiye Rahula Thera as the Deputy Prelate of Kotte Kalyani Samagri Dharma Mahasangha Sabha.
The President Maithripala Sirisena offered the traditional Buddhist fan (Vijinipatha) to Rev. Kotapitiye Rahula Thera in order to officially proclaim the appointment.
Former President offered Atapirikara to the newly appointed Deputy-Prelate.

hits._id: 2018 appropriation bill to be presented in Parliament

_source.content:
State Minister of Finance Eran Wickramaratne will present the Appropriation Bill outlining allocations to be made for each Ministry for 2018,  to parliament today (09) for its first reading.
According to the Appropriation Bill presented by the Minister of Finance and Mass Media Mangala Samaraweera to the Cabinet of Ministers last month, the expected expenditure for the year 2018 is Rs. 3,982 billion, which is 10.5 percent more than 2017 estimate.
While recurrent expenditure is estimated to be at Rs. 1309 billion, the government has allocated Rs. 668 billion for capital expenditure.
Total government revenue is estimated at Rs. 2,175 billion. The government plans to borrow Rs. 1,813 billion.
Minister Samaraweera is expected to deliver the budget speech in parliament on the 9th of November for the Second Reading Debate.
The Ministry of Finance and Mass Media announced that public views and proposals for the 2018 budget will be accepted up until 18th of October.

Heated arguments over the budgetary allocations for the Education Ministry took place in parliament today as well.

hits._id: Foreign Minister of Norway calls on PM

_source.content:
A new chapter has been opened in the history of the two countries, said Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe. He made this observation yesterday following a bilateral discussion with Foreign Affairs Minister of Norway, Borge Brende. Norwegian Foreign Minister Børge Brende is expecting to meet the President Maithripala Sirisena today (08).
In a media statement after discussions with the visiting Norwegian delegation, Foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera said a special session in parliament on Saturday (January 9) will form a constitutional council which will draft the new constitution.
Stating that Sri Lanka’s multicultural identity was a strength to the country, Norwegian Foreign Minister Børge Brende in his statement said the reconciliation process was fully supported by Norway.
Brende, will be the first Norwegian minister to visit Sri Lanka since 2006, the Norwegian Foreign Ministry said in a statement, according reports.

hits._id: Japan has a special role to play in the reconciliation process in SL - PM addressing the Japanese Parliament

_source.content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasingha addressing the Japanese Parliament a short while ago stated that Japan has a special role to play in the reconciliation and economic development of Sri Lanka.
Meanwhile, Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe stated that Japan will give maximum support for the measures taken by the new Sri Lankan government to build national reconciliation.
Update: Tuesday, 06 October 2015 - 9:11-------------------------------------------------Update:Premier Ranil Wickramasinghe has commenced addressing the Japanese ParliamentPremier Ranil Wickramasinghehas already commenced addressing the Japanese Parliament. He is the third foreign leader honored with the opportunity to address the Japanese Parliament.
Update: Tuesday, 06 October 2015 - 8:24-------------------------------------------------Sri Lanka – Japan bilateral discussions today; PM to address Japanese Parliament. Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe, who is on an official visit to Japan, will address the Japanese Parliament today. 
Only two state leaders have been given an opportunity to address the Japanese Parliament in its history.
The two leaders are Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and US President Barak Obama.
He is also expected to hold another round of discussions with Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe today and call upon Emperor Akihito.
Meanwhile, Japanese Minister of Foreign Affairs Fumio Kishida yesterday pledged his government's fullest support to Sri Lanka in its efforts to create a new country through good governance and technological advancements.
During bilateral discussions with the Sri Lankan Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe at the Imperial Hotel in Tokyo, the Japanese Foreign Minister praised the new government's efforts to restore the confidence of the international community and commended the government for adopting a non-partisan foreign policy again.

hits._id: SLFP Central Committee Meets Again

_source.content:
An SLFP Central Committee meeting will be held tomorrow with President Maitripala Sirisena at the chair.
While earlier too the SLFP Central Committee met after the General Election, the Central Committee had approved forming a National Government with the UNP.
Former Deputy Minister Shantha Bandara appointed newly yesterday to the SLFP Central Committee said that at the discussion held tomorrow, attention would be drawn on the programme of the National Government.
The Cabinet of the new national government to be formed in collaboration with the UNP and the SLFP scheduled to be sworn in, on September 2nd.
After several rounds of deep and cordial discussions, the two parties finally agreed yesterday to form a national government. 
UNP chairman Malik Samarawickrama said both parties made sacrifices to come to the conclusion.
SLFP Leader President Maitripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe had come to an agreement regarding the division of minister portfolios between the two parties.
Minister Mahinda Amaraweera representing the SLFP stated that the UNP will receive 30 portfolios and the SLFP 15.

hits._id: 70th budget to be presented in parliament today

_source.content:
Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake says that a long term development oriented budget to fulfill the aspirations of all people will be presented to parliament today at 2.00pm.
The theme of Budget 2017 is “A budget for rapid development with benefits to all”. 
It is the 70th budget of Independence Sri Lanka and the third budget by the National Unity Government.  
The Finance Ministry has received nearly 2500 public proposals to be considered for the budget. 
Budget 2017 has focused on finding solutions to issues of several sectors in the economy including unemployment, cost of living, investment promotion, education, health and agricultural issues.
Speaking to our news team, Minister Karunanayake said that he expects to present a people’s friendly budget this time.

Budget 2018 will be presented by Finance and Media Minister Mangala Samaraweera. It is his maiden budget speech. At the same time, a special Cabinet meeting will be held this afternoon under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena. Our correspondents say people are eagerly awaiting to see what they have been offered by the budget.The Chairman of the Ceylon Vehicle Importers' Association, Sampath Merenchige said customers will be relieved if any duty percentage on vehicle import is reduced. hits._id: Update: Speaker Karu Jayasuriya – Mahinda seated 2nd in the first row of the opposition.

_source.content:
The First Sitting of the Eighth Parliament commenced this morning at the Parliament chamber at Sri Jayawardanapura.
MP Karu Jayasuriya was elected Speaker, proposed and seconded by Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe and former Opposition Leader Nimal Siripala De Silva respectively.
MP Thilanga Sumathipala was appointed as Deputy Speaker and Selvam Adaikalanathan who represents the Tamil National Alliance was appointed as Deputy Chairman of Committees.
Further the Honorable Speaker Karu Jayasuriya informed the Parliament that MP Lakshman Kiriella and MP Gayantha Karunathilake will be appointed as Council Leader and Ruling Party Chief Organizer respectively.
It is also reported that former President Mahinda Rajapakshe was seated 2nd in the first row of the opposition.
Party Leaders had the opportunity to express their views after the appointment of the new Speaker.

10.11 AM : Party leaders are delivering their speeches at the moment
9.58 AM : The bizarre Parliament you have now is very complex and because of that take decisions based on public requirement – requests Anura Kumara Dissanayake, Leader of JVP
9.45 AM : MP Nimal Siripala delivered a speech about the appointment of Mr Karu Jayasuriya as Speaker. 
9.43 AM : Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe in his speech made a request from the newly appointed Speaker Mr Karu Jaysuriya to act impartially. He also made an explanation of the future programs.9.41 AM : Speaker Karu Jayasuriya was seated and ministers swore in front of the new Speaker. 9.36 AM : Karu Jayasuriya has been unanimously elected as the Speaker of the 8th Parliament.His name was proposed by Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe and seconded by former Opposition Leader Nimal Siripala De Silva.
8.00 AM : The First Sitting of the Eighth Parliament will commence at 9.30 a.m. today.
The Secretary General of Parliament Dhammika Dasanayake said, according to Parliament Standing Orders,  an MP elect for the new Parliament can sit anywhere inside the chambers until a Speaker is elected.
Parliament Secretary General Dasanayake told our news team that seating arrangements have not yet been finalized.
However seating have been already arranged for the President, the Prime Minister and the three ministers who have already been sworn in.
All MPs elect to be sworn in after a Speaker is elected for the new Parliament today.
Parliament Secretary General Dasanayake said that a Deputy Speaker and Deputy Chairman of Committees would be elected thereafter.
Later when house sits in the afternoon, President Maithripala Sirisena is to present the government’s policy statement to Parliament.

hits._id: Update: Govt. Destroys 387 Mil. Worth Blood Ivory Today

_source.content:
The Government of Sri Lanka destroyed African elephant tusks worth Rs. 368 million at Galle Face Green, which were confiscated by Sri Lanka Customs in 2012.           Update: ...........................................................
A haul of 359 pieces of blood ivory, equaling 1.5 tons worth more than 387 million rupees forfeited by Sri Lanka Customs in 2012, is being destroyed now under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena and the Premier Ranil Wickramasinghe at the Galle Face Green.The Secretary General of the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora (CITES), John E. Scanlon arrived at Sri Lanka yesterday to observe the demolition of blood ivory, the first time in South Asian region.

hits._id: Update: Video:   100% surcharge on imported gold removed. Budget-2014

_source.content: The government has removed the 100 percent surcharge on gold import with immediate effect. However the Cess on imports has been revised intending to encourage the local manufacturing sector. Besides existing special commercial good tax, Vat and National Building Levy have been added to certain goods. A consultant of the KPMG Tax Consulting firm Suresh Perera said that prices of these particular goods could go up consequent to the new tax.UPDATE : Friday, 22 November 2013 - 7:41 PM---------------------------------------Customs duty amendments effective from today.The amendments for customs duty relief put forward in the budget will be effective from today.Through these amendments, Information Technology and Business Process Outsourcing have been freed from customs duties.Accordingly IT related printing equipment and video cyber cables too are freed from tax.Energy-saving solar security discs too have been rid of tax.While customs duty on tea industry equipment  and tractors has been amended, this amendment will also cover steel and cement.It is stated in the budget this time that customs duty on Aayurvedic product industries too are subjected to amendment.While tax on frozen fish bait connected to fishing industry will be amended from today, sweetener tax  relevant to short-eat industry too will be amended.The customs duty for coco seeds that has been amended too will be implemented from today.Import tax on gold and diesel hybrid motor vehicles too has been amended.The budget says that relevant customs duty on boat production industry too will be amended. President Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday presented a people - friendly Budget 2014 that is formulated with a view to accelerating economic growth to 7.5 or 8 percent.This would help address the emerging aspirations and goals of particularly the country's low and middle income people in rural as well as urban areas at a time when Sri Lanka has reached a unique crossroads, emerging as a strong middle income economy in the Asian region.A proposal to increase the cost of living allowance given to state employees by 1200 rupees from the 1st of January was also presented during the 2014 budget by President Mahinda Rajapakse.In addition a proposal to increase the cost of living allowance for pensioners by 350 rupees and to increase the cost of living allowance for those who retired prior to 2006 by 500 rupees was also presented.The President also announced that Judges Personnel expenses allowance will be increased by 8%.Another proposal presented during the 2014 budget is to provide female entrepreneurs with interest free loans for up to 250 thousand rupees. Update :  Friday, 22 November 2013 - 8:20-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------1,200 rupees increment in Cost of Living for Government workers Fertilizer subsidy to continue - Pension for farmers.Interest-free loan for women entrepreneursA proposal to increase the cost of living allowance given to state employees by 1200 rupees from the 1st of January was also presented during the 2014 budget by President Mahinda Rajapakse.In addition a proposal to increase the cost of living allowance for pensioners by 350 rupees and to increase the cost of living allowance for those who retired prior to 2006 by 500 rupees was also presented.The President also announced that Judges Personnel expenses allowance will be increased by 8%.During his budget speech President Mahinda Rajapakse also stated that a proposal will be presented to initiate a pension scheme for farmers over 63 years of age from the 1st of January in 2014.Hence farmers over 63 will be subject to a pension with a minimum amount of 1200 rupees.Another proposal presented during the 2014 budget is to provide female entrepreneurs with interest free loans for up to 250 thousand rupees.President Mahinda Rajapakse also proposed to increase the uniform concession for supplementary nurses and paramedics from 500 rupees to 1500 rupees during his budget speech today.        In addition increasing the monthly telephone allowance of supplementary nurses and paramedics by 250 rupees was also proposed during the budget.Thursday, 21 November 2013 - 7:21 PM------------------------------------------------National Building Levy extended to Bank and Financial Sector  During his budget speech the President also stated that the Nation Building Tax of 2% will be extended to banks and financial institutions as well. Speaking further President Mahinda Rajapakse also stated that no state institution will be privatized. During his budget speech President Mahinda Rajapakse stated that the budget deficit will be reduced from 5.8% to 5.2% in 2014, 4.5% in 2015 and is expected to reduce to 3.8% in 2016 and state debt will be reduced to 65%. President Rajapakse who stated that poverty has reduced also stated regarding bringing economic development higher than inflation. Allocations were set aside for Sri Lankan Airlines, Mihin Lanka and the Sri Lanka Transport Board.------------------------------------------------Allowance for Pensioners' increasedWhile presenting the budget speech for 2014, President Mahinda Rajapaksa said that 500 rupees will be increased for Government servants retired before 2006, and 350 rupees will be given to others who retired after 2006.Thursday, 21 November 2013 - 3:31 PM------------------------------------------------Cost of Living Allowance for Government workers increasedWhile presenting the budget speech for 2014, President Mahinda Rajapaksa said that the Cost of Living Allowance for Government employees will be increased by 1,200 rupees from January 2014.Thursday, 21 November 2013 - 3:28 PM------------------------------------------------Allowance for lecturers to be increasedA proposal to increase the educational allowance of university lecturers by 5% have been presented during the 2014 budget by President Mahinda Rajapakse. In addition another proposal to increase the funding provided to Buddhist monks studying in pirivenas by 15 rupees per day and for lay students studying in pirivenas by 5 rupees per day.Thursday, 21 November 2013 - 2:28 PM------------------------------------------------Budget proposal to improve transportation in rural areas.President Mahinda Rajapakse stated that a special program will be initiated to improve transportation in rural areas during his budget speech. Elaborating further he stated that 300 million rupees will be set aside to deploy 500,000 buses in rural areas and steps will be taken to improve roads in these areas as well. Thursday, 21 November 2013 - 2:26 PM---------------------------------------------Furniture transportation license abolished.A proposal has been presented to abolish the furniture transportation license during the 2014 budget.Thursday, 21 November 2013 - 2:25 PM---------------------------------------------Female entrepreneurs to be given interest free loans up to 250,000 rupees A proposal to provide female entrepreneurs with interest free loans up to 250,000 rupees was presented during the budget today.President Rajapakse stated that the age limit to apply for these loans have increased up to 68 and for those who have passed 68 years of age can obtain a loan by naming a family member during the application process.Thursday, 21 November 2013 - 2:22 PM----------------------------------------------Veterinary officers to be given a 7500 rupee monthly allowance.During his budget speech in parliament President Mahinda Rajapakse stated that a 7500 rupee monthly allowance will be provided for veterinary officers.President Rajapakse also stated that more new officers will be recruited to improve the live stock industry.Thursday, 21 November 2013 - 1:56 PM----------------------------------------Budget deficit to be reduced to 5.2% in 2014.During his budget speech President Mahinda Rajapakse stated that the budget deficit will be reduced from 5.8% to 5.2% in 2014, 4.5% in 2015 and is expected to reduce to 3.8% in 2016.Update : Thursday, 21 November 2013 - 1:45 PM----------------------------------------------- 2014 Budget Speech Commences.President Mahinda Rajapaksa commenced his 2014 budget speech in the parliament a short while ago.Thursday, 21 November 2013 - 1:15 PM-----------------------------------------The Cabinet approves the budget for 2014.Cabinet approval was granted to the budget 2014 which is scheduled to be presented in parliament this afternoon. A senior minister told our news team that the Cabinet met this morning and approved the budget for 2014. Today’s budget will be the 68th budget presented to parliament after Independence, and it will be the 9th budget speech presented in parliament after President Mahinda Rajapaksa took office. The Appropriation Bill which announced the average government expenditure was presented in parliament on the 22nd of last month. Accordingly, the total government expenditure is 1,542 billion rupees and the highest allocation was for the Urban Development and National Security Ministry and that is nearly 254 billion rupees. The expenditure of the President is nearly 8.5 billion rupees. Nearly another 46.5 billion rupees have been allocated for education while nearly 17.7 billion rupees was given for health sector. According to the Appropriation Bill for 2014, the loans that have to be obtained to meet the total government expenditure will be over 1,100 billion rupees. President Mahinda Rajapaksa, in his capacity as the Finance Minister will inform the parliament this afternoon, how his government is going to earn revenue to meet the government expenditure for 2014.    Hiru TV will telecast live the budget speech presented in parliament by the President from 1pm this afternoon. Arrangement have also been made to present the budget speech live on Hiru News website www.hirunews.lkThursday, 21 November 2013 - 1:01 PM---------------------------------------------Next year's budget proposals to Parliament today.President Mahinda Rajapaksa is scheduled to present the 2014 budget in parliament at 1.30 this afternoon. This is the eighth budget President Mahinda Rajapaksa presents after assuming duties as Finance and Planning Minister. While the President carried out the final review of the budget document this time day-before-yesterday afternoon, Finance Ministry Secretary Dr. P. B. Jayasundara also participated in it. According to Finance Ministry sources, Budget 2014 will be looking at bringing down the deficit to 5.2 percent from 6.5 percent of the Gross Domestic Product. It is specially significant that the country has achieved an eight percent economic growth rate two years in a row for the first time. Sources said that Budget 2014 would be development oriented and SME friendly and would take the country another step closer to its coveted goal of being the ‘Wonder of Asia’. The debate on the second reading of the Budget will commence the following day and continue until November 29th. The Committee Stage debate of the Appropriation Bill will continue until December 20th. The final vote on the Budget will be taken on December 20th.

hits._id: Finance Minister says he will be presenting a development oriented budget today

_source.content:
Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake says that a long term development oriented budget to fulfill the aspirations of all people will be presented to parliament today at 2pm.
The theme of Budget 2017 is “A budget for rapid development with benefits to all”. 
It is the 70th budget of Independence Sri Lanka and the third budget by the National Unity Government.  
The Finance Ministry has received nearly 2500 public proposals to be considered for the budget. 
Budget 2017 has focused on finding solutions to issues of several sectors in the economy including unemployment, cost of living, investment promotion, education, health and agricultural issues.
Meanwhile, budget speech will be broadcast live on Hiru TV.
Latest developments of the budget proposals would be aired by Gold FM on news highlights.  
The budget highlights will also be available on our website, www.goldfmnews.lk and they will be sent out through our SMS network as well.

hits._id: Country bids farewell to the Maestro of Sri Lankan Music Industry Pandith Amaradeva

_source.content: The funeral of late veteran artiste Dr. Pandit W.D. Amaradewa was held with full state honours at the Independence Square. The mortal remains of Pandit Amaradewa were placed on a special podium adjoining the funeral pyre.  Lecturers from the University of Visual & Performing arts carried the remains of the veteran artiste from Independence Square to the podium.  Members of the Maha Sangha, religious leaders, President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe and political leaders were present at the funeral service. A large number of the public also attended the cremation ceremony. The religious rites were conducted by the Chief incumbent of Kotte Sri Kalyani Saamagri Dharma Maha Sanga Saba, Venerable Iththapaane Dhammalankara thero.Meanwhile President Maithripala Sirisena stated that the government expects to establish an Amaradeva Centre in honour of the legendary musician. He requested artists to provide necessary guidance for this purpose.  The President made these remarks while delivering a condolence message during the funeral of late veteran musician Pandith W.D. Amaradeva.

hits._id: President says free education will be protected

President Maithripala Sirisena says that the government is taking action to strengthen and protect free education as well as to provide sound vocational training for youth.

hits._id: Government policy planning would be based on Maithree Administration and election manifestos of main political parties

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena said that country’s policy planning would be designed based on his Presidential election manifesto – ‘Maithree Administration and a Stable Country’. 

This would also include inputs from the election manifestos of United National Front, UPFA, JVP and TNA.

The president made this statement during his address to the inaugural session of the 8th parliament when it met this afternoon.

A special inaugural ceremony was held today to welcome the president to parliament. 

Speaker Karu Jayasuriya was the first to arrive in the parliament complex for the ceremony.

The Speaker and the Secretary General of Parliament received Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe when he arrived for the inaugural ceremony.

After the president was received by the Speaker and the Parliament Secretary General at the main gate, a guard of honor including a 21 gun salute was held in honour of the President. 

The president was escorted into parliament chambers amid citing of Jaya Mangala Gatha and the Buddhist stanzas of ‘Devo Vassathu Kalena’.  
 
While presenting his speech to parliament, President Maithripala Sirisena explained the importance of the government of compromise, saying that several countries including South Africa have formed similar governments of compromise, where the latter formed a democratic government after ending the apartheid.

The president also stated that the two main political parties could not form a government of compromise during the post-war period, which would have presented a golden opportunity to counter the national and international challenges.
 
The President also stated that the policy of the new government of compromise will be based on his Presidential election manifesto ‘Maithree Administration and stable Country’, in addition to incorporating the abridged proposals included in the manifestos presented by main political parties including the UNF, UPFA, JVP as well as the TNA.

President Maithripala Sirisena further said that power would be delegated to Parliament in order to introduce a new electoral system and shape the Executive Presidency.

While addressing the Parliament, President Maithripala Sirisena said that if anybody finds it embarrassing to use his or her surname in public, such individuals will be given an option to use either the surname or the initials.

Speaking further, the President said a special bureau would be set up under his purview in order to repatriate the professionals and scholars who are working overseas for various reasons.

He said that his government has given priority to eliminate fraud, corruption and public waste, therefore, the culprits who have been charged of misusing public property would be dealt with, irrespective of their status.

Later the House was adjourned until 3rd of September.

Venerable Maduluwawe Sobhitha Thera and former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaranatunga were also present in the VIP gallery during President’s speech in parliament today

hits._id: 3 Member Committee to expedite Chinese Investment Projects

_source.content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe stated that a high level 3 member committee will be appointed to expedite and standardize Chinese Investment Projects in Sri Lanka.
The Premier had expressed these views during his visit to China where he met with Chinese President Xi Jinping and Chinese Premier Li Keqiang.
Minister of Special Projects Sarath Amunugama, Minister of Development Strategy and International Trade Malik Samarawickrama and Advisor to the Ministry of Policy Planning and Economic Development R Paskaralingam have been appointed as members of the Committee.
The Chinese President and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe met for discussions at the Great Wall of the People in Beijing yesterday.
Chinese President Xi Jinping said that his government is interested only in people and the policies and not individuals when extending its assistance to Sri Lanka.
The Chinese President has further stated that his government values the foreign policy adopted by the Sri Lankan government led by President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.

hits._id: Budgetary allocation for education increased by 4 fold

_source.content:
According to the Appropriation Bill for the year 2016, the total expenditure of the government is 1941 billion rupees. 
More than 67 of the appropriations are recurrent expenditure.
The total special expenditure has been accounted at 112 billion rupees.
It includes the Presidential Secretariat, the Prime Minster’s Office, and Ministry offices, the Parliament, the Opposition Leader’s Office, the Bribery Commission, the Human Rights Commission and the Election Commission.
The total allocation for the President next year is 2.3 billion rupees against 9.6 billion rupees in the previous year.
The Defence budget has risen for the year 2016 as well. 
In Contrast to the previous year, the Defence budget has gone up by 21 billion rupees. 
The Defence budget last year was 285 billion rupees and it has increased up to 306 billion rupees next year.
At the same time, it is significant to note that the allocation for Education has gone up to 185 billion rupees from the previous year’s allocation of 47.6 billion rupees.
Meanwhile,  The Health Ministry has been allocated 174 billion rupees, the Provincial Council and Local Government Ministry has been allocated 237 billion rupees and the Finance Ministry has been allocated 107 billion rupees.
The Tourism and Christian Affairs ministry, the Southern Development Ministry and National Integrated ministry, have been allocated the least amount of funds.
The presentation of Appropriation Bill is considered the first reading of the budget and the presenting of the budget by the Finance Minister is considered the second reading. 
It will be held on the 20th of November. 
The vote taking for the budget 2016 would be held on 19th of December.

hits._id: PM Proposes Committee To Consider No-confidence Motion Against Ravi K.

_source.content:
Prime Minister (PM) Ranil Wickremesinghe today proposed Parliament that the no-confidence motion against Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake should be considered by a special select committee.
He made this suggestion during a heated debate on the no-confidence motion.
United People’s Freedom Alliance (UPFA) MP Vasudeva Nanayakkara asked whether a date will be given to debate the no-confidence motion. In response, Leader of the House Lakshman Kiriella said that there was no need for a debate since the budget was passed in Parliament with an overwhelming majority.
The Prime Minister maintained that the budget was not solely a document of the Finance Minister. The government, as a whole, was responsible for it he said.

hits._id: Germany proposes EU parliament to grant GSP+ to Sri Lanka again

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena arrived at the Tegel International Airport in Berlin early this morning, to begin his two day official visit of Germany.
Chief Alliance Officer of the German government Jergen Christian Merten and Sri Lankan Embassy officials led by Ambassador Karunathilaka Amunugama received the President at the airport.
A group of Ministers including Mangala Samaraweera, Malik Samarawickrama, Mahinda Samarasinghe and Daya Gamage are part of the delegation.
Meanwhile Germany has proposed to the EU parliament to grant the GSP Plus (GSP+) concession to Sri Lanka.
Ambassador Karunathilake Amunugama stated that the German government is pleased about the development of Sri Lanka and therefore it has made this proposal to the EU.
The country will be able to increase its value of export by at least one billion rupees in the event the GSP Plus concession is reinstated.
At the same time, bilateral talks between President Maithripala Sirisena and German Chancellor Angela Merkel will be held tomorrow. 
A special Guard of Honour is to be held for the President. In addition, a tour of the parliament has also been scheduled for the president.

hits._id: 69th Independence Day celebrated with pomp and pageantry

_source.content:
The 69th Independence Day was celebrated with much pomp and pageantry this morning under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena at Galle Face Green.
Inspector General of Police, Commanders of the tri forces arrived at the ceremony and were followed by the defence secretary, secretary to the president and chief minister of the western province.
Field Marshall, Minister Sarath Fonseka and minister of ​home affairs arrived at the function subsequently.
Later on, Chief Justice and the Speaker arrived at the occasion followed by former president Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumarathunga.
Afterwards, Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe too arrived at the ceremony. 
President Maithripala Sirisena arrived at the ceremony around 8.45 AM and was greeted by the prime minister and the speaker.
Many ministers, members of the parliament and many foreign dignitaries graced the occasion.
The 69th independence day celebrations got underway with president Maithripala Sirisena hoisting the flag.
The Chief of Defence Staff, Commanders of the Tri forces and the inspector general of police escorted the president to the podium upon singing the national anthem.
Following the Military Honours President Maithripala Sirisena addressed the Nation.
President Sirisena said that reconciliation and harmony would help in bringing about political stability and development.See the video below for special moments:

hits._id: NG Minister Portfolios Rise up to 93

_source.content:
Chief Government Whip MP Gayantha Karunatilleke says that a motion is scheduled to be moved in Parliament today for increasing the number of national government’s ministry posts.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe is scheduled to move the motion in Parliament today.
Parliament General Secretary Dhammika Dassanayake told our news team that on this occasion the Prime Minister would be seeking Parliament’s approval for 48 cabinet ministries and 45 deputy and state ministries.
Accordingly the total number of ministries will be 93.
Responding to a query by our news team Chief Government Whip, MP Gayantha Karunathilaka said that a debate is also scheduled to be held with regard to this today.
Subsequently a voting will also be held with regard to increasing the number of ministries of the national government.
Meanwhile the Speaker is also scheduled to reveal in Parliament today who the Opposition Leader will be.
A letter signed by 56 UPFA MPs was also submitted to the President recently requesting that MP Kumara Welgama be appointed as Opposition Leader.
The TNA with its 16 parliamentary seats had also stated several times that the post of Opposition Leader should be given to a TNA MP.
However speaking to media recently UPFA national list MP Lakshman Yapa Abeywardhana told them that the President would take an unexpected decision with regard to the post of Opposition Leader.

hits._id: 3rd reading of the budget 2016 passed in parliament, with a majority of 109 votes

_source.content:
The 3rd reading of budget 2016 was passed in parliament, with a majority of 109 votes short while ago.

160 voted in favour of the budget, 51 voted against the budget while 13 MP’s were absent.

Meanwhile, The second reading of the budget 2016 was passed in parliament on the 2nd of December with a  majority of 107 votes.

159 MPs voted for the budget while 52 voted against.  13 MPs were absent.

SLFP and TNA MPs joined their UNP counterparts. However JVP and SLFP Joint Opposition members voted against the budget.

During the budget speech Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayaka stated that due to new amendments to the budget government expenditure has increased by 35 thousand 500 million rupees.

He further stated that as the first stage 2500 rupees will be added to the basic salary of public sector employees from next year.
 
Update: Saturday, 19 December 2015 - 18:30--------------------------------------------------- --------Final voting on the budget today
The voting on the 3rd reading of the budget 2016 will be held in Parliament this afternoon.

This is following the conclusion of the budget committee stage debate.

The committee level debate on the heads of eight ministries including Plantations, Telecommunication and Digital Infrastructure and Internal Affairs was taken up yesterday.

Meanwhile, Badulla District UNP MP Vadival Suresh told parliament yesterday that he will immolate himself inside the chambers, if the government does not take action to increase the wages of e
