hits._id: New Government is an experiment for the entire region; Says Prime Minister

_source.content: The Parliament met today under the patronage of speaker Chamal Rajapaksa for the first time after the Presidential election.President Maithreepala Sirisena was also in the parliament chambers when the house met this afternoon.With the change of the government following the Presidential election, the UNP and other factions who supported President Maithreepala Sirisena sat in the government side.The MPs who represented the previous UPFA government led by Opposition Leader Nimal Siripala de Silva sat in the Opposition side.The seating of ministers and MPs in the chamber have also been changed as the new parliament met today. Accordingly, government members sat on the speaker’s right while the Opposition sat on his left.President Maithreepala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, leader of the house Lakshman Kiriella, Ministers Karu Jayasuriya, Rauff Hakeem, Joseph Michael Perera, Gamini Jayawickrama Perera and John Amaratunga sat in the forward benches of the government side.Our parliament correspondent stated that ministers Gayantha Karunatilake, Rajitha Senarathna, Ravi Karunanayake, Mangala Samaraweera, Duminda Dissanayake, P. Harison, Kabeer Hashim, Sajith Premadasa, JHU General Secretary Patali Champika Ranawaka, All Ceylon Peoples Congress leader Rishard Badi Udin and JHU MP Athuraliye Rathana Thera were seated in the government benches.Meanwhile MEP leader Dinesh Gunawardana, CWC leader Arumugam Thondaman, MPs S.B Dissanayake, Sumeda G. Jayasena, P. Dayaratna, former prime ministers D.M. Jayarathna and Rathnasiri Wickramanayake were seated in the opposition benches.In addition, Opposition Chief Whip W.D.J. Seneviratne, EPDP leader Douglas Devananda, MPs A.L.M. Athaulla, LSSP General Secretary Tissa Vitharana, Sri Lanka Communist Party General Secretary D.E.W. Gunasekera, NFF leader Wimal Weerawansa, Democratic Left Front leader Wasudeva Nanayakkara, TNA leader R. Sampandan, Suresh Premachandran, Mawai Senadhirajah, JVP leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake and Vijitha Herath were present in parliament today.Addressing parliament, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said Sri Lanka’s new government system is an experiment for the entire countries in the region.

hits._id: Fall of SLFP in Mahinda Rajapaksha's eyes

_source.content:
Former president Mahinda Rajapaksa says the deterioration of the SLFP started from the day President Maithripala Sirisena was declared the common candidate.
The statement was made during a meeting held for  SLFP local government representatives held in Kandy yesterday.

hits._id: Government cannot increase salaries; says Opposition Leader. - Video

_source.content: Opposition Leader Ranil Wickramasinghe stated that the current government doesn’t have the potential to increase the salaries of the government workers.Following a meeting with the trade union representatives of the State Press which was held in Colombo today, the Opposition Leader stated that the salaries of government workers were not increased since 2006.

hits._id: President explains reasons to prorogue Parliament

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that Parliament was prorogued due to the tension prevailing among the parliamentarians after the “no-confidence motion” against the Prime Minister was taken up.
 
The President said this in an interview with BBC News Sinhala during his stay in London to attend the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting last week.
 
The President proroguing the Parliament is not a new thing and it was a common practice and was carried out in compliance with the Constitution.
 
President Sirisena further said that the Sri Lanka Freedom Party would not be divided with the resignation of 16 Ministers from the Government.

hits._id: 32 SLFP MP’s write to President rejecting the national government

_source.content:
A group of SLFP MPs are preparing to hand over a letter to the party’s Chairman President Maithripala Sirisena refuting the national government concept.

The party’s internal sources stated that MPs who intend to sit in the Opposition in parliament and those who would not assume positions in the national government are signing the letter these days.

The group of MPs plan to submit the letter to the party’s chairman President Maithripala Sirisena before to the next parliamentary session.

The objective is to inform the President that they intend to sit in Opposition.

Meanwhile, SLFP senior member MP Kumara Welgama stated that 30 SLFP MP’s would not support the national government and would sit in the Opposition.

In addition, our news team also inquired from Leader of Pivithuru Hela Urumaya Udaya Gammanpila, who was elected to parliament under the UPFA ticket, regarding the matter.

hits._id: UNP anniversary celebrations commence

_source.content:
The 70th Convention of the United National Party commenced under the patronage of party leader and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe at the Campbell Park grounds, Borella.
President Maithripala Sirisena arrived at the venue as the chief guest.
According to our correspondent, former president Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaranatunga, government ministers, local government representatives, political party representatives as well as foreign dignitaries were also present at the occasion.

hits._id: Swaraj assures India’s continued assistance to Sri Lanka

_source.content:
Indian External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj says that the government of President Maithripala Sirisena could always count on continues Indian support.
She said this when she called on President Sirisena at the President’s Official Residence in Colombo (01). The Indian External Affairs Minister was in Sri Lanka to attend the “Indian Ocean Conference” held in Colombo.
The President and the Indian External Affairs Minister exchanged views on ongoing and proposed joint ventures and projects, the President’s Media Division said.
She also met her Sri Lankan counterpart, Tilak Marapana this morning in his Ministry in Colombo.
Swaraj, meanwhile, called on Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe at Temple Trees, last evening.

hits._id: The Interim Budget is 99% public-centric - PM Ranil

_source.content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasingha states that the interim budget that was present by the new government targets 99 percent of the public.Addressing a meeting held in Kandy today, Prime Minister stated that the previous regime only targeted only 1 percent of the public through its budget.

hits._id: 42 cabinet Ministers take oaths; 11 from SLFP; 31 from UNP; S B and Mahinda Samarasingha receive portfolios despite election defeat

_source.content:
43 cabinet ministers of the national government have already been sworn-in in their new portfolios. 

At the same time, 11 ministers who were sworn in today are from the SLFP. 

Addressing the swearing in ceremony, the president said that 15 SLFP MPs are receiving cabinet ministerial portfolios.

The parliament approved yesterday to appoint 48 cabinet ministers in the national government. 

As President Maithripala Sirisena also holds a ministerial portfolio, 4 more SLFP MPs will be sworn in as cabinet ministers in the next few days.
 
Meanwhile, two UPFA MPs out of the 7 that were appointed to parliament through the national list received cabinet portfolios despite their election defeat. 

They are S.B. Dissanayake and Mahinda Samarasinghe.

However, Vijith Vijithamuni Soyza, Lakshman Yapa Abeywardana, M.L.A.M. Hisbullah and Angajan Ramanadan did not receive cabinet portfolios.

hits._id: UNP ready to discuss with the government regarding Geneva issues

_source.content: UNP Leader Ranil Wickramasinghe said that UNP is ready to discuss with the government regarding the Geneva issues, if the government implements the LLRC recommendations and 17th amendment.Speaking during a meeting held at Katuwana area yesterday, he further said that he is willing to incorporate other opposition parties into this discussion.

hits._id: A decisive meeting of the Government Group to be held this afternoon

_source.content: A decisive meeting of the Government group will be held under the leadership of President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe at the Presidential secretariat today.a senior Government Minister stated that discussions would be focused on  parliamentary activities beginning tomorrow as well as the Government’s next line of action.The senior Minister said further that attention would also be drawn to the agreement that was signed by the SLFP and the UNP for holding a national government.

hits._id: Change in government positions to take place within the next 2 weeks

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena said that he would make a complete change to the government sector mechanism soon.
During a meeting held in Colombo this morning, President Sirisena told several heads of media institutions that significant changes will be made to top positions of the government sector.
The President who said that the government will answer all allegations thereby entering into a new economic advent this year.
He also reiterated that the economy has rebounded and is moving on the right track with a record of foreign reserves amounting to 5 billion US dollars.
President Sirisena said that the National Audit Draft Bill will be presented to parliament soon.

hits._id: 68 thousand slums in Colombo city limits; 500 beggars and 150 children among them

_source.content:
Today is the 5th day for the Committee Stage Debate on the Appropriation Bill.
Heads of the Ministry of Provincial Councils and Local Government, Ministry of Megapolis and Western Development and Ministry of Social Empowerment and Welfare will be taken in for debate.
The minister of Megapolis and Western Province Development Patali Champika Ranawaka told parliament today that there are 60 thousand slums in Colombo city.
Participating in the committee level budget, minister Ranawaka also said there are approximately 500 beggars within the city limits and among them are 150 children.

hits._id: No Escape For Persons Involved In Corruption And Frauds – PM

_source.content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe on Wednesday (10) informed the Parliament that there will be no escape for persons who were involved in corruption and financial frauds.
He said that the present Government will never let these corruptionists to escape’ from wrongdoings they committed to the nation. He was responding to a question raised by Chief Opposition Whip Anura Kumara Dissanayake, under Standing Order 23 (2).
The Premier also emphasized that the Government will never let anyone make allegations against the Government claiming that it is on a political witch-hunt. The 'Yaha Palan' government will not interfere with legal proceedings and freedom has given to Police and the Attorney General's Department to deliver the final decision, he added. However, he pointed out that time must be given to the investigators to conduct comprehensive investigations.

hits._id: President reveals the reason for Cabinet reshuffle

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena remarked that the Cabinet reshuffle was conducted in order to proceed as one country with novel ambitions.Speaking after the oath taking of the new Cabinet portfolios, President requested from the new Ministers to work for the betterment of the country in the fullest capacity.Moreover, in a Twitter message, President Sirisena stated that this Cabinet reshuffle will provide a new impetus to Sri Lanka's development.The Prime minister, Ranil Wickramasinghe also participated in the oath taking event of new Cabinet portfolios.

hits._id: 2018 Budget speech ends

_source.content: The 2018 Budget speech was delivered by Minister Mangala Samaraweera in Parliament this afternoon.He began the speech at around 3 pm.At the start of the sessions, the Joint Opposition group leader MP Dinesh Gunawardena said that the JO MP's were obstructed while entering the Parliament.The Finance Minister continued his speech until around 5.45 pm....................................................Finance Minister starts Budget speechBudget 2018 is now being presented in Parliament by Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera. It is the 3rd Budget of the Unity Government.

hits._id: PM calls a report over Microphone disconnection incident

_source.content: Prime Minister (PM) Ranil Wickramasinghe calls a report from the Secretary General of the Parliament over disconnection of the microphone while he was addressing the house.

hits._id: Sambandan on the fence with regard to voting on the budget

_source.content:
Voting on the second reading of the budget 2016 is scheduled to be held in parliament at 5 pm today.
There were indications that the SLFP Opposition MPs had plans to oppose the budget and vote accordingly.
President Maithripala Sirisena had a meeting with those SLFP MPs in parliament this morning to hear their views.
It is reported that the President has asked the SLFP MPs who represent the Joint Opposition to vote for the budget or else to refrain from voting.
Our parliament correspondent stated that the SLFP Joint Opposition members are now having a meeting in order to arrive at a final decision with regard to voting.
Meanwhile attention has also been drawn to the stance of the TNA with regard to the voting.
When contacted Opposition leader R. Sambandan said that a final decision will be made today.
Meanwhile the EPDP, led by Douglas Devananda has already decided to vote for the budget subject to certain conditions being met.

hits._id: SLFP wont split, confirms Min. Duminda Dissanayake

_source.content:
At the special executive meeting of the SLFP held today with the patronage of party chairman, President Maithripala Sirisena, Party General Secretary Minster Duminda Dissanayake said that the forthcoming local government election and the new constitutional changes were discussed during the meeting.
He further said that all participants came to a formal agreement to work together for the party’s victory.
SLFP ministers who support President Sirisena and a number of SLFP MP’s who have allegiance with former president Mahinda Rajapaksa participated in the meeting. 
Meanwhile, The SLFP MPs in the Joint Opposition have stated that it is not necessary to form a new political party. 
Addressing a media conference held in Colombo today,  MPs Roshan Ranasinghe and Ramesh Pathirana said they anticipate the forthcoming local government polls will be led by former President Mahinda Rajapaksa under the leadership of president Maithripala Sirisena.
Despite the statements made, other alliances of the Joint Opposition, stated recently that they will contest the forthcoming local government polls as a separate party.

hits._id: Another party leaders meeting to be held on Thursday, says Chief Opposition Whip

_source.content: Chief Whip of the Opposition John Amaratunga said another meeting of party leaders will be held on next Thursday to finalize the dates for 2015 budget debate.He made this statement after the party leaders meeting presided by Deputy Speaker Chandima Weerakkody at the parliament complex today.Parliament Secretary Dhammika Dasanayake told our news team that a time table for the budget debate was also presented to the meetingPresident Mahinda Rajapaksa is to present the budget for 2015 on October 24th.The government had proposed to open the second reading of the budget debate on October 25th and continue it for 5 days.It had also proposed to hold the second reading on the 30th and Committee level debate on the 31st to be continued for 15 days.The proposal stated to hold the third reading of the budget and vote taking on November 18th.However MP John Amaratunga has said that he wanted to discuss the government time table with his parliamentary group before a final decision is taken.Chief Opposition Whip John Amaratunga further described his party position to our news team.

hits._id: Cabinet approves to cover 80% of cigarette packs warnings

_source.content: The Cabinet yesterday sanctioned legislation to make it obligatory for cigarette companies to cover the 80% of outer surface of cigarette packets with pictographic or visual warnings against the danger of smoking.Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and the Cabinet members met the Presdient Maithripala Sirisena last evening to discuss in this regard. Under the 100 days program of President Maithripala Sirisena, the government anticipates to enforce the law within this stipulated time period.At present, only 40 % of space is covered with such warnings.

hits._id: Sri Lanka celebrates centenary of Great Russian Revolution

_source.content:
The centenary commemoration of the 1917 glorious Russian revolution was held at the BMICH yesterday, under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.
The Russian Embassy in Sri Lanka had organised the event.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said that following the revolutionary win by this national government, the journey forward for the nation, had to be at a slow pace, in some instances.

hits._id: Video : Opposition leader makes a statement about rendering oppositions support.

_source.content: Opposition leader Ranil Wickramasinghe states that all the opposition parties are ready to support the government.However, the opposition leader points out the government must first accomplish certain facts.He made this statement participating at a meeting held in Maharagama.

hits._id: Swearing in for a minister post by Thissa Aththanayaka takes place today.

_source.content: Former UNP general secretary MP Tissa Attanayake who joined the Government to support President Mahinda Rajapaksa at the upcoming presidential election is scheduled to take his oaths in a Ministry post today.UNP General Secretary MP Tissa Attanayake resigned from the general secretary post last Monday and joined the Government to support the President.With former Health Minister Maitripala Sirisena coming forward as the common candidate, the Health Ministry post remains vacant.As a result of this health ministry affairs are carried out by an acting Minister.However Government Sources say that most probably that the health ministry post would be given to Tissa Attanayake.

hits._id: It is the responsibility of Govt officials to make budget benefits reach the people: President-Budget 2015

_source.content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa says that it is the responsibility of Government officials to make budget benefits reach the people properly.The President said so at a meeting held in Colombo yesterday for briefing public administration officials on next year’s budget proposals.

hits._id: Government is dedicated towards achieving reconciliation among ethnicities and religious coexistence; Says the president at Independence Day celebrations

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena stated that political stability and development can be achieved through reconciliation among ethnicities and religious coexistence. The president expressed these views addressing the 69th Independence Day celebrations held at Galle Face Green today. Religious leaders, Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe,  the speaker, Ministers and Parliamentarians and foreign dignitaries graced the Independence Day celebrations held under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena. President Maithripala Sirisena hoisted the national flag after he was greeted by the Prime Minister and the Speaker. Subsequent to singing the national anthem, the Chief of Defense Staff, Commanders of the Tri Forces and the Inspector General of Police escorted the President to the main podium. President Maithripala Sirisena paid his respects to the heroes who dedicated themselves for gaining independence as well as to those who made sacrifices in the 30 year long war.The 69th Independence Day celebrations concluded with the national anthem being sung in Tamil language.

hits._id: SLFP Collapsed When A Part Of Its Members Joined The Government

_source.content:
MP Dilum Amunugama claims that Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) split when a part of its members joined the government after Mahinda Rajapaksha lost Presidential election last year.
This was said in a media brief held in Kandy yesterday.

hits._id: President instructs immediate relief to be offered regardless of circulars; Join hands and provide support; request from Asgiri Maha Nayaka Thera

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has issued instructions to all authorities to offer immediate relief to those affected by the inclement weather, regardless of circulars.
The president issued the directives at a discussion held today at the Kalutara District Secretariat with the participation of ministers, parliamentarians, commanders of the tri-forces, police and government officials.
Meanwhile, speaking at a discussion this morning at Temple Trees, Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe expressed these views on providing relief.
Chief Prelate of the Asgiri Chapter, Most Venerable Warakagoda Gnanarathana Thera requests everyone to provide their assistance to carry out relief operations for those affected by the inclement weather.
Making a special statement this morning at the Asgiri Maha Viharaya, the Chief Prelate stated that everyone’s contribution is expected to carry out relief activities during such national disasters.

hits._id: Joint Opposition wants Prime Minister's position if they are to unite - says president

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that if all 96 UPFA parliamentarians were to stand alongside him, he would establish an SLFP government.
He made this remark while addressing the rally in Ratnapura yesterday(Jan.27).
Meanwhile, General Secretary of the Pivithuru Hela Urumaya, Udaya Gammanpila said that they were willing to form an SLFP Government, if Mahinda Rajapaksa was appointed as the Prime Minister.

hits._id: Joint Opposition Protest March Restarts from Uthuwankanda; UNP Organises a Protest March in Mawanalla

_source.content:
The Joint Opposition started its protest march for the second day from Dharmadhutha Yogasramaya in Uthuwankanda this morning.
The organizers had planned earlier to start the march from Mawanella today but they had to seek an alternative venue to restart the protest following a Court order that was issued preventing protestors entering Mawanella.
Day 2 of the march began with the participation of former president Mahinda Rajapaksa. 
Meanwhile President Maithripala Sirisena is participating in several ceremonies in Mawanalla area. 
This morning he was at  a ceremony organized by the Education Ministry titled “The nearby is the best school” held at Mederigama Vidyalaya.
afterwards the President was scheduled to participate in ceremony to distribute computers to Piri-vena and other religious school at the Auditorium of the Mawanella Pradeshiya Sabha.
Meanwhile a group of UNP supporters conducted a parade in Maawanella to greet the government led by President Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.
The parade marched towards the Pradeshiya Sabha along Hemmathagama Road from Venus Hall.

hits._id: Opposition Leader alleges that the sea has also been leased

_source.content:
Opposition  Leader Ranil Wickramasinghe states that the government has leased the  sea to foreign countries thereby causing difficulty for local fishermen.
 
The opposition leader made this statement while speaking at a public gathering held in the Puttalam region.

hits._id: JVP says the new ministry portfolios are a new year’s gift

_source.content:
The JVP says that the increasing number of ministers in the government have overlooked the people’s aspirations.
Addressing a media conference held at the party headquarters this morning, the general secretary Tilvin Silva said that the new ministry portfolios offered yesterday are a New Year’s gift.
Meanwhile the appointment of new ministers was questioned in parliament today.
Answering Mahinda Yapa Abeywardana of the Joint Opposition, Government chief whip minister Gayantha Karunathilaka said that there is more room for ministry portfolios in the national government.

hits._id: Prime Minister’s Tour to India Due This Month

_source.content: The Indian Express says that Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe is due to visit India at the end of the month. The press mentions that he is expecting to meet The Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Indian Opposition Leader Sonia Gandhi. The press further declared that Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe is due to meet a few high rank officers of the Indian government in New Delhi.  In response to an inquiry by Hiru News, a senior officer at the Prime Minister’s office said that Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe will be making his initial official overseas tour to India according to the tradition after his appointment as Prime Minister.

hits._id: 14th UN Vesak commemoration inauguration takes place in Colombo

_source.content: United Nations 14th Vesak Celebration has commenced at the BMICH currently, with the patronage of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the diplomats.President Maithripala Sirisena, Premier Ranil Wickramasinghe, indian Premier Modi and the diplomats arrived in BMICH in the morning today and they were welcomed with a traditional Udarata Dance and an orchestral performance.Later, the International Vesak Festival commenced with the President, premier and the distiguished guests lighting the traditional oil lamp.

hits._id: Tissa released on bail

_source.content: It is reported that former Health Minister and United National Party (UNP) General Secretary Tissa Attanayake was bailed out while ago with two sureties of Rs. 1 million each.Mr. Tissa Attanayake had been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) based on reports that Attanayake showed an alleged stealthy pact letter said to have signed between President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe prior to the recently concluded Presidential Election.

hits._id: Opposition charges that the decisions taken at the party leaders meeting are being altered

_source.content: The joint opposition accused the government of not adhering to the decisions taken at the Party leaders meeting, instead, acting according to their own will.Leader of the Mahajana Eksath Peramuna, Parliamentarian Dinesh Gunewardana made this statement at a media briefing held in Colombo today.MP Dinesh Gunewardana stated that although the leader of the house had wanted the entire parliament to act as the parliamentary select committee, while making amendments to the constitution, Premier Ranil Wickramasinghe had held a contrasting opinion on the matter.

hits._id: First anniversary celebrations of the Good Governance held today

_source.content:
The first anniversary celebrations of Good Governance will be held today at the Matara Sanath Jayasuriya Grounds under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.
The UNP and the SLFP that won the general election held on 17th August 2015 decided to jointly set up a national Government.
Accordingly while the national government was set up on 19th August, 2015, UNP leader Ranil Wickremesinghe was appointed its Prime Minister.
While UNP and SLFP MPs were included in the National Government, in addition, several other parties that had supported the two main parties two joined the national Government.
A Government spokesman said that a main aim of the commemorative celebration was the appreciation of the Government’s service to the people during the past year.

hits._id: Indian National security advisor meets Opposition Leader.

_source.content: Indian National Security Advisor Ajit Doval met and discussed the current political situation in Sri Lanka with Opposition Leader Ranil Wickramasinghe yesterday.The NSA is reported to have enquired about the election strategy and campaign plans of the Common platform that the UNP is backing.Doval is in to attend the ‘Galle Dialogue’ organised by Sri Lanka's Ministry of Defence.Indian National Defense Advisor held discussions with TNA seniors including its leader R. Sambandan as well yesterday.  The Hindu newspaper said that former President Chandrika Kumaratunga and Opposition’s common candidate Maitripala Sirisena too were scheduled to meet Ajith Devol.The Indian National Defence Advisor is scheduled to meet President Mahinda Rajapaksa this forenoon.

hits._id: Special parliament debate on Methotamulla and garbage dumping commences;   President also present in Parliament

_source.content:
Parliament session commenced this morning , with the objective of endorsing several gazette notifications with regard to waste management.
Our staff correspondent stated that President Maithripala Sirisena is present in parliament at this time  .
A special gazette notification effective from midnight April 20th  was issued by the president, declaring disposal of garbage by every local government institution as being essential.
An emergency parliament meeting has been convened today to obtain the approval of parliament for the special gazette notification.
Parliament has decided to hold a debate over the Meethotamulla incident and disposal of garbage later today.

hits._id: Judiciary & Bribery  re-shuffled

_source.content: Dilrukshi Dias Wickramasinghe was appointed as the new Director General for Bribery and Corruption Commission today(11) before the President.At the same time, Justice Hema Kumudini Wickramasinghe was also sworn in as judge of the Court of Appeal at the Presidential Secretariat before the President Maithripala Sirisena.

hits._id: UNP takes a decision

_source.content: Following a meeting with Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, the UNP MPs say they have agreed to continue with the present government.They say that the  SLFP MPs could leave the government if they wish.The meeting was attended by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, UNP Ministers, Deputy Ministers and State Ministers.It is reported that the PM along with UNP cabinet Minister thereafter had visited to meet President Maithripala Sirisena to convey their decisions.

hits._id: UPFA writes to President

_source.content:
It is reported the General Secretary of the United People’s Freedom Alliance Minister Mahinda Amaraweera had handed over a letter to the President last night (Feb. 18) saying that the Sri Lanka Freedom Party is seriously considering leaving the Unity Government.
 
A senior SLFP Minister told our news team that a final decision regarding this will be taken at the Parliamentary group meeting scheduled to be held today.
 
The President will then move to seek the view of the Supreme Court regarding the appointment of a new Prime Minister.
 
The UPFA MPs had informed the President last night that their stance regarding the Good Governance Government, was that, it would be appropriate for the SLFP to leave the government if SLFP cannot establish a government of its own.
 
Meanwhile, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and Speaker Karu Jayasuriya met with President Maithripala Sirisena last afternoon.
 
Sources disclosed that at that meeting Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe had informed the President that he would not step down from the office of Prime Minister.

hits._id: President says nobody can form a government without his blessings

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that those who day dream to gain state power by changing the number of MPs in parliament, they are not able to form a new government without his blessing.
He was addressing a ceremony to open a building at the Zonal Education Office in Hingurakkgoda today.

hits._id: Kotmale Mahaweli Maha Stupa Inaugurated [Photographs]

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe inaugurated the Mahaweli Maha Stupa built in Kotmale area today.
Seth Pirith was chanted by the Maha Sangha to invoke blessings during the occasion.
The construction of Mahaweli Maha Stupa commenced during the regime of then President J.R. Jayawardena, led by former Mahaweli Development Minister Gamini Dissanayake.
Mahaweli Maha Stupa denotes the completion of the Mahaweli Development Program.
Mahaweli stupa measures 289 ft in height and 628 ft at its perimeter, and can accommodate 4000 devotees simultaneously in its premises.     Images by: Ranjith Rajapaksha

hits._id: I am not a racist, Says Mahinda Rajapaksa

Former President, Member of the Parliament Mahinda Rajapaksha says that he is neither a racist nor an extremist.
The statement was made while participating at a people’s rally held in Hanwella yesterday.

hits._id: Indian FM Swaraj To Meet The PM Today

_source.content:
The Minister of External Affairs of India, Sushma Swaraj will undertake an official visit to Sri Lanka today to attend the Ninth Session of the India-Sri Lanka Joint Commission.
The Joint Commission, co-chaired by Sri Lankas Minister of Foreign Affairs and the India’s Minister of External Affairs will be held today in Colombo.

hits._id: The President chairs a ruling party meeting in parliament complex

_source.content: A meeting of government parliamentarians was held with the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena at the parliament complex this afternoon. According to Government sources, discussions were focused on disaster situation and providing relief to affected people during the meeting. At the same time, the proposed adjournment debate over the recent disaster due to the inclement weather has also discussed in the meeting. Those speaking on behalf of the government have also been educated on the facts that they should present at the debate on Friday.

hits._id: UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon to arrive in Sri Lanka

_source.content:
UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon will arrive in Sri Lanka on the 31st of August.
He will meet with President Maithripala Sirisena, and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, and other members of the Government and Parliament.
He will also deliver a keynote speech at a public event on the Sustainable Development Goals, in particular Goal 16, dedicated to the promotion of peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development.
While in Sri Lanka, the Secretary-General will also visit a resettlement site in Jaffna in the North of the country, and participate in an event on the role of youth in reconciliation and coexistence in Galle, in the South of the island.

hits._id: President says the rulers responsibility is to handover the task of building the country to the Youth

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena stated that it is the responsibility of the government to ensure that the Youth don’t take weapons. Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe also joined the event. President Maithripala Sirisena addressing the event stated that it is the responsibility of the rulers of the country to handover the task of building the country to the Youth. President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday engaged in an inspection tour of the Kinniya Base Hospital. A protest was being held demanding the hospital be renovated and the President responded positively.

hits._id: Government sees sufferings of people only during elections: Common Candidate Maithri

hits._id: Prime Minister to visit India on an official tour tomorrow

Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe will leave to India tomorrow on an official tour.

hits._id: Appropriation bill presented before parliament; VAT amendment draft bill to be presented in Oct

_source.content: The Appropriation Bill for next year was presented to parliament today.  Accordingly, the government’s total expenditure is Rs. 1819 billion. Finance Minsiter Ravi Karunanayake presented the relevant appropriation bill pertaining to the 2017 Fiscal year, and it is considered as the first budget reading. In comparison to the government expenditure of the previous budget, there is a reduction of Rs. 122 billion in the budget for next year. However, the allocation for the President has increased by Rs. 4.06 billion against the previous Rs. 2.39 billion.  The total allocation for the President for next year has been billed as Rs. 6.45 billion.  In addition, Rs. 5.76 billion has been allocated for the Mahaweli Development and Environment Ministry which is also coming under the purview of the President. Furthermore, the Ministry of National Integration and Reconciliation was allocated a sum of Rs. 1.83 billion. Meanwhile, Rs. 1.23 billion have been allocated for the Prime Minister.  In comparison to the previous year’s allocation for the Premier, an increment of Rs. 770 million can be observed this year.  In addition, National Policy and Economic Affairs Ministry which also comes under the purview of the Prime Minister, has been allocated Rs. 12.5 billion. Meanwhile, the highest appropriation has been allocated for the National Defence in the next year’s budget as well, which amounts to Rs. 284 billion.  Rs. 251 billion out of the total Defence appropriation has been billed for recurrent expenditure. The second biggest allocation has been made for the Ministry of Finance and the Finance Ministry has been allocated a sum of Rs. 242.2 billion. Provincial Council and Local Government Ministry has been allocated Rs. 214.1 billion, while Public Administration Ministry has been allocated Rs. 165.2 billion. In addition, Rs. 160.9 billion was allocated for the Health and Indigenous Medicine Ministry. Health ministry was allocated Rs. 174 billion in last budget. Meanwhile, it is significant that the allocation for the Education Ministry has been reduced by 41% in comparison to its allocations in the previous budget.  Education Ministry has been allocated only Rs. 76.9 billion in the budget for next year. In addition, Rs. 163.4 billion has been allocated for High Education and Highways Ministry.Meanwhile, the lowest allocation was made to the minister of Special Assignment Sarath Amunugama’s ministry, and the allocation amounts to Rs. 110 million. The second time budget reading by the Finance Minister will take place on the 10th of November, and the Budget is expected to be taken up for debate on the 10th of December.

hits._id: Suranimala Rajapaksha Dies At Aged 68

_source.content:
The Coordinating secretary to the Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe and Former Minister Suranimala Rajapaksha passed away this morning at the aged of 68 (March 14).
Mr. Rajapaksha, born in 1949, was first elected to the Parliament of Sri Lanka in 1994 and he was the Minister of School Education from 2001 to 2004. Being member of the UNP, he was appointed as the Coordinating secretary to the Prime Minister Wickremasinghe on 27 January 2015.

hits._id: Sajith - Karu sought for UNP leadership

_source.content:
The Sri Lanka Freedom Party Ministers in the government has proposed the President to remove Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe to ensure SLFP - UNP coalition government to be continued.
It is reported that SLFP Ministers have pointed out PM's economic strategies and Bond issue were the reasons for losing the February 10th Local Government election.
The discussion was held yesterday (Feb. 11).
Meanwhile, a Minister who was at the discussion told us that they proposed to appoint another leader from the UNP as the PM to form a government.
Sources of the United National Front meanwhile said that it is preparing to form a government.
It is reported that that decision has already been communicated to President Maithripala Sirisena.
This was decided when Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe met his party Ministers and MPs at Temple Trees after the election results were declared yesterday.
A group of about 50 members has proposed this to the Premier during the meeting to form their own government.
The UNF has 105 seats in Parliament and, it needs 8 more seats to claim the simple majority in the House.
UNP sources said that several deputy ministers, state ministers and Cabinet Ministers of the SLFP have pledged to join in a new government to be formed by the UNF.
It was reported that Prime Minister Wickremesinghe has discussed this matter with the President at his Official Residence yesterday.

However certain SLFP MPs are campaigning against President Maithripala Sirisena’s manifesto.He also said that the government obtained power with the mandate of the people, and therefore, they are ready to dissolve parliament at any given time as they are confident of being re-elected to power.Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said that he raised a legal question over the recent judgment issued with regard to former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa’s Fundamental Rights Petition.He said, although there is no problem for Gotabhaya Rajapaksa to file a FR petition, the problem is that certain SLFP MPs behavior against the Premier’s legal opinion.

hits._id: Update: Parliament dissolved: Election on August 17th

_source.content: Parliament dissolved: Nominations to be called from 6th to 13th July: Election on August 17th: New Parliament by 01st SeptemberParliament was dissolved with effect from last midnight.The gazette notification signed by President Maithripala Sirisena dissolving parliament was sent to the Government Press.Accordingly the general election will be held on the 17th of August, while nominations will be accepted from the 6th to the 13th of July.The new Parliament is to convene for the first time on the 01st of September.The previous general election was held in the year 2010 where the UPFA won 144 seats whereas the UNP managed only 60, Illangei Thamil Arasu Katchchi 14 and Democratic National Alliance 7.Update: Saturday, 27 June 2015 - 9:00-------------------------------------------------Parliament dissolvedGovernment sources stated that Parliament will be dissolved with effect from midnight.The gazette notification signed by President Maithripala Sirisena dissolving parliament has been sent to the State Printers.The President earlier in the day hinted that the prevailing political situation would lead to dissolving parliament without passing the 20th Amendment.

hits._id: ISIS claims responsibility for Paris Terror attacks

_source.content: ISIS has claimed responsibility for the terror attacks that took place in France. Therefore, 3 days of national mourning in France has been declared.President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe offered their condolences for the victims of the Paris attacks.President Maithripala Sirisena in a condolence message vehemently condemned the terrorist attack.Having suffered due to terrorism for many decades, Sri lanka unequivocally condemns terrorism in all its forms and manifestations.Attacks of this nature clearly indicate the urgent need for concerted measures by the global community to combat terrorism and extremism.The government and People of Sri Lanka stand in solidarity with the government of France during this time of tragic loss and suffering.Ministry of Foreign Affairs said no reports of any Sri Lankans affected in the coordinated attacks at several sites in Paris.Sri Lanka's Ambassador to France Thilak Ranaviraja stated that officials at the Embassy in Paris are in contact with relevant authorities in France to gather information on any Sri Lankans who may have been affected by the attacks.At least 120 people have been killed and 200 hurt, 80 seriously, in attacks striking several entertainment venues in Paris.President Francois Hollande has declared a state of emergency and sealed the country's borders.A hotline has been established and Sri Lankans in Paris who need assistance can contact 0033 620505232 or 0033 677048117

hits._id: I was against giving nominations to Mahinda Rajapakse from the very beginning, Mahinda will never win the election, Even if the party wins there are enough deserving senior politicians for the premiership candidacy: President

_source.content: President Maithreepala Sirisena addressed the nation yesterday (14) as scheduled.According to the statement made by the president he said that he has no intentions to disrupt the smooth functioning of the SLFP and  will continue to hold the chairmanship of the SLFP. President further said in his speech that he opposed to the decision made to give nominations to former president Rajapakse and he had expressed his concern in writing. "I want to continue as the president of this country with a parliament who will support my principles. I won the presidential elections on the 8th of January on such agreement irrespective of the political party. That is the very same reason why I dissolved the parliament when they submitted the motion of no confidence against PM Wickramasinghe to prevent Mahinda Rajapaksa from becoming Prime Minister by defeating Ranil Wickramasinghe.""I will remain impartial in the coming election and request the people to vote for those who are suitable to march forward with the January 08 mandate.""I am against giving nominations to former president Rajapakse, if at all if SLFP wins in the upcoming elections there are several deserving senior politicians to be the Prime Minsiter."

hits._id: The President says he has not forgotten the past

Addressing a ceremony to hand over letters of appointment to manpower workers of the CEB at the parliament grounds, President Sirisena said the current government has faced several challenges during a short spell.Elaborating his views the President noted that the government has taken steps to establish good relations with the international community, which was disrupted two years ago, when the regime first came to power.He also noted that in order to develop a country, the government should maintain good relations with its neighbouring states.In response to those who question the accomplishment of the government, the President stressed that the government has rebuilt ties with the international community and currently taking measures to implement initiatives failed to realize by the previous regime, two years ago.

hits._id: Update: Minister Susil's message to MR

_source.content:
National Organizer of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party Minister Susil Premajayantha has met with former President Mahinda Rajapaksa at his official residence this morning (Feb. 16).
During the meeting, he has informed the former President that the United People’s Freedom Alliance is ready to form its own government by ousting the current Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe from office.
Several Joint Opposition leaders including Basil Rajapaksa, Dinesh Gunawardena, Wimal Weerawansa and Udaya Gammanpila also took part in the discussion.
MP, Vasudeva Nanayakkara who participated in the discussion said that former President Rajapaksa had also endorsed the UPFA proposal.
Later MPs Dinesh Gunawardena, Wimal Weerawansa, Kumara Welgama, Pavitra Wanniarachchi and Udaya Gammanpila held further discussions with President Maithripala Sirisena at his Official Residence.
Following the discussion, MP Dinesh Gunawardena said that they informed the President that Joint Opposition would extend unconditional support to form a new government.
Meanwhile, UNP sources revealed that a discussion is scheduled to take place between Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and senior Ministers of the UNP this afternoon.
In addition, the Prime Minister is scheduled to make a special statement later in the afternoon
Meanwhile, Jathika Hela Urumaya had stated that there is a need to be humble enough to recognize Podujana Peramuna led by former president Mahinda Rajapaksa as the main Opposition.
In a communiqué issued with the signature of party’s General Secretary Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Jathika Hela Urumaya pointed out that the need of the hour is an urgent settlement to calm the current political climate.
Minister, Ranawaka further said that currently there is a need to form an alliance between the UNP and the new political force led by President Maithripala Sirisena in order to take the country forward.
Update : Friday, February 16, 2018 11.43...........................................
Minister Susil meets MRNational Organiser of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party, Minister Susil Premajayantha has arrived at the official residence of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, a short while ago.Meanwhile, the Joint Opposition MPs yesterday said they would support President Maithripala Sirisena unconditionally.

hits._id: Unity government’s 3rd Budget to be presented today

_source.content:
Minister of Finance and Mass Media, Mangala Samaraweera will present the 2018 Budget proposals in Parliament today (09).
 
This will be the first budget presented by Samaraweera following his appointment as the Minister of Finance and Mass Media.
 
The Budget speech will be delivered from at 3 pm.
 
Today's budget is the 71st budget of Independent Sri Lanka and the third budget of the unity government.
 
Minister Samraweera disclosed at a media briefing in Colombo yesterday (08), that the Budget contains a number of proposals providing special relief to youth.
 
The debate on the second reading of the Budget bill will take place between 10th and 16th of November.
 
Voting will take place at 5 pm on the final day.
 
The Committee stage debate will begin on 17th this month and it will continue until 9th of December.
 
The third reading of the budget or the final voting is scheduled to take place on 9th of December.
 
Special security arrangement is in place in and around Parliament premises.

hits._id: Suraksha insurance scheme for schoolchildren launched

_source.content:
The national ceremony to mark the inauguration of the ‘Suraksha’ Insurance scheme introduced by the Ministry of Education was held under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe at Temple Trees this morning (02).
The beneficiaries of this scheme will include nearly 4.5 million students between 5 to 19 years of age.
Students attending government schools, assisted private schools, non-assisted private schools, international schools and student monks are included in the scheme.
Sources from the Ministry of Education have stated that registration for the insurance scheme is compulsory and all data files relating to them are now being processed.
Students need not pay any premium for this insurance as all relevant payments are made by the government.
The Government initially allocated 2,700 million rupees towards this scheme under the 2017 budget and the scheme is being handled by the Sri Lanka Insurance Corporation.
The maximum annual cover for hospitalization and medical services for a child is Rs. 200,000.
Expenses up to Rs.100,000 at a time could be reimbursed for a child for a hospitalization.
Medical examinations fees without hospitalization could also be reimbursed.
When a child obtains treatment from a government hospital, payment of Rs.100 per day will be paid for a period of 30 days.
When in-house treatment from a government hospital is obtained, a maximum of Rs.10,000 would be paid for diagnostic laboratory tests conducted outside.
If treatment is obtained from any private hospital registered with the Health Ministry, a maximum payment of Rs.100,000 will be paid at a given time.
Children receiving treatment under the ‘Suraksha’ scheme will be entitled to a 20 percent discount on hospital charges and medical consultant fees.
This follows a discussion between the Education Minister and the Private Hospital Association and Consultant Medical Practitioners’ Association.
The maximum room charges for a day paid at a private hospital, ward at a government hospital or a fee-levying Ayurveda Hospital is Rs.5000.
Maximum room charges paid per annum will be Rs.60, 000.
There is also a provision to obtain insurance cover for treatment and doctors charges, even without hospitalization, as there is an annual cover up to a maximum of Rs.10,000 for 7 types of illnesses.
In the event of a child’s death due to an accident, Rs.100, 000 will be paid as compensation.
In the event of a parents death Rs.75,000 with be allocated towards the child’s education.
If a student suffers permanent disability, Rs.100, 000 will be paid as compensation while Rs.50,000 will be paid as compensation for partial disability.
During his address, President Maithripala Sirisena stated that the government is dedicated to protecting the nation’s children.

hits._id: President Maithripala Sirisena completes 1st year in office

_source.content:
The one year completion of the democratic governance established under the leadership of President Maithripala Sirisena will be celebrated today.
A series of programs will be held today to mark the one year completion of the democratic governance.
The President’s Media Division stated that the main national ceremony will be held at 2pm at the Bandaranaike Memorial International Conference Hall under the patronage of President Sirisena.
The key note address of this ceremony will be made by Gopalkrishna Gandhi, the grandson of the pioneer of the Indian independence struggle Mahatma Gandhi.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, Ministers, diplomats, intellectuals and artists are also due to participate in the ceremony.
The academic book ‘One Nation – Great Power’, published to mark this historic occasion will also be launched during the ceremony.
Furthermore, a special religious program will be held at 7 this evening at the historical Kalutara Bodhi to bless President Sirisena, the government and the people of the country.
Meanwhile, the government says the country’s democracy will be confirmed during the first anniversary celebrations of President Maithripala Sirisena sworn in as the Head of State.
Furthermore, President Maithripala Sirisena says the new government has ended the era of putting headlines on newspapers or media outlets from the Temple Trees.
The Head of State said the government worked to provide protection for the independence of media.
Speaking at an event held at the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation yesterday, President Sirisena said a media house can only gain the highest level of excellence through impartiality and independence.
President Maithripala Sirisena said he believes all media houses will work to fulfil its responsibilities, obligations and duties by protecting its legitimacy for the future of the country.

hits._id: Special cabinet discussion ends, more talks to follow

_source.content:
Special cabinet discussion ends, more talks to follow"The special cabinet meeting which was held at the Presidential Secretariat this morning (Feb. 14) to discuss the future of the government has come to an end.
 
The discussion commenced at around 9.30 am under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena.
 
Later today, the SLFP Ministers are scheduled to meet President Maithripala Sirisena for a separate meeting.
 
Meanwhile, the Sri Lanka Freedom Party Media Spokesperson, State Minister Dilan Perera said that several crucial decisions will be taken at that meeting.
 
He mentioned that their stance not to support the government will not change unless the Ministry portfolios are shuffled.
 
Meanwhile, the SLFP Ministers had a lengthy meeting in Colombo last night to discuss their future political plans.
 
When contacted Minister Chandima Weerakkody said that the President will be informed of the outcome of their meeting when they meet him this afternoon.
 
Meanwhile, another round of discussion UNP and SLFP Ministers will be held later today which will be followed by a meeting which will be chaired by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe at Temple Trees.
 
A 10 member committee was appointed yesterday to come up with necessary recommendations to decide the future of the Good Governance government.
 
The committee will include five members each from the SLFP and UNP.

hits._id: Premier Moves Resolution to Extend Ministerial Portfolios

_source.content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe moved a resolution in Parliament today to obtain approval for the extended portfolios of the national government.
The resolution has sought approval for 48 cabinet ministers and 45 state and deputy ministerial posts.
However JVP leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake said that the current government cannot be accepted as national government therefore cabinet portfolios should not exceed 30.
He further said that it is not a national government because all political parties have no representation in it.
Later the Prime Minister quoted certain sections of the 19th Amendment and attempted to justify his resolution is constitutional. 
At that point, SLFP Senior Vice Chairman and former Opposition Leader Nimal Siripala de Silva submitted facts in support of the Premier’s resolution.
MPs Dinesh Gunawardana, Wasudeva Nanayakkara and Wimal Weerawansa spoke against the resolution and at that point Speaker adjourned the house for 10 minutes.
As the house reassembled the Speaker stated that the Prime Minister's resolution is constitutional.

hits._id: Update : Ranil Wickramasingha sworn in as Prime Minister

_source.content:
UNP leader Ranil Wickremesinghe was sworn in as the 23rd Prime Minister of Sri Lanka before President Maithripala Sirisena at a ceremony held at the Presidential Secretariat.

Seniors of the UNP, parliamentarians as well as Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa were also present at the occasion.

Premier Wickremesinghe was first appointed as the Prime Minister from 1993 to 1994.

He was also elected as the Prime Minister from 2001 to 2004 when the United National Front Government won the parliamentary elections in 2001.

Wickremesinghe was appointed as Prime Minister for the third time by President Sirisena after winning the 2015 Presidential Election.
Update : Friday, 21 August 2015 - 12:43------------------------------------------------ 
Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi today congratulated Ranil Wickremesinghe after he was sworn-in as Sri Lanka’s Prime Minister.

After Ranil Wickremesinghe’s United National Party won the Parliamentary polls, the Indian Prime Minister had called him up on August 18th to congratulate him and expressed confidence that the relations between the two countries will get better under his leadership.

Meanwhile, Leaders of Singapore sent congratulatory letters to Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe as well.

Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong in a letter to his Sri Lankan counterpart stated that the electoral victory reflects the faith Sri Lankans have placed in your vision of a peaceful, democratic and prosperous nation.

Under the leadership of Ranil Wickramasingha, Sri Lanka has implemented wide-ranging reforms and enhanced healthcare, education and infrastructure.
 
Update : Friday, 21 August 2015 - 10.23------------------------------------------------The challenge is to change the political culture: Says UNP leader Ranil Wickremesinghe who takes oaths as Prime Minister todayUNP leader Ranil Wickremesinghe says that modern democracy is not one party rule over the country but working together by a number of parties as well as the civil society.  UNP leader Ranil Wickremesinghe who takes oaths as the new Prime Minister today said further that the challenge now was to create a new political culture in the country.Participating a religious programme held at the Naalandaaraama Buddhist Temple in Nugegoda yesterday, the UNP leader said that all political parties in parliament as well as the public should work concertedly for this.Update : Friday, 21 August 2015 - 8:33------------------------------------------------Ranil Wickremesinghe will be sworn in as the Prime Minister of the new government tomorrow morningUNP Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe who won the recently concluded General Election will be sworn in as the 23rd Prime Minister of Sri Lanka tomorrow morning.He will take oath in the new position before President Maithripala Sirisena at the Presidential Secretariat.Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has held the prime ministerial post on three previous occasions, in 1993, 2001 as well as 2015 following the Presidential election.UNP Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe is scheduled to participate in religious activities at Nugegoda Nalandaramaya this evening and at Hunupitiya Gangaramaya tomorrow morning, prior to assuming duty.

hits._id: Cabinet meeting held sans SLFP Ministers

_source.content:
The first Cabinet meeting of the Unity Government without the participation of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party Ministers took place this morning (Apr. 10).
 
It was convened under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe at the Presidential Secretariat.
 
Minister Gamini Jayawickrama Perera said that the Cabinet meeting went ahead without any issue although the SLFP Ministers were absent.
 
During yesterday’s SLFP Central Committee meeting, the Ministers decided to boycott today's Cabinet meeting.
 
Minister Anura Priyadarshana Yapa had proposed that SLFP Ministers should resign from the Unity Government.
 
Party Treasurer, Minister S.B. Dissanayake seconded the proposal made by Yapa.
 
However, SLFP General Secretary Duminda Dissanayake and UPFA General Secretary Mahinda Amaraweera had said that the party should stay on as part of the Unity Government.
 
In addition, it has been made known that former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga hold the same opinion.
 
Meanwhile, the SLFP CC is to meet tomorrow to take a final decision with regards to the matter.

hits._id: A Budget full of tax on the common man - a statement from the UNP The Budget has gone off the country's economic track - says the JVP

_source.content: Members of several opposition parties were absent in parliament chambers when the budget speech was delivered this afternoon. The UNP and several members of the Democratic National Alliance including MP Jayantha Ketagoda boycotted the budget speech today.  Another 2 Democratic National Alliance MPs Arjuna Ranatunga and Tiran Allas were also absent in parliament during the budget speech. However MP Ajith Kumara who contested under the Democratic National Alliance ticket and later decided to remain independent was present in parliament during the budget. The TNA also remained in parliament during the budget speech. After the budget speech was over, our news team contacted several Opposition MPs to comment on the budget speech. The first to express his party views on the budget for 2014 is UNP General Secretary MP Tissa Attanayake. MP Thissa Aththanayka stated that the common man is heavily taxed through the budget. The JVP pointed out that the 2014-budget speech has gone off the country’s economic tracks. Speaking to our news team Colombo District Parliamentarian R. Dumindha Silva speaking about the 2014 budget which was presented by President Mahinda Rajapakse stated that he is thankful to the president for providing many concession to the public through the budget. Minister of Economic Development Basil Rajapakse stated that funds are allocated to the health and education sectors and the drinking water issued is addressed through the budget.Update : Thursday, 21 November 2013 - 07:15 PM----------------------------------------------------------------UNP and JVP to boycott today's budget speech. Budget-2014The UNP and the JVP have decided to boycott the budget speech which is scheduled to take place in Parliament today. However, the TNA states that it will take part in Parliament during the budget speech. Subsequent to a special UNP parliamentary team meeting that took place in parliament this morning UNP parliamentarian Ajith P. Perera expressed the following views to our news team regarding the decision taken by the UNP.Speaking to our news team, UNP parliamentarian Sunil Handuneththi stated that despite not taking part in the budget speech, the UNP will be taking part in the budget debate. While the JVP is representing the parliament under the Democratic National Alliance, chairman of the Democratic Party, Jayantha Katagoda has also decided to boycott the budget speech scheduled for today.

hits._id: UN Secretary General congratulates new President Maithreepala; Phone call from British Premier;Scores of state leaders wish new President and new Prime Minister

_source.content: United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon today congratulated the people of Sri Lanka on the successful conclusion of the country’s presidential election, and welcomed the constitutional transfer of power.The Secretary-General in a statement had said that he looks forward to working with President Maithripala Sirisena and the people of Sri Lanka.The UN will continue to support development, reconciliation, political dialogue and accountability in Sri Lanka.Meanwhile, British Prime Minister David Cameron today called on President Maithripala Sirisena to congratulate him on his victory in yesterday's Presidential election.The British Prime Minister wished President Maithripala Sirisena well in taking every opportunity to help realise the country’s potential and lead a stable, prosperous, united country.Prime Minister Cameron further stated that these peaceful, democratic elections are a credit to all those involved and the people of Sri Lanka.Meanwhile, the European Union issuing a statement congratulated Maithripala Sirisena on his election as President of Sri Lanka.The EU mentioned that it will continue to support Sri Lanka in its development as a prosperous and inclusive democracy for the benefit of all its citizens.Japan has also extended wishes to the new President, Maithripala Sirisena.Issuing a statement Japanese government says Japan hopes that under the leadership of Maithripala Sirisena, all parties concerned in Sri Lanka will work together to further promote reconciliation and economic development.Meanwhile, Singapore President Tony Tan and Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong have sent congratulatory letters to President Maithripala Sirisena for his victory in the presidential election.In his letter, President Tan said the victory was a testament to the faith that the people have in President Sirisena's leadership.Meanwhile Prime Minister Lee in his letter said Singapore has consistently supported national reconciliation in Sri Lanka through concrete projects to help better the lives of Sri Lankans, such as in healthcare and education.Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman, Hong Lei and US President Barack Obama had also earlier extended their wishes to President Maithripala Sirisena.Meanwhile, India’s The Hindu newspaper stated that Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe is seen as a leader close to India, and his presence in the government, will be a welcome sight for India.India’s The Hindu also said that the business-friendly UNP leader is a strong proponent of closer trade ties with India.

hits._id: Update: The Nation bids farewell to Venerable Maduluwawe Sobitha thero today

_source.content:
The lighting of the funeral pyre of the late Maduluwawe Sobhitha Thera was conducted a short while ago.The special casket in which the remains were lying was brought to the pyre amid chanting of Seth pirith by the Maha Sangha.Large Crowds gathered at the Kotte Sri Naga Viharaya to pay their last respects and later they moved to the parliament grounds to join the funeral ceremony.The cortege left the Kotte Sri Naga Viharaya at one o’clock this afternoon and religious leaders of different denomination including the Maha Sangha, political leaders including President Maithreepala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, representatives of Civil Organizations were all present.Update: Thursday, 12 November 2015 - 19:25---------------------------------------------------
The ceremonial cremation process of Ven. Madhuluwwe Sobitha thero commencesHiru correspondent at the site reported that the chariot carrying the body of Sobitha Thero reached the parliament stadium at 3pm.President Maithripala Sirisena, PM Ranil Wickramasinghe, speaker Karu Jayasuriya, former President Chandrika Bandaranayaka Kumaranathunga and many other ministers along with the clergy are gathered at the grounds.
He further reports that foreign Ambassadors, Generals of the Three-Forces and many State officials have also participated 
Update: Thursday, 12 November 2015 - 16:25---------------------------------------------------Update: Unprecedented crowd waiting to farewell Sobitha Thera; The President joins the crowdLarge crowd have gathered at the Kotte Sri Naga Viharaya to pay their last respects to Venerable Maduluwawe Sobitha Thera in the final few hours before the cremation, this afternoon.
Our correspondent stated that several political leaders including President Maithripala Sirisena paid their last respects to the remains of the late Nayake Thera.
People those who are mourning the demise of the Nayake Thera expressed their grief in the following manner.
The cortege will leave the Kotte Sri Naga Viharaya at one o’clock this afternoon and reach the Parliament grounds where the cremation is set to take place. 
Religious leaders of different denominations including the Maha Sangha, political leaders including President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, representatives of Civil Organizations and the public will participate in the funeral ceremony which will commence at 3 o’clock in this afternoon under full state honor.
Today has been declared a Day of National Mourning in lieu of the thero's death. National flags are at half mast, at government institutions, in respect of the thera while several households, motorists and private offices are also flying yellow flags to mourn the death of late Sobhitha Thera.
In addition, all liquor shops, slaughter houses, meat stalls and cinema halls have been closed today in respect of the Thera’s funeral.
Meanwhile police stated that a special traffic plan is in place in the surroundings of Parliament ground where the funeral is set to take place.
Meanwhile, before his death at the age of 73, Sobitha Thera made these comments, about how much the public and the clergy love him and respect him.  
       Update: Thursday, 12 November 2015 - 01-44---------------------------------------------------The Nation bids farewell to Venerable Maduluwawe Sobitha thero todayMinister of Mass Media Gayantha Karunatilleke says that all preparations have been made for the cremation of deceased Venerable Maaduluwaawe Sobhita Thera with full State Honours at the Parliament grounds this afternoon.At a media briefing held at the Government Information Department, the Minister said the Venerable Maaduluwawe Sobhita Thera’s remains will be taken from the Kotte Sri Naaga Vihaaraya to the parliament grounds at 1.30pm.The cremation ceremony will begin at 3pm.Large crowds have been gathering at Kotte Sri Naaga Viharaya to pay their last respects to the late Thera.Meanwhile a special holiday has been declared for all schools within the Jayewardenepura Educational Zone today.Western Provincial Education Minister Ranjith Somawansa said the special holiday is applicable to all students except those studying in Year 10 and Year 11.

hits._id: Update: The Prime Minister ready to take even unpopular decisions for the betterment of the country

_source.content:
The Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe told parliament today that even unpopular actions would have to be taken for the betterment of the country.
He was making a statement in parliament with regard to the government’s future economic policy for the country.
The government future economic policy has targeted five major goals.
Among them are: Generating one million jobs, increasing government revenue, promoting rural economy, making citizens landholders and economically empowering the country’s middle class.
In addition, the prime minister said that 2500 Grama Rajya development centers would be set up. 
A 13 year school education for every child would be made mandatory and the maximum number of child to be enrolled for a classroom would be limited to 35.Update: Thursday, 05 November 2015 - 19:11------------------------------------------------------------Lands and houses to be given to those who are devoid of them - PM
Premier Ranil Wickramasinghe stated that 30 lakhs of those who are given government lands under various license will be issued clear land deeds.
Also those living in government owned houses for more than ten years will be given the ownership.
He further stated that EPF and ETF funds will be utilized to establish a retirement plan named “Retirement benefit foundation”.
He stated the above while issuing a special statement at the parliament regarding the government’s future economic strategy of distributing lands and houses to the homeless, establishing a retirement plan using EPF and ETF funds and granting ownership to those living in state owned houses for more than ten years.

hits._id: Voting on 2nd reading of the budget today

_source.content:
The voting on the second reading of the budget is due to take place at 5 pm today.
While Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake delivered the budget speech in parliament on the 20th of novemaber, the second reading of the budget was carried out over nine days beginning on the 21st of November.
While the committee stage debate on the third reading of the budget begins tomorrow, it will carry on till 19th this month.
The final voting is due to take place at 5 p.m. on the same day.
President Maitripala Sirisena, after his official tour of Malta and France, is scheduled to arrive at the parliament complex today to ensure that the national government’s maiden budget is passed  by majority vote.
The President arrived in the country yesterday afternoon after concluding his foreign tour.
The President is also scheduled to meet the SLFP MPs representing the joint opposition this afternoon in parliament to have the budget passed by majority vote.

hits._id: UPDATE: Video:SLFP to sack their recalcitrant local government institution members

_source.content: Budgets of several local government institutions were presented today too, and UPFA controlled Attanagalla, Mawanella, Pelmadulla and Kekirawa Palagala local government budgets were passed.However UPFA member A. Rathnayake of the Matale Ambanganaga Korale Pradeshiya Sabha said that the ruling and opposition members protested when the budget was presented today.Meanwhile the UPFA controlled Imbulpe Pradeshiya Sabha budget for next year was defeated for the second time with 4 majority votes today.Deputy Chairman and another 5 UPFA members joined their UNP counterparts to vote against the budget while Chairman Indu Gunatilaka and one UPFA member voted for the budget.UPFA member Indika Rohana Jayamanne who voted for the budget on the previous occasion has grabbed a file document from the Chairman’s table and run away in protest of not taking one of his proposals for discussion.Local Government and Provincial Councils Ministry Secretary R.A.A. K. Ranawaka said that the number of UPFA controlled local government institutions which lost their budgets have risen to 9 with the budget defeat of Imbulpe Pradeshiya Sabha today.Meanwhile the SLFP has decided to take disciplinary actions against its members who voted against their budgets at several UPFA controlled local government institutions.At the same time, Minister Sirisena said that UPFA members who voted against the party budget will be sacked from the present positions and only those who voted for the budgets will be given positions instead.Our news team contacted several UPFA members who contributed to defeat budgets to comment on the party decision to take disciplinary actions.Update : Wednesday, 18 December 2013 - 07:40 PM--------------------------------------------------------------UPFA to remove all local government members who voted against their budgetsThe budgets of UPFA controlled Ja Ela Urban Council and Dompe Pradeshiya Sabha were also defeated today.The Dompe Pradeshiya Sabha budget was defeated with 6 majority votes after 5 UFPA members including its Deputy Chairman joined their 9 opposition counterparts to vote against the budget.Meanwhile Ja Ela Urban Council budget was defeated with 7 majority votes. Except the Chairman, other 5 government members joined their 3 opposition members to defeat the budget.With the defeat of budgets for Ja Ela and Dompe, the number of budget defeats of UPFA controlled local government institutions has risen to 16; and 8 out of them have been already defeated for the second time; thereby compelling the chairmen of the 8 local bodies to resign from their posts.Meanwhile the UPFA has decided to appoint new chairmen to the local government institutions of which their budgets were defeated for the second time. UPFA General Secretary Susil Premajayantha said that the party has decided to pick a member, who voted for the budget, to the new position as it is not mandatory to appoint the Deputy Chairman to fill the vacant post at every time.Simultaneously, actions will be taken to remove the recalcitrant members of the UPFA coalitions from the party; if they voted against the budget with ulterior motives.Such decisions of removal will be informed to the respective party secretaries and the Election Commissioner later.The General Secretary also warned of tough disciplinary actions against its members if anybody will vote against the budget despite the party instructions or coalition secretary’s advice in the future.Meanwhile SLFP Executive Committee is scheduled to meet at Temple Trees tonight.UPFA General Secretary Susil Premajayantha said that a decision will be taken about the disciplinary actions against the SLFP members who have already voted with the opposition to defeat the budgets of UPFA controlled local government institutions.

hits._id: Sri Lanka calls applications to recruit for OMP

_source.content:
The Government has stepped up activities with related to the establishment of Office of Missing Persons.
Accordingly, the Constitutional Council has called for applications from prospective candidates to be appointed to the new establishment.
Candidates with knowledge and experience in Human Rights Law, International Humanitarian Law, and Humanitarian Response and investigations are encouraged to apply.
The OMP is one of the main pillars of Sri Lanka’s transitional justice agenda.
President Maithripala Sirisena signed the Office on Missing Persons Act in July.
Sri Lanka introduced a bill to establish the OMP on the 22nd of May and the Bill was gazetted on the 27th of May 2016.
On June 21, the Office on Missing Persons Bill, presented by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, was passed unanimously in Parliament.
