hits._id: Sri Lanka names a free trade zone from Europe to China

_source.content:
The government has decided to declare a special free trade zone unifying Europe, China, Singapore and India.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe is to make a special announcement in parliament during the month of July regarding the Special free trade zone which is aimed at strengthening the future economic plan of the country.
A spokesperson for the government noted that with the declaration of the new trade zone, Sri Lanka would be able to enter the second largest trade zone.
It was added that Sri Lanka would be introduced as the leading country in the steering process.
With the lifting of the EU fishing ban, 28 countries representing the European Union would be able to enter the Free trade agreement, India via the ETCA agreement and Singapore and China would also be entering the free trade zone.
The government spokesperson added that entrepreneurs would be given the opportunity to perform transactions with the specific currencies used by the nations in the zone.

hits._id: Udalagama and Paranagama commission report along with UNHRC report tabled in Parliament

_source.content:
The Udalagama and Paranagama commission reports as well as the UN Human Rights report were presented before the Parliament today by Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe.

At this juncture, MEP leader Dinesh Gunawardana enquired the Premier about the U.S. Report which was co-sponsored by Sri Lanka.

The Udalagama Commission was appointed by former President Mahinda Rajapaksa in 2006 to probe 16 assassinations that took place during war. 

The Maxwell Paranagama Commission was appointed in 2013 to probe the missing persons. 

The Udalagama Commission report was handed over to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa in 2009 but it was not publicized.

Meanwhile, 16 assassinations including the murder of former Foreign Minister Lakshman Kadirgamar, the murder of 17 relief workers in Muttur, the murder of TNA MP Joseph Pararajasingham, the murder of 68 civilians at Kebitigollewa and the murder of 98 security forces personnel in Digampatana were probed under the Nissanka Udalagama Commission.

The Maxwell Paranagama Commission was tasked to probe whether international human rights were violated during the last phase of the war. 

The Maxwell Paranagama Commission Report was handed over to President Maithreepala Sirisena recently.
Update: Monday, 20 October 2015 - 18:19---------------------------------------------------Premier Presents Udalagama, Paranagama Commission Reports To ParliamentThe OHCHR resolution on Sri Lanka, Paranagama Commission report on missing persons and Udalagamma commission report, tabled before Parliament today.The government had earlier promised to table the documents before the debate on the UNHRC report is to be held in Parliament.The debate will be held on October 22 and 23.

hits._id: President walks away from Cabinet meeting

_source.content:
A tense situation was reportedly erupted at the weekly Cabinet meeting held under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena today (Jan. 16).
 
At the start of the Cabinet meeting, the President had complained that United National Party Ministers are criticizing him for appointing the Bond Commission and accusing him of trying to destroy the UNP.
 
A senior Minister said that the President had asked UNP Ministers to run the government alone if the criticism is continued.
 
Then the President had walked away from the meeting.
 
Thereafter, the Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and another group of Ministers had a meeting with the President and were able to convince him to attend the Cabinet meeting again.
After the Bond Commission report was released a number of UNP Ministers criticized the President.
Meanwhile, addressing the media at the SLFP Headquarters, Colombo, Minister Mahinda Samarasinghe said that the Bond report will be tabled in Parliament tomorrow (Jan. 17).
He also said that the report will be added to the Parliamentary website thereafter.

hits._id: Colombo Port City permitted to carryout work

_source.content:
China Communications Construction Company Pvt. Ltd (CCCC) has received written approval from the Sri Lanka Government in a letter dated 20 March 2015 by the Secretary to the Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to commence protective work on the temporarily suspended Colombo Port City Project. 
All construction work on the Colombo Port City came to a halt following the Sri Lankan Government’s official communication on 6th of March 2015 to temporarily suspend ongoing work of the project, with immediate effect.
As a result of the immediate suspension, over 200 meters of the breakwater constructed for the project, was damaged and the company was unable to take measures to protect the reclaimed land area. The permission to carryout protective work on the site was granted following a request made by CCCC to the Sri Lankan Government.
CCCC is appreciative of H.E. the President of Sri Lanka, Maithripala Sirisena, Hon. Prime Minister, Ranil Wickramasinghe and the Cabinet of Ministers for granting permission to protect the reclaimed land area.   CCCC, a responsible Fortune 500 company having confidence in the future of Sri Lanka invested 1.4 billion USD to build the Colombo Port City. This is the single largest privately funded Foreign Direct Investment to date, in Sri Lanka.  
As a result of the project’s suspension, CCCC estimates an initial direct loss for the company of over USD 380,000 per day. Further the interest on the financial loan obtained by the company for the development of the project has to be paid, regardless of the ongoing suspension.
The company will continue to cooperate with the Sri Lankan Government on relevant evaluations of Colombo Port City.
The Colombo Port City project, which is a 100% privately funded FDI by CCCC, began construction following the signing of an Agreement with the Government of Sri Lanka on 16 September 2014.

hits._id: 'No-confidence motion' : TNA & CMC yet to announce their decisions

_source.content:
The Tamil National Alliance and Ceylon Workers' Congress are scheduled to finalise their decisions on the 'no-confidence motion' on Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe this afternoon.
 
The EPDP has not taken a decision at this stage.
Meanwhile, JVP MP Bimal Rathnayake said that they will vote in favour of the motion.
Although Jathika Hela Urumaya had decided to vote against the 'no-confidence motion', MP, Ven. Athuraliye Rathana Thera who remains independent in Parliament has not yet taken a final decision.
Our correspondent said that MP Wijedasa Rajapaksha who was removed from his ministry portfolio recently is also present in the House at this time.

hits._id: President Chairs SLFP Electoral Organizers Meeting

_source.content:
A special meeting of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) electoral organizers was held at Foundation Institute under the patronage of party leader, President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday (19).
SLFP General Secretary Minister Duminda Dissanayake earlier said the party was expected to present amendments to the proposed VAT Bill to the President at this meeting.
The amendments proposed to the Value Added Tax (VAT) and Nation Building Tax (NBT) in the 2016 budget have been put on hold until the relevant legislative enactments are passed in Parliament.
The Head of State has stated former President Mahinda Rajapaksa who was rejected by the public during two national elections has no basis to form a new alliance.
Former President Chandrika Banadaranayake Kumarathunga was also part of the discussion held at the Sri Lanka Foundation.

hits._id: Election Commission meets tomorrow to take a decision

_source.content: The Court of Appeal has postponed consideration of the Writ against the Gazette that has already been issued with regard to the delimitation of Local Government Institutions and their number of members. Chairman of the Appeal Court, Justice L.T.B. Dehideniya, Justice Kumuduni Wickramasinghe and Justice Shiral Gunarathna have postponed the hearing to November 22. At the same time, the panel of judges allowed the Secretary of Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna and attorney-at-law, Saagarika Abeywickrama to intermediate in this Petition. 6 voters from Kandy, Elpitiya, Colombo, Matara and Hali Ela have filed this Writ seeking annulment of the Gazette. Minister of Provincial Council and Local Government Minister Faizer Mustapha and his ministry secretary have been named as respondents. Meanwhile, Elections Commission Chairman Mahinda Deshapriya stated that the commission will convene tomorrow to discuss about the local government election.

hits._id: Second reading of the budget passed in parliament with a majority of 107 votes; 162 voted for and 55 against

_source.content:
The second reading of Budget 2017, was passed with 107 majority votes in parliament a short while ago.
162 voted for the budget and 55 voted against.

Ministers S.B. Dissanayake,

Representatives of UPFA-administered Local Government Institutions with budget defeat occurring twice have been summoned to the SLFP Executive Committee meeting held today.UPFA general secretary Minister Susil Premajayantha told our news team that a decision about these representatives was scheduled to be taken at the executive committee meeting.Meanwhile a special code of instructions was issued yesterday to representatives of local government institutions where the budget was defeated for the first time. hits._id: German Parliamentary Delegation Met President

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday emphasized Sri Lanka’s immense commitment to safeguard the national security as well as regional security.
Addressing a delegation of German Parliament, he said that the foreign policy of the government based on the principle that the relationship with one country should not have any adverse impact on another country.
The delegation called on President Sirisena at the Presidential Secretariat yesterday (7th April). The delegation comprised of the SDP Parliamentary Group Spokesman Niels Annen, Michael Donth, Caren lay and Prof Egon Juttner. The German Ambassador Dr. Jurgen Murhad also took part in the discussion.
President recalling his recent visit to German thanked the Chancellor Angela Merkel, and the government and the people of Germany for the warm hospitality and friendship extended to him.
During the discussions, President requested foreign assistance for technology training, water purification and other programs launched by the government to prevent Chronic Kidney Diseases.

hits._id: Government files answers JVP  allegations regarding emergency acts

_source.content:
The government today answered queries raised by the JVP regarding emergency acts which have been submitted before parliament.

Expressing its views in parliament yesterday the JVP noted that, if the government fails to approve 6 bills before parliament prior to the end of this month, registration fees as well as fines contained therein would require to be annulled.

Expressing further views in this regard JVP parliamentarian Anura Kumara Dissanayeke noted that 21 tax revision acts which were presented in accordance to the budget proposal had been presented before parliament last Friday.

However Dissanayeke noted that only 15 drafts had been tabled in parliament out of the 21 revision acts which were presented.

Moreover Anura Kumara Dissanayeke noted that the government was attempting to table the remnant 6 bills in violation of parliamentary traditions.


			   
			   		
	
			   

When inquired from Deputy Speaker Chandima Weerakkodi in this regard he noted that steps had been taken to obtain approval for these bills in accordance with standing orders.

hits._id: More benefits needed for MP’s; PM Ranil

_source.content: The Constitutional Board tasked with formulating a new Constitution convened this morning at the Parliamentary Complex.Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe forwarded the reports of the 6 subcommittees appointed for the purpose of drafting a new Constitution to the Constitutional Assembly. The 6 sub committees on Fundamental Rights, Judiciary, Finance, Law and Order, Public Service and Centre Periphery Relations were therefore presented. Special attention was paid towards abolishing the executive Presidency and changes to the electoral system. Joining in, Leader of the Opposition R. Sampanthan explained the process of presenting the draft constitution.  He furthermore stated that the new constitution will be subjected to the approval of the parliament as well as a referendum. The Constitutional Assembly will convene again on the 10th of December at 9 AM. Meanwhile, the 3rd reading of the budget referred as the Committee Stage commenced today. The Head of Expenditure of the President, Prime Minister, Independent Commissions and few other Ministries were taken up for debate. President Maithripala Sirisena also arrived in Parliament to participate in the debate on the President’s expenditure sheet.

hits._id: Pakistani PM arrives in Sri Lanka

_source.content:
Pakistan's Prime Minister Muhammad Nawaz Sharif arrived in Sri Lanka yesterday on a three-day official visit at the invitation of President Maithripala Sirisena.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe received Prime Minister Sharif, accompanied by his wife, on his arrival at the Bandaranaike International Airport.
The official welcome ceremony presided by President Maithripala Sirisena will be held at the Presidential Secretariat this morning.
The visiting Prime Minister will be accorded a ceremonial welcome including a Gun Salute and Guard of Honor.
The Prime Minister will hold official talks with the Sri Lankan leadership on issues of mutual interest.
President Sirisena will lead the official bilateral discussions with the visiting Prime Minister.
The delegation for the talks will include Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, Cabinet Ministers and senior government officials.
A number of MOUs and Agreements of cooperation in various fields would be signed after the talks.
Several bilateral instruments in the areas of Health, Science & Technology, Trade, Statistics, Gem & Jewellery, Money Laundering & Terrorism Financing, and Culture are envisaged to be signed during the visit.

hits._id: UNP is ready to be flexible on 20th amendment

hits._id: Update:" New leadership in Sri lanka treat all communities equally"

_source.content:
The Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi says he believes the possibility of reconciliation from the Sri Lankan new leadership where all communities are given equal treatment.

He stated this during a joint media conference held in Hyderabad after bilateral discussions he had with visiting Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe today.
  
Addressing the joint media conference, premier Wickremesinghe said all communities have been given responsibility in Sri Lankan parliament.

He further stated that the government is looking into the ways and means on how to share power and devolution of power within the provisions of the Constitution.
  
Meanwhile 4 MoUs were signed between the two countries today. 

Among them are: Cooperation of exchange of SAARC region satellite technology, rejuvenation of small industries program with the patronage of Indian government, providing a fully fledged ward complex consisting of 200 beds to Vavuniya hospital and set up an ambulance service in Sri Lanka.

In addition, Prime Minister Wickremesinghe has had discussions with Indian Foreign Minister Sushma Swaraj, former Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh and Congress leader Sonia Gandhi.

Update : Tuesday, 15 September 2015 - 18:49------------------------------------------------------ India and Sri Lanka Sign Four AgreementsSubsequently to the discussions between PM Ranil Wickramasinghe and his Indian counterpart Narendra Modi, four MOU’s between the two countries were signed. Foreign minister Mangala Samaraweera, Indian ministers and High Commissioner of India to Sri Lanka Y A Singha had been present at the occasion. The initial treaty signed between the countries was the Satellite for South Asian Association for Regional Co-operation (SAARC) Countries.
An MOU was signed with the sponsorship of India regarding the revival of the minor industries’ development program. Today the two countries signed bilateral agreements regarding the supply of medical equipment to the Regional Hospital of Vavunia which consists of 200 beds and to create an emergency ambulance service in the country.
Update : Tuesday, 15 September 2015 - 15:04----------------------------------------------------Discussions commence between Ranil and ModiPrime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe who is on a three-day official visit to India has met his Indian counterpart Narendra Modi this morning.
The two leaders met at the Hyderabad Palace in New Delhi.
Indian Premier Modi hosted lunch today for the Sri Lankan delegation including Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe.
During the discussions, the leaders of the two countries are expected to focus on ways to further boost bilateral ties, and among other things on the vexing fishermen issue.
Prime Minister Wickramasinghe is scheduled to call on the President of India Pranab Mukherjee at the Rashtrapati Bhavan tomorrow.
Update : Tuesday, 15 September 2015 - 12:37----------------------------------------------------PM Ranil Wickramasinghe meets Indian Premier Narendra Modi today. Making his first overseas visit to India after assuming office last month for the fourth time, Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe arrived at the Indira Gandhi International Airport in New Delhi yesterday.
The Sri Lankan Prime Minister was received at the airport by India's Commerce Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.
During his three-day visit the Prime Minister is expected to meet with his Indian counterpart Narendra Modi today and other Indian leaders and hold extensive discussions on a range of issues.
He will also meet the Indian External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj and later in the day meet with the Prime Minister Modi at the Hyderabad House for bilateral discussions.
During the discussions, the leaders of the two countries are expected to focus on ways to further boost bilateral ties, and among other things on the vexing fishermen issue.
Prime Minister Wickramasinghe is scheduled to call on the President of India Pranab Mukherjee at the Rashtrapati Bhavan tomorrow.

hits._id: SL To Be Developed Into Air And Maritime Hub Of Asia – Says The President

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena said that the government expects to develop Sri Lanka as the air and maritime hub of the Asian region.
He stated this while addressing the 53rd Conference of the Asia Atlantic Civil Aviation Director General’s launch in Colombo yesterday (01st) morning.
Addressing the conference, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said
Sri Lanka will develop its domestic aviation industry to international standards.
The 53rd Conference of Asia Atlantic Civil Aviation Director Generals will be held in Colombo until August 5th.

hits._id: EU Parliament delegation arrives today

_source.content:
A 4-member delegation from the European Parliament, led by Jean Lambert, will visit Sri Lanka this week.
 
The delegation will meet government and civil society representatives to discuss Sri Lanka's progress on national reconciliation and its implementation of the international conventions applicable to GSP+.
 
The MEPs will also visit EU-funded projects in the North and will conduct an inter-parliamentary dialogue.
 
Meanwhile, Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull will arrive in Sri Lanka on Thursday (02) following his state visit to Israel.
 
The statement said the Australian Premier will meet with President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe for discussions during his stay in Sri Lanka.
 
The Australian Premier said this year also marks the 70th anniversary of Australia’s bilateral relationship with Sri Lanka, and he is delighted to be able to visit Sri Lanka on his return from Israel.

According to officials the first and second mobile services were held in Kurunegala and Jaffna Teaching Hospitals. The third will be held at the Badulla General Hospital.
Meanwhile, President Maithripala Sirisena and Minister of Health Rajitha Senaratne has ordered to fund provincial hospitals and develop them, rather than taking them over by the central government.

hits._id: Special Envoy of Anti-personnel Mine Ban Convention to arrive in Sri Lanka

_source.content:
At the invitation of the Government of Sri Lanka, the Special Envoy of the Anti-personnel Mine Ban Convention, Prince Mired Raad Zeid Al-Hussein of Jordan will undertake an official visit from 5th of March to 7th of March.
The Foreign Ministry said that the visit is of particular significance since Sri Lanka acceded to the Anti-personnel Mine Ban Convention on 13th 0f December 2017 becoming its 163rd State Party.
During his visit to Sri Lanka, the Special Envoy will call on President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and Foreign Minister Tilak Marapana.
After being appointed in 2009 as the Special Envoy to the Anti-personnel Mine Ban Convention, he has worked extensively with the UN and member countries to promote the banning of anti-personnel mines, worldwide.

hits._id: Galle Dialogue 2016 commences under the leadership of President Sirisena

_source.content:
Sri Lanka Navy's International Maritime Conference, 'Galle Dialogue 2016' began in Colombo today under the leadership of President Maithripala Sirisena.
The two-day conference organized by the navy with the support of the Ministry of Defence is being held for the 7th consecutive year.
President Maithripala Sirisena graced the inaugural session as the Chief Guest while Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe was the Guest of Honour.
Local and foreign scholars and experts in naval and maritime affairs representing 42 countries and 12 International organizations will share their expertise and discuss matters of professional interest at the two-day dialogue held under the theme, "Fostering Strategic Maritime Partnerships".

hits._id: Update: Prices of essential products reduced

_source.content:
State has taken steps to reduce Dhal by Rs. 10, potatoes by Rs. 5, sprats Rs.5, Kerosene oil by and Gas by Rs. 25.
Also Highway toll will be reduced by Rs50 from 9 pm to 5 am.

In addition Budget 2017 proposed to lift the existing 25% Cess on construction industry.
The minister also proposed in his budget to list hotels, Colombo Grand Hyatt, Grand Oriental, Waters Edge, Hilton Hambantota and Mannar Salterns on Colombo Stock Exchange to earn 1000 million rupees to government coffers.
The minister also proposed to rename Samurdhi Movement as Jana Isuru. 
At the same time he proposed to implement a 500 thousand housing scheme for the middle class people.
---------------------------------------------------------------Ravi Karunanayake, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, presented the Budget for the fiscal year of 2017 to the Sri Lankan Parliament, a short while ago. Meanwhile, budget speech will be broadcast live on Hiru TV.Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake said in his Budget speech that tablets computers will be provided free of charge to GCE Advanced Level students and teachers. He proposed to allocate 5000 million rupees to implement the project. The Finance Minister further said that an additional 17.84 billion rupees will be allocated for education in budget 2017.    In addition, Budget 2017 has proposed to introduce a 200 thousand rupees insurance cover for each school student. Finance Minister Karunanayake also proposed a 50% subsidized loan scheme for farmers who grow value added fruit varieties.  He said that this subsidy could be extended to paddy cultivation as well.Minister Ravi Karunanayake presenting the budget 2017 stated that 7,500 million rupees will be allocated from the Finance Ministry to the Megapolis Ministry with immediate effect.Also a Special incentive will be given for investments of more than 100- to 500 million rupees. It was also proposed to grant a 200 million rupee capital allowances to North and 100 million rupees to  Uva and Eastern Provinces for businesses over 30 million dollars.
Watch it live below..
Ravi Karunanayake, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, presented the Budget for the fiscal year of 2017 to the Sri Lankan Parliament, a short while ago. Meanwhile, budget speech will be broadcast live on Hiru TV.

hits._id: Video : Peliyagoda Urban Council budget defeated for the second time - Chairman loses position

_source.content: Next year’s budget of for the Peliyagoda Urban Council was defeated for a second time by 3 votes.3 out of the 6 Urban Councillors who represent the government had voted against the proposed budget along with the 3 from the opposition. The budget was defeated by 3 votes the first time it was presented on the 19th as well.Our news team inquired from the mayor of the Peliyagoda Urban Council Nihal Ananda regarding the proposed budget being defeated for a second time.Speaking to our news team UPFA Urban Councillor Sarath De Silva stated that 3 Urban Councillors representing the government including himself voted against the budget again for the second time in order to show protest against the Mayor.According to the Special Provisions Act regarding Local Government Institutions passed last year, if a proposed budget is defeated for a second time in a local government institute, the chairman of that local government institute has to resign.Only the proposed budget of the Peliyagoda Urban Council has been defeated in its second vote thus far.Accordingly our news team inquired from the Western Provincial Chief Minister Prasanna Ranatunga as to what steps the Peliyagoda Urban Council will take in this regard.

hits._id: 70th anniversary of the UNP falls today

_source.content:
The United National Party which celebrates its 70th anniversary will hold its party Convention at the Campbell Park grounds, Borella today, under the patronage of party leader and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.
President Maithripala Sirisena will also participate in the 70th anniversary.
The UNP was founded on September 6th, 1946 under the leadership of D.S. Senanayake, who became the country’s first Prime Minister later.
During the past 70 years, the party represented the Government and the Opposition.
D.S. Senanayake, Dudley Senanayake, Sir John Kotelawala, J.R. Jayewardene, Ranasinghe Premadasa, D.B.Wijetunge and present leader Ranil Wickremasinghe have given leadership to the party during the past 70 years.

hits._id: PM Leaves for India on a 2 day Official Visit

_source.content:
Making his first overseas visit to India after assuming office last month, Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe will leave for New Delhi today on a 2 days’ official visit.
Prime Minister Wickramasinghe is set to meet his Indian counterpart Narendra Modi, President Pranab Mukherjee, External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj and several other Indian leaders.
At Sri Lanka- India bilateral talks, the leaders of the two countries will focus on consolidating and strengthening the friendship of India and Sri Lanka and regional links for peace and reconciliation.
According to our correspondent in India all preparations have been made to welcome the Prime Minister in New Delhi.
Meanwhile, the government has decided to release 16 Indian fishermen in Sri Lankan custody in view of Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe’s official visit to India.

hits._id: 68th Independence Day Celebrations Today; President Vows To Protect The Heritage Of The Country

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena in his Independence Day message has called upon the nation for a pledge to consolidate on the peace and freedom that has been achieved. He urged that the people of Sri Lanka help to build the future of the motherland and the nation.
He said “ On this day, as we celebrate the 68th anniversary of our Independence, we are proud of the progress made towards safeguarding the freedom, sovereignty, territorial integrity of the Nation and strengthening national reconciliation and economic and political rights of all our citizens”.
The president also stated, "This occasion is of special significance because we commemorate the dawn of freedom at a time coinciding with the taking of clear and resolute steps to firmly establish democracy and good governance, the Rule of Law, and a truly meaningful parliamentary system; to establish a long lasting and stable structure of good governance in keeping with the mandate given by the people one year ago.”
Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe said in a communiqué issued  that although Sri Lanka has been restored as a country that abides by the democratic principles with last year's election of new government, the country faces a formidable task of ensuring lasting peace and co-existence for all citizens while building on the concept of social economic development for the country.
England Queen, Elizabeth the 2nd has sent a congratulatory message to the President on the occasion of the country's 68th National Independence Day.
Indian President Pranab Mukherjee also extended his greetings and felicitations to the government and people of Sri Lanka.
In a message to President Maithripala Sirisena, President Mukherjee said, Quote -“On behalf of the Government, it gives me immense pleasure to extend warm felicitations and best wishes to Your Excellency and to the people of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka on the occasion of the 68th Anniversary of your Independence”.

The Minister points out that if a patient receives treatment at the intensive care unit the Government incurs an expenditure of more than 10 thousand rupees.

hits._id: Update : Ambilipitiya Pradeshiya Sabha budget defeated amidst police protection.

_source.content: The UPFA controlled Ambilipitiya Pradeshiya Sabha budget for 2014 was also defeated for the second time today by one vote.Out of the 14 member Ambilipitiya Pradeshiya Sabha, 2 UPFA members joined their 5 Opposition counterparts to vote against the budget while 6 UPFA members voted for the budget. One UPFA member was absent today.Our correspondent said that heavy police protection was provided to the Pradeshiya Sabha premises during the vote taking.Former Chairman of the Ambilipitiya Pradeshiya Sabha did not attend the meeting during the vote taking today.During the today’s meeting,  the Opposition Leader charged that there was a move to arrest the former Chairman in connection with a financial fraud.The budget of the UPFA controlled Imbulpe Pradeshiya Sabha budget for 2014 was also defeat by 4 votes.The Imbulpe Pradeshiya Sabha consists of 13 member seats and 9 out of them are from the government side.Three government members and the Opposition Leader voted for the budget while 6 government members and 2 opposition members voted against the budget. One Opposition member was absent in the meeting today.UFPA member Srilal Senerath said that he voted against the budget in protest of the irregularities of the PS Chairman.Ten members opposed this budget when it was presented to the meeting on the 28th of last month and consequently, the Chairman postponed the meeting todate without taking a vote.Our news team attempted to contact Pradeshiya Sabha Opposition Leader D.R. Indu Gunatilaka to comment on the change of his stand, and voted for the budget today.However our attempt was failed as Indu Gunatilaka was engaged in a meetingUpdate :Thursday, 05 December 2013 - 13:38-------------------------------------------------------------Imbulpe Pradeshiya Sabha budget also defeatedThursday, 05 December 2013 - 13:04The budget of the UPFA controlled Imbulpe Pradeshiya Sabha budget for 2014 was also defeat by 4 votes.The Imbulpe Pradeshiya Sabha consists of 13 member seats and 9 out of them are from the government side.Three government members and the Opposition Leader voted for the budget while 6 government members and 2 opposition members voted against the budget. One Opposition member was absent in the meeting today.Ten members opposed this budget when it was presented to the meeting on the 28th of last month and consequently, the Chairman postponed the meeting todate without taking a vote.

hits._id: President tells Prime Minister to decide future

_source.content:
Reports say that the President Maithripala Sirisena has requested the Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe to take a decision regarding the local government election results.
The statement was made during a discussion between the President and the Prime Minister at the President’s official residence last night.
It was made known that the meeting lasted over two hours.
While the President had said that it had become necessary for him to take a decision taking into consideration the people’s expectations and the results of the election, he had requested that the Prime Minister do so before him.
During the discussion, a proposal had been made for the government to be accepted with Speaker Karu Jayasuriya named as Prime Minister.
However, the discussion had ended without a consensus on the proposal.
On this occasion, the President had stressed that since the people had made a verdict, a suitable option was to dissolve parliament and hold a general election.
The Prime Minister had been requested to take a decision prior to finalizing their next move.
However, the Prime Minister’s faction had informed that to make a decision it was necessary that the UNP cabinet ministers hold a discussion with the President.
Meanwhile, a meeting between Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and UNP MPs was held last afternoon at Temple Trees.
At the conclusion of the meeting, Minister Naveen Dissanayake said that if a problem surfaces with regard to the government continuing in the future, the UNP had the ability to form a new government.

hits._id: Free Media Policy Will Be Strengthened – President Maithripala Sirisena

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says the free media policy of the government will be further strengthened.
The Head of State said it was the responsibility of media to act impartially within a free media environment claiming certain media institutions were acting in an unsatisfactory manner.
The President expressed these views during a media briefing with heads of media at the Presidential Secretariat yesterday (Tuesday 19th) evening.
The Head of State noted media possessed the right to criticize any action of the government stating the government has ensured complete media freedom.
President Sirisena however expressed disappointment over certain reports containing baseless allegations and criticisms, adding media institutions and personnel were intimidated under the former government.
President Maithripala Sirisena while noting it was the government’s intention to fortify media freedom, urged all media outlets to act responsibly.
Furthermore changes will be introduced to the field of media through digitalization which includes the renewal of transmission licenses of media institutions.

The conference was held to inform the media about the programs which have been organized to mark the completion of President Maithripala Sirisena’s first year in office on January 8th.
The President is scheduled to deliver a special lecture at the BMICH on January 8th.

_source.content:
The Government has decided to gazette the scopes relevant to the new cabinet reshuffle within five days.
Accordingly the subject areas of new ministries are scheduled to be altered.
reports say that several institutions currently under cabinet ministries are also scheduled to be handed over to the new ministries.
Subject areas of ministries where there had been problems in the past are also due to be altered.
The first cabinet reshuffle of the consensus Government took place yesterday making changes in top ministry posts including finance, foreign affairs, Port and Mass Media.
Accordingly new ministers for nine cabinet ministries and one state ministry took their oaths before President Maithripala Sirisena at the Presidential Secretariat yesterday.
Similarly after the President’s Australian tour changes  are scheduled to take place with regard to Deputy Ministers and State Ministers.

Ministry of Buddhasasana and Religious Affairs says that it would take actions to ban deformed masks during religious season.

He also requested the Inspector General of Police to assist him prevent the sale of such masks in the local market.

			   
			   		
	
			   
Dissanayake also stated that complaints have been received regarding certain traders who include unethical as well as substandard goods in ‘Atapirikara pooja’.

Former president Mahinda Rajapakse was absent during the vote taking. He also said that the duty concession for one million rupees granted by the budget for electric cars will be extended for such imported vehicles used abroad less than one year.

hits._id: “Budget 2018 targets to achieve medium-term economic goals” – Finance Minister

_source.content:
The maiden Budget of Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera and the 3rd Budget of the Unity Government was presented in Parliament this afternoon.
 
It was titled “Enterprise Sri Lanka”.
 
Minister Samaraweera said the overall idea of the Budget was to improve the country’s entrepreneur culture and taking Sri Lanka towards a green economy giving prominence to environmental protection.
 
He said a concessionary loan scheme will be introduced by the National Savings Bank to facilitate first-time middle-income home buyers.
 
Maximum loan size Rs. 5 million
Interest rate 7% per annum
Tenure 7 years
 
The Minister said an “Employment Preparatory Fund” will be established under the Ministry of National Policies and Economic Development and will be operated through the National Youth Corps.
 
This fund will finance vocational training courses that are required by the private sector.
 
The courses will be designed in collaboration with the private sector and such courses may be conducted at institutions such as Hotel Schools, Nursing Schools etc.
 
He said that the economy is expected to grow by around 4.5% in 2017 and projected to move gradually to a higher GDP growth path of around 6% by 2020 while containing the level of unemployment at around 4% level.
 
The National Budget 2018 will support the achievement of envisaged medium-term targets such as per capita income of 5,000 dollars, one million new jobs, FDI inflows of 5 billion dollars, and doubling exports to 20 billion dollars.
 
In 2018, the Government envisages a GDP growth of 5%, inflation of around 6%.

hits._id: MKDS Gunawardena’s last rites to be held in Kanthale

_source.content:
Minister of Lands MKDS Gunawardena has passed away at the age of 68 while receiving treatment at a private hospital in Colombo yesterday (19th).
Minister Gunawardana began his political career with the Sri Lanka Freedom Party representing the Trincomalee district.
Minister MKADS Gunawardana held the portfolio of Deputy Minister of Buddha Sasana during the tenure of the United People’s Freedom Alliance led government and later pledged his allegiance to then common candidate Maithripala Sirisena at the Presidential election in January 2015.
Minister Gunawardana made immense contributions to the victory of President Maithripala Sirisena during the presidential election and was later elected to Parliament through the National List.
He was subsequently sworn in as the Minister of Lands.
The final funeral rites are to be performed at the Kanthale Leelarathna Stadium on the 23rd evening.

hits._id: 18 trade unions including doctors, engineers and accountants to launch a strike today

_source.content:
18 trade Unions, including the GMOA will engage in a countrywide strike from 8.00 a.m. today against the 2016 budget proposals.

Government Medical Officers Association Spokesman Dr. Naveen Soysa said The GMOA and the other unions decided to resort to strike action as the authorities failed to respond to its key issues with respect to several proposals suggested in the Budget 2016.

Convener of the Joint Committee of Executive Officers in All Island Services, Dr. Nirmal Karunasiri said the strike action is being taken against the reduction of benefits for public servants, including doctors.

Dr Karunasiri emphasized that they seek a practical solution to its issues before the Budget 2016 approved by the Parliament.

hits._id: PM is ready for several reforms including a new constitution

_source.content:
The inaugural session of the 8th parliament of Sri Lanka was held this morning. 

MP Karu Jayasuriya was unanimously appointed as the Speaker of new Parliament. 

His name was proposed by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and seconded by former Opposition Leader Nimal Siripala de Silva.

Addressing the parliament, the Prime Minister stated that they intend to implement several reforms including consolidating working committee system, district development councils as well as budget office in parliament within a given period.

He also stated that the UNP and the UPFA have requested for a new constitution.

hits._id: Price of LPG Gas, Kerosene, Dhal, Sugar, Green Gram, Potatoes and sprats reduced

_source.content: Samurdhi to be renamed Jana IsuruFree tablet computers to advance level students and teachers.Insurance coverage for every school student. Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake presented Budget 2017 in parliament this afternoon. It is the 70th budget of Sri Lanka and the 2nd budget by the National Unity Governmen Finance Minister who commenced the budget speech at 2.03 pm today continued till 5:08 pm.President Maithripala Sirisena also arrived in the chambers while the budget was being presented.Starting his budget speech, Finance Minister Karunanayake said that the aim of the government is to achieve a 7% economic growth next year. He said that it’s the first time in history of budget preparation; public proposals were gathered for the budget.Budget 2017 has proposed to reduce prices of LP Gas by 25 rupees, a kilogram of sugar by 2 rupees, a kilogram of dhal by 10 rupees and a kilogram of green gram by 15 rupees. In addition, prices of a kilogram of sprats and potatoes will be reduced by 5 rupees.At the same time, the Finance Minister proposed to rename Samurdhi Movement as Jana Isuru. A proposal was also made to introduce a housing project with 500 thousand units for the milled class families.Minister Karunanayake stated in his budget speech that agricultural sector has been given priority this time thereby granting subsidized loans for fruit and vegetable farmers.With the view to protect local producers, 2% cess was imposed on imported sugar while 5% cess imposed on ethanol.  15,000 milch cows will be imported and distributed at least among each farmer.At the same time, plantation companies are limited to obtain a maximum of 5000 acres, and the minister said that tax on tea industry will be eased out.He also said that 900 million rupees will be allocated for rubber plantation development and decided to maintain the current price of a locally manufactured packet of 400 gram powered milk.The minister said that additional grants of 17.84 billion rupees have been allocated for education.At the same time, Finance minister said that 175 thousand A/L students and their teachers will be provided free computer tablets in 2017.He further stated that an insurance coverage of 200 thousand rupees will be introduced for each student between the ages 5 to 19.Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake proposed to encourage the use of electric cars instead of three wheelers.In addition Budget 2017 proposed to lift the existing 25% Cess on construction industry and to list hotels Colombo Grand Hyatt, Grand Oriental, Waters Edge, Hilton Hambantota and Mannar Salterns on Colombo Stock Exchange to earn 1000 million rupees to government coffers.The minister also proposed to rename Samurdhi Movement as Jana Isuru.

hits._id: Chinese envoy to Sri Lanka

_source.content: The Special Envoy of the Government of China Assistant Minister of Foreign Affairs Liu Jian-chao called on the Minister of Foreign Affairs Mangala Samaraweera yesterday at the Foreign Ministry. During the meeting, the Special Envoy conveyed warm greetings of the Government of China to the new Government and emphasized continuity of the close friendship and engagement with Sri Lanka reinforced by the exchange of high-level visits. Minister Samaraweera warmly welcomed Special Envoy Liu Jian-chao to Sri Lanka, and reiterated Sri Lanka’s time-tested bonds of friendship and cooperation with China nurtured over the years. Referring to the Sri Lanka - China relationship as an ‘all-weather friendship’, Foreign Minister Samaraweera pledged Sri Lanka’s support for the further consolidation of friendly relations between the two countries.During the meeting, the two sides discussed issues of mutual interest ranging from bilateral political, economic, cultural cooperation to people-to-people contacts.Special Envoy Liu Jianchao, who is on a two-day visit to Sri Lanka, is also scheduled to call on President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake.Meanwhile, the Cabinet has also approved to continue the construction of the Colombo Port City project.Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Rajitha Senarathna said the Prime Minister informed the Cabinet that there are no defaults found in the Environment report on the Colombo Port City project.Foreign Minister Samaraweera is scheduled to undertake a bilateral visit to China in the latter part of February 2015 on the invitation of the Chinese Government. The Chinese Government has also extended an invitation to President Sirisena to undertake a State Visit to China in March this year.

hits._id: SLFP appoints committee to reunite Maithree and Mahinda

_source.content: A committee of 6 MPs has been appointed to make a compromise between President Maithripala Sirisena and former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.This committee was appointed during the SLFP working committee meeting which was presided by President Maithripala Sirisena today at the Sri Lanka Foundation Institute.SLFP electorate organizers, MPs and Ministers participated in the meeting. Party Media Spokesman Minister Dilan Perera stated that it was decided to contest in the forthcoming general election under UPFA ticket.He further stated that UNP is continuously saying that they cannot run the government after 100 days.Therefore, a request was made to the UNP to resign before the General Election and hand it over to the UPFAMeanwhile former minister Bandula Gunawardana also expressed his views at this occasion, saying that the President has given a responsibility to the senior leaders of the party to strengthen the alliance and to hold discussions with all allied parties together with President Maithripala Sirisena and former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.Expressing his views, Minister Vijith Vijayamuni Soyza said that different persons hold different opinions. However, despite the differences in opinions, the SLFP has taken the initiative in the process of defeating the UNP.

hits._id: No foreign advice for the new constitution

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena states that some are spreading false rumours to the effect that foreign advice is sought when drafting the new constitution.

Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe presented a proposal to Parliament today for the establishment of a constitutional council with the objective of drafting a new Constitution.

Parliament convened at 10.30 this morning and the first task for the day was to present the proposal for the establishment of a constitutional council.

The President stated that just as times change, the constitution should be changed to suit the need of the hour and meet the aspirations of the people.

Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe stated that even the general public will be involved in the process of drafting a new constitution.

hits._id: 68th Independence Day celebrations today

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena in his Independence Day message has called upon the nation for a pledge to consolidate on the peace and freedom that has been achieved. He urged that the people of sri lanka help to build the future of the motherland and the nation.
He said “ On this day, as we celebrate the 68th anniversary of our Independence, we are proud of the progress made towards safeguarding the freedom, sovereignty, territorial integrity of the Nation and strengthening national reconciliation and economic and political rights of all our citizens”.
The president also stated, "This occasion is of special significance because we commemorate the dawn of freedom at a time coinciding with the taking of clear and resolute steps to firmly establish democracy and good governance, the Rule of Law, and a truly meaningful parliamentary system; to establish a long lasting and stable structure of good governance in keeping with the mandate given by the people one year ago.”
Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe said in a communiqué issued  that although Sri Lanka has been restored as a country that abides by the democratic principles with last year's election of new government, the country faces a formidable task of ensuring lasting peace and co-existence for all citizens while building on the concept of social economic development for the country.
England Queen, Elizabeth the 2nd has sent a congratulatory message to the President on the occasion of the country's 68th National Independence Day.
Indian President Pranab Mukherjee also extended his greetings and felicitations to the government and people of Sri Lanka.
In a message to President Maithripala Sirisena, President Mukherjee said, Quote -“On behalf of the Government, it gives me immense pleasure to extend warm felicitations and best wishes to Your Excellency and to the people of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka on the occasion of the 68th Anniversary of your Independence”. Unquote

hits._id: No one needs be concerned about my political future, Says Ex-Pres. Rajapaksha

_source.content:
Former President and MP Mahinda Rajapaksa says that nobody should be concerned about his political future.
He made this statement  during a public program held at Pannala today (25th) in response to a President Maithripala Sirisenas comments during an interview with the BBC Sandeshaya last week.
When the journalist asked the President's opinion on his predecessor he responded saying future political ambitions of Rajapaksha is out of his concerns.

hits._id: Sri Lanka raises ceiling, interest for senior citizens' fixed deposits to Rs. 1.5 mn at 15%

_source.content: The government has raised the ceiling and the interest rate of senior citizens' fixed deposits. According to a Finance Ministry statement, the upper limit of Fixed Deposits will be raised to 1.5 million rupees at an interest of 15 percent per annum, effective from March 01st. According to the Finance Ministry the present Government, under its 100-day program, in the Budget - 2015 for the first time introduced a 15% special interest scheme for senior citizens fixed deposits up to one million rupees maintained by senior citizens over the age of 60 years. Accordingly, the Government pays the difference between the 15 percent and the market standard interest rate offered by commercial banks. Treasury has incurred 13 billion rupees for this purpose in 2016.

hits._id: Terms of Local Government Bodies which were not dissolved extended by 6 months

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena stated that the terms of local government bodies which have not yet been dissolved will be extended by another 6 months.
 
The President stated that this decision was made taking in to consideration the amendments which are to be made to the Local Government Elections System.
 
President Sirisena participating at an event organized by the Sri Jayawardanapura Kotte Municipal Council to provide exercise books to students said that Local Government Bodies which are termed as dissolved are not really dissolved but rather their terms have expired.

hits._id: 1 hundred thousand rupees compensation for families of the dead - Compensation up to 2.5 million rupees for property damage

_source.content: The government has decided to pay one hundred thousand rupees compensation to the families of each victim of the Meethotamulla garbage mount. Maximum compensation of up to 2.5 million rupees will be paid for property damage. A media communiqué issued by the Ministry of Finance stated that this decision was taken in a meeting held with the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena. The communiqué further stated that the Treasury has approved funds to provide prepared food for the displaced and action will be taken to relocate other families vulnerable to danger or repair the damaged houses. In addition, houses will be provided in government flats to those whose houses were destroyed in the disaster.

hits._id: Opposition Leader urges independent investigation

_source.content: Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe making a special statement in parliament today stated that the government should launch an independent probe into the alleged dormancy of police not investigating complaints received by it with regards to religious extremism.

hits._id: President and PM Arrive at Central Bank

_source.content: President Maithreepala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe arrived at the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) premises a short while ago.A spokesperson from CBSL said the President and PM have called a meeting with CBSL staff to discuss about appointing a new governor.President said in the morning that a new governor will be appointed to the CBSL within next few hours.

hits._id: JHU pledges to stay with govt. till 2020

_source.content:
Megapolis and Western Development Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka yesterday averred that the Jathika Hela Urumaya (JHU)’s support which was extended to President Maithripala Sirisena and the current coalition government would continue until 2020, even if the government had to face problems in the future.
He vowed not to let any so-called patriot to destroy the country’s image which was founded on democracy.
Delivering the main speech at the 12th convention of the JHU, at the ‘Ape Gama’ premises in Battaramulla, the minister, who is also the General Secretary of the JHU, said the government may have to face problems due to recently presented budget, problems from Geneva and other problems. But the JHU would continue to support the government and stay with it and face the problems.
He said that the intention of the JHU was to help build a professional political system which created national unity and was supported by all the political parties in the country.
“Even we have to change ourselves to change the country -- to build an atmosphere where all communities can live in peace and security. We should not change our objectives because some opponents are saying pointless things,” he said.

hits._id: Main political parties announce their decision regarding the vote taking for the budget 2015.

_source.content: All main political parties that represent parliament have announced their decision with regard to the vote taking for the budget 2015.Accordingly, UNP, JVP, TNA and Democratic Party have already decided to vote against the budget while JHU which defected the alliance recently has decided to refrain from voting.However, UPFA coalitions SLMC, NFF, MEP, LSSP and Communist Party have decided to support the budget.Meanwhile former UPFA Minister and Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena told journalists in Kandy that he would not participate in the vote taking at the parliament today.Political sources sated at the same time, the other UPFA parliamentarians who defected the party along with Sirisena would not probably participate in the vote taking this afternoon.When our news team contacted the Independent MP sitting with the Opposition Arjuna Ranatunga said that he has not taken a final decision as yet with regard to the vote taking for the budget 2015.Another Independent MP sitting with the Opposition Ajith Kumara said that he would vote against the budget.The budget 2015 vote taking for the second reading was passed with 100 majority votes on the 1st of November.In the vote taking, 157 MPs voted for the budget while 57 MPs voted against.

hits._id: Mahinda - Maithripala coordination committee meets today

_source.content: The SLFP six-member committee appointed for coordination between former President Mahinda Rajapaksa and Maithripala Sirisena in view of the upcoming general election is scheduled to meet former President Mahinda Rajapaksa today.This is to inform about the discussion they had with President Maithripala Sirisena recently.The committee met the President and held discussions for the first time on 19th this month.After the discussion, Committee members who participated told media that it was possible to arrive at important decisions on this occasion.SLFP MPs who met recently with the President at the chair appointed a six member committee aimed at improving goodwill between former president Mahinda Rajapaksa and current president Maithripala Sirisena.

hits._id: Treasuries Enshrined into Moragahakanda – Kaluganga Dam by President

_source.content:
Enshrining of the traditional sacred relics in the dam of the Kaluganga reservoir of the Moragahakanda - Kaluganga project took place today at the most auspicious time- 10.59 am this morning, under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe and several ministers accompanied the President at this remarkable moment.
After the completion of the Moragahakanda - Kaluganga reservoir, the project result will direct benefit people in North Central, Eastern and North Western provinces by supplying water for 82,000 hectares of cultivation fields in the mentioned areas.
Being a durable solution for the Chronic Kidney Disease caused by the water in the dry zone the Moragahakanda - Kaluganga project target to add an additional 25Mw to the national power grid.

hits._id: The spring is unstoppable, says MR in his New Year wish

He urges the citizens to step forward to create a bright future for the country.
Giving a poetic touch to his wish, Rajapaksha says that ‘flowers can be crushed by enemies but the spring is unstoppable’.

hits._id: President Maithripala poses a question to the former President

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena says that his predecessor had called for early elections to find an escape route for the country’s huge debt trap and added that another reason to hold an early election was his incompetence in facing the UN Human Rights Commission’s charges. President Sirisena was speaking at a conference titled “Strong country, sustainable tomorrow – Let’s ensure 25% female representation”, organized for the female local government representatives at the SLFP headquarters in Colombo this morning. Elaborating further President Maithripala Sirisena noted that he has posed a question to the former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, as to why he called for an early election, when he could have remained in power for two more years. The President also noted that in his opinion, an early election was called by the former President to evade the imminent economic crisis and due to the inability in facing the UNHRC resolution.

hits._id: 42 Ministers of National Government Swore-in Today

_source.content:
42 ministers of the national government swore in today before the President. 11 MPs of the SLFP are included among the cabinet ministers who swore in today. Mangala Samaraweera swore in earlier as the Minister of Foreign Affairs. The resolution for the appointment of 48 cabinet ministers passed in Parliament yesterday. 
The new cabinet swore in today before President Maithripala Sirisena at the Presidential Secretariat. 41 Ministers of National Government have sworn-in already.
P M Ranil Wickramasinghe swore in as Minister of National Policy and Economic Development, John Amaratunge as Minister of Christian Affairs and Tourism Affairs and Nimal Siripala De Silva gave oath as Minister of Transport.  Anura Priyadarshana Yapa swore in as Minister of Disaster Management, Ravi Karunanayake as Minister of Finance and Sajith Premadasa as Minister of Housing and Construction.  Thilak Marapana gave oath as Minister of Law, Order and Prison Reforms, Gayantha Karunathilaka as Minister of Media and Parliament Rehabilitation and Ranjith Maddumabandara swore in as Minister of State Administration and Management.
Wajira Abeywardana gave oath as Minister of Home Affairs, W.D.J. Senaviratne swore in as Minister of Labour and Trade Union and Rajitha Senarathne as Minister of Health.
 Gamini Jayawikrama Perera swore in as Minister of  Wildlife while  Thalatha Athukorala gave oath as Minister of  Foreign Employment and S.B.Navinna as Minister of  Internal Affairs, North-West Development and Culture.
Chandrani Bandara swore in as Minister of  Women and Child Affairs, Mahinda Amaraweera as Minister of  Fishing and Aquatic Resources and Patali Champika Ranawaka gave oath as Minister of  Megapolis and Western Province Development.
Akila Viraj Kariyawasam swore in as Minister of Education, Chandima Weerakkodi as Minister of Petroleum and Gas and Dayasiri Jayasekara as Minister of Sports.
Sagala Rathnayake gave oath as Minister of Southern Development, Laxman Kiriella as Minister of Highways and Harin Fernando as Minister of Telecommunication.
Daya Gamage swore in as Minister of Primary Industries, Mahinda Samarasinghe as Minister of Vocational Training and Development and Navin Dissanayake as Minister of Plantation.
Ranjith Siyambalapitiya swore in as Minister of  Power and Renewable Energy, Duminda Dissanayake as Minister of  Agriculture and Wijeyadasa Rajapaksa gave oath as Minister of  Buddhist Affairs.
P.Harrison swore in as Minister of  Rural Economy, D.M.S.Swaminathan as Minister of  Rehabilitation and Resettlement and S.B. Dissanayake as Minister of  Social Empowerment and Welfare.
 U.P. Digambaram gave oath as Minister of  Upcountry, Village and Community Development, Rishard Bathiudeen as Minister of  Industry and Commerce, Kabir Hasheem as Minister of  Public Enterprise Development and Rauff Hakeem as Minister of  Town Planning and Water Management.

hits._id: Bond report to be handed over to President within next two days

_source.content:
Sumathipala Udugamasuriya, the Secretary of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry appointed to probe the controversial Central Bank bond issuance says that the Commission report would be submitted to the President within the next 48 hours.
 
He said the report is being printed now.
 
President Maithripala Sirisena appointed the Commission on 27th January this year to probe the controversial bond issuance.
 
The Commission’s term will end on 31st of December, 2017.
 
Originally the Commission was scheduled to end its probe on 27th of April. Later, the term was extended at the request of the Commission.
 
During the past 11 months the Prime Minister, Ranil Wickremesinghe, as well as a large number of Government Ministers and Government officials, made statements before the Commission.

hits._id: President 'not influenced' SLFP MP's in NCM, says Minister Samarasinghe

Minister Mahinda Samarasinghe says President Maithripala Sirisena did not advice any parliamentarian to vote in support or against the 'no-confidence motion' on Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.
 
The Minister said this addressing a media conference held at the SLFP Head Quarters in Darley Road today (Apr. 05).
 
Ministers Mahinda Samarasinghe, Vijith Wijayamuni Soyza and Ranjith Siyambalapitiya who were absent during last night's voting attended this media conference.
 
Meanwhile, addressing a media conference, the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake said that the NCM revealed the true nature of this country's political culture.

hits._id: PSC convenes today

_source.content:
The Parliamentary Select Committee established to solve the national issue will convene for the first time today.
Speaking to our news team, the chairman of the PSC Minister Nimal Siripala De Silva stated that the PSC is scheduled to convene at the parliamentary complex at 3pm today.

			   
			   		
	
			    
This committee has been named the PSC to recommend political and constitutional steps to enable the Sri Lankan public to live as one race.
The speaker named the government members who will represent the PSC recently and it includes 19 members of parliament representing the government.
Ministers, Professor G L Peries, Maithripala Sirisena, Douglas Devananda, A L M Athaulla, DEW Gunasekara, Rishard Baduideen, Champika Ranawaka, Wimal Weerawanse, Wasudewa Nanayakkara and Deputy Minister Muththu Sivalingam are members of the PSC.

hits._id: Army submits a report to government on Kandy incident

_source.content:
Sri Lanka Army has submitted a report to the government disclosing details about the recent incidents in the Kandy district.
 
Army Commander, Lt. Gen. Mahesh Senanayake told us that Kandy is peaceful now.
 
Meanwhile, several police teams including the Criminal Investigation Department are carrying out investigations into the incidents in Kandy.
 
In an attempt to contain the clashes, the government imposed ‘State of Emergency’ on 6th of March for a period of 10 days.
 
Minister of Law and Order, Ranjith Madduma Bandara said that a final decision with regard to the ‘State of Emergency’ would be taken at the National Security Council meeting.
 
However, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has suggested that a decision will be taken on the ‘State of Emergency’ after having consulted President Maithripala Sirisena.

hits._id: Thomas Shannon to Call on President Sirisena and PM

_source.content:
US Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs Thomas Shannon is due to call on President Maithripala Sirisena today. The discussion will take place at the Presidential Secretariat.
The Ministry of Foreign Affairs said defense and economic relations between the two countries will be on the agenda.
Shannon engaging in an observational tour of the Eastern Province yesterday said Sri Lanka is an example to the world.
He also commended steps taken by the government towards development and reconciliation following the end of the 3 decade long conflict.

hits._id: UPFA Gen. Sec. stresses MS will be SLFP Presidential candidate

_source.content:
The General Secretary of the United People's Freedom Alliance Minister Mahinda Amaraweera says President Maithripala will be the Sri Lanka Freedom Party's Presidential candidate for 2020.
He told this expressing views to the media following a meeting with the party supporters in Moneragala yesterday (May 06).
He also said that the Ministers who resigned from the government might not attend SLFP's May Day rally to be held in Batticaloa this afternoon.
It will be held under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena.
Meanwhile, W. D. J. Seneviratne, S.B. Dissanayake and Dayasiri Jayasekera who resigned from the Unity Government recently confirmed that they will participate in the SLFP May Day rally.
However, former Ministers, Chandima Weerakkody, Lakshman Yapa Abeywardana and former Deputy Speaker Thilanga Sumathipala did not respond.
The Joint Opposition led by Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna will hold its May Day rally at Samanala Grounds in Galle.
MP Mahindananda Aluthgamage said that the rally will be launched under the patronage of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa at 3 pm.

Minister Ranawaka made this statement while launching his book titled “ Al-jihad Alqaida” which evaluates the Past, Present and Future of Muslim principals”


			   
			   		
	
			   

Meanwhile, Opposition Leader Ranil Wickramasinghe states that the government is attempting to cover up the increase in cost of living through the Halal issue.

hits._id: SLFP to discuss Local government elections

_source.content: The Sri Lanka Freedom Party is to hold a decisive discussion regarding the upcoming local government elections today (03).The meeting will take place under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena at the President's official residence.The SLFP General Secretary Minister Duminda Dissanayake noted that MPs representing the Joint Opposition have also been invited to the discussion.Meanwhile, a letter signed by 42 MPs representing the joint Opposition including former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, was sent to the General Secretary of the SLFP, Minister Duminda Dissanayake yesterday (02).This was in response to the letter issued by the SLFP regarding the discussions on the Local Government elections.In the letter, the JO had put forward 7 conditions in order to move forward together.

hits._id: Multi Party, Multi Religious Summit for Reconciliation; Mechanism only domestic - President

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena stated that the government would take on the responsibility of averting any harmful effect on the country from the world. 
The President stated that an unbiased foreign policy will be adopted to allow the country to win the world.
President Sirisena expressed these views at a media briefing that was held last evening at the President’s House following the return to the island from the US.
President Maithripala Sirisena reiterated that only domestic mechanisms will be allowed to address any concerns on Sri Lanka.

hits._id: Commitment made by war heroes cannot be undervalued - President

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that the commitment made by the war heroes during the war cannot be undervalued.
He stated that the country’s independence was secured due to their commitment and determination.
While participating in a passing out parade held at Diyatalawa Military Academy today (27), President Maithripala Sirisena further stated that as a government, measures will be taken to successfully fulfil the duties and responsibilities it has towards the war heroes.

hits._id: The Prime Minister emphasize on protecting national government for the future

_source.content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe noted that the national government should be protected for the future of the country.The Premier noted this while addressing a UNP member promotion program held at Welimada in Badulla today.Expressing his views further the Premier noted that a national government has the potential to develop the country and help build a better future for the children and youth.He also noted that the government intends to relieve the accumulated debt burden gradually, and attention will be drawn to reducing the debt burden and the budget deficit during the preparation of the next budget.He further stressed that expenditure of the country should be controlled, while means of income should be developed.

hits._id: Former President directed questions by the Premier

_source.content:
“Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa will have to cry in two more Vesak Poya days”, says Premier Ranil Wickramasinghe
Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe made this statement while participating in a rally in Kiribathgoda.
The rally themed as “Let’s protect our victory achieved on the 08th of January in 2015 – let’s stand together as one” which was organized by the United National Party was held in Kiribathgoda yesterday with the Premier chairing the event.
Meanwhile Prime Minister Wickramasinghe directed some questions at former president Rajapaksa as mentioned below.
01)  Why did you not agree to pay back the debts to the Exim bank after 20 years?
02)  Why did we choose to sell the better part of Hambantota port to Chinese organizations and to pay the debts?
03)  Why did you sell part of port city in property and rented the rest for 99 years?
04)  Are you not ashamed to cry for the selling of Hambantota Port?
Check out the statement made by premier below.

President Maithripala Sirisena says short sighted decisions taken by the previous government damaged the Wilpattu National Park.

hits._id: A budget with many benefits to the public will be presented; says President.

_source.content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa says he is not prepared to mislead the public by presenting the budget aiming an election.The president said that this budget will provide benefits to the public.He noted that it includes number of proposals focusing on the future of the country, to improve the quality of life.The president expressed these views during a meeting held with trade union representatives at Temple Trees this morning.The president said that they were able to provide numerous benefits for the working masses due to accurate economic management of the government during the past 10 years.From 2005 every budget has increased the salaries of the state sector employees.President Rajapaksa said similarly various benefits were provided to the public.The President’s Media Unit said that trade union activists also presented several proposals related to next year’s budget.

hits._id: All locations in parliament undergo special inspection

hits._id: Mahinda Rajapaksha Returns from Bangkok

Mahinda Rajapaksha was accompanied by former minister G.L.Pieris and Western Provincial Councilor Upali Kodikara.

hits._id: SLFP Ministers to meet discuss 'no-confidence motion'

It was reported that the SLFP Ministers in the government have had a meeting with President Maithripala Sirisena on the proposed motion, last night.
 
It is reported that the SLFP Ministers are planning to hand over a letter to the President, offering their support to the no-confidence motion.

hits._id: UNHRC commissioner to arrive tomorrow

_source.content:
Accepting an invitation extended by the Sri Lankan Government in February 2015, the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights, Zeid Ra'ad Al Hussein will undertake a four-day official visit to Sri Lanka beginning tomorrow.
During the visit, the UN human rights chief will call on President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and Leader of Opposition R. Sampanthan.
On 7th and 8th February, the High Commissioner will visit Jaffna and Trincomalee where he will meet with the Governors and Chief Ministers of the Northern and Eastern Provinces respectively.
The High Commissioner will also meet with religious leaders in different locations.

hits._id: Consensus government’s first cabinet reshuffle today

_source.content: Consensus Government’s first cabinet reshuffle takes place today.President Maithripala Sirisena has informed all cabinet, state and deputy ministers to be at the Presidential Secretariat at 8.30 this morning.Political sources said that final discussions between the President and the Prime Minister regarding the cabinet reshuffle were held last afternoon.After the meeting, the consensus government’s ministers representing the UNP met Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe at Temple Trees at 9.30 last night.Reports say that the discussion continued on till 10:30 .Responding to a query by our news team a senior minister said the Prime Minister had informed all Ministers that the cabinet reshuffle would take place today.the Prime Minister had informed the UNP Ministers that there wouldn’t be a change in the ministry posts assigned to the UNP and the SLFP.Reports state that it is probable that the posts for the  ministry of finance and ministry of mass media  communications will be assigned to Mangala Samaraweera who had previously held the Foreign Affairs Ministry post.political sources say that Ravi Karunaanayake will be reassigned from the ministry of finance to the Foreign Affairs Ministry post.At the meeting held with the Prime Minister it was also proposed that Tilak Maarapana who had recently resigned from the ministry should be re-assigned a ministry.Gayantha Karunatilleke will be assigned the ministry of  parliamentary reforms and lands.Expressing his views to our news team UPFA general secretary Minister Mahinda Amaraweera also said that with the cabinet reshuffle taking place today the country would embark on a  new path, one that will be beneficial to the people. Meanwhile a senior minister representing the SLFP said a special SLFP central committee meeting is also scheduled to be held tonight. at the presidential secretariat with President Maithripala Sirisena at the chair.

hits._id: No One Can Topple This Government: Prime Minister

_source.content:
No one will be able to topple this government prematurely and do not get deceived by false statements made by conspirators, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe said on Saturday (19th).
Both the President and the Prime Minister were present at the 19th national convention of Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) in Ampara where they responded to the rally held by the Joint Opposition on March 17, 2016.
Prime Minister (PM) Wickremasinghe who took the opposition on said no one will be able to stop the development programs of this government. He said countries such as Singapore and India will assist the development of East while China will assist the development of Hambantota.
The premier said the government is faced with the task of paying the loans taken by the previous government which had spent those funds to construct presidential palaces. He said government wanted to handover these to investors to convert them into hotels but no one was interested in buying them.
Meanwhile, addressing the convention, President Maithripala Sirisena said this government will push its opponents to political wilderness and will take the country towards prosperity.

hits._id: Vehicle importers describe how prices fluctuate after budget proposals.

_source.content: The Lanka Vehicle Importers Association said that the prices of vans will be reduced extensively after vehicle import tax was revised in the recent budget.Presenting the budget in parliament, President Mahinda Rajapaksa said that a special tax will replace the various current taxes on vehicle import.However, Lanka Vehicle Importers Association’s President Indika Sampath Merenchige stated that prices of hybrid vehicles will not reduce sharply although tax on them was cut to some extent in the budget.

Meanwhile, journalists questioned Dinesh Gunawardena at the press conference drawing attention to initiatives to form a new party under Mahinda Rajapaksha’s patronage.
Gunawardena affirmed that Rajapaksha is in the Joint Opposition which is the genuine anti-UNP camp in the house.See the video below....
