hits._id: UPFA Local Government members who voted against their budgets summoned

_source.content: UPFA Local Government members who voted against their budgets for 2014 and defeated them later have been summoned for a special meeting at the parliament complex today.UPFA General Secretary Susil Premajayantha has made this summons.Meanwhile Local Government members of the SLFP who voted against the budgets and defeated them later yesterday have also been summoned by party General Secretary Maithreepala Sirisena to the SLFP headquarters.SLFP senior spokesman said that the local government members were advised on several matters including how to secure the administration of the local bodies.Meanwhile the UNP Leadership Council has decided to take disciplinary actions against their local government members who did not vote against the budgets presented by UPFA controlled local government bodies.UNP General Secretary MP Tissa Attanayake said that details of the local government members who did not support to defeat UPFA budgets have already been compiled.Similarly the party has focussed its attention towards the discussion held with the alliance to obtain its support to win budget votes in local government institutions in which the UNP holds power in.Dialogue regarding this arose after the Chairman and the Deputy Chairman of the Seethawaka Municipal Council requested the assistance of the UPFA to pass its budget.Upon inquiry by our news team, the General Secretary of the UNP Parliamentarian Thissa Attanayaka stated that both the Chairman and the Deputy Chairman of the Seethawaka Municipal Council had been severely warned in this regard.

hits._id: Further discussions about VAT revision; Solutions to 95 per cent traders’ problems

_source.content:
A special discussion on re-amending the increased Value Added Tax was held at President’s office yesteday.
While close to 200 representatives of retail and wholesale Vendor unions participated in the discussion, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake also took part representing the Government besides the President.
However representatives of vendor unions who participated in the discussion said that a final decision on providing a VAT relief could not be reached at the discussion.
Expressing his views to media after the discussion Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake said that it was hoped to introduce a simple tax system in the future.
Meanwhile all Government Party Ministers and MPs assembled at President’s office under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe last night.
On this occasion UNP General Secretary Minister Kabir Hasheem also gave a special presentation about VAT.
On this occasion the UNP MPs pointed out that all Government ministers and MPs should shoulder a combined responsibility amidst certain groups raising their voice against the VAT.
It was also decided at this discussion that if amendments were required for VAT steps should be taken for it in the future.

hits._id: Wijeyadasa Rajapakse, Field Marshal Fonseka Flare Up In Cabinet

_source.content:
Ministers Wijeyadasa Rajapakse and Cabinet Minister for Regional Development Sarath Fonseka had a heated argument at the Cabinet meeting yesterday (April 06th), when the latter accused of former for violating a collective agreement of the Cabinet of Ministers.
According to sources, the dispute had taken place when Field Marshal Fonseka objected to the action of Mr. Wijeyadasa Rajapakse in tendering an apology to a Buddhist monk over a statement made by Field Marshal Fonseka in Parliament recently.
“I made a statement in Parliament where I referred to a statement made by a monk. I referred to this statement as I wanted to disclose who is going behind the Rajapaksas. But one minister of the Cabinet is violating the collective agreement of the Cabinet of Ministers. We want to safeguard the government, but some are still going behind the Rajapaksas,” Minister Fonseka had told President Maithripala Sirisena.
Mr. Rajapakse had immediately responded by saying it was he who had tendered the apology. “I tendered an apology as the Prime Minister or the President would otherwise have had to do so, on behalf of the government, as it is not possible to run a government without the support of the Buddhist monks,” he said.
President Sirisena had then intervened and calmed both ministers down, saying the views of both of them were important.

hits._id: PM Ranil Wickramasingha says Foreign naval bases will not be allowed in Sri lanka

Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe affirmed that while the government of Sri Lanka will continue to ensure that all ports in the country are open for commercial shipping, it will not be allocating naval bases to foreign countries,

hits._id: Stern action will be taken against wrongdoers: President

hits._id: "Group of 16" undecided to whom to support at Presidential Election

hits._id: Commonwealth summit begins today; Sri lanka hands over the chairmanship to Malta

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena, arrived in Malta last afternoon to attend the heads of government meeting commencing this morning.President Maithripala Sirisena is scheduled to hand over the Commonwealth chairmanship to Maltese Prime Minister Joseph Muscat.President Sirisena, who is the current Chair-in-Office of the Commonwealth, received accolades for his commitment to promote commonwealth principles.The Secretary General of Commonwealth Secretariat, Dr. Kamlesh Sharma said the President Maithripala Sirisena did a wonderful job to promote Commonwealth ideals.Speaking to media after a joint press conference with Maltese Prime Minister Joseph Muscat at the CHOGM Media Center, Dr. Sharma said President Sirisena’s total commitment to promote commonwealth principles such as democracy, human rights and accountability is exceptionally praiseworthy.

hits._id: The anti narcotic program launched by the government has borne fruit says the president

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena says that the anti narcotic program launched by the government to save the future generation has borne fruit. He said that revenue incurred from alcohol and cigarettes have drastically dropped for the first time in history. President Sirisena was speaking at a ceremony to open a building complex at Teldeniya District hospital in Kandy today.

hits._id: Speedy relief to those displaced due to Uma Oya project.

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has given instructions to officials to provide speedy relief to people displaced due to the Moragahakanda and Kalu Ganga Projects.
The President said so while participating at a meeting held at the Mahaweli Development and Environment Ministry yesterday for reviewing the progress of programmes implemented under that ministry.
On this occasion the President inquired from the officials with regard to additional allocations and other physical and human resources required for the Moragahakanda and Kalu Ganga projects.
Issuing a communiqué the Presidential Media Division said that the Government  promised to provide the resources required for completing the project within due time frame without any hindrance. 
President Maithripala Sirisena also instructed relevant officials to present a work plan including proposals to minimize the use of polythene and plastics.
He advised them to present recommendations on low-cost alternatives for asbestos.
The President gave these instructions at a discussion on the progress of the programs carried out under the Ministry of Mahaweli Development and Environment, held yesterday at the Ministry of Environment.
He directed the officials to take speedy actions to provide drinking water to the victimized people in the areas where the water sources have been dried out due to Uma Oya project.

hits._id: Mahinda speaks of what should be done if elections cannot be held

_source.content:
Former President and Member of Parliament Mahinda Rajapaksa says that if local government elections are to be postponed, former local government institutions should be reinstated.  

He expressed these views to the media following a discussion held with the representatives of the local government at the residence of former minister of the Wayamba provincial council, D.B Herath.

The discussion held yesterday saw the attendance of many representatives of the local government institutions yesterday.

hits._id: New Cabinet takes oath: 27 cabinet Ministers, 10 state Ministers and 8 deputy Ministers.

Swaminadan – Minister of Resettlement, Reconstruction and Hindu Affairs, Rauff Hakeem – Minister of Urban Development, Water Supply and Drainage,Thalatha Athukorala – Minister of Foreign Employment, Ranjith Madduma Bandara – Minister of Internal Transport, P. Harrison – Minister of Social Services and Social Welfare.M.K.D.S. Gunawardena took oaths as the Minister of Land, Chandrani Bandara – Minister of Women’s Affairs, Karu Jayasuriya - Minister of Buddha Sasana, Lakshman Kiriella – Minister of Plantation and Gamini Jayawickrama Perera – Minister of Food Security. 10 MP’s took oaths as state Ministers.Accordingly Nandimithra Ekanayake took oaths as the state Minister of Culture and the Arts, V. Radhakrishnan - Ministry of Education, Faizer Mustapha - Ministry of Aviation, Palitha Range Bandara - Ministry of Power and Energy,Dilip Wedaarachchi - Ministry of Fisherie, Rosy Senanayake - Ministry of Children’s Affairs, Rajiva Wijesinghe - Ministry of Higher Education,Ruwan Wijewardene - Ministry of Defence, K. Velayudhan - Ministry of  Plantation Industries and Niroshan Perera - Ministry of  Youth Affairs.8 Deputy Ministers also took oaths before President Maithripala Sirisena.Champika Premadasa took oaths as the deputy Minister of Industry and Commerce, Harsha de Silva - Ministry of Policy Development & Economic Affairs, Eran Wickramaratne- Ministry of Highways and Investment Promotion, Sujeewa Senasinghe - Ministry of Justice, Wasantha Senanayake - Ministry of Tourism,Vijayakala Maheswaran - Ministry of Women’s Affairs,Ajith P. Perera - Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Anoma Gamage - Ministry of Irrigation.

hits._id: 1,000 Proposals On Constitutional Reforms

_source.content:
The committee appointed to gather suggestions for Constitutional reforms has gathered close to 1,000 proposals in the Colombo District.
Chairman of the Committee Attorney Lal Wijenayake said the proposals were submitted via written form, fax, e-mail and verbally.
Speaking at a media briefing this morning Wijenayake said the committee will reconvene in the Colombo District in the month of March for more ideas and suggestions of the masses.
From the 1st of February the committee will break into groups and visit all districts and while in Colombo will engage in a joint venture.
Attorney Lal Wijenayake added they will also call on the President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe to discussion the proposals and suggestions put forth to the committee.

hits._id: Fuel prices reduced: Petrol by 33 rupees, diesel and Kerosene oil by 16 rupees.

_source.content: The government announced that it has decided to reduce the prices of fuel with effect from midnight yesterday.The government said it will cut taxes on the fuel to lower the prices in order to provide relief to the people as promised during the election campaign of the President.Accordingly, the government has reduced the price of 92 Octane Petrol by Rs. 33 rupees per liter and it will now cost 117 rupees per liter.Price of 95 Octane Petrol has been reduced by 30 rupees and the new price is 128 rupees.Price of diesel has been reduced by 16 rupees per liter to 95 rupees, Super Diesel reduced by 23 rupees to 110 rupees.Kerosene was reduced by 16 rupees per liter and it will now cost 65 rupees.Power and Energy Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka said the decision to reduce the fuel prices was taken during a cabinet meeting held yesterday under the patronage of the President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.

hits._id: Budget of Good Governance Government approved with a Two Thirds majority

_source.content:
The 3rd reading of budget 2016 was passed in parliament, with a majority of 109 votes yesterday.
 
160 voted in favour of the budget, 51 voted against it while 13 MP’s were absent.
 
Minister of Finance Ravi Karunanayake presented the budget to the parliament on the 20th of November.
 
The second reading of the budget  2016 was passed in parliament on the 2nd of December with a  majority of 107 votes.
 
The absent MP’s were Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, Wimal Weerawansa, Pavithra Wanniarachchi, Thenuka Vidanagamage, Janaka Bandara, Manusha Nanayakkara, Siripala Gamlath, Premalal Jayasekera, Geetha Kumarasinghe, Selvam Adekkalanaadan, Shiva Shakthi Anandan, Ali Sabir Mowlana, and M.K.D.S Gunawardena respectively. 
 
However the MP’s absent during the 2nd reading of the budget, UNP MP Buddhika Pathirana and Ven. Rathana of the Hela Urumaya were present for the voting yesterday.
 
SLFP and TNA MPs joined their UNP counterparts in voting for the budget. 
 
However JVP and SLFP Joint Opposition members voted against it. Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake making the reply speech on the budget noted that expenditure of the state increased by 35.5 Billion Rupees due to the recent amendments made. 
He noted that he would cater to the added expenditure by cutting down expenses of other ventures.
The finance minister added further that the state resources will be allocated accordingly in order to boost investments.
He also provided additional details with regard to the amendments made and added that the increment of salary’s of the state employees will be implemented in the month of January.

hits._id: UPDATE: Don’t underestimate the enemy: says the President; President and I are drivers who do not fall asleep: says Premier

_source.content:
The 69th anniversary commemoration of the UNP was held at the party headquarters today, under the patronage of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.President Maithripala Sirisena was invited as the chief guest of the ceremony.Leaders of the coalition parties which contested the General Election together with the UNP under the ticket of United National Front, including Rauf Hakeem, Rishard Badiudeen, P. Digambaram, Patali Champika Ranawaka, Mano Ganesan, as well as Venerable Rathana Thera in addition to leader of Democratic party Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka also participated in the UNP’s 69th anniversary commemoration.After Vice Leader of the party Minister Ravi Karunanayake delivered the welcome address, Deputy Leader of the party Sajith Premadasa and General Secretary Kabir Hashim also addressed the ceremony.President Maithripala Sirisena participating in the ceremony stated that UPFA would extend the hand of fellowship to the UNP in order to build a country ruled with good governance.Later, Leader of UNP Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe addressed the party’s 69th anniversary commemoration ceremony.In his speech, the Premier stated that he and the President would take measures to bestow a favorable future for the people, who placed the country in their hands.Expressing his views about the National Government, The Prime Minister stated that he and President Maithripala Sirisena are drivers who do not fall asleep.Sunday, 06 September 2015 - 18.42--------------------------------------------Family rule brought to an end with the sacrifice of party supporters -PMThe 69th anniversary commemoration of the UNP commenced at Sirikotha party headquarters this morning.

The commemoration is held under the patronage of Party leader Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, while it is significant that Chairman of SLFP President Maithripala Sirisena also participating in the commemoration ceremony.

Leaders of the coalition parties which contested the General Election together with the UNP, under the ticket of United National Front, including Rauf Hakeem, Rishard Badiudeen, P. Digambaram, Patali Champika Ranawaka, Mano Ganesan, as well as Venerable Rathana Thera in addition to leader of Democratic party Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka also participated in the UNP’s 69th anniversary commemoration.
 The commemoration ceremony commenced after offering garlands to the statues of the late leaders of the UNP.

Vice Leader of UNP Minister Ravi Karunanayake, Deputy Leader of the party Sajith Premadasa, General Secretary Kabeer Hashim addressed the ceremony.

Later Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe addressed the 69th anniversary commemoration ceremony.

In his speech, Prime Minister expressed his gratitude to the party supporters who made sacrifices to end the family rule, believed to have remained unchanged for long.
  
Addressing the commemoration ceremony, President Maithripala Sirisena stated that today’s commemoration is a historical milestone.

			   
			   		
	
			   Sunday, 06 September 2015 - 12:18--------------------------------------------69th Anniversary of the UNP at Siri Kotha party headquarters todayUnited National Party's 69th Anniversary will be held at the party headquarters 'Sirikotha' this morning at the 9.30 under the patronage of Party Leader, Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasingha.

Chairman of SLFP, President Maithripala Sirisena is also scheduled to participate in the anniversary celebrations.

According to event organizers, the President's participation in the party event, signals a new political culture that reflects consensus building.

Newly appointed ministers and parliamentarians, leaders and deputy leaders, organizers from electorates of the United National Party and a large number of party members are expected to attend the event.

Prime Minister Wickremesinghe will make a special announcement on the programme to be launched by the new government to uplift the country's economy.

hits._id: New Tough Laws on Child Pornography And Excess To Pornographic Material

Government is looking at enacting new legislations to prevent exploitation of children in obscene publications and to safeguard the children from exposure to ill effects of pornographic materials, government media reports.
Minister of Justice, Dr. Wijayadasa Rajapaksha has proposed drafting a new Obscene Publications Bill as the government believes that the provisions stipulated in the archaic Penal Code and Obscene Publications Ordinance of 1927, are inadequate to deal with current social context.

hits._id: Proposal to remove the Media Secretary will be handed over to the President

_source.content:
The government has recommended to remove Nimal Bopage from the post of Secretary of the Ministry of Parliamentary Reforms and Mass Media.
This decision had been reached after having considered the impact of a communiqué released by the secretary, thus acting against the efforts of President and the Prime Minister to establish a free environment for media.
The statement under the title “Uthum vu Madhya Nidahasa, Awabhavitha Nokaramu” issued by Nimal Bopage drew much attention of the government, prompting the Prime Minister to summon the Secretary and severely reprimand him.
Bopage soon after assuming duties had issued this controversial statement which had belittled the Government. Senior Cabinet Ministers had expressed their serious concern, and the decision to remove him from the post had been taken thereafter.
Directive removing the secretary is expected to be forwarded to President Maithripala Sirisena within the next couple of days.

MP Kanchana Wijesekara, State Minister Dilip Weddearahchi, MP Piyal Nishantha, MP Vijitha Herath, and ministers Mahinda Amaraweera, Daya Gamage and MP Jayantha Samaraweera voiced their views this way..

hits._id: Chinese Foreign Minister Arrives Today

_source.content:
A high caliber Chinese delegation, led by Foreign Minister Wang Yi, will arrive in Colombo today and will shortly thereafter call on President Maithripala Sirisena, before attending a formal dinner hosted by foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera.
The delegation will also be meeting Premier Ranil Wickremesinghe on Saturday for talks on furthering Sino-Lanka relations in several fields. Relations between the two countries took a nose dive triggered by the different foreign policy stances opted by the current government in its first year in power. Many Chinese mega projects were initiated under the former pro-China government.
However, the government was able to restore good relations with China after official visits made by the President and Premier.
Up for discussion are the present status on mega projects, potential areas of future investments and issues relating to bilateral trade. The delegation will be visiting the Kelaniya Temple on Saturday evening and returning to China Saturday night.

The government had insisted that it will not hold the election under the present electoral system.
The delimitation has been done to introduce the new electoral system, but there were many complaints regarding the delimitation, the government also says.
President Maithripala Sirisena also gave an assurance recently that the LG polls will be held early next year.

hits._id: "Health Minister and Secretary should be arrested" - SAITM parents

_source.content:
The Parents' Association of Malabe Private Medical College said today (Mar. 15) that the Health Minister and his Ministry Secretary should be arrested.
Addressing a media conference held in Colombo, the convener of the Association, Gemunu Wijerathna said that the takeover of the Neville Fernando hospital by the government is not genuine.
Meanwhile, Dr. Neville Fernando noted yesterday that he decided to sell the Malabe Neville Fernando hospital to settle the loans he obtained for its construction.
A newspaper advertisement was published recently seeking a buyer for the hospital.
Earlier, the Government announced that it took over the Neville Fernando hospital.
The respective agreement was signed between the then Health Ministry Secretary Janaka Sugathadasa and Dr. Neville Fernando on 17th of July last year.
President Maithripala Sirisena and Health Minister, Rajitha Senarathna also participated in the ceremony.
The General Manager of the state bank which granted the loan to construct the hospital was also a signatory to the particular agreement.

hits._id: Hacked websites rectified

_source.content:

The affected websites are the Chief Government Whip of Parliament, Ministry of Rehabilitation and Prison Reforms and Deyata Kirula Exhibition.
Engineer of the Sri Lanka Rapid Computer Response Gild Roshan Chandragupta said Swift actions were taken to block further deface and the damaged websites are rectified by now.

hits._id: Debate over Mohan Peiris begins today

_source.content: The parliament meets this afternoon for the debate requested by the Opposition with regard to removing Mohan Peiris from the post of Chief Justice.That was in accordance with a relevant request Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe submitted to Speaker Chamal Rajapaksa.An argumentative situation arose in parliament last Friday as a result of the Opposition asking for a debate after Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe made a special statement in parliament with regard to removing Mohan Peiris.While subsequently parliament was adjourned for 20 minutes, the house met again after 30 minutes.On that occasion the Prime Minister had agreed to hold the debate concerned on February 5th.However at the time parliament resumed session MP Dinesh Gunawardhana requested that the debate be commenced on Friday and at least one opposition MP be given opportunity to speak.However the Prime Minister said that opportunity for the debate would be given on February 5th.Although the Opposition requested for the debate on February 2nd, the Government rejected it giving Independence Day celebration rehearsals as the reason for the refusal.Subsequently a heated argument took place between Government and Opposition MPs.

The President said that he fully trusts the masses to undertake his fight against corruption.

hits._id: ‘Sri Lanka’s economy and future journey’- expert assistance to a better SL

_source.content:
A special discussion with regard to obtaining the expert government officials’ views for preparing the country’s future economic plans was held with President Maithripala Sirisena, yesterday.
The Presidential Media Division said that the expert assistance was thus being obtained for the country’s future economic plans aimed at a model nation with a firm development possessing a high income and creating a satisfied and peaceful society.
Parliamentarians and Ministers including Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, Finance Minister Ravi Karunanaayake, Ministry secretaries including Presidential Secretary P. B. Abeykoon, senior government officers as well as a group of intellectuals including university lecturers and professors participated in the discussion organized under the theme ‘Sri Lanka’s economy and future journey’.
The Presidential Media Division said that lengthy discussions had been held at this meeting on preparing economic plans aimed at fulfilling the country’s development targets.
On this occasion the experts had expressed views about methodologies to be adopted in fulfilling Sri Lanka’s intermediary targets such as generating a million employment opportunities, raising the people’s income level, widening the rural economic development in order to create a wide and strong middle class.
The President said that through discussions like these, academicians as well as intellectuals could freely express their views as the drawbacks of the government could be identified and also future development and economic plans will be prepared.

Party leaders' meeting, which was held at the Parliament to decide whether to hold the debate on Bond Commission and other commission reports has ended without an agreement.
The parliamentary group leader of the Joint Opposition MP Dinesh Gunawardena confirmed it.The meeting was chaired by the Speaker Karu Jayasuriya.
 
Chairman of the Election Commission, Mahinda Deshapriya was also invited to attend the meeting.
 
Prior to the commencement of the meeting, JVP Propaganda Secretary Vijitha Herath told our news team that his party intends to propose that the debate is held over two days, before 7th of February.
 
Speaking to our news team, Joint Opposition Group Leader, Dinesh Gunawardena said that his group is ready to participate in the debate at any time before the election.

hits._id: Today marks 3rd anniversary of President assuming office

_source.content:
Today marks the 3rd anniversary of President Maithripala Sirisena assuming the office as the President of Sri Lanka.
 
Contesting the Presidential Election on 8th of January 2015 as the common opposition candidate, President Maithripala Sirisena was elected as the country’s 6th Executive President, with over 6.2 million votes.
 
Several state functions have been organized today in commemoration of the anniversary.
 
Meanwhile, Sri Lanka's largest multi-functional irrigation project, Moragahakanda-Kalu Ganga Multi-Purpose Development Project will be commissioned today.
 
The commissioning ceremony has been organized with President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe as Chief Guests.
 
The President will ceremonially release water from Moragahakanda reservoir at the auspicious time of 11.20 this morning to mark the completion of the project which commenced on 25th of January, 2007.
 
The project was expedited over the last three years under the guidance of the President.
 
The event will be followed by another opening ceremony in Polgolla, Kandy at 3.30 pm, to mark the completion of Mahaweli Development Programme.
 
The President will also participate in the opening ceremony for the Rajagiriya flyover.
 
The project, at a cost of Rs. 4.7 billion was financed via a soft loan of Rs, 4.3 billion from the Government of Spain.

hits._id: SLFP's crucial meeting commences

UPFA General Secretary, Minister, Mahinda Amaraweera told our news team that the forthcoming Local Government polls and the future course of action of the party are on the top of the agenda. SLFP General Secretary Duminda Dissanayake stated recently that SLFP parliamentarians in the Joint Opposition were invited to this discussion. A letter signed by 42 MPs representing the Joint Opposition including former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, was sent to General Secretary of the SLFP, Minister Duminda Dissanayake yesterday (02).This was in response to the letter issued by the SLFP regarding discussions on the Local Government elections.In the letter, 7 conditions had been mentioned, to be implemented immediately, to consider any unification.The proposals include the disengagement of the SLFP from the coalition government, reduction in the cost of living, detachment from the constitution compilation process, and action be taken against individuals connected to the bond issue and ending of underworld killings.

M. A. Peiris, Dr. Nimalka Fernando, Mirak Raheem, Somasiri K. Liyanage and Kanakapillai Vendan are the other members of the OMP.The Government set aside Rs. 1.3 billion for this Office through the 2018 Budget.

hits._id: Visit of UAE Foreign Minister  to Sri Lanka

_source.content: The United Arab Emirates’ Foreign Minister, His Highness Sheikh Abdullah bin Zayed al-Nayhan, visited Sri Lanka on the invitation of the Government of Sri Lanka.   During bilateral consultations the Foreign Ministers explored ways of strengthening trade and investment ties, improving the welfare of Sri Lankan workers in the UAE, and collaborating on issues regional and international concern. Foreign Minister Samaraweera briefed his counterpart on the government’s political and economic plans. He noted that the formation of a National Government would create political and policy stability that would enable the country to address long-unsolved challenges facing Sri Lanka. Minister Samaraweera said that, just as Sri Lanka was a paradise for UAE tourists, the government’s objective was to make it a paradise for investors. He invited UAE firms, which are already a significant source of investment for Sri Lanka, to increase their investments, observing that the Government was establishing 45 economic development zones. Minister Samaraweera noted that the 250,000 Sri Lankan migrant workers employed the UAE make a tremendous contribution to Sri Lanka’s economy. He emphasized that Sri Lanka is committed to increasing the skill level of migrant workers entering the UAE – including domestic workers. He also noted that Sri Lanka would continue to engage through the Abu Dhabi Dialogue to improve inter-ministerial coordination and cooperation on migrant worker issues – including qualification recognition.The two Foreign Ministers also agreed to hold the second Sri Lanka-UAE Joint Commission later this year in Colombo.The Secretary to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Secretary to the Ministry of Foreign Employment, the Chairman of the Board of Investment and the Director-General to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry and other senior officials attended the meeting. The UAE Foreign Minister also called on President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.

hits._id: This is the time for Sri Lanka: Kerry

_source.content:
U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry said that the United States wants to renew ties with Sri Lanka and urged its new government to work with the United Nations.
Kerry announced the start of an annual bilateral dialogue and said the United States would immediately send experts to advise the new government on economic growth, trade and investment.
Kerry said that no country in the world saw 100% fulfilment of human rights.
U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry also met President Maithripala Sirisena and later Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.
During a news conference Kerry said the United States was not seeking to meddle in Sri Lanka's internal affairs.
He did not mention China by name but said he had reiterated during his meeting on Saturday that the United States was not asking Sri Lanka to align with any one country.

hits._id: A new system replaces duty free vehicle permits

_source.content:
Five committee’s comprising members of parliament from the UNP have been appointed to undertake discussions about budget 2016.
This appointment happened following the two-day workshop held in Benthota where UNP MPs attended. Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe chaired the workshop.
The leadership of these committees has been handed over to Ministers Akila Viraj Kariyawasam, Harin Fernando, Eran Wickremaratne and Ajith P. Perera.
 Topics to be discussed include fulfilling people’s aspirations, how the upcoming election should be contested and how dealings with media should be carried out.
 A senior Minister, who participated in the workshop said that discussions were also had relating to the introduction of a new system that would replace duty-free vehicle permits for MPs and State officers.
In the budget 2016, it was decided to do away with the permit system through which Government provides relief in buying motor vehicles.
This decision was made, taking into account the abuse of the said permit granted once in five years and a 147- billion rupee tax revenue loss to the country during the past four years.
The workshop also focused on how to provide a fertilizer subsidy to farmers again.

On this occasion discussion was held with regard to the mode of action the SLFP and UPFA MPs adopt in parliament.
The decision as to who should participate at party leaders’ meetings was also taken on this occasion.
On this occasion party leaders and President Maitripala Sirisena said that while SLFP MPs who accepted posts of Minister, Deputy Minister or State Minister should occupy Government seats in parliament, the other MPs could if necessary occupy seats in the Opposition.

hits._id: A New Education System Will Be Introduced – PM

_source.content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe says a new education system will be introduced in the near future.
Speaking at an event held in Colombo last evening, Premier Wickremesinghe said the present government hopes to develop education costs through the growth of the country’s Gross Domestic Product (GDP).
He said the country’s development relies on the education system in the island.
The Prime Minister said the public was promised of a 6 per cent allocation for education from the Gross Domestic product when President Maithripala Sirisena was elected as the new President.
Accordingly, he said the economy should be further developed in order to keep to the government’s promise.

hits._id: 13 institutions removed from Prime Minister

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has relinquished the authority of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe in two key monetary institutions and placed them under the Ministry of Finance.
In an extraordinary Gazette issued yesterday (Mar 28), the President moved the Central Bank of Sri Lanka and the Securities and Exchange Commission of Sri Lanka from the Ministry of National Policies and Economic Affairs to the Finance Ministry.
Accordingly, formulation of monetary policies and macroeconomic management in coordination with the Central Bank of Sri Lanka and monitoring revenue collection and expenditure would be a responsibility of the Ministry of Finance.
The President also re-assigned several other institutions that were under the Ministry of National Policies and Economic Affairs including the National Youth Council, National Youth Corps, National Youth Awards Authority, Public Utilities Commission, Department of Project Management and Monitoring, Employees Trust Fund, and etc under the Ministries which were held earlier.
In addition, at the Cabinet meeting, the President also abolished the Cabinet Committee on Economic Management which was headed by the Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.

Mahinda Rajapaksha and Namal Rajapaksha were also present at Kaduwela Magistrate Court.
5 persons including Yoshitha Rajapaksa were taken into custody by the FCID on 30th January under several charges including the abuse of state property to promote CSN television channel and launching the CSN channel on undeclared assets.

hits._id: SLFP CC meets tonight

_source.content:
Sri Lanka Freedom Party Central Committee will meet this evening (May 17) under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena.
 
MP Chandima Weerakkody who recently stepped down from the Ministry post said that the meeting is scheduled to begin at around 7 pm.
 
It is expected to take a decision on the fate of the SLFP in the Unity Government at this meeting.
 
Meanwhile, State Minister A. H. M. Fowzi said that the agenda which is already finalized made no mention of such a decision to be made.
 
The State Minister said that a discussion on party restructuring is on the agenda.

hits._id: Governors swear-in before President

_source.content:
The government has taken steps to shuffle the governors.
 
Accordingly, they were sworn-in before President Maithripala Sirisena today (Apr. 12).
 
Hemakumara Nanayakkara  - Sabaragamuwa
K. C. Logeshwaran - North-West
Niluka Ekanayake - Sabaragamuwa
Reginald Cooray - Central
Marshal Perera - South
M. P. Jayasinghe - North Central
P. B. Dissanayake - Uva

hits._id: Update: 19th Amendment tabled in Parliament

_source.content: The 19th Amendment to the Constitution, which recommends several constitutional changes including the pruning of the powers of the Executive Presidency, was tabled in Parliament by Prime Minister (PM) Ranil Wickremesinghe today. Update: Tuesday, 24 March 2015 - 3:19 PM....................................................19th amendment todayThe first parliamentary meeting after the formation of a national Government with 26 SLFP ministers accepting ministries in the Government will be held at 1 p.m. today.Meanwhile the draft 19th amendment to the constitution Act is scheduled to be presented in parliament today.A senior Government spokesman said that the draft amendment Act has received cabinet nod.The draft 19th amendment to the constitution Act containing amendments including removal of certain executive presidency powers was gazetted on the 16th of this month.

hits._id: Only 30 ministers in the new government; says Common candidate Maithripala.

_source.content: The Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena says the number of ministerial portfolios in his future government will be limited to 30.Common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena was speaking at a public rally held at Mawanella this afternoon.Meanwhile Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe who met a group of personnel engaged in tourism industry at his office said the current government has crippled the industry.At the same time, former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga rejected the allegations made by the government that a conspiracy was hatched in Singapore to topple the government.Addressing a media conference held in Colombo to explain the decision by two UPFA Pradeshiya Sabha members of Mirigama and Attanagalla to support the common candidate, former President Kumaratunga had this to say.

hits._id: Economics Affairs Subcommittee Headed by PM to Take Final Decision on Taxes Including VAT

_source.content:
It has been decided that the final decision on taxes including VAT will be taken by the Economics Affairs subcommittee headed by Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasingha.
A senior spokesperson at the Prime Ministers office stated that President Maithripala Sirisena will be made aware of all the decisions taken by the Economics affairs subcommittee.
The spokesperson further stated that taxes will not be imposed in a manner that inconveniences the general public.
He reiterated that the finance Ministry and other institutions must take decisions only after discussing with the Economics affairs subcommittee.

hits._id: SLFP CWCM: No separate factions - Disciplinary actions against critics in the Party

_source.content:
The SLFP Central Working Committee which met this afternoon has decided to take disciplinary action against its members who criticize the party and its leadership.
At the same time the Central Working Committee has decided to not allow its MPs to function as a separate group in parliament.  The SLFP Central Working Committee met with the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena and its 53 members.
An advisor of the party and former president Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga as well as MPs who represent the Joint Opposition such as Kumara Welgama, Mahinda Yapa Abeywardana and Pavithra Wanniarachchi were also present.
Later on, party General Secretary and Minister Duminda Dissanayake told the media that the resolution to take disciplinary action against those who criticize the party and its leadership was passed unanimously.
The party general secretary also said the Central Working Committee decided to give another opportunity for the nine local government institutions’ chairmen to show cause for criticism against the party policies during media conferences.

hits._id: President inaugurates National Drug Prevention Week

_source.content: The National Drug prevention week which continues until August 8th was inaugurated under the patronage of President Maithreepala Sirisena at the Ja Ela Urban Council sports ground today.Several ministers including Joseph Michael Perera, John Amaratunga and Felix Perera were also present for the occasion.Addressing the inauguration ceremony the President stated that as a government they aim for an economic development where the country can exclude the revenue from liquor shops for the budget of year 2020.

hits._id: Local bodies terms lapse will be placed under special commissioners

_source.content: President Maitripala Sirisena said that special commissioners would be appointed for the 234 Divisional Councils which end their period of office on 15th this month.Participating at meeting held in Aluthgama yesterday the President said that the election of these local government authorities would be held this year.Meanwhile local government councillors’ collective said that on 15th instant black flags would be hoisted in all local government authorities wielding UPFA rule.This came to light at a conference a group of UPFA local government councilors held in Colombo yesterday against dissolving the local government authorities and bringing them under a rule of officials.At this conference they passed eight resolutions.Among these are several other resolutions including briefing the President and the Prime Minister about the dissolution of local government authorities and a one-year extension of local government authorities’ period of office.However, President Maithripala Sirisena addressing a meeting in Aluthgama stated that Divisional councils will not be dissolved.

hits._id: Mahinda Rajapaksha Joins the Joint Opp March

_source.content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksha joined with the protest march organized by the Joint Opposition a short while ago.

hits._id: Doctors request Government’s proposals on SAITM to be presented to Supreme Court

_source.content:
The Government Medical Officers Association has requested President Maithripala Sirisena to present the government’s proposals with regard to the Malabe Private Medical College, to the Supreme Court.
Secretary of the GMOA Doctor Haritha Aluthge stated that a request letter has been forwarded to the President.

hits._id: President elucidates the aim behind empowering women

_source.content:
During a message commemorating International Womens’ Day, which falls today President Maithripala Sirisena stated that it is the aim of the government to commit towards empowering a diverse platform for Sri Lankan women.
The president noted that as a country which looks at motherhood as being sacred, the female population does not received due respect and protection.
The President emphasized that in efforts towards establishing sustainable development, the government should implement an active programme to protect the identity and safety of women.
Meanwhile, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe acknowledging International Womens’ Day noted that it is everyone’s responsibility to assure the freedom, recognition, acceptance and empowerment of women in society.
The premier added that though there is a significant increase in the contribution of women in every sector, it is necessary address the issue of equal rights in the workplace.

hits._id: UNP General Secretary Kabeer Hashim says Thissa Aththanayaka has no bar to join UNP

_source.content:
The CID informed the Courts today that the Attorney General has informed them the controversial property believed to have been owned by former minister Basil Rajapaksa will be utilized for public welfare.
Pugoda Magistrate Nilupuli Lankapura ordered to suspend the auction of the properly scheduled for March 29th when a motion was considered before courts today.
The Magistrate also informed that a decision with regard to the property will be announced on March 23.
The government has estimated the value of this 16 acre property at 208 million rupees.
Meanwhile, the Colombo High Court issued summonses on President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe to appear in Courts on July 17th.
The summonses were issued when the Case against former UNP General Secretary Tissa Attanayake was taken before High Court Judge Wikum Kaluarachchi today.
Former UNP General Secretary Tissa Attanayake has been accused of three counts of charges including preparing forged documents.
President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe have been named as first and second witnesses of this Case.
Accordingly, the Judge issued summons on the duo to appear before Courts on July 17th.
Meanwhile, another witness of the Case UNP General Secretary Minister Kabeer Hashim who was in Courts warmly greeted his predecessor Thissa Attanayake today.

hits._id: GMOA writes to President

_source.content:
The Government Medical Officers' Association has written to President Maithripala Sirisena.
 
They are seeking an opportunity to discuss the intended final solution on the SAITM issue.
 
In their letter, the GMOA is requesting to invite Medical Faculty heads, University teacher associations and parents' association for this discussion.

hits._id: Local Government Polls held according to the Electorate system; President says

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has informed SLFP Organizers that the forthcoming local government elections will be held according to the Electorate system.
The President at a discussion held yesterday with SLFP Organizers had stated that the election will be held during the first quarter of next year.

hits._id: Video : Cabinet grants approval to make amendments to the Provincial Council Special Provisions Act

_source.content: The Cabinet has granted approval to make amendments to the Provincial Council Special Provisions Act which was passed during last year.Deputy Minister of Local Government & Provincial Councils Indika Bandaranayake stated that accordingly the act will be amended expediently and presented in Parliament.Previously, heads of Local Government Institutions had the ability to continue functioning in their post even after the budget of such an institution was defeated several times.The government then passed the Provincial Council Special Provisions Act which amended the above provision to state that if the budget of a local government institution is defeated twice the head of such an institution loses his post.However, Deputy Minister of Local Government & Provincial Councils Indika Bandaranayake stated that after the budgets of several local government institutions were consecutively defeated a decision was made to amend the act.

hits._id: Three hints on 2020 Presidential candidates

_source.content:
Sri Lanka's next Presidential election will be held in 2020, which is just 18 months away.
 
The political parties are hinting of their candidates for that crucial election.
 
Speaking to the media following an event in Kuruwita, Ratnapura today (May 13) former Minister MP W. D. J. Seneviratne said at any future election they would work under the leadership of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.
 
Meanwhile, following a rally in Kandy, Minister Lakshman Kiriella said that the United National Party's 2020 candidate will be Ranil Wickremesinghe.
 
In the meantime, Minister Mahinda Amaraweera said that Sri Lanka Freedom Party will field President Maithripala Sirisena for 2020 Presidential election.

hits._id: Budgets of 2 institutions defeated today as well

_source.content: The budgets of UPFA controlled Ja Ela Urban Council and Dompe Pradeshiya Sabha were also defeated today.The Dompe Pradeshiya Sabha budget was defeated with 6 majority votes after 5 UFPA members including its Deputy Chairman joined their 9 opposition counterparts to vote against the budget. Meanwhile Ja Ela Urban Council budget was defeated with 7 majority votes. Except the Chairman, other 5 government members joined their 3 opposition members to defeat the budget.

hits._id: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe to meet UNP Cabinet, State Ministers and Deputy Ministers tomorrow

_source.content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has decided to meet UNP Cabinet Ministers, State Ministers and Deputy Minister at the Temple Trees tomorrow.Meanwhile, a special discussion regarding the National Executive Committee proposed by JVP was held at the Presidential Secretariat today.A JVP spokesman said that President Maithreepala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, party leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake, and leaders of other coalition parties of the then common opposition participated in this discussion.A National Advisory Committee has been proposed under the 100 Day Action Plan and election manifesto of the Current government led by President Maithreepala Sirisena.

hits._id: Foreign Expertise to Impede Crimes

_source.content:
Minister of Justice Wijedasa Rajapaksha announced that foreign expertise is sought to draft laws to impede crimes.
The minister made this remark while addressing the Parliament this morning.

hits._id: President meets with SLFP MPs

_source.content:
A special meeting was held last evening (05) between President Maithripala Sirisena and a group of MPs from the SLFP.
 
All Ministers and MPs representing the SLFP had present at the meeting.
 
Opinions were exchanged regarding the proceedings of the SLFP at elections which are to be held in future.
 
Sources noted that organizing of election campaigns and the future of the party was also discussed.
 
The SLFP Ministers and MPs decided yesterday to present the National Audit Bill in parliament immediately.
 
The good governance government, in its election manifesto, assured that a National Audit Act would be introduced in order to counter corruption in the state sector.

hits._id: Is New ecclesiastic bill an attempt to of silence bhikkus, questions MR

_source.content:
Former President and Member of the Parliament Mahinda Rajapaksa says that the government has introduced the bikkhu ecclesiastic draft bill in order to silence the Bikkhus.
He expressed these views at a function held in Aheliyagoda yesterday.

hits._id: Unity can win any challenge – says Common Candidate Maithreepala

_source.content: The Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena says that unity is a good instrument to win any form of challenge.Addressing a convention of young professionals held at the Colombo New Town Hall today, Maithreepala Sirisena said that the intellectuals and scholars have not been given a deserving social value under the current government.Meanwhile, UNP National Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe toured in Galgamuwa area to meet the weather affected people.During his inspection tour, UNP National Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe said that the funds allocated for relief assistance by the government are not sufficient.

hits._id: President's daughter authors a book on her father's political journey

_source.content:
A book authored by Sri Lanka President Maithripala Sirisena’s eldest daughter, Chathurika Sirisena was launched at BMICH this morning (15).
The book shares the story of the President's journey to become the first citizen of the country.
The book titled “Janadhipathi Thaththa” written by Chathurika Sirisena is a narrative describing the different chapters of her father’s political career.
It has explained the tough times the President faced until he reached the President’s House.
President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and many others attended the event.

hits._id: Leave no room for extremists; Protect peace- President

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that today many have forgotten how all races within this nation jointly acted in the struggle for freedom.  
The President made the statement yesterday while participating at the opening ceremony of the Muslim Cultural Complex at the department of Muslim Religious Affairs.
On this occasion the President said that forces opposed to the Government were taking action to spread disunity amongst races by giving incorrect interpretations.
President Maithripala Sirisena said further that all religious leaders should act insightfully towards protecting unity in the nation, without being entrapped by extremist forces.

hits._id: Sri Lankan President condemns the Pakistan terrorist attack

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that he strongly condemns the terrorist attack on innocent civilians in Lahore, Pakistan.Releasing a special message to the Pakistan Prime Minister Nawaz Shariff, Sri Lankan President says that the people of Sri Lanka will join hands with the Pakistani government and its people during this tragic moment.
Offering his condolences to the bereaved families President Maithripala Sirisena wished speedy recovery to the injured.
The Sri Lankan President further noted in his message that the Asian states have an inevitable responsibility to protect their people.

hits._id: “Group of 16” says more SLFP Ministers would join them

_source.content:
Former Deputy Minister, Anuradha Jayaratne says that another Sri Lanka Freedom Party group would join with them in near future.
 
Jayaratne is a member of SLFP's "Group of 16" who resigned from the Unity Government recently.
 
He mentioned that the new group would join them according to decisions which would be taken at the party Central Committee meeting tonight.
 
It has been reported that several crucial decisions are to be taken at this meeting.
 
The agreement on Unity Government and future actions to be taken by the SLFP are to be discussed tonight's CC meeting.
 
MP Anuradha Jayaratne said that it is anticipated that many SLFP MPs would join with them by 8th of May, it means after the May Day.
 
Meanwhile, a special discussion between the President Maithripala Sirisena and the 16 Sri Lanka Freedom Party MPs who resigned from Ministry posts will take place this afternoon (Apr.24).
 
Prior to this, this group met in Colombo and Kurunegala last night for separate discussions.
 
Several MPs including former Ministers S. B. Dissanayake, Susil Premajayantha and W. D. J. Seneviratne held a discussion at the residence of former Deputy Speaker Thilanga Sumathipala.
 
In addition to this, another meeting was held in Kurunegala where former Ministers Dayasiri Jayasekera, Anura Priyadarshana Yapa and T. B. Ekanayake met for a discussion.
 
Former MP Shantha Bandara and former North-Western Chief Minister Dharmasiri Dassanayake had also participated in the discussion.
 
Meanwhile,   the committee headed by Minister Dr. Sarath Amunugama which was appointed to study the future of the Unity Government will hand over a report to the President today.
 
President Maithripala Sirisena appointed this committee on 13th of this month.
 
The SLFP Central Committee chaired by President Maithripala Sirisena is also scheduled to meet at the President’s official residence tonight.

hits._id: Voting on the 3rd reading of the budget today

_source.content:
The voting on the 3rd reading of the Budget 2017 will be held in Parliament today.
Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayaka presented the budget to Parliament on the 10th of last month while the second reading was approved with a majority of 107 votes.
Meanwhile, the heads of expenditure of 5 Ministries were taken up for debate under the budget committee stage.

hits._id: An urgent TNA meeting in Vavuniya today.

_source.content: The TNA is scheduled to hold an urgent meeting in Vavuniya this forenoon.TNA Northern Provincial Councillor M. K. Sivajilingam said that this meeting was scheduled to be held at 10 a.m. today.TNA parliamentarians and Northern and Eastern Provincial Councillors too will participate in this discussion.President Mahinda Rajapaksa had also invited the TNA to come for discussion about peace and reconciliation.That was on 21st this month in parliament during the finance ministerial budget debate reply.  Councillor M. K. Sivaajilingam said that TNA was scheduled to discuss about this invitation as well today.The councillor said further that in addition discussion would be held with regard to resolving several problems that had cropped up within the TNA.The Tamil National Alliance says that they are prepared to accept the invitation extended by President Mahinda Rajapaksa.TNA Leader R Sambanthan stated that they will accept the invitation subject to the implementation of the recommendations of the Lessons Learnt and Reconciliation Commission and the enactment of the consensus reached during discussions with the government.

hits._id: SLFP Central Committee To Convene

_source.content:
The Central Committee of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party will convene this evening under the patronage of party chairman President Maithripala Sirisena.
Former Minister Nandimithra Ekanayake speaking to Hiru news said the meeting will focus on activities of the Joint Opposition and the forthcoming Local Government Election

hits._id: There is a reproachable opinion about the Government

_source.content: Minister of Transport states that there is a reproachable opinion about the national government and the budget. Participating at a function in Badulla- Vineethagama yesterday he further stated that to prevent the country from being deteriorated one has to criticize the government though being part of the national government

hits._id: Acceptance of ministerial portfolios by the SLFP is a positive move; says PM Ranil

_source.content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe states that the acceptance of ministerial portfolios by the SLFP is a positive move.He stated this at a ceremony held at Temple Trees this morning to distribute motor cycles among 2000 local government representatives.The Prime Minister further stated that the SLFP’s decision to join in the government is a good rehearsal in order to transform the entire parliament into one government after the next general election.Premier Wickremesinghe said that it is a part of the good governance to provide equal treatment to every citizen.

hits._id: Sri Lanka to import rice to stabilize prices

_source.content:
The Government has decided to import 500,000 metric tonnes of rice within the next several months.
Plans are in place to sell rice, onions, and potatoes to consumers through the Sathosa outlets from today at prices lower than the prevalent prices.
The decisions were made yesterday (27) at a special discussion held at the Presidential Secretariat with President Maithripala Sirisena at the chair.
Meanwhile,   the Coconut Marketing Board has initiated a programme to sell coconuts directly to consumers to assist with price control, as prices have gone up excessively.
The President instructed that a committee consisting of officials from the Ministry of Trade and Ministry of Agriculture should meet on a weekly basis to discuss variables relating to the sale of essential food items.

hits._id: UK Foreign Office Minister for Asia visits SL

_source.content:
Minister of State for Asia at the Foreign and Commonwealth Office, Hugo Swire arrived in the island on a three day official visit a short while ago.
Hiru news Airport correspondent said Swire was accompanied by another delegate. Minister Swire is scheduled to engage in a tour of Galle and Jaffna during his stay.
The Ministry of Foreign Affairs said, Minister Swire is expected to call on President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, Leader of the Opposition R Sampanthan and former President Chandrika Kumaratunga during his visit.

hits._id: Two weeks ultimatum to Government - GMOA

_source.content:
A group of government medical officers have filed six petitions with the Appeals Court. One of the appeals is to order that the government restore the duty free vehicle permit to government servants including doctors.

Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake, secretary to the ministry of Finance and several others have been named as respondents.

The GMOA has given the government an ultimatum, where they expect certain issues affecting government doctors to be settled within the next 2 weeks.

Among those demands are:

To remove the negative impacts on the government sector by the 2016 budget;  
To Annul the proposed Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement with India, to prevent the Indian workforce from  invading the local job market

 And the withdrawal of the minister of  health’s decision to provide clinical training to students of Malabe Private Medical College.

The GMOA stated that its members will launch an island wide strike in the first week of January next year if these demands are not met over the next two weeks.

hits._id: State Minister Piyankara Jayarathna resigns

_source.content: State Minister of Local Government and Provincial Councils Piyankara Jayarathna has resigned from his position.Political sources closer to the him said that he had handed over his letter of resignation to President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday and has also handed over his official vehicle as well.

hits._id: Will allow government servants to work independently; Common Candidate

_source.content: Common Candidate Maithripala Sirisena says that after the 8th of January a state service will be created where state sector employees could act independently.Speaking at a meeting held in Kurunegala yesterday he stated that most of the government servants were faced with financial difficulties.

hits._id: Look in to the journalists: UNP requests government -Video

_source.content: Heads of Expenditure of the Ministry of External Affairs and Mass Media & Information were taken up for debate in parliament yesterday.UNP Parliamentarian Gayantha Karunathilaka speaking at the debate stated that the government should provide benefits to journalists similar to benefits offered to state servants.

hits._id: Discussion between the President and TNA on 5 basic factors.

_source.content: TNA states that they held talks with President Maithreepala Sirisena at the Presidential Secretariat this morning concerning 5 main factors.The party representative MP M.A. Sumandiram told our news team that TNA leader R. Sambandan, Mawei Senadhiraja, Selvam Adek-kala-nadan and Dharma-lingam Siddharthan as well as 5 MPs were present during the meeting.In addition, Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe and former Minister Rajitha Senaratne also joined the meeting.

hits._id: The president discloses a conspiracy theory regarding attempts to create dissatisfaction of the government amongst the Muslim community

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena attest that the army would not in any way be deployed to be involved in the disposal of garbage in Colombo.The president was chairing the Colombo District Special Environment Conference held at the Maharagama Youth Services Council when he confirmed this .Meanwhile President Maithripala Sirisena says that the attempt to cause dissatisfaction among the Muslim community regarding the Government is a political conspiracy of the opposition groups.The President made this statement at the Iftaar celebration at the conclusion of the daily Ramzaan fast held at the President’s House yesterday.

hits._id: New Policy on Ministerial Portfolios

_source.content: The SLFP General Secretary Duminda Dissanayake said that the ministerial portfolios of the National Government are offered according to the requirement of the country. He told our news team that it would not offer ministry positions to please individuals. The new cabinet of the National Government would be sworn in week. Dissanayake said the SLFP would get the Opposition Leader post of the parliament.

hits._id: Northern provincial council election in September; a statement from Minister G L in parliament.

_source.content:
Foreign  Affairs Minister Professor G. L. Peiris said in parliament yesterday  that the Government would definitely hold the Northern Provincial  Council election in September this year. 
On this  occasion the Minister said that there was a dialogue between political  parties representing the Government with regard to the election. 
The Minister pointed out that it was a sign of democracy. 
The  Foreign Affairs Minister said while delivering his reply to the  adjournment motion the TNA had moved in parliament yesterday. 
The  TNA moved an adjournment motion over several facts arising out of the  reply Foreign Affairs Minister G L Peiris gave in response to the  statement opposition leader Ranil Wickramasingha made in Parliament.
TNA leader R. Sambandan speaking in Parliament had this to say....

			   
			   		
	
			   
Ports and Highways Minister Rohitha Abegunawardana replied in the following manner.

hits._id: SL and Bangladesh sign MOU on Procurement of Pharmaceuticals & Medical Devices

_source.content: An MOU on Procurement of Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices between the Government of Bangladesh and Sri Lanka was signed by Minister Maitripala Sirisena and Mohammed Nasim, Minister of Health & Family Welfare of Bangladesh recently at a ceremony held at the Ministry of Health & Family Welfare of Bangladesh.The MOU was initially proposed during the visit of the Sri Lankan Health Minister to Bangladesh in April 2013 as a measure to improve the efficiency of supplying pharmaceuticals and medical devices to Sri Lankan government hospitals on a Government to Government basis.

hits._id: President says there is no time to worry about criticism

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena said that certain groups eagerly awaited the government to collapse consequent to the recent drought prevailed in the country. President Sirisena said that making charges and criticism is a positive sign of democratic country. The President expressed these views at the inauguration of the Sustainable Lanka National Program which is coinciding to the sustainable goals of United Nation in Colombo today.

hits._id: A special discussion regarding Mahinda  - Maithree meeting to be held tonight

_source.content: Former minister T.B. Ekanayake told a media briefing held at the parliament complex today that President Maithripala Sirisena and former President Mahinda Rajapaksa would meet at a public place soon.He stated that a SLFP MPs group would meet at 7 this evening to discuss about the facts to which attention should be drawn during the meeting between the two.Former Minister Ekanayake further said that the former president has agreed to a meeting with the President.Meanwhile, former President Mahinda Rajapaksa said that all human beings should face victory and defeat during one’s lifespan.He stated this at the opening ceremony of the Jeyaraj Fernandopulle memorial hall built at Henegama in Gampaha today.

hits._id: FR petition filed by PAFFREL on Local Government Elections

_source.content:
Fundamental Rights petition filed by People’s Action for Free and Fair Elections (PAFFREL) seeking an order to hold the local government election forthwith in respect of the local authorities was fixed for support on October 7.
The petition was filed by PAFFREL citing Provincial Councils and Local Government Minister Faiszer Musthapha, the Provincial Councils and Local Government Ministry Secretary, Elections Commission Chairman Mahinda Deshapriya and nine others as respondents.
They accuse the Provincial Councils and Local Government Minister has postponed the local government elections continuously.

hits._id: Video: JVP in discussion to boycott budget speech. Budget-2014

_source.content: Addressing a media briefing held in Colombo today, JVP propaganda secretary MP Vijitha Herath said that his party is currently holding discussions with the Democratic National Alliance regarding a boycott of the budget speech which is scheduled to be presented in parliament tomorrow.The JVP is represented in parliament by 3 MPs namely Vijitha Herath, Anura Kumara Dissanayake and Sunil Handunnetti.The JVP contested the previous general election under the Democratic National Alliance ticket, and MP Jayantha Ketagoda represents the Democratic National Alliance in parliament.Meanwhile UNP MP Ajith P Perera said that his party will take a decision at the parliament group meeting tomorrow morning whether to stay in parliament during the budget speech.However the TNA said that its MPs will attend parliament during the budget speech tomorrow.

hits._id: Video: UNP searching for house hold that is not pawned

_source.content: Today is the 6th day of the 2nd reading of the budget for 2014.Parliament convened today at 9.30 am under the patronage of speaker Chamal Rajapakse.UNP MP Kabir Hashim also expressed his views in parliament.MP Hashim stated that it is impossible to find a house hold that has not pawned jewelry.MP Kabir Hashim during his speech also accused that certain islands in Kalpitiya have been sold to foreigners.In reply Minister Lakshman Yapa said that MP Kabeer Hashim has misled the chambers by stating that the government has sold 13 island in Kalpitiya to foreigners.He also stated that it is regrettable that MP Hashim made such false statement in Parliament.

hits._id: Priyankara Jayarathne to get another ministry

_source.content: Government sources say it is most likely that Piyankara Jayaratne will be sworn in as local government State Minister before President Maitripala Sirisena tomorrow. Currently Piyankara Jayaratne serves as the state minister of Law and Peace. Karunaratne Paranavitana who served as Deputy Local Government Minister  previously took his oaths before the President as deputy minister of Parliamentary Affairs and Mass Media on 4th this month. Sources connected to the SLFP said that in addition, three more SLFP MPs would be offered Ministry posts in the near future. Accordingly MPs Manuusha Nanayakkara, Geethaa Kumarasinghe and Lakshman Seneviratne will thus receive State and Deputy Ministry posts. SLFP sources said that accordingly these MPs would be sworn in, in their the respective Ministry posts  during the first week of 2016.

hits._id: Easy to break than building them up

_source.content:
The current regime is destroying development projects implemented by the former government without introducing new ones, MP Mahinda Rajapaksa claimed.
He made this statement after attending a ceremony held at the Sports Ministry Auditorium yesterday.

hits._id: The 2nd reading of budget passed with a majority of 99 votes - UNP, TNA and DNA voted against

_source.content:
The second reading of the budget was passed in parliament with a majority of 99 votes today. 154 members voted for the budget while 55 voted against it. The UNP, TNA and Democratic National Alliance voted against the budget.The debate over the second reading of the budget ended today and the committee level debate will start on the 2nd of December.
			   
			   		
	
			   UPDATE: Friday, 29 November 2013 - 17:13-------------------------------------------------- 2nd reading of the budget passedThe second reading for the budget for 2014 was passed in parliament a short while ago with a majority of 99 votes.154 votes were for the budget while 55 votes were against.

hits._id: Cabinet approves 19th Amendment

_source.content: The Cabinet that was summoned for an emergency meeting yesterday by President Maithripala Sirisena has approved the 19th Amendment to the Constitution and decided to reach a final settlement on electoral reforms today.Accordingly, the relevant reforms would be produced in parliament for debate as a regular bill.The proposed legislation needs to get the support of all major political parties in parliament, in order to be enacted into law.The main constitutional proposals of the 19th Amendment include the transformation of the Presidential form of government to a Presidential-Parliamentary system of government and the restoration of the 17th Amendment to the Constitution.The new reforms will result in the President losing the power to dissolve parliament after one year of its election.According, to the proposed reforms the President cannot dissolve the parliament until 4 years of election.The maximum term of a President to hold office has been limited to two terms.Apart from this it has also been decided to re-appoint the independent commissions.However, the President would remain as the head of the Cabinet, and the commander in chief of the armed forces.He would also retain the power to appoint the Prime Minister and the Cabinet.The Presidential immunity from being sued over matters conducted during his period of office is to also be removed under the proposed reforms.

hits._id: Premier to meet Indian President today

_source.content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe is scheduled to meet Indian President Pranaab Mukherji today.
India offered Sri Lanka full support to strengthen connectivity between the two countries to deepen human and economic links that will benefit all sections of the two societies when Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe and his Indian counterpart Narendra Modi held talks in New Delhi yesterday.
Indian Prime Minister issuing a statement after the meeting that took place at the Hyderabad House said Sri Lanka's progress is important for the two countries, South Asia and the maritime region.
Both sides inked four agreements, including renewal of an MOU for Indian grant assistance for implementation of Small Development Projects and one for the supply of medical equipment to the General Hospital at Vavuniya.
Welcoming the significant developments in bilateral relations since March, including the currency swap arrangement, Modi expressed hope that progress on key bilateral initiatives and projects will gather speed now.
The two leaders agreed that both countries want the bilateral trade to grow and become more balanced for Sri Lanka and discussed how to achieve those goals in a more open and competitive Indian market, including bilateral arrangements for trade and investments.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe also met Indian External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj, Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, and Indian Congress Leader Sonia Ghandi.
Similarly the delegation including Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe met India’s Highways, Transport and Navy Minister Nithin Gatkaari and held discussions last afternoon.
While discussion had been held at this meeting with regard to Indo-Sri Lanka fisheries problem, reports say that the Prime Minister said that in future bottom-trawler fishing would not be allowed within the Sri Lankan sea boundaries.
While India’s Petroleum and Natural Gas Minister Dharmendra Pradhaan promised at the discussion to provide facilities for one of the Economic Zones expected to be set up in Sri Lanka and he also agreed to offer assistance for repairing the Trincomalee oil tanks.
Foreign Affairs Minister Mangala Samaraweera said that Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe’s choice of India for his first foreign visit reflected the great importance the Sri Lankan Government attached to the bilateral relationship.
The Minister said so in a special statement to our news team from New Delhi.

hits._id: Ban ki moon congratulates the President for holding a peaceful election: Laurels from UK as well to Prime Minister

_source.content: UN General Secretary Ban Ki Moon Congratulated President Maitripala Sirisena for being able to hold a peaceful and a successful election.The Presidential Media Division said that UN General Secretary congratulated the President last afternoon over the phone.He commended President Maithripala Sirisena for having "shepherded an inclusive process" and the Election Commissioner Mahinda Deshapriya for his exemplary efforts in helping guarantee the exercise of the right to vote of the people of Sri Lanka.The Secretary General said he looks forward to continuing to work with the President, the Prime Minister, the Government and the people of Sri Lanka in support of building long-term peace and prosperity for the country.Responding to the congratulations President Maitripala Sirisena informed the Secretary General that holding the election in such manner was evidence testifying that democracy reining in Sri Lanka.Meanwhile, UK Foreign Secretary Phillip Hammond congratulating Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe said The United Kingdom will remain a steadfast partner for Sri Lanka as it continues on the path towards delivering reconciliation and a lasting peace across the country.He said the "manner in which the election was run was a credit to the Sri Lankan people."The United States applauded the Sri Lankan Elections Commissioner, Sri Lankan civil society, and the candidates themselves for holding free and fair elections that were widely hailed as among the most peaceful in Sri Lanka’s history.

hits._id: Biswal Meets President and PM; Discussions with TNA today.

_source.content:
US Assistant Secretary of State for South and Central Asian Affairs Nisha Biswal, accompanied by the Assistant Secretary of State for Democracy, Human Rights and Labor Tom Malinowski met with President Maithripala Sirisena at the Presidential Secretariat yesterday.

During her meeting with the President, Biswal appreciated his initiatives towards democracy, peace and reconciliation in the island nation.

She said the government's initiatives towards democracy, peace and reconciliation are highly satisfactory to the international community.

President Sirisena has stated to the Assistant Secretary that his government desires to maintain cordial and fruitful relationships with the U.S. while strengthening the longstanding friendship between the two countries.

Biswal extended best wishes on behalf of the U.S. Government and the Secretary of State, John Kerry to President Sirisena for conducting recently concluded Parliamentary Elections in a free and fair manner.

The two high ranking U.S. officials also met with the Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe and the Foreign Affairs Minister Mangala Samaraweera to discuss issues relating to the national reconciliation, combating corruption and good governance.

Nisha Biswal will meet representatives of the TNA today.

The United States pledged to provide every possible support to Sri Lanka in its future development works as well as its endeavour to bring about peace and reconciliation throughout the country.
