hits._id: President issues tough message to party's newly elected councillors

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena presided over a meeting of Sri Lanka Freedom Party's Electoral Organizers, District Organizers and the LG candidates who won the Saturday's poll at the President’s House in Colombo Fort this afternoon.
Addressing the gathering, President Sirisena said that all those who violate party decisions and support any other party to establish administrations in LG authorities will be dismissed from the party.
Meanwhile, Deputy Minister, Nishantha Muthuhettigama told journalists in Colombo today that SLFP will form a government within the next 48 hours.
He further said that the Joint Opposition, as well as several UNP MPs, are willing to support the SLFP in this effort.
At the same time, Chairman of the Ceylon Workers' Congress, MP Muttu Sivalingam was sworn in as Deputy Minister of Small and Primary Industries before the President today.
Ceylon Workers Congress leader, Arumugam Thondaman and several party top rankers who met President Sirisena last evening promised that they would support any decision taken by the President in the future.
Meanwhile, UNP General Secretary, Minister Kabir Hashim said that his party decided to continue the Unity Government after making changes to the government policies and the party structure.
This decision has been taken after a meeting among Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, Ministers of the United National Front and other parliamentarians.
At the same time, a group of UNP Ministers held discussions at the residence of Minister, Kabir Hashim last night.

hits._id: Cabinet approves the Budget-Budget 2015

_source.content: The 2015 budget was approved when the Cabinet met at Temple Trees this morning.After President Mahinda Rajapaksa was elected to the top post, this is the 10th budget to be presented today by him in his capacity as the Finance Minister.Prime Minister D.M. Jayarathna presented the Appropriation Bill in parliament on the 26th of last month.  According to the Appropriation Bill, the government’s total expenditure has been estimated as 1 thousand 812 billion rupees. Government’s expenditure this year is 1 thousand 542 billion rupees, and comparing to this year, government’s next year expenditure has been increased by 17%.It is expected that many relief measures will be given to the public in the budget to be presented by the President this afternoon.

hits._id: "New Audit Bill will be brought in soon” - President

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says the new Audit Bill will be tabled in parliament soon.
He said he regrets the delay of this Bill.
President Maithripala Sirisena also assured that this government will go on until 2020.
He said, "Anyone can come in and anyone can leave" and added that the crossovers will not deter the government’s tenure.
The President expressed these views during an interaction with Heads of local media institutions in the President's House this morning (30).
He further said that stern legal action will be taken against anybody found guilty of corruption. President Sirisena said he does not care whether such wrongdoers belong to the SLFP or UNP.
Expressing his views about next Sunday’s, 66th SLFP anniversary to held at Campbell Park in Borella, he mentioned that this year’s theme will be “Creating unity for a clean political movement”.
President Sirisena also pointed out that politicians should behave properly and set an example to the society, as the educated younger generation is disappointed with the current political trends.
Later, in response to questions by the Heads of Media Institutions, the President said former minister Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe was removed in accordance with a decision taken by the UNP.
President Sirisena further said that he never forcibly took over the party’s chairmanship. He said party members had appointed him as the party chairman in compliance with the SLFP constitution.

hits._id: Public-welfare oriented Interim budget - tomorrow

_source.content: The interim budget is scheduled to be presented in parliament tomorrow in order to bring about economic relief to the masses.Leader of the house minister Lakshman Kiriella said that the proposed interim budget would be presented in a form of a statement by the finance minister.The Finance Minister also expects to present a description about the current economy of the country.He also said a parliament debate on the Interim Budget would be held on February 5th and 6th .Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake explained about the interim budget to be presented in parliament tomorrow at 1 in the afternoon during a media conference held recently.Several relief measures to the masses have been promised under the 100 day program presented by President Maithreepala Sirisena as a candidate of the recently concluded Presidential election.The waiving of import duty to reduce prices of 10 essential goods is one major step mentioned in the 100 day program. To double the Samurdhi benefit, 10 thousand salary increment to state workers and to provide interim allowance of 3500 rupees to retired persons until their salary anomalies corrected are major among the reliefs.In addition, the 100 day program has promised senior citizens to increase their fixed deposit interest rate upto 15% for the first million rupees.At the same time, the current monthly allowance given to senior citizens with abject poverty would be increased by 1500 rupees.

hits._id: Emergency cabinet meeting begins

A special cabinet meeting to discuss the future of the government is now underway.
 
It is being held at the President's Secretariat with President Maithripala Sirisena at the chair.
 
Sources say following this special cabinet meeting, the Ministers representing the Sri Lanka Freedom Party will have a separate meeting with the President.

hits._id: State is dedicated to serve war heroes- President Sirisena

Government will work for the welfare of war heroes than the previous regime, President Maithripala Sirisena vows.
He added that the state is dedicated to serve the war veterans.
The President was addressing the first stage of national programme where retired soldiers will be deployed for the development work in the country.

hits._id: Maithripala Sirisena leads the race as per results released so far

_source.content: According to results released thus far, Common Candidate Maithripala Sirisena is ahead after having obtained 2 million 306 Thousand 612 votes which accounts to a percentage of 52.7. Mahinda Rajapaksa has obtained 2 million 11 thousand 512 votes accounting to a percentage of 45.9. The election was held in 22 districts of the island which comprise 160 electorates. Mahinda Rajapaksa won the postal voting in Colombo, and Kalutara while Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena won the postal voting in Gampaha. Common Candidate Maithripala Sirisena also won the postal voting in Kandy, and won the electorates Paathadumbara and Kandy. Mahinda Rajapaksa won the postal voting in Matale while Common Candidate Maithripala Sirisena won the postal voting in Nuwara-eliya. Mahinda Rajapaksa also won the postal voting in Galle district and managed to secure victory in Balapitiya and Akmeemana electorates while the Common Candidate was victorious in the Galle electorate. Mahinda Rajapaksa won the postal voting in Matara as well as the electorates namely Devinuwara and Weligama. The Hambantota district postal voting as well as the electorates Mulkirigala, Beli-aththa and Thissamaharama were won by Mahinda Rajapaksa. Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena won the postal voting in Jaffna as well as the electorates namely, Kytes, Wadukoddai, Kankasanthurai, Chaavakachcheri, Jaffna and Kilinochchi. Postal voting of Wanni district as well as the Mullativu electorate were secured by Common Candidate. The Common Candidate also won the postal voting in Digamadulla and Batticaloa district. Mutur and Trincomalee electorates of the Trincomalee district were won by the Common Candidate while Seruwila electorate was won by Mahinda Rajapaksa. Postal voting of Puttlam, Anuradhapura and Polonnaruwa districts were won by the Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena while Medirigiriya and Polonnaruwa electorates were also won by him. Badulla district postal voting was secured by Mahinda Rajapaksa while the Badulla seat was won by Common Candidate Sirisena. Mahinda Rajapaksa was able to secure victory of Moneragala postal voting and the Moneragala electorate. Postal voting of Ratnapura and Kegalle were also won by Mahinda Rajapaksa.

hits._id: Diplomatic intervention mooted to solve the tea crisis

_source.content:
The Ministry of Plantation industries expects to make a request to the Japanese government through diplomatic channels regarding the matter that has arisen in connection to tea exports to Japan.
The Chairman of the Tea Research Institute of Sri Lanka, Jayantha Gawarammana said that they would put forward a request to amend the minimum residual value of the chemical MCPA found in Ceylon tea.
A special meeting will be convened by the Secretary to the Ministry of Plantation Industries to discuss this further.
Previously, Japan has rejected a consignment of Ceylon tea worth over 1 billion rupees, stating that MCPA had exceeded the standard quantity in the consignment.
Minister Navin Dissanayake this he would speak to President Maithripala Sirisena in order to make a decision regarding steps to be taken to amicably solve this issue.

hits._id: Revelation of telephone conversations to be sent to MP’s privilege committee

Speaker Karu Jayasuriya announced in Parliament today (21) that the MPs Privilege Committee will be asked to determine whether MP privileges have been breached by revealing details of telephone conversations that had taken place between Perpetual Treasuries owner Arjun Aloysius and several COPE members.
 
Heated arguments erupted between ruling and Joint Opposition members at this juncture.
 
The committee stage debate on the Budget 2018 began thereafter.
 
The expenditure heads of the Ministry of Higher Education and Highways and Ministry of Skills Development are debated today.

hits._id: Sri Lanka elated with the 'path-breaking' success at the UNHRC

_source.content: The Sri Lankan government  said the country achieved a "path-breaking success" in the UN Human Rights Council in Geneva at the current 30th Session.Foreign Affairs Minister Mangala Samaraweera said Sri Lanka have succeeded in winning over the once divided Human Rights Council to work with the Government of Sri Lanka in its efforts to achieve meaningful reconciliation through truth, justice, reparations and guarantees of non-recurrence to ensure peace and prosperity for all our people.The Minister noted that for the last several years, Sri Lanka was repeatedly humiliated by the international community with Resolutions that censured the conduct of the country.Today, as a result of the determined efforts of the Government led by President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe since January 2015, Sri Lanka has once again succeeded in joining the international community as a responsible, confident and peaceful nation that respects the universal values of freedom, equality and justice.The victory that was achieved for the people of our nation, in line with the 100 Day Work Programme and Manifesto of President Maithripala Sirisena, reflects the desire of the people of Sri Lanka expressed twice at elections this year, for justice, rule of law, good governance and accountability in all aspects of life.This includes credible investigations into alleged violations of human rights so that non-recurrence is guaranteed and the people of Sri Lanka can steadfastly progress towards reconciliation, peace and stability with the support and assistance of the international community and all stakeholders living in Sri Lanka and overseas.

hits._id: A new journey whilst identifying and addressing crises; Prime Minister says in China

_source.content: China has said that they would extend their fullest support in transforming Sri Lanka in to a financial hub in South Asia.Mayor of Chong-Jing Huang Jifan and other officials had expressed these views when they met with visiting Sri Lankan Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.The Chinese had said that it was only Asia that was somewhat safe from the global economic crisis.Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe during the discussion had said that under the leadership of President Maithripala Sirisena, the unity government would identify the new financial and social trends as well as crises affecting the work and would tread upon a new journey to achieve sustainable economic development.The Prime Minister had said that the end objective was to transform Sri Lanka in to a financial hub in South Asia.Mayor of Chong-Jing Huang Jifan had also said that the need for a financial city between Singapore and Dubai is increasing.

hits._id: MP Nishantha’s SLFP membership is cancelled

_source.content:
The Central working committee of the SLFP has decided to cancel the party membership of MP Sanath Nishantha.
General Secretary of the SLFP, Minister Mahinda Amaraweera stated that the decision was taken as a result of criticising the party leadership and activities of the party.
Meanwhile, The SLFP Central Committee has decided to abolish the membership of former Kurunegala local government representatives responsible for destroying interview letters.
The SLFP Central Committee met last night at the President’s official residence with President Maithripala Sirisena at the chair.
While this decision was taken, it was also decided to inform the disciplinary committee of party representatives who had joined the joint opposition’s protest March.

hits._id: India Likely To Set Up LNG Fuelled Power Plant in Western Lanka

_source.content:
India is likely to set up a Liquefied Natural Gas-fuelled 500 MW power plant at Kerawalapitiya on the Western coast of Sri Lanka as requested by the Lankan government, the New Indian Express reported on Monday (18).
On environmental grounds, the Sirisena-Wickremesinghe government is keen on switching over to LNG from coal as fuel for its future power plants.
During his last visit to India, Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena had requested Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi not to proceed with the 500 MW coal-fired power plant at Sampur in Eastern Lanka but build a plant using LNG instead. Modi said that he would discuss the matter with his officials.
According to sources, an Indo-Lankan Joint Working Group (JWG) has been working on various options in this regard.
The Lankan side has proposed that an LNG-fuelled 500 MW plant be set up at Kerawalapitiya, just north of Colombo, where there is already 300 MW LNG-fuelled plant set up during the regime of President Mahinda Rajapaksa.  (NIE reports)

hits._id: 'We are Redy for Upcoming Election' - Nimal Siripala Says

_source.content: Opposition leader Nimal Siripala says that they are ready to contest in the upcoming general election after uniting the opposing parties.According to the statement he made at a press briefing held in Colombo today the President Maithripala Sirisena has declared that the Sri Lanka Freedom Party will contest under his leadership.The opposition leader further stated that the SLFP has decided to support the interim budget which was introduced last week.

hits._id: Common Candidate Maithri commences the battle from Polonnaruwa

_source.content: The inaugural rally of the common candidate Maithripala Sirisena is scheduled to be held at the Kaduruwela area in Polonnaruwa today.The rally is held under the theme “supirisindu nayakathwayak, maithri paalanayak” which means “pure leadership and a compassionate administration.”The event will see the participation of number of political leaders including UNP leader Ranil Wickremesinghe and former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga.A pirith chanting will also be held opposite the historic vatadagey in Polonnaruwa in order to invoke blessings on common candidate Maithripala Sirisena.Our Polonnaruwa area correspondent noted that a cover which was erected for 500 bikkhus was suddenly taken down last evening.However it is reported that 500 bikkhus will be provided the noon almsgiving today.Meanwhile addressing the Anuradhapura UNP balamandala meeting yesterday, UNP deputy leader Sajith Premadasa said that Samurdi benefits will be increased through a government which will come into power after the victory of the common candidate.

hits._id: Norwegian Prime Minister meets the President

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that the government is committed to assure a strong and independent judicial system in the country. 
He was speaking at the Legal Asian Summit inaugurated at the BMICH this afternoon.
Sri Lanka and Norway will take steps to increase cooperation in several areas, including fisheries, information technology, energy, hydro and solar power as well as oil and gas exploration.
This was revealed during the bilateral discussions held between President Maithripala Sirisena and visiting Norwegian Prime Minister Erna Solberg at the Presidential Secretariat today.
Solberg expressed appreciation over the steps taken by the current government to strengthen democracy, reconciliation and development.
The President said that Sri Lanka would appreciate technical expertise from Norway to develop the fisheries industry in Sri Lanka as there are immense possibilities for growth in both sea fishing and inland fisheries.
He said that Sri Lanka seeks foreign investments in export oriented industries such as garments, gem and jewellery, ceramic, plants, timber and medicine.
Solberg said her government would take steps to bring together potential Norwegian investors and Sri Lankan partners.

hits._id: Constitutional Board to convene for the first time today to prepare new Constitution

_source.content:
After 44 years the entire Parliament is due to convene today as a Constitutional Board with the intention of drafting a new Constitution.
The previous such occasion was back in 1972 for drafting the Republic Constitution.
The Proposal submitted by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe to convert the entire Parliament in to a Constitutional Board was approved in Parliament upon a 2 day debate.
The Speaker of Parliament will be the Chairman of the Constitutional Board while 7 Deputy Chairmen will be appointed from the Government and Opposition Ranks.
A Steering Committee will also be appointed and it will appoint necessary Sub Committees.

hits._id: Announcement on calling of nominations for local government election on the 27th

_source.content: The Chairman of the National Election Commission, Mahinda Deshapriya said that the notice to call nominations for the Local Government Polls will be issued on November 27th. The Election Commission Chairman was addressing a media conference in Colombo on the forthcoming Local Government polls. Accordingly, nominations will be called from December 11th and be closed on December 14th. Meanwhile, views were expressed in parliament with regard to a Writ filed with the Court against the Local Government Delimitation Gazette. Minister Dayasiri Jayasekera responded to allegations that were made against the Government that it is attempting to circumvent the Local Government polls. The Government Chief Whip and Minister, Gayantha Karunathilaka and Deputy Minister Ajith P Perera also intermediated.

hits._id: UNP- 33 cabinet, 11 state and 11 deputy - SLFP 13 cabinet, 08 state and 13 deputy

_source.content:
33 cabinet ministers, 11 state ministers and 11 deputy ministers have been appointed from the UNP to the national government. 



13 cabinet ministers, 8 state ministers and 13 deputy ministers have been appointed from the SLFP to the national government so far.



No minor coalition of the UPFA has accepted ministry portfolios of the national government.



UPFA coalitions - EPDP and CWC leaders, Douglas Devananda and Arumugam Thondaman also have not been given any ministry portfolios.



13 MPs out of 95 UPFA MPs in parliament represent minor political parties.



34 MPs out of 82 SLFP MPs have already taken oaths in various ministries in the new government.



Parliament recently approved 48 cabinet ministry portfolios, and 46 have already been appointed. 



45 state and deputy ministers were approved but only 43 ministers have been appointed so far.



Meanwhile, it is significant to note that one of the strong followers of former president Mahinda Rajapaksa – T.B. Ekanayake accepting a deputy ministerial position. 



In addition, several other strong Mahinda Rajapaksa followers such as Dilan Perera, Sumeda Jayasena, Lakshman Wasantha Perera, Nishantha Muthuhettigama and Nimal Lanza were sworn in as state and deputy ministers today.

-------------UPDATE----------------------------------19 State Ministers and 21 Deputy Ministers  Swore-in todayPresident Maithripala Sirisena addressed the gathering subsequently to the swearing-in of State and Deputy Ministers.
I am very glad to speak a few words in front of people like you who are dedicating yourself for the country. I bless you and congratulate you for the service you will be rendering to create the changes topically necessary for the betterment of the country.
We have a very long journey to make. It is definitely not going to be smooth. I became the President, Mr Ranil Wickramasinghe became the PM and you all obtained ministerial posts, not to perform duties of an easygoing, relaxed sort. We all admit the toughness and the challenging nature of politics.
One could engage in serene politics with the acquisition of power. Yet immorality would emerge along with that serene political agenda. We must engage in challenging work, retaining the toughness. We do all that for the country and the public.   I’m obliged to you for agreeing to the SLFP and the UNP working together for a certain period of time. From the very beginning our path was not smooth. Some say that the PM and myself have been trapped in an Imperialist plot…I will not answer that yet. We shall respond through our work in the future, and prove that we truly love the country.
We will succumb to no foreign influence. We will not despoil the prestigious history of this country. Whether it be Buddhists, Christians Hindus or Muslims, all talk about the congregation and separation of people for the good of people.    The national government concept was introduced for the betterment of the country. Considering the combination of this government some say that it will not last long..  No one must expect a government before 2020. Whatever anyone might say, our government is the stable one. No one will be allowed to change it - I assert that point.  Our effort is to build the country with the combination of the two parties. We transformed the ignoble political culture that was in operation for the past few decades. Therefore we must all resolve with responsibility to perform our duties true to our conscience and abstain from all sorts of corruption.
PM Ranil Wickramasinghe addressing the newly appointed State and Deputy Ministers: 
We have got over the initial step of establishing the national government. The cabinet assembled and the initial discussion was held as well. This is a political revolution – two parties coordinating according to an agreement. The public expects the national government to provide solutions to the problems faced by them.  
We who are now gathered here in this manner, used to be constantly at tug-of-war divided into two factions. We must coordinate and proceed together. We must consider the ideas of both the TNA and the JVP. We have a new journey to make.
There were those who shirked their duties despite all the perks they enjoyed. This cannot happen anymore. The public handed over to us the responsibility of working for the country. Traveling abroad must be limited. We’ll get to work now.
Our President was appointed on the 8th of January to initiate good governance. We have discussed together and covered up a large area of work. We shall solve our problems through discussions within our parties. Eventually we can be satisfied that we fulfilled our obligations for the country.

19 State Ministers and 21 Deputy Ministers took oaths today
Accordingly the total number of State and Deputy Ministers sworn in today is 40.

The three Deputy Ministers absent from the swearing-in ceremony:

hits._id: Special Order to stop university ragging

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena said that he advised the IGP to collaborate with university administration and take action to stop ragging. Addressing the75th anniversary of Ananda Sastralaya in Mathugama, President Sirisena said that the government has a responsibility over the future of university students. hits._id: President says an independent investigation will be conducted over Meethotamulla incident

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena said today that a committee chaired by a retired judge will be appointed to probe the garbage mound collapse in Meethotamulla. During a meeting with the heads of media institutions held in Colombo this morning, the president said the committee will find out as to who should be held responsible for the tragedy. The President has instructed to submit him the report within a month. Meanwhile, President Sirisena also stated that a full change in the government sector mechanism will be made within the next two weeks. Accordingly, a big reshuffle will be made in the top positions of the government sector. In addition, the President said that the government will answer all allegations made against it thereby entering a new economic advent this year. He also reiterated that the economy has rebounded and is moving on correct track with a record of foreign reserves amounting to 5 billion US dollars. At the same time, President Sirisena said that the National Audit Draft Bill will be presented to parliament soon. He also said that the Malabe Private Medical School will be kept under an administrative board to ascertain whether it is maintaining the standards of medical education. Speaking further during the meeting with heads of media institutions, President Sirisena stated that he has no intention to change the pledges he gave before the nation on January 8, 2015. The president also said that he is ready to abolish the executive presidency or to curtail its extreme powers.

hits._id: MR Addresses Parliament For First Time As Kurunegala MP

Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa currently addressing the Parliament, for the first time since he was elected as an MP from the recently concluded General Election. In his speech, Rajapaksa requested the government not to accept money from foreign nations for armed forces reform.

hits._id: No-confidence motion against Min. Ravi today

hits._id: The President Receives A Warm Welcome From G7 Leaders

_source.content:
A warm welcome was offered to President Maithripala Sirisena by the leaders of G7 during its outreach meeting today.
It is significant that US President Barrack Obama and President Maithripala Sirisena engaged in a friendly conversation following the meeting.
In addition, President Sirisena talked with British Prime Minister David Cameron, German Chancellor Angela Merkel, French President Francios Hollande and Canadian Prime Minster Justin Trudeau.
President Maithripala Sirisena today called on the leaders to help steer economic growth to sustain well-being of Asia and countries like Sri Lanka.
Addressing the G 7 Outreach Summit today in Japan, President Sirisena said Japan's formal announcement that G7 will explore what is needed to sustain the well-being of Asia to steer economic growth, highlights the relevance of Sri Lanka being at the summit.
The President said that with a revolutionary change of sri lankas governance, his government has succeeded in creating the path for a viable development environment and for reconciliation in a multi-faceted society.

Meanwhile, the General Secretary of the UNP, Minister Kabir Hashim said that the masses have issued a warning to the UNP through this Local Government election.

hits._id: Do we allow Pillai's committee? Decision to be taken by parliament: President emphasises.-Video

_source.content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa emphasized that the Government that goes forward strongly facing problems cannot be weakened by charges and insults.The President said that the current Government had completely avoided allegations and insults.President Mahinda Rajapaksa also said that he intended to consult parliament about allowing the persons appointed for probing war crimes to do so.The President expressed these views while handing over the Mahindodaya  Science Laboratory constructed at the Maedirigiriya National School for students’ yesterday.Parliament stands for the people.Therefore MPs will be consulted on this.On this occasion President Mahinda Rajapaksa attested that it was not possible to allow those subjected to dollars to betray the country.

hits._id: Securities Exchange Bill to be tabled in Parliament

_source.content:
The Cabinet has granted approval for the Securities Exchange Bill to be published in the gazette and tabled in Parliament.
The new bill will replace the Securities and Exchange Commission Act No. 36 of 1987.
Once passed in Parliament, the new act will strengthen the independence of the Securities Exchange Commission with a stringent governance structure.
Considering the regulatory principals and standards in developed countries, the relevant bill has been prepared, the Government said.
Meanwhile, the Ministry of Ports and Shipping has proposed to improve the terminal management software system of Sri Lanka Ports Authority.
Accordingly, Cabinet approved a proposal by Minister Mahinda Samarasinghe to appoint a technical evaluation committee and a Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee.
The system will be updated to face the competition with other ports in the region.

hits._id: It is vital to learn info of non-state institutions- Prez

_source.content:
As much as it is important to know state information it is vital to know about non-government institutions, President Maithripala Sirisena says.
He said this at the International Conference on Information held in Colombo today.
Key note speech of the event was delivered by former Chief Justice of Delhi High Court Ajit Prakash Shah.

hits._id: Govt agreed with Minister Wimal only for a discussion; statement from the government.-Video

_source.content: Minister Keheliya Rambukwella says SLFP and NFF agreed during the recent meeting only to discuss about bringing about a new constitution.Minister Rambukwella stated this in response to a recent statement made by Minister Wimal Weerawansa who said SLFP agreed to introduce a new Constitution through the Parliament Select Committee.Later journalists questioned the Minister why a discussion is given only to NFF while other ruling coalition’s have also sought such opportunity to discuss over an amendment to the Constitution.Then the minister said no other party has officially sought such a discussion, and the government is ready to give opportunity in the event they ask for it.Meanwhile answering a journalist, Minister Rambukwella said government servants salaries could be increased by the 2015 budget.

hits._id: Government has printed Rs 5000 counterfeit rupee notes: Common Candidate

_source.content: Common candidate Maitripala Sirisena says that the Government has printed 5000 counterfeit rupee notes targeting the presidential election.The Common Candidate said so while participating at a people’s rally held in Udunuwara yesterday.Meanwhile a people’s rally was held with UNP national leader Ranil Wickremesinghe at the chair at the stadium in Talawakele in Hatton yesterday.

hits._id: UNP requires fulltime organizers - says Opposition leader

_source.content:
Opposition leader Ranil Wickramasinghe issued clarification regarding his party's main responsibilities while speaking at a function held to notify party members in Kandy.

Wickramasinghe further stated that he will strive to somehow obtain a vote along with the protest of the opposition.

hits._id: Govt, semi –govt & pvt trade unions on strike tomorrow

_source.content: Several Government, semi-government and private sector Trade Unions including those connected to transport and health are preparing for a strike from mid-night today.Trade Union Collective’s convener Saman Ratnapriya told our news team that the strike in protest of over several issues including the pruning of Government employees’ pension, non-incorporation of the allowance of the  ten-thousand-rupee increase to the basic salary and making ‘Man Power’ employees permanent. Saturdays Meeting between Representatives of many trade unions and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe was unsuccessful.Meanwhile issuing a communiqué yesterday the Prime Minister’s office said that Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe is scheduled to make a statement in parliament today clarifying the Government’s stand with regard to trade union demands.The communiqué said that the Prime Minister would apprise the House about the discussions held with trade union representatives.

hits._id: President Meets State Ministers

_source.content:
Few state ministers representing SLFP met with the President Maithripala Sirisena this morning to discuss the powers and obligations assigned to state ministries.
Meanwhile, President is scheduled to meet few state ministers from UNP at 2.30 pm today in the Parliament complex.

hits._id: Jaishankar To Meet President Today

_source.content:
In what appears to be a low-key, business-like visit to Sri Lanka, Indian Foreign Secretary S Jaishankar on Tuesday had talks with his Lankan counterpart, Chitranganee Wagiswara, on the entire gamut of bilateral relations.
He also met the Minister for Development Strategies and International Trade Malik Samarawickrama; called on Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe in the evening; and had dinner with Foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera. On Wednesday, prior to his departure for New Delhi, Jaishankar will call on President Maithripala Sirisena and former President Chandrika Kumaratunga, a key supporter of the Sirisena government who has also been a long standing friend of India.
This is Jaishankar’s first stand-alone visit to Lanka as Foreign Secretary. According to officials, one of the main purposes of the visit is to prepare the ground for the India-Sri Lanka Joint Commission meeting to be held here on February 5 and 6.

hits._id: MP Bandula believes Bond Report will decide Govt.'s destiny

_source.content:
Joint opposition MP, Bandula Gunawardena says a number of changes in the government would happen when the final report of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry on Bond COntroversy is issued.
The final report is expected to hand over to President Maithripala Sirisena on or before 31st of this month.
MP Gunawardena said that several SLFP Ministers are preparing to quit the government soon after the report is released.
He disclosed this at a media conference held in Colombo today (26).

hits._id: Deans propose solutions for SAITM issue; Government Doctors to meet with President

_source.content:
Deans of all 8 Medical Faculties have presented a series of proposals to the Government including solutions to the crisis surrounding the Malabe Private Medical College.
Accordingly, the proposals include the temporary suspension of new enrolments, offering registration upon proper training and few others.
Meanwhile, a discussion is to be held today between President Maithripala Sirisena and the Government Medical Officers Association.
Chairman of the GMOA Specialist Doctor Anuruddha Padeniya stated that the President had offered a discussion following requests made by them.

hits._id: Government expenditure in the budget increases by Rs 356 billion;Borrowings also increased by Rs 440 billion.-Video

_source.content: The 2015 government budgetary service expenditure and the ceiling of government’s borrowing have been increased.Having obtained Cabinet approval, the prime Minister has presented the new proposals to parliament today.Accordingly, the government expenditure has been increased by 356 billion rupees while the ceiling of government borrowings has been increased up to 440 billion rupees.The increased government expenditure has been allocated for the Finance and Planning Ministry.73 thousand 910 million rupees have been allocated for its appropriations while 282 thousand 92 million rupees have been allocated for capital expenditure.The wage increments, pensions, scholarship grants and new recruitments to the government service will include in government appropriation while capital expenditure will be used for postal services, community water projects, housing, urban development, fisheries, health, and agriculture.

hits._id: Extending the term of office of the local government bodies will snatch away the people’s right to vote - says the President

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena stated that extending the term of office of the local government bodies, which ended their term of office, would snatch away the people’s right to vote.He stated this while speaking during the summit of the SLFP held in Polonnaruwa today.He further stated that he can issue a gazette notification to extend the term of office of the relevant local government bodies, however, doing so would deprive the right of the voters in the country.

hits._id: "SL foreign Policy redrawn; Zero-problems with neighbors" – PM Ranil

_source.content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe says that Sri Lanka has brought the relationship with India and the Western World to normalcy.Sri Lanka had become close only to China through the foreign policy prevalent during the former government.Participating in an interview with the international Time magazine Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe said that during the former regime it could be observed that Sri Lanka had been left isolated by the Western World.

hits._id: Joint Opp. Demands Optional Budget

_source.content:
Joint Opposition says that they will request an opptional budget instead of the national budget presented to the Parliament.
This was told at a press conference held in Colombo today.

hits._id: Opposition leader to tour England tomorrow.

_source.content: Opposition Leader, Ranil Wickramasinghe, is scheduled to leave for England on tomorow to participate in the 2014 Conference of the Conservative Party. Ranil Wickramasinghe, who is slated to hold a series of talks with leaders of the UK’s Conservative Party during the visit, is expected to return to the country on October 05th. British Prime Minister David Cameron is the incumbent leader of the Conservative Party, the largest single party in the House of Commons with 305 MPs, governing in coalition with the Liberal Democrats.

hits._id: The Kaesbaeaewa Urban Council budget defeated

_source.content: The Kaesbaeaewa Urban Council 2014 budget was defeated yesterday.The Alliance – administered urban council’s budget received six votes for and seven against.While there are 17 members in this urban council, 10 of them represent the Government party.At the time of voting, four Alliance councilors including the Urban Council Vice Chairman refrained from voting.

hits._id: Two Ministers assume office

_source.content:
Two Ministers who were sworn in before President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday (May 01) assumed office today.
 
Minister of Higher Education and Cultural Affairs, Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe commenced work at the Higher Education Ministry.
 
Meanwhile, Daya Gamage, the Minister of Social Welfare and Primary Industries assumed work at his Ministry in Sethsiripaya.

hits._id: Term of Office of 23 Local Government Bodies including the CMC Will Not Be Extended

_source.content:
The Government has decided not to extend the term of office of the remaining 23 local government bodies which was due to end from mid night yesterday.
This decision was taken during a special discussion which was held under the patronage of President Maitripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe last afternoon.
Accordingly the relevant 23 local government bodies are dissolved with effect from mid-night yesterday.
Accordingly among the 23 local government bodies ending their term of office with effect from mid-night yesterday are 17 municipal councils, one urban council, and five divisional councils.
Although the term of office of the 23 local government bodies was due to end on 31st October last year it was extended by the President twice up to today.

hits._id: Don't stoop to politicos: President

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena says that the Police service will be transformed in to an unbiased service and room will be made for everyone to carry out their duties in a respectable manner.The President requested the Police not to give in to political influence when enacting the law.President Maithripala Sirisena expressed these views at a meeting held with Senior DIG’s and DIG’s at the Presidential secretariat.Meanwhile, another meeting was held with Foreign Ambassadors operating in the Country and President Maithripala Sirisena.The President speaking at the meeting stated that steps are already been taken to reduce powers of the executive Presidency and strengthen the Parliament.

hits._id: Opposition leader has another suspicion-Video

_source.content: Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe says that there is a suspicion about the Government taking action to abolish the currently implemented Seed Act  No. 22 of 2003 and bring about a new Seed Act. A discussion with regard to the problems that have cropped up in connection with the proposed draft Seed Act was held in parliament yesterday between the National Movement for Safeguarding Seed Rights, a group of Farmers’ Organization representatives and the Opposition Leader.The Opposition Leader said so while expressing his views on this occasion.The Agriculture Ministry has said that the new draft Seed Act was put forward aiming at safeguarding and monitoring of seed material quality, national seed industry development and national gene resource protection.

hits._id: Cabinet Approves Establishing An Office On Missing Persons

_source.content:
Cabinet has approved establishing an office on missing persons, the Government information department said today.
The Government said there have been strong requests for providing true information on disappeared or missing persons to their relatives to know their actual fate.
“It will enable such families to reunite, closure with regard to such disappearance, or granted with reparations and other relief and support,” the Government said.
Therefore, a proposal made by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to establish an independent institution as office on missing persons by a Parliament act, was approved by the cabinet.

hits._id: President says no mercy for fraud and corruption

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that he would not hesitate to take legal action against those who commit fraud and corruption irrespective their political or social status.
President Sirisena said this while speaking at a public rally at Diyasenpura in Polonnaruwa today (Jan. 11).
He also spoke on the clash among parliamentarians that took place in Parliament yesterday.

hits._id: SLFP committee proposes to continue Unity Govt.

_source.content:
Minister Dr. Sarath Amunugama, Chairman of the Committee appointed by the President to assess the feasibility of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party continuing with the Unity Government, says that the committee in its report has proposed to continue the Unity Government.
 
Addressing a ceremony in Colombo today (Apr. 21), he stated that the report of the committee will be finalized within today.
 
16 SLFP Ministers voted in favour of the "no-confidence motion' against the Prime Minister on 4th of April and thereafter the United National Party said that they can’t work with that group.
 
Now the SLFP Group says they would sit in the opposition.
 
Then President Maithripala Sirisena appointed a Committee headed by Dr. Amunugama to review the situation.
 
Ministers Duminda Dissanayake, Mahinda Amaraweera, Ranjith Siyambalapitiya and Mahinda Samarasinghe are the other members of the committee.
 
Meanwhile, it is reported that 3 representatives of the group of 16 SLFPers, have met the President in London and have requested to remove the general secretaries of the SLFP and the UPFA from their posts.

hits._id: Chief Ministers summoned by President

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has summoned all UPFA chief ministers and provincial ministers from the 7 provinces to meet in Colombo today.
The Discussions are to be held at the president’s official residence at 7pm this evening.
The local government elections as well as provincial development activities will be discussed in detail at the discussion.

hits._id: GMOA Collects Public Signatures for a New Petition

Government Medical Officers’ Association has initiated to collect signatures from public for a petition that emphasizes the need for a national policy in getting into international trade agreements.
Collection of signatures is carried out from the intellectual professionals’ hall in Colombo.
The petition is scheduled to be handed over to the President Maithripala Sirisena.

hits._id: We need a national government; Opposition Leader

hits._id: President arrives in Jakarta, Indonesia for the Ocean Rim Countries Association summit

President Maithripala Sirisena who left for Indonesia this morning to participate in the Indian Ocean Rim Countries Association summit has arrived in Jakarta this afternoon.
The President’s Media Unit stated that a special government delegation led by Indonesian Public Utilities and housing Minister welcomed the Sri Lankan President.
The summit which aimed at sustainable and balance development is scheduled to be inaugurated tomorrow.
President Maithripala Sirisena is scheduled to address the summit at 11am Sri Lankan time tomorrow.
Meanwhile, foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera has participated today at the 20th anniversary of the Indian Ocean Rim countries Association.

hits._id: Good Governance has exceeded 200 days: dissolve parliament: Request Former President

_source.content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa requests the Government to dissolve parliament soon and hold a general election.Expressing his views further while participating at a people’s rally held at Diyatalawa recently, the former president said that it would be possible to see the results of good governance at the upcoming election.

hits._id: New parliament before September - statement by the Prime Minister

_source.content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe stated that a new parliament will commence its activities before September.He stated this while attending a meeting of the UNP activists held at Walapane area today, saying that they would prepare new policies and implement a new system, and subsequently provide jobs for the youth, increase the income, build houses and empower the rural economy.Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe further expressed his views saying that the current government has taken measures to fill the bag of the people.

hits._id: "It's an injustice to the Proletariat" - Finance Minister

_source.content: The resolution moved by the Government seeking the approval of Parliament to issue Treasury Bills not exceeding 400 billion rupees in addition was defeated by 21 votes.31 members voted in favour of the Government while 52 members voted against.Independent MP Ajith Kumara asked for a division after the winding up speech made by Policy Planning and Economic Development Deputy Minister.However after the defeat of this motion, Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayke held a media briefing at the finance ministry last night.On this occasion the Finance Minister said that defeating this motion was an act of injustice to the working community.The Minister said further that even though the proposal the Government had presented had not been passed in parliament steps would be taken to provide the relief required for the people.

hits._id: Video : Having announced that the budget was passed, Uhana Chairman leaves the meeting.

_source.content: The Uhana Pradeshiya Sabha was gripped in a tense situation today when it met to pass its budget for the second time.The meeting began at 10 am, and Chairman Ranjith Ekayanake announced that the budget presented on December 20th was legitimate under Article 169 of the Local Government Act.Having said the budget should be considered to be passed, the Chairman left the meeting, and later a tense situation erupted in the meeting.

hits._id: ‘Bhikkhu Kathikawatha’ Bill will be debated in parliament with consent of Tri Nikayas’ Sanga Nayaka Theros – President

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena says the ‘Bhikkhu Kathikawatha’ Bill presented to the Parliament, is not the ultimate Bill and the acceptance, rejection or amendments to it will prepare with the consent of Nayaka Theros of the Tri Nikayas.

hits._id: UNP accuses government of debacle in Indo-Sri Lanka ties

_source.content:
While addressing a media briefing which was held in Colombo today General Secretary of the UNP MP Thissa Aththanayeke charged that Indo-Sri Lankan ties had deteriorated at present.


			   
			   		
	
			   

The United National Party questioned the government in parliament today regarding the plight of the country in the Commonwealth as well as the government’s reluctance to implement the recommendations of the Lessons Learnt & Reconciliation Commission.

Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe making a special statement in parliament today noted that the plight of the country in the face of the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting had been discussed with its Secretary General.


			   
			   		
	
			   

Minister of External Affairs G.L Peiris meanwhile filed the following views in reply.

hits._id: Dr. Dhanapala briefs UNHR Chief Ra'ad Hussein

_source.content: Dr. Jayantha Dhanapala, Senior Advisor on Foreign Affairs to President Maithripala Sirisena, briefed United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (UNCHR) Zeid Ra’ad Al Hussein on the policies of the newly elected government.Foreign Ministry stated that Dr. Dhanapala also met President of the Human Rights Council Joachim Rücker as well as all the members of the Human Rights Council.Characterizing his visit as an “exploratory visit,” Mr. Dhanapala briefed them on the policies of the newly elected government, and in that context sought a constructive engagement with the High Commissioner and the Human Rights Council in terms of the manifesto and the 100-Days Programme of the new Government.Both sides agreed to continue the dialogue.

hits._id: UNP working committee and parliamentary group to meet today

_source.content:
The UNP working committee and the parliamentary group will be meeting together today with party leader Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe at the chair.
UNP MP Nalin Bandara said they are hopeful that questions relating to the Justice minister Dr. Wijedasa Rajapaksha would be answered at this meeting.
However, party's general secretary minister Kabir Hashim told on Tuesday that  the matter pertaining to minister Rajapaksha would not be included in the working committee meeting agenda.

hits._id: SLFP General Secretary Maithripala Sirisena nominated as the Common Candidate.Executive Presidency and 18th Amendment to be abolished within 100 days; Ranil to be appointed as the Prime Minster.

_source.content: The long awaited common candidate unveiled today when SLFP General Secretary Minister Maithreepala Sirisena said that he would contest for the forthcoming Presidential election.Minister Sirisena announced his candidacy during a special media conference held at the New Town Hall in Colombo this afternoon.Minister Sirisena who remained tight-lipped last week as rumors were spreading that he would be the common candidate; participated in a ceremony to distribute letters of appointment at the Folk Art Center in Battaramulla this morning.Addressing the gathering, the minister thanked all those who supported him during his tenure in the ministry post.As leaving the venue at Battaramulla, journalists asked Minister Maithreepala Sirisena whether he expected to contest as the common candidate.Political sources stated that Minister Sirisena met Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe in the parliament complex.Our correspondent stated that later he reached at the New Town Hall to participate in a special media briefing where he was given a rousing welcome.At the beginning of the media briefing, Minister Sirisena announced that he would contest as the common candidate in the forthcoming Presidential election.

hits._id: President visists the Abhayarama

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena visited Narahenpita Abhayarama Viharaya today.
The Abhayarama temple was a hot topic in recent times due to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa and the Joint Opposition holding media briefings within the temple premises.
However, President Maithripala Sirisena visited Abhayarama temple today to attend as the Chief Guest of the prize-giving ceremony organized by the Sucharitha Dhamma School.
President Maithripala Sirisena also stated that he and the Chief Incumbent of Abhayarama temple Venerable Muruttettuwe Ananda Thera have maintained close ties for a long time.
Expressing his views during the ceremony, Venerable Muruttettuwe Ananda Thera stated that President Sirisena is the first state leader to attend a prize-giving ceremony of the temple’s Dhamma School.

hits._id: Mahinda Defends Loans Obtained During Previous Regime

_source.content:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa has defended the decision taken when he was in power to borrow money.
Furthermore he said such borrowings were spread out over many years and that his Government never borrowed for consumption like the present Government which is why he said there were no fiscal fiascos like sweeping revisions of budget proposals and constant revision of tax rates when his Government was in power.
After coming into power, the present Government obtained $ 400 million under a currency swap arrangement with India in March 2015. They obtained another $ 650 million through a sovereign bond issue in May 2015. Another $ 1,100 million was obtained from India in July under a currency swap agreement. A further $ 1,500 million was obtained through a sovereign bond issue in October.
Between March 2015 and March 2016, the Government issued short and medium term Sri Lanka development bonds on 12 different occasions borrowing over $ 2,711 million. Thus in the 15 months they have been in power, the present Government has obtained $ 6,361 million in foreign loans.

hits._id: National Economic Council convenes

_source.content:
The National Economic Council met for the first time yesterday with President Maithripala Sirisena at the chair.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, Minister of Finance and Media, Mangala Samaraweera and Ministers Sarath Amunugama and Susil Premajayantha too participated in the meeting.
In addition, officials including the Presidential Secretary, Prime Minister’s Secretary, Secretary of the Ministry of Finance and Media, and Secretary of the Cabinet hold membership in the National Economic Council as well.
Moreover, Professor Lalith Samarakoon has been appointed as the General Secretary of the National Economic Council and the Council is scheduled to meet every fortnight.

hits._id: Australian PM meets President and PM

_source.content:
The visiting Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull had bilateral discussions with President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe in Colombo this morning (02).
Bilateral economic and trade ties as well as addressing the issue of human trafficking were among the topics discussed.

hits._id: Minister Kiriella says President is willing to take forward Unity Govt.

_source.content:
Minister Lakshman Kiriella quoting President Maithripala Sirisena said that the President is ready to continue the Unity Government with the support of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party Ministers who abstained from voting in the 'no-confidence motion' against the Prime Minister.
Minister Kiriella said this while speaking to media after a ceremony in Kurunegala yesterday (Apr. 09).

hits._id: "Will not desert SLFP" - Arundika Fernando

_source.content:
Former Deputy Minister Arundika Fernando says although he has been removed from the Deputy Ministerial post, he would not leave Sri Lanka Freedom Party.
Earlier today (12), the President issued a directive to remove him from his post. When contacted, he told us, he was anyway planning to resign from the Government.Arundika Fernando was elected to parliament in the 2015 General election from the Puttalam District. Later, he was sworn in as Deputy Minister of Home Affairs.
However, President’s Media Unit announced later that Tourism Promotions and Christian Affairs Deputy Minister Nimal Lanza and Arundika Fernando exchanged their ministry portfolios.Arundika Fernando repeatedly stated during the last few weeks that a group of SLFP Ministers had decided to quit their posts.
They had a discussion with President Maithripala Sirisena last Thursday. This is the first time that President Sirisena removed a SLFP Minister. Earlier, the President removed Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe from Justice Ministry Portfolio at the request of UNP.

hits._id: Government will not desert our artists – says President Sirisena

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena says that the government will not desert the artists in their old age dragging their life into tragedy, and will fulfill the responsibility of the government well.President Sirisena made this remark while addressing the event held in Presidential Palace in Fort yesterday in order to mark the donation of Rupees Twenty Five million to the Trust Fund of Sri Lankan artists.According to the President’s Media Division, President has stated that Arts, Literature and music has no politics and he, as the Head of state will always look into the betterment of artists no matter on which political stage he will step up.

hits._id: Opposition leader ready to meet President.

_source.content:
Opposition Leader Ranil Wickramasinghe has made a request from President Rajapakse to allow a group of representatives including the opposition leader to have a discussion regarding the upcoming Northern Provincial Council Election.
 
In an epistle to the president Wickramasinghe had expressed his pleasure regarding the decision of the government to hold the elections in the month of September.
 
The opposition leader had also mentioned that this is upholding one of the proposals made during the UNHRC summit during this year.
 
The epistle sent to the president by the opposition leader also had included several points crucial to holding the election in a free and fair manner.
 
These included the abolishment of the 18th amendment and initiating the 17th amendment, strengthening the police commission, appointing of a civil servant to the post of governor in the North and inviting a group of commonwealth representatives to observe the election activities.

hits._id: Parties and associations including the UNP signs an Agreement for Consensus

_source.content:
A number of political parties and associations including the UNP signed an Agreement for Consensus today in Colombo.

The agreement which consists of 10 clauses includes a clause to abolish the Executive Presidency and to hand over power to the parliament.

The 2nd clause of the agreement contains the abolishing of the 18th amendment and activating the 17th amendment.

Leader of the UNP Ranil Wickramasinghe expressed the following views during the signing of the agreement known in short as “Samagi”.

hits._id: President's special message to voters

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says a disciplined group of representatives should be elected to the Local Government bodies to efficiently implement the government's development programme.
 
Addressing a public rally in Hingurakgoda yesterday (Jan. 11) the President said the initial step for a people-friendly journey, which is devoid of corruption will be laid with this election.

hits._id: No confidence motion against a MP as Premier says Govt. has recovered Rs. 1000 Billion

_source.content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe stated today that the government has been able to recover Rs. 1000 billion which had been robbed during Rajapaksa regime.He was speaking at the launch of a 5-year project to upgrade the lifestyle of the plantation community held at the BMICH today. 
The Premier said that the previous regime has stolen a sum of money 21 times more than the amount allocated by the budget for community development project by the current regime.Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said that a no confidence motion would have to be brought against an Opposition MP, once the investigations relating to the case where the Army discovered gold jewellery during the war, as well as the other misappropriations are finished.

hits._id: Appropriation Bill presented in Parliament today

_source.content:
The budget appropriation bill for the 2017 financial year is scheduled to be presented in parliament today.
While parliament is scheduled to meet at 10.30 a.m. with the Speaker at the chair, presenting of the appropriation bill is mentioned as the first item in the agenda.
Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake will present the relevant bill.
While the budget is scheduled to be presented in parliament on 10th November, voting is scheduled to take place on 10thDecember.

hits._id: Revolution in subsidies including Samurdhi

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena said the government will start a new program to eliminate poverty by building the economy of low income families. 
The President said a program will be implemented to invest every cent which the government allocates for the people, for the welfare of them.
The President made these remarks at a ceremony held to offer appointments to 2635 Public Service Management Assistants.
President further stated that relevant advice is given to subject Minister S B Dissanayaka to subject the welfare mechanisms to a complete change.
Meanwhile, a group of representatives of World Health Organization met President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday at the Presidential Secretariat.
They informed the President about the proposal to hold the Regional Summit of WHO, next year in Sri Lanka.
President Sirisena expressed his pleasure that Sri Lanka will be the host country for the WHO Summit.
The President recalling the assistance given by the WHO expressed his satisfaction over the advice and contribution provided by the WHO to strengthen the health sector in Sri Lanka.

hits._id: Minister Rishad pledge support to Maithripala

_source.content: The All Ceylon Muslim Congress led by former minister Rishard Badi Udin has decided today to support common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena.Addressing the media briefing organized by a Common Opposition, former minister Rishard Badi Undin said that the party representatives who met this morning took this decision.All Ceylon Muslim Congress Eastern PC members Ameer Ali who was appointed to parliament from the UPFA national list also participated in the media briefing.As MPs Rishard Badi Udin and Ameer Ali’s cross over, 7 provincial councilors and 69 local government members of All Ceylon Muslim Congress have joined the two MPs to support common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena.Former Minister Rishard Badi Udin describes why his party decided to quit the government and support the common candidate.Common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena and also participated in this media briefing.Addressing the media, UNP National Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe said that former minister Rishard Badi Udin’s party joined the common candidate to support him to create a democratic society where safety is assured for Sinhalese, Tamils, Muslims, Burgers and other communities to live in peace.Meanwhile common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena said that he would assure the trust that was put on him by All Ceylon Muslim Congress.

hits._id: Deputy Ministry portfolios to be changed within a week

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that the Cabinet objective of the reshuffle was to move forward with fresh hopes for the country.
Following the swearing in ceremony, President Sirisena requested that the new ministers  lead with full commitment for the betterment of the country.
President Sirisena posted a twitter message citing that the new cabinet reshuffle would rejuvenate the development of the country.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe was also present at the swearing in ceremony that was held at the Presidential Secretariat this morning.
Having been sworn in as State minister of Mahaweli Development and fisheries,Minister Mahinda Amaraweera said the Cabinet reshuffle had taken place according to the needs of the country.
Minister of Post and Muslim Religious Affairs M.H.A. Haleem quoted the President as saying that the reshuffling of deputy ministers will take place in the next few weeks.

hits._id: Budget 2017- Voting on the second reading held today

_source.content:
The voting on the second reading of the 2017 budget is scheduled to take place this afternoon.

The budget committee stage debate will begin tomorrow, the final voting on the budget is scheduled to be held on 10th December.

hits._id: Doctors to strike island wide tomorrow

_source.content:
The GMOA stated that its members together with 16 trade unions will launch an island wide strike, beginning at 8am tomorrow against the budget proposals.
GMOA media spokesman Dr. Naveen de Soyza said that several other trade unions have pledged to join the strike.
Meanwhile GMOA stated in a media communiqué today that they expected more facilities in the budget to attract doctors to government service, but instead, even the existing facilities have been curtailed.
The GMOA also protested against the cancellation of duty free vehicle permits to government officers including doctors.

hits._id: A fresh demand from SLFP Minister who voted for NCM

_source.content:
Minister Chandima Weerakkody says that a resolution will be presented to the Central Working Committee meeting this evening, demanding to change the General Secretaries of Sri Lanka Freedom Party and United People's Freedom Alliance.
 
The Central Working Committee of the SLFP will meet under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena at the President’s Official Residence at 7 this evening
 
During this meeting, the 16 SLFP MPs who voted in favour of the 'no-confidence motion' against the Prime Minister are going to decide as to whether they should resign from the current Ministry portfolios.
 
A group of UNP Ministers led by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe recently met with the President and informed him that they cannot work in the government with those SLFP Ministers who voted in favour of the 'no-confidence motion' against the Prime Minister.
 
Meanwhile, speaking to media after an event in Irattaperiyakulam in Vavuniya today (Apr. 09), Minister Duminda Dissanayake said that the NCM mooted against the SLFP Ministers has been withdrawn.
 
Minister Lakshman Kiriella who addressed a ceremony in Kandy, told media that it is not acceptable for those SLFP ministers who voted in favour of the NCM to remain as part of the government.
 
Meanwhile, the leaders of the United National Front will have a meeting with the Prime Minister on 11th of April to discuss the current political situation.

hits._id: President Sirisena tells developed nations to be thoughtful

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena joined over 150 heads of state and government in Paris to reach a new and universal climate change agreement at the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change Summit.Addressing the summit President Maithripala Sirisena stated that Sri lanka too contributes to the effort being made for minimising climate change in the world.The President was received by French President François Hollande and United Nations Secretary General Ban Ki-moon.The Conference commenced with the opening announcement given by President Hollande and it was followed by a speech from the UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon.Over 180 countries attending this global summit made it the largest single-day gathering of heads of state or government in history.On the eve of the COP21 conference, 184 countries covering around 95 percent of global greenhouse gas emissions had delivered their national climate action plans to the UN Framework Convention.

hits._id: New session of 8th Parliament commences today

_source.content:
The new session of the 8th Parliament will commence at 2.15 this afternoon, under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena.
 
The Deputy Secretary General of the Parliament Neil Iddawela said that all necessary arrangements have been in place in this regard.
 
The President will be welcomed by the Speaker and Prime Minister and will be escorted to the chamber.
 
The mace bearer is to enter the chamber with the ceremonial mace and after its customary placement, the new parliamentary session is to commence with the Secretary-General presenting the prorogation.
 
Following these proceedings, President Sirisena will make the policy statement of the government.
 
According to British customs, the queen is to deliver a speech upon recommencement of Parliament following adjournment.
 
This is known as the throne speech.
 
However, according to the 1978 constitution, there is no mention of a throne speech.
 
However, with the commencement of a session, the leader of the state is vested with the right to deliver a policy statement.
 
A vote can also be called for.
 
However, it was decided at the party leaders meeting recently, that an adjourning debate will be held on Thursday, with regard to the President’s speech.
 
Accordingly, constitutional experts note that holding a vote isn’t possible under these circumstances.

hits._id: Divisional and urban councils owe Rs659 million to Government.

_source.content:
Provincial Councils and Local Government Ministry says that local government bodies have to pay the Government Rs659 million. 
Issuing a communiqué the Ministry said that therefore Minister Faizer Musthapa had instructed Ministry Authorities to take immediate legal action against local government bodies that do not repay.
Loans have been provided from the National Credit Loans and Development Fund to Local Government Bodies for Development Projects.
Although the National Loans and Development Fund is implemented under the Local Government Ministry, funds are provided to it from the Government Treasury.
Out of local Government Bodies, the Dambulla Municipal Council has to pay the biggest amount of loan which is Rs118 million.
The Ministry said that in addition, the Balangoda and Gampola Urban Councils owe a huge amount to the said Fund.
Provincial Councils and Local Government Ministry Secretary Kamal Padmasiri told our news team that in the future legal action would be taken against local government bodies that do not repay loans.

hits._id: Parliamentary Council approves President's decision

_source.content:
The parliament has approved the President's proposal to appoint former Attorney General Mohan Peiris as the new Chief Justice.

The parliamentary council appointed according to the 18th amendment comprises of the Speaker, Prime Minister, the Opposition Leader and MPs A. H. M Ashwar and D. M. Swaminathan representing the minorities.

However, only the speaker, the prime minister and MP A. H. M Ashwar were present in parliament today.

Leader of the opposition Ranil Wickramasinghe and MP D. M. Swaminathan had not participated in any prior meetings of the parliamentary council.

Speaking to our news team parliamentarian A. H. M Ashwar explained the decision reached by the parliamentary council.


			   
			   		
	
			   

The speaker has currently informed the president of the council's decision.
