hits._id: Issue of Nurses council - President reveals

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena disclosed the reason why it was impossible to implement the Nursing Council during the time he was Health Minister.The President did so while participating at a special conference of Government nursing officers at the Maharagama Youth Services auditorium yesterday.Addressing the conference, Power and Energy Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka said that India too experienced the impact of Sri Lanka’s political change.

hits._id: President removes Postal Secretary following recommendation from Elections Commissioner #GenElecSL

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena has removed the Secretary to the Ministry of Posts Abdul Majeed with immediate effect.This is considering a complaint and recommendation made by the Elections Commissioner.The Presidential Media Unit stated that the deposed Postal Secretary will be transferred to the Ministry of Public Administration while the Additional Secretary of the Ministry of Posts will take over duties of the vacated post.

hits._id: Former Attorney General Mohan peiris says that he will be sworn in as the new Chief Justice today.

_source.content:
Former Attorney General Mohan peiris says that he will be sworn in as the new Chief Justice today at 12.30 pm before the President.

Government sources state that the newly appointed Chief Justice would be sworn in this evening.

The name of Mohan Peiris had been directed to the Parliamentary Council yesterday by President Mahinda Rajapaksa.

Parliament is due to convene at 10 a.m. today in a bid to nominate a new Chief Justice.

According to the 18th amendment to the constitution the composition of parliamentary council includes the Speaker, President, Premier, Opposition Leader & two MP's both from the opposition as well as the government representing minorities.

Deputy Speaker Chandima Weerakody elaborating on today’s Parliamentary council meeting had this to say…..


			   
			   		
	
			   

However it is reported that neither Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe nor parliamentarian D.M. Swaminathan have attended a single session of the parliamentary council.

According to United National Party sources the duo will not be present during today’s meeting.

hits._id: Residential water bill for the first 25 units to be reduced by 10 percent.-Budget 2015

_source.content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa, presenting the budget for 2015 in parliament today, stated that it has been decided to reduce the residential water bill for the first 25 units by 10 percent.Paye tax will be limited to a maximum of 16 percent, while VAT will be reduced to 11 percent.President also stated that US dollars 100 will be charged to enter Casino centers.In addition, a tax concession will be introduced to small industries.

hits._id: President & PM to meet today

_source.content:
Minister of Law and Order Ranjith Maddumabandara says that a special meeting between President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe will be held today (Apr. 23).
 
The Minister said that discussions would look into the allocation of cabinet portfolios and the composition of the new cabinet.

hits._id: Tajikistan President arrives in the island today

_source.content:
President of the Islamic Republic of Tajikistan Emomali Rahmon is due to arrive in the island today. He will be in Sri Lanka on a three-day state visit.
The President will hold discussions with President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, and Speaker Karu Jayasuriya.

hits._id: Diaspora removed from 'Terrorist' list

_source.content: The Foreign Affairs Minister Mangala Samaraweera says that the government has announced its plans to remove 16 groups and hundreds of Tamils from a list of foreign terrorists.Speaking to Australia’s Channel Nine news service, Foreign Minister Samaraweera said that this action would be taken as part of the reconciliation process of the country.The minister also said it was important to review a list of nearly 424 individuals and 16 entities, at a time when the government of President Maithripala Sirisena is strongly committed to expedite the reconciliation process.

hits._id: President, Prime Minister to visit India

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe will be engaging in a visit to India in the next two weeks. President Maithripala Sirisena is to leave for India in order to attend the BRICS summit. BRICS - the intercontinental association comprises developing countries including Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa respectively, and the summit is to be held in Goa, India this year. Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, extended the invitation to member countries of BIMSTEC (Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation). BIMSTEC has been established for countries located around the Bay of Bengal, with the aim of establishing Multi-Sectoral Technical & Economic Cooperation. Accordingly, President Maithripala Sirisena is to attend the summit held in Goa on the 15th and 16th of October. Meanwhile, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe is to arrive in New Delhi upon concluding his visit to New Zealand. A discussion has also been scheduled with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday. It has been reported that Indian Prime Minister and his cabinet ministers are to host a luncheon for the Sri Lanka Prime Minister.

hits._id: No intention to consolidate power for gaining rule again- Prez

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that certain individuals have made various charges, as they are not satisfied with the government doing what is beneficial for the country, without a mindset of regaining power.
The President said this whilst participating at a discussion themed ‘one nation, a great power’ held at the BMICH yesterday in view of the completion of one year after becoming President.

hits._id: SAARC speakers and parliamentarians meet in Colombo

_source.content:
The eighth Conference of the Association of SAARC Speakers and Parliamentarians was inaugurated under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena in Colombo, today (04).
This Conference is a platform for the Parliamentarians of South Asia to work together to reach the 2030 agenda for Sustainable Development.
The conference will be held until Friday.
The SAARC Speakers General Assembly also expects to hold discussions on “Promoting Parliamentary Diplomacy and Open Parliament in the age of digitalization” and “SAARC Parliamentarians’ role in preserving Cultural and Archaeological Heritage in South Asia Region”.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe delivered the keynote address at the opening ceremony and the Speaker Karu Jayasuriya delivered the welcome speech at the inauguration.

hits._id: New Sri Lanka from Ranil in 2014

_source.content:
Leader of the UNP Ranil Wickramasinghe states that he will build a new Sri Lanka in 2014.
 
He made this statement while addressing the gathering at the party headquarters in Sirikotha during UNP’s 67th anniversary celebrations.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
The UNP leader also elaborated that the youth of the country has no alternative other than the UNP.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
The United National Party was formed at the Colombo Palm Court on the 6th of September in 1946.
 
The party won the country’s first general election in 1947 and formed a government under the leadership of D.S. Senanayake.
 
The UNP also came to power in the years of 1952, 1960, 1965, 1977, 1989 and 2001.

hits._id: SLFP CWC has given the President approval for a National government.

_source.content:
The Central Working Committee of the SLFP granted President Maithreepala Sirisena approval to form a national government.

The central working committee of the SLFP met this morning at the official residence of President Maithreepala Sirisena.

During the meeting, a committee headed by former president Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga was appointed to facilitate the building of a national government in the future.

Nimal Siripala de Silva, Susil Premajayantha, S.B. Dissanayake, Sarath Amunugama and Mahinda Samarasinghe are the other members of this committee.
  
When journalists asked about the changes of the party office bearers, minister Dissanayake said that the central working committee has endorsed the decisions taken by the president.
  
Journalists also enquired about the ministerial positions of a national government to be formed in the future.

hits._id: Drama in Parliament, Active Liabilities Management Draft Bill passed

_source.content: Former President calls President Sirisena to discuss the draft Bill...Parliament was adjourned for several minutes this evening (Mar. 23) due to a tense situation erupted after the vote-taking on the debate of the Active Liabilities Management Draft Bill.A commotion started in the House after opposition MPs spotted on the vote results display board that Minister S. B. Dissanayake's name appearing on the board as he had voted for the Bill. However, Minister, Dissanayake was not present in the House at the time of the vote.Earlier, participating in the debate on the Active Liabilities Management Draft Bill, Joint Opposition MP Vasudeva Nanayakkara revealed that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa had a telephone conversation with President Maithripala Sirisena over the draft Bill.

hits._id: Prepare Programme for Repairing Houses after Waters Recede; President

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has instructed officials to give priority to essential requirements when providing relief to those affected by floods and landslides/
Food, Health and Safety and Shelter has been named as priorities.
President Sirisena has also emphasized on the need to have a programme in place to repair houses affected, once flood waters recede.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe says that from today the army will be deployed to all locations for protecting the properties of people affected by disaster.
Making a special statement at Temple Trees yesterday the Prime Minister requested the people staying in houses at a risk in the face of floods to evacuate immediately.
Expressing his views on this occasion Disaster Management Minister Anura Priyadarshana Yapa said that the Government had set apart 300 million rupees for providing relief to the distressed.
The Minister said that accordingly money would be provided for work including repairing of houses without any consideration of house owner’s status.

hits._id: Prime Minister is ready to offer any official residence except the President’s House to former President

_source.content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe told parliament today that any official residences could be given to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa except the President’s House.He stated this in response to a question raised regarding an urgent requirement of an official residence for the former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.The Premier also stated that more security measures can be provided to the former President Mahinda Rajapaksa during the election period.

hits._id: President says Cabinet posts will only be assigned to suitable persons

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has stated that at the upcoming Cabinet reshuffle, Ministry posts will be assigned only to suitable individuals.
 
He said changes will be implemented very soon.
 
The President said so while participating in an interview with BBC News Sinhala.

hits._id: President tells missing persons’ relatives that there are no secret camps

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that the current government does not run any secret camps and detain anyone in a camp.
A discussion was held between missing persons’ family members and the President at the Presidential Secretariat yesterday.
The President said that he had a thorough insight about the problems of all sections of the people and that the government including him is committed to resolve them openly and fairly.
Furthermore, he attested that his government don’t have at least one secret camp.
On this occasion, the President also instructed that a new application is provided for gathering complaints and requests of missing persons’ family members through district secretaries.

hits._id: AG's advice obtained on 'Bond report' - SLFP

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that a patriotic, disciplined and morally clean political journey would be launched with the victory at the upcoming local government election.
The President made the statement yesterday (Jan. 10) at the first of the series of public rallies the SLFP led UPFA had organized under the President’s patronage in view of the upcoming local government election.
Participating at the rally Minister Susil Premajayantha said that the Attorney General’s advice had been obtained regarding the report of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry on the bond issue.

hits._id: CoA issues interim injunction against delimitation gazette

_source.content:
The Court of Appeal has issued an Interim Injunction until 4th of December preventing the implementation of the Gazette notification released recently with regard to the delimitation of Local Government authorities.
 
The petition against the Gazette was taken before the panel of 3 Appeal Court judges headed by Justice L.T.B. Dehideniya today (22).
 
Justice Kumuduni Wickramasinghe and Justice Shiral Gunarathna were the other two members on the panel.
 
6 persons from Colombo, Kandy, Matara, Embilipitiya, and Hali Ela filed this petition against the delimitation Gazette.
 
The Minister of Provincial Councils and Local Government, Faizer Mustapha, Ministry Secretary and the Attorney General were cited as respondents in this petition.
 
Meanwhile, the Additional Election Commissioner, M.M. Mohamed told us that the Commission expects to meet soon to discuss the matter.
 
Earlier, the Election Commission stated that the Gazette with regard to calling nominations for the Local Government Polls would be released on 27th of November.

hits._id: No plan to sell water resources; a clarification from water supply ministry

_source.content: The Urban Development, Water Supply and Drainage Ministry Secretary Karunasena Hettiarachchi said the government has no need whatsoever to privatize water resources.He stated this in response to statements made by UPFA leaders these days. Former MP Wimal Weerawana made a similar allegation today and said that subject minister Rauff Hakeem has already submitted a paper to the Cabinet.However, ministry secretary Karunasena Hettiarachchi said such allegations are baseless.He further said that a proposal to appoint a water conservation commission has been submitted to the Cabinet.Former president Mahinda Rajapaksa also accused the government saying it is going to privatize water resources.

hits._id: Is it morally good for Anti Indians to meet Modi late at night; President queries?

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that day dreaming to form a government after calculating May Day crowd at Galle Face is ridiculous.
He was speaking at a ceremony held at Vilayaaya Vidyaalaya in Aralaganwila to distribute one hundred thousand Mahaweli land deeds this morning.
President Sirisena queried the morality of those who ordered to hoist black flags on Vesak day to protest against the tour of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi but meeting the visiting Indian Premier later at 11 in the night.

hits._id: President Maithripala Sirisena Calls On To Find Root Cause For Federal Demand

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday (01st) stated that the root cause for the demand for a federal solution should be found and answered to move forward as a unitary state.
Speaking at the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) May Day Rally in Galle, he pointed out that the federal demand came from the north even in the 40s, 50s and 60s.
The government should take an appeasing approach and grant the rights of the people of the country if it needs to move forward, he added.
President Sirisena also said that it was the responsibility of the people to safeguard the hard-won democracy and called upon all people to join hands with the government to achieve this goal.

hits._id: Patali Champika replies to government allegations.

_source.content: Former Minister Patalee Champika Ranawaka says the manifesto presented to the people is important despite the content of MoUs.The former minister stated this in reply to certain allegations that UNP Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe and Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena have entered a MoU.MP Champika Ranawaka also made an allegation against the government for its attempt for an election boycott in the North.

hits._id: President, his family or war heroes will not be allowed to be taken to any international war crimes tribunal. A pledge from Common Candidate Maithripala.

_source.content: Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena says that he would not let any force to take current President Mahinda Rajapaksa, his family members or any war hero to any international war crimes tribunal in the event he is elected the next President.Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena made a pledge with regard to his statement during a media conference organized by the common opposition in Colombo this morning.He further said that the public relief measures granted to the people by the budget 2015 would be continued under his administration as well in the future.

hits._id: Doctors to go on strike; Nurses Unions also hold discussions

_source.content: The Government Medical Officers Association is preparing to resort to trade union action against the budget cuts affecting health and education sectors. Secretary of the GMOA Doctor Naveen De Soyza said that they would conduct protests in front of hospitals tomorrow. Meanwhile, Nurses Unions are also conducting discussions to enter in to a strike action over the steps taken through a circular issued by the Ministry of Health. Chairman of the All Island Health Services Union Gamini Kumarasinghe stated that the circular had cancelled back wages due to nurses since 2003.

hits._id: Malaysia – Sri Lanka ties to be enhanced

_source.content:
Malaysian Prime Minister Datuk Seri Najib Razak will arrive in Sri Lanka on Sunday (17) for a 2-day official visit.
 
The scheduled visit is expected to further strengthen ties between the 2 countries.
 
The Malaysian PM will have discussions with President Maithripala Sirisena and PM Ranil Wickremesinghe.

hits._id: Chief prelates write to President and PM

_source.content: The Chief Prelates of the three Nikayaes have written to President Maithripala Sirisena and PM Ranil Wickremesinghe uring them to intervene to solve the SAITM crisis.They have written to the President and PM considering the facts forwarded by the Parents' Associations of medical faculty students and SAITM students.

hits._id: Convene Provincial Chief Ministers to Colombo- President and PM

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe have given instructions to Minister of Education Akila Viraj Kariyawasam to call all Provincial Chief Ministers to Colombo.
They are due to discuss regarding issues in the Education sector, Minister Akila Viraj Kariyawasam said addressing the media in Kandy yesterday.

hits._id: Govt. imposes "State of emergency" for 10 days

_source.content:
Minister S. B. Dissanayake says that the government has decided to impose the state of emergency for a period of 10 days.
 
The Minister told 'Hiru News' the decision was reached at the weekly Cabinet meeting which was held under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena.
 
He said the decision was made to maintain law and order in the country.

hits._id: Minister issues red notice to striking railway workers

_source.content: Transport Minister Nimal Siripala says as railway services have been gazetted as an essential service, the railway workers who do not report to work will be considered as vacated their posts.President Maithripala Sirisena signed the relevant gazette notice last night (08).Meanwhile, the Government Printer said that they received the signed gazette notice this afternoon and it will be published by this afternoon.

hits._id: National Development Scheme for retired Armed Forces Personnel

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that a national development scheme would be introduced for retired tri-forces personnel to serve the country further.
President added that one can be enrolled to the scheme voluntarily and could work together with government institutions.
President participating at a function held in Galle yesterday noted that this would solve the shortage in human resources in the state service.

hits._id: Sri Lanka will decide on deadlines. not Navy Pillai a statement from government

_source.content:
External Affairs Ministry Secretary Karunatillake Amunugama says that the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Navi Pillay has no right to issue a deadline for a probe on human rights allegations.
 
He said that it is the government that would take decisions related to the matter.
 
The External Affairs Ministry Secretary stated that certain points raised in the report by Navy Pillai had already been fulfilled by the government.

Navy Pillay had said in her report that if the government does not address human rights concerns by March 2014 she believes the international community will have a duty to establish its own inquiry mechanisms.
 
Meanwhile, President Mahinda Rajapaksa in an interview with Al Jazeera channel stated that certain groups were engaged in a campaign against Sri Lanka.

hits._id: Premier Wickramasinghe Leaves for Singapore

_source.content:
Prime Minister (PM) Ranil Wickramasinghe left the island on a two day private visit to Singapore today.
He left on board flight UL 308, which left the island at 12.05pm.
Mr. Wickramasinghe is expected to meet his Singaporean counterpart Lee Hsien Loong and other senior ministers in Singapore.
The Prime Minister expects to hold talks on economic collaboration and seeking support for Sri Lanka's development.

hits._id: Premier reiterates CEPA will not be signed

_source.content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasingha, addressing parliament a short while ago stated that the Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement or any similar pact under different name will not be signed with India.
Today is the 6th allotted day for the Committee Stage Debate on the Appropriation Bill 2016.
Heads of the Ministry of Transport and Civil Aviation, Ministry of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Development, Ministry of Ports and Shipping will be taken in for debate.

hits._id: Live telecast of the budget debate till 6.00 pm

_source.content:
The speaker informed house today that the live telecast of budget debate could be viewed until 6pm from today to December 10th.
The live telecast will continue from 9.30am to 6.30pm accordingly.
The committee level debate on the second day of the third reading of the Budget is currently being held.
The heads of Justice Ministry, Law and Order and Southern Development Ministry and National Policies and Economic Affairs Ministry will be debated today.

hits._id: Educational reforms within a month

_source.content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has instructed the education ministry officials to submit a programme within a month for implementing the country’s educational reforms.Reports say that the Prime Minister gave this instruction at a discussion with top officials including the ministry secretary held on Friday at Temple Trees.The Government has decided to increase the allocations for education fourfold than previous years.The Prime Minister stated that even in spite of this the National Education Institute was lethargic in its work.

hits._id: President says Government has not taken a decision to change the school uniform

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena states that the government has not taken a decision to change the school uniform.President made this statement participating at the annual price giving ceremony at Asgiriya – Sri Chandananda Buddhist school.Meanwhile, President said that there is no possibility for a shortage of rice in the market.The President stated this at a special meeting held at the Presidential Secretariat today to ascertain whether stocks of rice are maintained properly in the country.The meeting was called after the President received information that there is a shortage of rice in the market.The President also instructed the Commerce Ministry to keep monitoring rice stocks in the market.The President’s media unit stated that attention was drawn to selling rice above the controlled maximum price.

hits._id: Australia Joins with Rescue Efforts- Belarus President Expresses Condolences

_source.content:
Australia has pledged to provide any assistance it can following flash floods and landslides which have killed at least 58 people and displaced almost half a million more.
Foreign Minister Julie Bishop on Friday said that Sri Lanka was a close friend to Australia, and that the government would have no hesitation in sending assistance to help with the clean-up or to help resettle those who have lost their homes.
The government of France extended condolences to the families of the landslide victims in Sri Lanka and offered support to Sri Lanka government and the people.
Meanwhile, President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko also expressed condolences to President Maithripala Sirisena.

hits._id: A special cabinet meeting this afternoon regarding the economy

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has called a special Cabinet meeting this afternoon.
A senior government minister told our news team that during the meeting scheduled at 3pm, discussions will focus on the prevailing condition of the country’s economy.
Meanwhile addressing the media briefing to inform of Cabinet decisions yesterday, deputy minister Dr. Harsha De Silva said the amount of loans borrowed by Rajapaksa government and what measures should be taken to repay such huge credit will take center stage at today’s special Cabinet meeting.
In addition Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake told a media conference recently that the Rajapaksa government has borrowed unlimited loans which have put tremendous stress on the country.

hits._id: Joint Opposition requests special laws

_source.content: Leader of the Joint Opposition MP Dinesh Gunawardana said in parliament today that special laws should be introduced to settle the issue of waste in the country. He was speaking when parliament met today to endorse several gazette notifications with regard to waste management and the debate over the Meethotamulla incident. Our staff correspondent said that Opposition Leader R. Sampandan opened the debate and, President Maithripala Sirisena was also present in parliament during the debate today.

hits._id: Budget debate adjourned early as no MPs to make speeches

_source.content: The Deputy Chairman of Committees adjourned the budget debate at 4.45 this evening since there were no speakers available to contribute to the debate.The house was adjourned till 9.30 tomorrow morning as the four MPs from the government as well as the opposition sides were absent in the chambers this evening.Today is the third day of the budget debate for 2015.

hits._id: Red Notice From Lal Kantha against ECTA

_source.content:
Despite Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe saying ECTA agreement between India and Sri Lanka would be signed whatever opposition is placed against it, the people and the trade union movement in the country would never allow it to be implemented says the President of National Trade Union Center (NTUC) K.D. Lal Kantha.
He said the attempt to implement ECTA would be defeated and island wide protests would be launched whatever bold words Mr. Ranil Wickramasinghe uses.
Mr. Lal kantha stated this while speaking at a media conference held in Colombo yesterday (25).

hits._id: Stress on SL removed; Ready to bear resolution’s universality - Premier.

_source.content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe said that Sri Lanka was prepared to bear the universality of the resolution on Sri Lanka that four countries including US have submitted to the Geneva Human Rights Commission.
The Prime Minister said that this resolution had removed from Sri Lanka an immense stress that had vexed the country.  
Similarly the Prime Minister said that as a result of these developments Sri Lanka could face the future with confidence.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe said so while participating at the golden jubilee of the Chartered Institute of Management Accountants.

hits._id: Message from Opposition leader to UNP and SLFP members

_source.content: Opposition Leader Ranil Wickramasinghe states that UNP and SLFP supporters must join a common front rather than having disputes.He made this statement while addressing the Anuradapura UNP Bala Mandala meeting.

hits._id: Certain state institution heads do not respect political leadership; says a deputy Minister in Parliament

_source.content: Deputy Minister Sarath Kumara Gunarathna stated in Parliament today that heads of some state institutions do not respect the political leadership.This was during the 4th day of the budget committee stage debate in parliament today.

hits._id: UNP asks to present the budget according to the constitution.-Video

_source.content: The UNP requests the government to present the budget for next year in line with the constitution.Party representative MP Doctor Harsha de Silva stated this while addressing a media briefing held in Colombo today.

hits._id: President says some don’t know ‘difference’ of war heroes and terrorists

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that certain members of the government, opposition, and non-governmental organizations cannot comprehend the difference between war heroes and terrorists.
 
The President made these comments at the Commemoration of National War Heroes held at the War Heroes' Memorial in Parliament Grounds, Kotte.
 
Many invitees including the Speaker, commanders of the tri-forces as well as the relatives of the war-heroes took part in the commemoration.
 
After the President arrived the National anthem was sung following which the ceremony began.
 
2 minutes of silence was held as a mark of respect to war heroes who laid down their lives for the country, following which the President addressed the gathering.Here, he said that he will never allow the wishes of LTTE supporters to be fulfilled.

hits._id: Chief Ministers to meet with Former President tomorrow

_source.content:
Western Province Chief Minister Isura Devapriya said that SLFP Chairman, President Maithripala Sirisena had granted consent for Chief Ministers from the SLFP to meet with Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.
Accordingly a meeting has been scheduled for tomorrow.

hits._id: UN Secretary-General discusses 100-day plan with Sri Lankan President

_source.content: The United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon has spoken on the phone with President Maithripala Sirisena and discussed the President's 100-day plan.The Spokesperson of the Secretary-General said Ban Ki Moon spoke on the phone with President Sirisena and congratulated him on his election and the successful conclusion of the presidential election.The Secretary-General and President Sirisena discussed the President's 100-day plan and Sri Lanka’s post-war agenda.Meanwhile, The US offered to immediately engage with the new Sri Lankan government but cautioned that there are still “real challenges” in the country.US Secretary of State John Kerry telephoned President Maithripala Sirisena late Sunday to say the US now hoped to strengthen its ties with Colombo.Kerry is in India ahead of a visit by US President Barack Obama, who will be guest of honour at the country’s January 26th Republic Day celebrations.

hits._id: Former President Mahinda says he only drew the attention of the government regarding incidents in the North

_source.content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa said that he only drew the attention of the government regarding the incidents which have taken place in the North.He stated this after participating in several meetings held at Abhayaramaya in Narahenpita today.Expressing further, the former President said that he was in parliament since 1970 and has witnessed the outset of the LTTE.Therefore, he said he has informed the government to find out if there are any organizations behind the Hartal which was staged within this week.

hits._id: Funds provided by government for school maintenance not sufficient; accusation from teacher unions.

_source.content:
The Lanka Teacher Services Association charges that the funds the Government provides for school maintenance is not sufficient.
Associations general secretary Mahinda Jayasinghe said at a media briefing held in Colombo yesterday that the Government should immediately increase its expenditure on schools.

			   
			   		
	
			   
However Education Minister Bandula Gunawardhana said in Parliament recently that a new circular would soon be issued with regard to collecting funds in schools.

			   
			   		
	
			   
Expressing his views further on this occasion, the Lanka Teacher Services' Association general secretary stated as follows:

hits._id: President vows to develop entire country

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says the current government’s policy is to build the entire country as a developed and respectful one.
He said the government has made plans to fast track the development projects in the North and East that were stalled due to the conflict.
He made these remarks addressing the “Samurdhi Praja Shakthi National Convention" held in Colombo today (23).

hits._id: A commission was appointed to impose maximum punishment on real offenders – says President

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena stated that he appointed a special commission to probe the Central Bank Bond scam to impose maximum punishment to the real perpetrators.
He was speaking at a ceremony held at the Abhayaramaya in Narahenpita last afternoon.
Speaking further the President stated that another presidential commission will be appointed to probe corruption and the malpractices of the previous government.

hits._id: Prez shoots downs claims of a SL/India bridge

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that discussions were not held with regard to the construction of a bridge which would span between Talaimannar and Sri Lanka.
The President said that he strongly refutes such false statements made to tarnish the reputation of the government.
The President said so while participating at a religious function held at the Ganemulla Buddhist Temple in Thalawatugoda yesterday.

hits._id: President leaves for Malta

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena left for Malta today to attend the 2015 Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting.
The CHOGM 2015 will be held in Malta from 27th to 29th of this month under the theme 'The Commonwealth - Adding Global Value'.
Commonwealth leaders in Malta will address global issues such as climate change, building resilience in small states, trade and sustainable development, the empowerment of youth, gender equality and human rights.
In 2013 Sri Lanka hosted the biennial event, which brings together Heads of State and government from the 53 countries in the Commonwealth.

hits._id: Opposition leader points out the need for independent police commission.

_source.content:
Opposition Leader Ranil Wickramasinghe states that in order to safeguard law and order an independent police commission must be established.
Opposition leader made this statement addressing a party meeting in Mathara yesterday.

hits._id: President Sirisena meets German President

_source.content:
The official meeting between President Maithripala Sirisena and his German counterpart Joachim Gauck was held yesterday afternoon at the Bellevue Palace in Berlin.
The German President warmly welcomed his Sri Lanka counterpart. 
President Sirisena has commended the German government for the continued assistance extended toward Sri Lanka’s development over the last five decades.
President’s Media Unit stated that President Gauck has made a pledge to provide a significant contribution toward the development of Sri Lanka as she is moving forward while restoring democracy and reconciliation.

hits._id: Update : Video : Unique solutions should be found on behalf of future generations - President

_source.content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa stated that we should find unique solutions on behalf of the future generation which would make ourselves proud setting an example for other countries.The President speaking in parliament as the Minister of Finance during the budget debate also extended an invitation to the TNA and Opposition.Update : Saturday, 21 December 2013 - 7:54-------------------------------------President invites TNA to join hands.President Mahinda Rajapaksa, in his capacity as Finance Minister arrived in parliament today to deliver the post speech during the end of the heads of expenditure debate.During his speech, the President invited the TNA to join hands with him and urged the entire Opposition to join a wide spread program under an alliance and work for a national course of development.

hits._id: Beleaguered Law and Order Minister Thilak Marapana resigns

_source.content:
Minister of Law and Order Thilak Marapana has sent his letter to the President Maithripala Sirisena stating that he is resigning from his Ministerial Portfolio.Marapana received severe criticism for his comments in Parliament last week, when he said that the Police raided Avant-Garde ship in January to "score points".Update: Monday, 09 November 2015 - 10:19----------------------------------------------------------Beleaguered Law and Order Minister Tilak Marapana to resign?Sri Lanka's beleaguered Law and Order Minister Tilak Marapana is expected to resign today ahead of moves to have him removed by his cabinet colleagues, official sources said.
Minister Tilak Marapana who defended the controversial Avant Garde arms scandal in parliament drew severe criticism from those who had supported the United National Party (UNP) and President Maithripala Sirisena for good governance.
Mr. Marapana called a press conference to announce his future plans even as his cabinet colleagues were holding a special meeting chaired by President Sirisena to remove him.

hits._id: President to go to Russia next year

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena will go on an official tour to Russia next year, Minister of Foreign Affairs Mangala Samaraweera said in parliament today.
He said that the President will go to Russia in March next year over the invitation of Russian President Vladimir Putin.

hits._id: "No use of continuing without 19th A" - Ajith P. Perera

_source.content:
If the 19th Amendment to the Constitution is defeated President Maithripala Sirisena should dissolve the Parliament, Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs Ajith P. Perera stated during a press conference.
He went on to say that if the 19th Amendment is defeated there is no point in continuing.

hits._id: Ravi K. Assures Close Relations with China

_source.content:
Minister of Finance Ravi Karunanayake has assured a close relationship with the Chinese government despite reinterpretation of contracts.
The Minister in an interview with CNBC said “We have a friendly persuasion with China. All we want to do is correct the in governance.
That’s what China is doing. That’s what Maithripala Sirisena government is doing.” Earlier this month, the government stated Chinese deals would proceed after nearly a year of delays as the contracts remain binding, adding that it is a reinterpretation of how clean government should be.
The Minister said “What we want to do is the Sri Lankan economy which was made to look small to be made open. And integrate with the world.” He noted for the first time in 15 years the new government is bringing in financial discipline by fixing its recurrent expenditure.

hits._id: Colombo-Kandy Expressway Work Begins In April

_source.content:
The Cabinet Minister of Highways & Higher Education Lakshman Kiriella said that the construction work of the Colombo-Kandy expressway will start in April 2016 under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe.
He stated this while speaking at a public gathering in Kandy yesterday (Wednesday 20th).

hits._id: President Maithripala To Hold Talks With Indian PM

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena during a short visit to New Delhi later this week will hold a special discussion with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
President Sirisena who will leave for London on May 11 to attend the Anti-Corruption Summit organized by the British government, is scheduled to visit India on his return on May 13 on an invitation extended by the Indian Prime Minister.
India's Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has officially invited the Sri Lankan President to take part in a Hindu religious ceremony in Ujjain district of the Indian state of Madhya Pradesh.
British Prime Minister David Cameron, who will host the landmark international summit in London on May 12, has extended an invitation to President Sirisena when the two leaders met at the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting held in Malta last year.

hits._id: Dr. Neville Fernando reveals reason for selling their hospital

_source.content:
Dr. Neville Fernando says that he decided to sell the Malabe Neville Fernando hospital to settle the loan he obtained to construct the hospital.
A newspaper advertisement was published recently seeking a buyer for the hospital.
Although we attempted to contact Dr. Fernando again to obtain more details, he did not respond.
Earlier, the government announced that it took over the Neville Fernando hospital.
The agreement in that regard was signed between the then Health Ministry Secretary Janaka Sugathadasa and Dr. Neville Fernando.
President Maithripala Sirisena and Health Minister, Dr. Rajitha Senarathna attended the agreement signing ceremony.
The General Manager of the state bank which granted the loan to construct the hospital was also a signatory to the particular agreement.

hits._id: SLFP's "Group of 16" undecided on May Day rally

_source.content:
The representatives of Sri Lanka Freedom Party's parliamentarians who had recently resigned from their Ministerial portfolios expect to meet President Maithripala Sirisena today (Apr. 23).
 
They said they would take a final decision on their participation in SLFP May Day rally following this meeting.
 
The SLFP Central Committee meeting will probably be held next week.
 
The SLFP's "Group of 16" said earlier that during this CC meeting, they are going to propose that the party as a whole should resign from the Unity Government.
 
Meanwhile, a committee headed by Dr. Sarath Amunugama was appointed to look into the future of the Unity Government.
 
The committee report will be handed over to the President soon and it was reported that the committee members have proposed to continue the Unity Government.
 
The Joint Opposition leaders will meet tomorrow under the patronage of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa at his official residence in Colombo.
 
The meeting will draw special attention to the possibility of engaging in politics with the 16 SLFP MPs who had resigned from the government.
 
MP Dayasiri Jayasekera said earlier that a political force will be formed with the affiliation of Joint Opposition and Podujana Peramuna.
 
Meanwhile, addressing a ceremony held in Bibila yesterday, Minister Vijith Vijayamuni Soyza requested the 16 SLFP former Ministers to return to the Unity Government.

hits._id: Former Prime Minister Rathnasiri Wickramanayake bids farewell to the nation – President along with Chandrika and Mahinda takes part in the funeral

_source.content:
The funeral of late, former Prime Minister Rathnasiri Wickremanayake was held under State Patronage today at the Horana Public grounds.
Rathnasiri Wickremanayake died at a private hospital in Colombo after a brief illness on the 27th.
The Maha Sanga, President Maithripala Sirisena, Former Presidents Chandrika Bandaranayaka and Mahinda Rajaapakse, Speaker Karu Jayasuriya, Opposition Leader R. Sambandan and many politicians attended the funeral.
President Maithripala Sirisena addressing the funeral house stated that former Prime Ministers honesty is an example to all.

hits._id: Protect the judiciary as well as Parliament; says opposition leader

However addressing yesterday's cabinet decision media briefing Cabinet Spokesperson Minister Keheliya Rambukwella stated that the Chief Justice should accept sole responsibility for creating the rift between the Judiciary & the government.


			   
			   		
	
			   

Meanwhile Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe addressing a function held at party headquarters Sirikotha stated that the UNP under any circumstance was not prepared to betray parliament.

hits._id: Govt takes all decisions based on the policy of safeguarding local industries; President.

President Mahinda Rajapaksa says that the government takes all decisions based on the policy of safeguarding local industries and promoting local products.
 
The President expressed these views at a discussion that was held at Temple Trees yesterday to obtain views from private sector entrepreneurs prior to the preparation of the 2014 budget.
 
The entrepreneurs had stated that they would provide their fullest support to the country’s development.
 
They had also stated that since infrastructure including the road network had developed significantly it added convenience to them in conducting their businesses.

hits._id: Former President looses the majority in Parliament

_source.content: The UPFA has lost its majority in parliament as several of its MPs have decided to support new president Maithreepala Sirisena.Accordingly, 112 MPs including the speaker are supporting former President Mahinda Rajapaksa while 112 MPs are supporting new president Maithreepala Sirisena.MPs M.K.D.S. Gunawardana, Rajitha Senarathna, Duminda Dissanayake and Rajiv Wijesinghe pledged their support to then health minister Maithreepala Sirisena who quit the Rajapaksa government to become the opposition common candidate.Later MPs Athuraliye Rathana Thera and Patali Champika Ranawaka of JHU pledged their support to then common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena.Other MPs followed suits are MPs Wasantha Senanayake and Navin Dissanayake, Rishard Badi Udin, Ameer Ali, Hunaiz Farook, P. Rajathurai, P. Digambaram, V. Radha Krishnan, Achala Jagoda and Nandimitra Ekanayake.As common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena won the election, MPs Janaka Bandara Tennakoon, Sarath Amunugama, Piyasena Gamage, S.B. Navinna, Reginald Corey, Vijith Vijithamuni Soyza, Jagath Pushpakumara, Nilvala Wijesinghe, Athauda Senevirathna and Manusha Nanayakkara pledged their support to the new president.When President Maithreepala Sirisena assumed duties today, several other MPs Milroy Fernando, Abdul Cader, Dayasritha Tissera, Felix Perera, Lalith Dissanayake, Niyomal Perera, Arundika Fernando and another MP pledged their support to the new president.By this afternoon, it is reported that another Matara district UPFA MP has decided to support President Maithreepala Sirisena.Meanwhile Ceylon Workers Congress led by Arumugam Thondaman which has two parliament seats has pledged its support to President Maithreepala Sirisena.In addition, 5 MPs including Wasudeva Nanayakkara, Tissa Vitharana and D.E.W. Gunasekera who represent the left wing have also pledged their support to President Maithreepala Sirisena.According to the current circumstances, President Maithreepala Sirisena needs only one parliament seat to secure the majority in the current parliament.

hits._id: Rajangana PS Chairman considered as resigned following 2nd defeat of budget

Prabhath Vitharana is considered as he resigned from his post after the budget was defeated at the second time.Local Government Commissioner W.A.T. Manel said that she has already written to Prabhath Vitharana in this regard.The budget for next year presented by the UPFA controlled Rajangana Pradeshiya Sabha was defeated with majority votes on October 24.Later the budget was defeated by 4 votes when it was presented at the second time on the 21st of November.In addition, Peliyagoda and Mirigama Pradeshiya Sabha budgets for next year have also been defeated after they were presented at the second time.At the same time, the new budgets presented by Kesbewa Urban Council, Alawwa and Ambilipitiya Pradeshiya Sabhas have now been defeated on the first occasion.

hits._id: Japan is ready to play a vital role in the process of economic reforms and development – Japans Minister of Economy, Trade and Industry(video)

_source.content: Japans Minister of Economy, Trade and Industry, Hiroshige Seko remarked that their government is ready to play a vital role in Sri Lanka’s process of economic reforms and development which is based on Environmental Protection and National Reconciliation.He made this statement at the discussion held yesterday in Tokyo with the Sri Lankan Premier Ranil Wickramasinghe and the diplomats who are on an official visit to Japan.Minister Seko further voiced that these steps would strengthen the bond between Sri Lanka and Japan more.Moreover, the Prime Minister’s office stated that thorough discussions were held regarding the development processes in Colombo-north port, Trincomalee City, second track of the BIA, Natural Gas Plant, third level of Central Express Way and soforth.

hits._id: Sivshankar Menon meets the Opposition Leader

_source.content:
The Indian National Security Advisor Shivshankar Menon who is on a tour or Sri Lanka met with opposition leader Ranil Wickramasinghe this morning.
 
Reports state that discussions between the two parties centred on the 13th amendment and the Northern Provincial Council election.
 
The opposition leader has also updated the Indian Security Advisor regarding the letter presented to the president which included several steps that need to be taken prior to the election in the North.
 
Furthermore the opposition leader has also stated that the government has not yet responded to the recommendations made by the opposition.
 
The Indian National Security Advisor Shivshankar Menon is scheduled to meet with representatives of the Sri Lanka Muslim Congress this afternoon.

hits._id: Urgent meeting between President and MPs

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has called the government group of SLFP MPs for an emergency meeting in Colombo tonight.
Responding to a query by our news team, an SLFP Minister said that this discussion would be held at 8pm at the President’s official residence.
Reports say that the President's Secretariat had informed the SLFP MPs by telephone last night that they should participate in the discussion without fail.
Political sources said that at this meeting, attention would be drawn on several matters including  the 20th constitutional amendment, holding the provincial council election on the same day and the current political situation.
The debate on the 20th constitutional amendment is scheduled to be held in Parliament on 20th this month and it is due to be passed on the same day.

hits._id: President arrives in Canberra

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena commencing his three-day state visit on the invitation of Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull has arrived in Australia.
The President is scheduled to meet with the Australian Prime Minister and will also hold several high level bilateral meetings.
The two leaders will explore possibilities of promoting bilateral trade, agriculture, and security.
During this visit of the President, the Government of Sri Lanka will enter into several bilateral agreements with Australia, strengthening economic and scientific cooperation. 
It is after six decades that a state leader of Sri Lanka, is visiting Australia on a State visit, and President Maithripala Sirisena is the first leader of Sri Lanka to visit Australia since the country became a Republic.

hits._id: Chandrika reveals how common opposition’s communication was carried out

_source.content:
Former President Chandrika Kumranatunga says that no outside force offered any support to common candidate Maithripala Sirisena at the recent Presidential Election.
The former President said so responding to queries journalists posed after she participated in a Buddhist and Hindu religious conference held in New Delhi.
On this occasion the journalists also asked whether India had carried out satellite technology communication with the team including common candidate Maithripala Sirisena.
Responding to this former president Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaranatunga said that Viber technology had been used between members of the common opposition during the recent presidential election.
Indian media reports said that during that time the Sri Lankan Government had not known the technique to tap such calls.

hits._id: President in London to attend CHOGM

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has reached London this morning (Ap. 16) to attend the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting (CHOGM) 2018.
 
He was received by the Commonwealth officials and Sri Lanka High Commission staff.
 
The theme of this year’s CHOGM is “Towards a Common Future” and the special attention will be given to the areas of prosperity, security, fairness and sustainability to achieve the goals of Commonwealth countries.
 
Within the official visit, President Sirisena is scheduled to meet the British Prime Minister Theresa May and also to hold discussions with several British government officials and visiting delegations.
 
Despite attending this conference the President is scheduled to address the Commonwealth Business Council and is also invited to deliver the keynote speech on the conference regarding achieving sustainable development goals.
 
President Sirisena will also attend the special celebration of the 92nd birthday of Queen Elizabeth.

hits._id: Kamalesh Sharma arrived in Sri Lanka

_source.content: Commonwealth Secretary-General Kamalesh Sharma arrived in Sri Lanka today for a three day official visit during which he will meet the President Maithripala Sirisena, the Commonwealth’s new Chair-in-Office.The Secretary-General will also meet Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and Foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera to discuss Commonwealth priorities as well as options for practical Commonwealth support for Sri Lanka’s national priorities.The Secretary-General said he is looking forward to working with President Sirisena as Chair-in-Office in the run up to the Heads of Government meeting in Malta in November.He said Sri Lanka is a founding member of the modern Commonwealth, and matters will be discussed how we can best support the country during this period of transition and in advancing national plans for the future.Meanwhile, Assistant Secretary of State for South and Central Asian Affairs Nisha Biswal will travel to Colombo on February 2nd. Joined by Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for South Asia Atul Keshap, she will review bilateral and regional issues with the new Sri Lankan government, civil society and religious leaders, and other officials. This will be the first visit to Sri Lanka by a senior State Department official since national elections were held earlier this month.

hits._id: UNHRC Commissioner explains the objectives of his tour of Sri lanka

_source.content:
The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Zeid Ra’ad Al Hussein will begin a four-day official visit to Sri Lanka tomorrow (06th).
During his visit, the High Commissioner will discuss a range of current challenges and opportunities for strengthening the rule of law and protection of human rights in Sri Lanka, including reviewing the implementation of the recommendations made in his report to the Human Rights Council, and in its subsequent Resolution on “promoting reconciliation, accountability and human rights in Sri Lanka.
The High Commissioner will meet President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, the Minister of Foreign Affairs and other Ministers, as well as other high-level Government officials at both federal and regional levels.
In addition the High Commissioner will also visit Jaffna, Trincomalee and Kandy.

hits._id: Vigneswaran to meet the President and the Prime Minister tomorrow

hits._id: Vesak is celebrated islandwide

_source.content:
Vesak Poya day which marks the Birth, Enlightenment and Passing Away of Lord Buddha is celebrated today (Apr. 29).
 
President Maithripala Sirisena in a statement in view of Vesak extended his wishes for a great Vesak celebration for all Buddhists around the world.
 
The President noted that Lord Buddha preached that human becomes a worthless person or a great person, not by his birth, but only through his actions.
 
This noble concept became a strong binding force of the entire humanity.
 
Meanwhile, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe in his Vesak message said that Vesak is a time for reflection and appreciation of our humanity, and to lead a life full of equality, respect and understanding.
 
The Premier also said that the unity Government is determined to make the prospects of a harmonious society a reality through the protection of democratic rights of people.
 
Meanwhile, Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa issuing a message in view of Vesak said that the teaching of Buddhism had always helped in overcoming challenges faced by the country and people since the past.
 
However, he raised concerns that the Sangha who had protected the Sasana had been pressurized during recent times.

hits._id: Foreign Ministry gives an explanation regarding the Indian fishermen shooting incident

_source.content:
The Foreign Ministry says that preliminary investigations revealed that the Sri Lanka navy did not shoot at Indian fishermen.
Issuing a communiqué the ministry noted that the safety of fishermen is important and the government would act humanely in any instance.
The communiqué further noted that the government of Sri Lanka expresses its deepest regrets regarding the alleged shooting incident.
The ministry added that if the shooting had occurred, it would be frowned upon and investigations into the incident will be conducted with the aid of Indian officials and the help of satellite technology.
Meanwhile, the minister of fisheries Mahinda Amaraweera responding to questions raised by journalists, noted that he had informed his defence secretary to conduct a comprehensive investigation into the matter.

hits._id: Mahanayake Davuldena Thera bids farewell to the nation

_source.content: The funeral of the chief prelate of Sri Lanka Amarapura Nikaya, Most Venerable Davuldena Gnanissara Thera was held with State honours at the Independence Square in Colombo this afternoon. The Maha Sangha from the 3 main Nikayas, other priests of different religious denominations, President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and large crowds of monks and laymen were present. The remains of the late Nayake Thera were escorted from Sri Vidya Vijayaramaya on Pagoda Road Nugegoda in a special vehicular parade at 1pm. The escort paraded past Pitakotte Junction, Athul Kotte, Parliament Road, Ayurveda Junction, Castle Street, D.S. Junction, Horton Place and Lotus Roundabout before it reached Independence Square. The Sri Lanka Army received the remains at the Lotus Junction and escorted it to Independence Square along Independence Avenue. The Army afforded a 17 gun salute in honour of the late Nayake Thera. After the funeral orations were delivered by the Maha Sangha, President Maithripala Sirisena addressed the gathering. Soon after the funeral rites were performed, the lighting of the funeral pyre was held amid a guard of honor by the tri forces this evening.

hits._id: Supreme Court verdict with regard to Pictorial warning on Cigarette Packets today

_source.content: The Supreme court verdict on the case filed against the gazette notification requiring the inclusion of a pictorial warning extending to 80 per cent of the cigarette covers is scheduled to be revealed today.While the Health Ministry prepared this gazette notification in 2012, the Ceylon Tobacco Company filed a petition to prevent its implementation.The Health Ministry said that the Appeal Court had also issued a verdict saying that the implementation of the gazette notification was legal.While the CTC filed again a Supreme Court case challenging the gazette notification, the Supreme Court verdict on the petition is due to be revealed today.Health Minister Maithripala Sirisena stated that the entire nation is waiting to hear the court verdict.President, the Cabinet and all 225 members of Parliament unanimously approved the gazette notification to cover 80 percent of cigarette packets with pictorial warnings.

hits._id: JVP supports no-confidence against Finance Minister

_source.content:
Government Party MPs held a special meeting last afternoon for discussing the no-confidence motion against Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake put forward by the Joint Opposition.
The meeting was held under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena.
It is said that while Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe also participated in this special meeting, all MPs representing the Government participated in it.
Reports say that the meeting that began at about 7 p.m. went on till 10 p.m.
UNP ministers and MPs and UPFA ministers and MPs representing the Government participated in the meeting.
The JVP said that it would support the no-confidence motion put forward against Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake.
At a media briefing held in Colombo yesterday JVP Propaganda Secretary MP Vijitha Herath said that the JVP would support the no-confidence motion deeming it as a no-confidence motion against the whole Government.
Meanwhile issuing a communiqué the Joint Opposition said that the no-confidence motion put forward against Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayke is a Litmus test for the SLFP.
In the communiqué released by the joint opposition, it is said that it believed that this no-confidence motion that was not included in the parliamentary agenda book and taken up for debate during a period of five months would not be withheld again.

hits._id: Update: State funeral of Asgiriya Mahanayake thero held

_source.content:
The cremation of the late Chief Prelate of the Asgiriya Chapter Most Venerable Udugama Sri Buddharakkitha Thera was held with full state honors today in Kandy.The Most Venerable Mahanayake was accorded a state funeral at the Asgiriya Police grounds, Kandy at 2.00 p.m. today.The revered Buddhist monk, passed away on Wednesday morning while receiving treatment at the Mount Elizabeth Hospital in Singapore for the past month.His remains were flown to Colombo last Thursday and later taken to the Asgiriya Maha Vihara.Thousands of people flocked to the temple to pay respects to the late Thero.The government declared April 12th as a Day of Mourning to honor the late Chief Prelate.President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasingha, Opposition Leader Nimal Siri Pala De Silva, many MP’s and Ministers as well as former President Mahinda Rajapakse were present to pay their last respects.         Update: Sunday, 12 April 2015 - 06:50 PM......................................................................................................................................
State funeral of Asgiriya Chief Prelate todayThe funeral of the Most Venerable Aggamaha Panditha Udugama Sri Buddharakkhita Mahanayake Thera of the Asgiriya Chapter will be held today (12).
The cremation with full State honours together with 17 gun salutes held at the Asgiriya Police Grounds in Kandy at 2 pm.
The Government has also declared 12 April, a Day of National Mourning as a mark of respect.
Accordingly, all private and state institution are requested to fly the national flag at half-mast on the aforementioned date and to hoist yellow flags in Temples and houses.

hits._id: Sustainable development should be founded on self-discipline and social justice - President

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena addressing the 70th United Nations General Assembly in New York said Sri Lanka's new vision for the country involves achieving the twin objectives of sustainable development and reconciliation.
The President said Sri Lanka's social and human development approach is founded on pluralism, reconciliation and sustainable development.
Noting that within the first six months of his Presidency, his government introduced essential amendments to the Constitution in order to strengthen democracy in Sri Lanka, the President said the new government under his leadership has already taken several steps to introduce and operationalize the reforms required.
He said the government intends to implement a new program and plan of action to advance human rights in Sri Lanka.
President Sirisena stressed that the edifice of sustainable development should therefore be built upon the foundation of self-discipline and equity.
The speech delivered by President yesterday (30th) at the 70th United Nations General Assembly.

hits._id: The mansion tax is now in force

_source.content: Speaker Karu Jayasuriya has put his signature to six legislations today.They were passed by parliament on October 20th.Among the legislations signed by Speaker are: the Inland Revenue Amendment Act, the Nation Building Levy Amendment Act and the Betting and Gambling Tax Amendment Act.The Speaker’s Office stated today, besides the above Acts, the Speaker singed to the Economic Services Fee Amendment Act, the Value Added Tax Amendment Act and another Finance Act.It is stated that the Mansion Tax which was introduced in the Interim Budget of the 100 day Government is included in the newly passed Finance Act. A Mansion tax of one million rupees would be charged from the owners of luxury residences which are valued above 150 million rupees or in the size of over 10 thousand square feet. This annual tax is applicable to the mansions which have been built after April 1st of year 2000.The government earlier announced that this tax could be paid in four installments.These six Acts could be considered the first legislation to be passed by the 8th parliament of Sri Lanka.

hits._id: President gives a wake-up call to the Government

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena today gave out a message to all stakeholders of the Government.The President expressed his views regarding the increase in taxes on cigarettes at the opening of the new building of the Maharagama Apeksha Hospital.President Sirisena also recollected the challenges he faced as the Health Minister back in the day.Meanwhile, the 150th Anniversary celebrations of the Police were also held under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena at the Bambalapitiya Police Grounds.The President’s Birthday also falls today.President Maithripala Sirisena who was born on the 3rd of September 1951 received his education from Thopa-Wewa Maha Vidyalaya and Polonnaruwa Royal College.He commenced his political career in 1967, and progressed towards becoming a District Organizing Secretary of the SLFP in 1979.He became the Secretary of the SLFP Youth Front in 1981 and was first appointed to Parliament in 1989.Since then after having held several key Ministerial positions, he was elected as the President of Sri Lanka on the 08th of January 2015.

hits._id: President talks about his political future

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that he has not yet decided whether he would contest at the next Presidential Election.
The President said this speaking to the heads of media institutions at the President House in Fort this morning (Jan. 26).
President Sirisena said that today he works to fulfil the responsibilities vested upon him and that would engage in politics for the rest of his life whether he would contest or not.
The President expressing views on his statement on the Central Bank bond report, he said that he made that statement after it was accurately summarized by a team of experts.
Speaking further, he stated that he resigned from the previous regime to contest the Presidential Election, as he was against fraud and corruption which he was witnessing at that time.
He noted in the two months into the formation of the new Government, the Central Bank heist occurred.
President Sirisena said that he had taken adequate measures to deal with the Central Bank bond scam.
He stated that a clan of white-collar thieves has been grouped to resist the measures.
The President insisted that there is need to establish non-corrupt organizations to take actions against corrupt individuals.
President Maithripala Sirisena expressed views on the country’s economy as well.
He said that 10 trillion rupees were borrowed during the previous regime and assets valued at just 1 trillion rupees are left.
President said that nobody knows what happened to the balance Rs. 9 trillion.
The President also revealed a trend in which the money meant for government coffers are being diverted to the private sector after the new government came to power.
The President told the heads of media institutions that he has evidence to prove that certain powerful groups within the government have allegedly influenced such operations.

hits._id: PSC to convene for the first time tomorrow without opposition members

_source.content:
The Parliamentary Select Committee established to solve the national issue will convene for the first time tomorrow.

Speaking to our news team, the chairman of the PSC Minister Nimal Siripala De Silva stated that the PSC is scheduled to convene at the parliamentary complex at 3pm tomorrow.

This committee has been named the PSC to recommend political and constitutional steps to enable the Sri Lankan public to live as one race.

The speaker named the government members who will represent the PSC recently and it includes 19 members of parliament representing the government.

Ministers, Professor G L Peries, Maithripala Sirisena, Douglas Devananda, A L M Athaulla, DEW Gunasekara, Rishard Baduideen, Champika Ranawaka, Wimal Weerawanse, Wasudewa Nanayakkara and Deputy Ministrr Muththu Sivalingam are members of the PSC.

However, the UNP, the TNA and the JVP have not yet nominated the names of their respective representatives for the PSC.

The SLMC, which represents the government, has also stated that it will not take part in the PSC.

Hence the PSC will convene tomorrow without any opposition members.

Speaking at a press conference held in Colombo yesterday, TNA Parliamentarian M. Sumandiran expressed the following views as to why the TNA is not taking part in the PSC.

hits._id: SLFP meets today to discuss Ministerial positions

_source.content:
A special Sri Lanka Freedom Party Central Committee meeting is scheduled to be held at 7 pm this evening (Apr. 09).
The discussion will be held at the President’s official residence with President Maithripala Sirisena at the chair.
Responding to us, Minister W. D. J. Seneviratne said that a decision would be taken at this meeting as to whether the 16 SLFP MP’s holding portfolios as cabinet members, State Ministers and Deputy Ministers, who voted in favour of the 'no-confidence motion' against the Prime Minister, should continue to hold ministerial posts.
During a meeting on Saturday night between the President, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe and a group of UNP ministers, it was stated that the government could not continue to run jointly with those SLFP ministers who voted in favour of the no-confidence motion.
Additionally, the SLFP’s future role in the national government will also be discussed at this evening's Central Committee meeting.
However, at a media briefing in Colombo yesterday, UNP Deputy General Secretary, Media Spokesperson, Minister Akila Viraaj Kaariyawasam, said that the Cabinet reshuffle was due to take place prior to the Sinhala and Tamil New Year.
Meanwhile, UPFA General Secretary, Minister Mahinda Amaraweera said that MPs and Ministers who voted in favour of the 'no-confidence motion' had informed, in writing, that they would not leave the party.
The UPFA General Secretary said this while participating at a function in Weeraketiya yesterday.

Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena has condoled the Russian President Vladimir Putin on the crash of a Russian aircraft in Egypt yesterday.

"The government and people of Sri Lanka join me in expressing their condolence to the Russian government, the people of Russia and relatives of the victims. On this sad occasion, all Sri Lankans will share the grief with the people of Russia," the President's message added.

_source.content: Former speaker Chamal Rajapaksa says that the people demand former president Mahinda Rajapaksa as their future Prime Minister.Addressing a media conference held in Tissamaharamaya today, former speaker Rajapaksa said that he bows to the people’s mandate.In a letter to the former president Rajapaksa, President Maithripala Sirisena stated that one of the senior SLFPers, other than former president Rajapaksa would be appointed the prime minister in the event the UPFA is able to form a government after the August 17th general election.In the president’s letter to the former president, the name of Chamal Rajapaksa was also proposed as a qualified senior SLFPer to the premiership.Expressing his views over the president’s letter, former speaker Rajapaksa said that all party members should unanimously declare that Mahinda Rajapaksa should be the prime ministerial candidate of the party.He also said that the people do not demand to appoint him as the prime minister.Meanwhile, Alliance lawyers Association has sent a letter to the Election Commissioner with regard to the president’s letter which was sent to the former president yesterday.The lawyers association requests the election commissioner to inform President Maithreepala Sirisena to make a statement asking the people to ignore the content of his letter sent to former president Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday.

hits._id: A special statement to Parliament by Minister Hakeem.

_source.content: SLMC Leader Minister Rauff Hakeem is scheduled to make a special statement in parliament today about the recent incident in Aluthgama and Beruwala.Earlier Deputy Speaker informed house that parliament does not treat Minister Hakeem as a party leader although he is a political party leader.Therefore SLMC spokesman said that his party would take time from the government’s allocations to enable Minister Hakeem to make the special statement.Meanwhile SLMC has vested power on Minister Hakeem to discuss with the government of strategies to prevent incidents similar to that of Aluthgama and Beruwala in the future.SLMC MP Faizal Cassim told our news team his parliament group will meet  this noon to decide the cause of action the party is going to take during the parliament debate over the UN Human Rights Investigative Committee against Sri Lanka.Meanwhile Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe will also make a special statement over the Beruwala and Aluthgama incidents in parliament today.In addition, UNP Media Spokesman MP Gayantha Karunatilaka said his party parliament group will decide the cause of action to be taken during the debate on UN Human Rights Investigative Committee against Sri Lanka when the group meets this noon.At the same time Minister Rohitha Abeygunawardana has explained in detail about the Beruwala and Aluthgama incident during the government parliament group meeting yesterday.It is reported that the group had discussed the government’s necessity to take measures to maintain a peaceful environment in the affected areas.Meanwhile ruling party MP Shantha Bandara described the cause of action to be taken by the government side during the parliament debate today on the UN Human Rights Investigative Committee against Sri Lanka.

hits._id: National heroes must be remembered: President

_source.content: The state religious ceremony, in view of the 67th Independence Day was held under the patronage President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasingha at Wadduwa – Molligoda – Degam-bada temple.Addressing the occasion President stated that the leadership provided by leaders of the country to liberate the country from Colonialist must be remembered with pride.

hits._id: SAITM parents and anti-SAITM Org. submit a joint proposal to President

hits._id: President says that at the upcoming election he expects a government that is able to take forward the January 8th victory

hits._id: We will create an economy where all could have 3 meals a day: statement from Common Candidate Maithri. -Video

hits._id: Minister Ravi absent during today’s cabinet meeting

_source.content:
SLFP Ministers meet the Prime Minister after a discussion with the President.
SLFP Ministers have requested that Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe ask Foreign Minister Ravi Karunanayake to resign from his portfolio.
SLFP Ministers group made this request during a meeting they had with the Premier before the Cabinet meeting commenced this morning.
The ministers stated that it is the responsibility of minister Karunanayake to resign from his post in order to safeguard the dignity of the unity government.
Meanwhile, Minister Ravi Karunanayake did not participate in the Cabinet meeting presided by President Maithripala Sirisena, this morning.
SLFP ministers discussed this issue with the President last night, requesting that the President either remove minister Karunanayake from his current post or ask him to resign with immediate effect.
It has been reported that the President pledged to resolve the issue in the next few days.

hits._id: Police should only adhere to the law - states opposition leader

The opposition leader Ranil Wickramasinghe states that the police should act according to the law and not according to the whims of politicians.
 
Wickramasinghe made this statement while speaking at a meeting held in the Kotte electorate.
 
Speaking further the opposition leader also stated that if state service and police services are to be initiated according to the law the 17th amendment should be put into action.
