hits._id: No-confidence motion against Min. Ravi at parliament today

_source.content:
Parliamentary sessions that were postponed due to a technical glitch in the microphone system at the Parliament will be taken up today at 9.30 am.
The Speaker said that the no-confidence motion against Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake will be taken into debate today.
Convening a special media briefing at parliamentary complex yesterday the Joint Opposition charged that the interruption was a pre-planned by the Government.
A Government party meeting was held at parliamentary complex last afternoon with Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe at the chair.
At this meeting the Prime Minister had informed all Ministers and MPs to be present for the debate that will be held today.

hits._id: President's address interrupted by a power cut

_source.content:
A power cut took place while President Maithripala Sirisena was addressing the gathering at the Wayamba Province Health Services Awards Ceremony held in Kurunegala organized by the Wayamba Province Health and Indigenous Medicine Ministry.
Ten minutes in to the President’s speech there had been a power outage, while the back-up generator also failed, leaving the entire audience in the dark for nearly 30 minutes.
The Presentation of awards had also taken place with the aid of candle lights.
However, addressing the occasion President Maithripala Sirisena said that the health service should be further strengthened to achieve international victories.

hits._id: I am ready to talk about Indo - Sri Lanka issues - Opposition Leader says in India

hits._id: Indian National Security Adviser to meet Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena: Also to meet Former president Chandrika and UNP Leader Ranil

_source.content: India’s Hindu newspaper reported that National Security Adviser Ajit Doval, who will arrive in Sri Lanka on Monday, will meet leaders of the newly-formed common Opposition, in addition to meeting with President Mahinda Rajpaksa.Doval is on Monday scheduled to deliver the keynote address at ‘Galle Dialogue 2014,’ an international conference on maritime security and cooperation in Galle.It was confirmed that the NSA was scheduled to meet President Mahinda Rajapaksa and during his meeting with the President and Defence Secretary Doval is expected to discuss maritime security in Sri Lanka and Maldives.The Hindu reported that Doval, is expected to meet Maithripala Sirisena and former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga, who is backing him.He is also expected to meet leader of the United National Party Ranil Wickremesinghe and representatives of the Tamil National Alliance and the Sri Lanka Muslim Congress.

hits._id: Ananda Sangaree requests a thorough investigation

_source.content:
Tamil United Liberation Front’s (TULF) leader V. Ananda Sangari request the premiere Ranil wickramasinghe writing for a thorough investigation into the deaths of seven parliament members.
The thorough investigation in to the deaths of the following is requested.
Lakshman Kadirgamar, Kingley Rajanyagam, Arunachalam Thanga Dorey, Joseph Pararajasingham, Nadaraja Raviraj, T.Maheshwaran and D.M.Dassanayaka.
However it was reported the other day that the premiere has decide to appoint a committee to look into the deaths of parliament members.

hits._id: NMRPP Urge President to Release Political Prisoners

_source.content:
The National Movement for Release of Political Prisoners (NMRPP) handed over a special letter to President Maithripala Sirisena today (10), urging the release of all political prisoners who are currently detained in several prisons in the country.
Although the government and authorities promised to offer amnesty to the inmates who jailed due to political reasons, now it has been proved that the authorities are ignoring the issue, Coordinating member of the NWRPP Sundaram Mahendran stated this while speaking to Hiru news.
Consequently, the Tamil National Alliance (TNA) Vanni District Parliamentarian Selvam Addaikalanathan also accused the government of misleading its people saying that the government would release the political prisoners.
Earlier, the Northern Provincial Chief Minister (CM) C.V. Wigneswaran told media that the government is engaged in a role of a drama with regard to the LTTE detainees.

hits._id: Vehicle leasing loan facility increased from 70% to 90%

_source.content: Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake says the loan facility for leasing vehicles has been increased from 70 percent to 90 percent.Addressing a media conference held at the finance ministry today, minister Karunanayake said this decision would remain until the next budget is presented.The leasing facility to buy vehicles was granted in full before it was recently reduced to 70 percent by the current government. Consequently, prospective buyers had to pay 30 percent of the value of the intended vehicle over the counter. Minister Karunanayake said that the on-the-spot payment has now been reduced upto 10 percent with effect from today.

hits._id: Clear Change of Ministerial Subjects

_source.content:
The political sources stated that subjects of several former ministers have been changed in allocating ministry portfolios of the new government.
Accordingly, it is reported that new faces have been selected to run the subjects of Law and Order, Power and Energy, Media, Home Affairs, Land and Highways.
The same sources disclosed that several new ministries have been added to the Cabinet of the new government.
The Cabinet of the new government is scheduled to be sworn in on September 2nd. 
MP elect Mahinda Amaraweera said that 30 ministries have been allocated for the UNP while 15 ministries have been billed for the SLFP.
Accordingly, SLFP ministry slots would include Higher Education, Agriculture, Irrigation, Petroleum, Samurdhi and Fisheries.
The sources also stated that former Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake would receive the same ministry but Banking and financial service sector have been removed from the Finance Ministry and brought under the purview of another ministry.
A new ministry under the name of Urban Development and Megapolis has been set up and MP elect Patali Champika Ranawaka is to be picked to run that new ministry.
Ministries of Housing and Construction, Education, Ports and Shipping as well as Health will be offered to the MPs Sajith Premadasa, Akila Viraj Kariyawasam, Arjuna Ranatunga and Rajitha Senaratne respectively.
In addition, sources have revealed that former Minister Palani Digambaram will be sworn in again as the Minister of Estate Infrastructure.
It is also reported that M.K.D.S. Gunawardena will be sworn in as the Minister of Buddha Sasana, Gayantha Karunaratne as Minister of Plantation Industries, John Amaratunga as Minister of Power and Lakshman Kiriella as Minister of Highways will be sworn in respectively.
In addition, political sources revealed that MPs Harin Fernando and Vajira Abeywardena who were re-elected to Parliament and MP S.B. Nawinna who joined the UNP prior to the General Election will be offered cabinet ministerial portfolios.

hits._id: A challenge from government to Anura Kumara to contest at the Presidential election.-Video

_source.content: The Government has challenged JVP leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake to contest at the presidential election, if he could.While the first budget committee stage debate was held yesterday, Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamagey extended this challenge to the JVP leader during the debate.

hits._id: Video : TNA puts conditions to support government - Come for discussions; Govt

hits._id: A decisive discussion to be held between Finance Minister and Customs Officials

Meanwhile, Finance Ministry announced yesterday that the ministry will recruit retired Customs officers with immediate effect to ensure the smooth function of the Custom Department. At the same time, the Joint Opposition stated in a media conference held in parliament complex today that the government is trying to suppress trade unions instead responding to their demands. Meanwhile, the Finance Minister has sent a letter inviting the trade unions of the Customs for a meeting on the 27th.

hits._id: Mahapola allowance to be increased by Rs. 4000.-Budget 2015

_source.content:
While presenting the Budget for 2015 at the parliament President Mahinda Rajapaksa stated that Mahapola scholarship offered to University students will be increased by Rs. 4000.
In addition, the scholarship offered to the students who pass year five scholarship will be increased from Rs. 500 to Rs.1500, while the number of recipients will be increased up to 25,000. Meanwhile, the Samurdhi allowance given to a 3 member family unit will be increased up to Rs. 4000/-, while Rs. 3000 will be given to a family unit with 3 members. Other Samurdhi recipients will also receive an increment of Rs. 1000.
Furthermore, a proposal was presented through the budget to introduce a pension for those working in the garment sector.

hits._id: UN HRC report handed over to the government

_source.content:
India’s The Hindu newspaper reported that the U.N. probe report on alleged war crimes committed during the final phase of the battle against the LTTE has been handed over to the Sri Lankan government.

The report, scheduled for public release during the 30th Session of the UN Human Rights Council which kicks off next on Monday in Geneva, was received by the government last night.

The presentation of the report was deferred until this month by the UNHRC as a goodwill gesture towards the government of President Maithripala Sirisena.

The Hindu quoted sources saying that Sri Lanka has five days to make its response in writing.

The report and Sri Lanka’s response would be submitted at the UNHRC session only at the end of this month.

hits._id: Profit of Sri Lankan Airlines to be Distributed Amongst People Following Its Success

_source.content:
Prime minister Ranil Wickramasinghe emphasizes that following the revival of Sri Lankan airlines through the amalgamation with a private entity, the profit obtained would be provided to the public.
Prime Minister had informed the officers of the airlines that following the revival, the company could engage in social service as well.
The profit obtained is to be utilized for education, health and for the provision of housing to low income families.
In order to attract interest and potential investors, the debt of 461 billion rupees has been taken over by the treasury.
Four previously ordered A350 aircrafts have also been cancelled.
The government believes that selling shares of 40% to a foreign company would mediate the debt crisis.
Prime minister informed the officials of Sri Lankan airlines yesterday that the government does not want to entertain the concept of a white elephant; letting money go to waste, by continuing to facilitate the airlines.

hits._id: Former President convenes Joint Opposition again

_source.content:
It is exactly one week since the end of 2018 Local Government election. However, the political uncertainty created with the release of results is still prevailing. The discussions are continuing. The United National Front says the present government will continue while the United People's Freedom Alliance says they cannot continue with Ranil Wickremesinghe as the Prime Minister.Meanwhile, the former President Mahinda Rajapaksa had once again convened a meeting which was attended by the leaders of the Joint Opposition.It was held at his official residence at Wijerama Mawatha, Colombo 07.This meeting was held after a statement made by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe last afternoon.
The parliamentarians of the United People's Freedom Alliance had a discussion at Minister S. B. Dissanayake’s residence yesterday and another discussion was held today.

hits._id: "Gov. Will Resettle All War-Displaced By Year-End" – Mano Ganeshan

_source.content:
The Government will by year-end resettle all people, including the minority Muslims and the Sinhalese, who were displaced during the nearly three-decade-long war against the LTTE, a senior minister said on Sunday, according to the Press Trust of India.
“We have six months to go, we will resettle all in the north by end of the year,” Minister of National Dialogue Mano Ganesan said, adding that even the Sinhala and Muslim minority communities who were chased out by the LTTE would be given their lands back by inviting them to return to Jaffna.
The return of the land was a top reconciliation priority for the government, he said. While the Sinhalese left their land in the early 1980s, the Muslims were evicted by the LTTE in 1990. Ganesan is a member of the panel appointed by President Maithripala Sirisena to identify the lands that are needed to resettle the war displaced.
The Sirisena government had released some of the Tamil civilian land held by the military during the 30-year conflict with the LTTE that finally ended in 2009. Sirisena recently in Japan had said that the Tamils’ lands must be returned at the earliest.

hits._id: JVP reveals an attempt by Indian Intelligence RAW to destabilize Jaffna

_source.content:
The former President Mahinda Rajapaksa was scheduled to address the 8th parliament today but he did participate in the debate.
He was scheduled to speak in parliament for the first time after his election to the legislature in the last general election.
The adjourning debate on the US resolution presented to UNHRC on Sri Lanka, Udalagama and Paranagama Commission reports was held in parliament for the second day today.
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa was scheduled 4th in the list to speak on the debate today. 
However MP Dallas Alahapperuma, during his speech quoted Minister Sarath Amunugama as saying that the former president would not participate in the debate.
Meanwhile, Deputy Minister Ajith P Perera said that former president Mahinda Rajapaksa did not turn out to parliament today as he has reached the same stance to that of the government.
He said therefore the former president did not turn out to parliament today to participate in the debate on the UNHRC resolution for Sri Lanka.
Meanwhile, The JVP leader and Chief Whip of the Opposition Anura Kumara Dissanayake told in parliament today that he has no confidence in the judiciary system of Sri Lanka.

He stated this while participating in the parliament adjourning debate of the second day.

hits._id: President calls for explanation regarding IGP’s phone call

President Maithripala Sirisena, explaining the incident following a question raised by Joint Opposition MP Wimalaweera Dissanayake, said that the IGP’s behavior was wrong and he will call for an explanation regarding the incident.

hits._id: Special committee to streamline SL Customs

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena said he will appoint a special committee to submit recommendations to provide solutions to issues pertaining to the Sri Lanka Customs Department and to streamline its work.
Meeting with Trade Union representatives of the Sri Lanka Customs Department, the President promised to provide possible solutions to issues.
The Trade Union representatives told the President regarding their difficulties. The President gave instructions to the officials to submit a report in this regard.
He further said that the aim of the Government is to increase its capacity as a profit making government institution while providing solutions.

President Maithripala Sirisena disclosed the contents of the report of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry that probed the Central Bank bond scam yesterday (Jan.03).

hits._id: 15 public enterprises incur 110 billion rupee loss

_source.content: Reports prepared by the Committee on Public Enterprises following its investigation on 15 public enterprises were presented to parliament today. The reports were presented by COPE chairman and JVP M,P Sunil Handunnetti. The report divulged that the total loss incurred by public enterprises has accumulated to more than 110 billion rupees. Meanwhile, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe informed parliament today that the government expects to import 100 metric tons of rice in the next few weeks. The Premier revealed these details following MP C.B.  Rathnayake’s statement, that the benefits of tax reduction have not been passed on to the consumer.

hits._id: Ready for a discussion; report for duty Health Minister request from nurses who are engaged in the strike : Video

_source.content: Health Minister Maithripala Sirisena requests the nurses who are engaged in the strike to report for duty.The minister expressed these views participating at a media briefing held in Colombo today.About 650 hospitals have ceased to function following the island wide trade union action by the Nursing professionals Associations.The trade union action commenced today at 7am after the discussions held with the Health Minister concerning the Midwifery training failed yesterday.Government Service United Nurses Association, All Island Nurses Association and the Government Nursing Officers Association have joined the Trade union action.Government Nursing officers association chairman Saman Ratnapriya told our news team that they will continue the trade union action if they fail to provide a solution to the issue.Nurses’ trade unions directly accuse the Government medical officers association for the issue that has cropped up.However the media spokesperson of the GMOA Dr. Naveen De Soysa states that the trade union action initiated by nurses trade unions is a failure.Health Minister Maithripala Sirisena addressing the media briefing this morning requested from the trade unions to call off the strike and to resolve the issue through discussions.

hits._id: President holds bilateral talks with Indian Prime Minister

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena met Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the BRICS Outreach Summit in Goa, India this morning. The President is attending the event upon a special invitation extended by the Indian Prime Minister. BRICS is an international relations conference attended by the heads of state or heads of government of the five member states Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa. According to the President’s Media Unit, President Sirisena is also expected to hold bilateral discussions with several Heads of State on the sidelines of the BIMSTEC summit.

hits._id: "I want a national government" - PM

_source.content: Attending a ceremony held at Colombo Royal College today, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe stated that he will turn the entire parliament into a government following the next election.He also said that this will be implemented by following the example of the mechanism used by the Lichchavi Kings.The Prime Minister also expressed his views about former President J.R. Jayawardena who was also a Royalist, describing how he survived impediments of his political journey.

hits._id: Opposition leader to fight for 17th amendment

_source.content:
Opposition leader Ranil Wickramasinghe states that independent commissions should be established and the 17th amendment should be initiated expediently.
 
Wickramasinghe, speaking at a meeting held at the Jayawardena Center expressed that this should take place before all amendments.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
However, various opinions are being expressed in society regarding the 13th amendment.
 
Speaking to the media yesterday in Kandy, Minister of National Languages and Social Integration Wasudewa Nanayakkara stated that the forces against it are not strong forces.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
Speaking at a meeting held in Kandy, UNP General Secretary Parliamentarian Thissa Attanayaka stated that the government is avoiding the issues faced by the public by speaking about the 13th amendment.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
The JVP, who has constantly opposed the provincial council system, is preparing to present a set of proposals aimed at safeguarding the rights of the Tamils in the North.
 
Upon inquiry by our news team, JVP Parliamentarian Anura Kumara Dissanayaka expressed the following views.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
However, speaking at a meeting held in Matara, Minister Dallas Alahapperuma states that the 13th amendment was put in place due to being intimidated by Prabakaran.

hits._id: Joint Opposition walks away from Parliament which was adjourned twice

_source.content:
Parliament was adjourned twice yesterday after heated arguments erupted between ruling MPs and their opposition counterparts.

MP Namal Rajapaksa expressed his views about CCTV footage during his address to parliament, and subsequently MP Mujibar Rahuman, in his address, referred to late ruggerite Wasim Thajudeen.

Certain statements by MP Rahuman dragged some opposition MPs in to a heated argument.

Later Opposition MPs urged Mujibar Rahuman to withdraw certain words he used during his speech.

As the situation did not return to normal, the house was adjourned for the second time.

Parliament recommended after one and half hours following the Speaker’s decision to remove certain comments made on Thajudeen’s murder from the hanzard.

However, MP’s representing the Joint Opposition walked away in protest, without participating on the budget debate pertaining to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

hits._id: Reforms to Budget 2015 today

_source.content: The interim budget is scheduled to be presented in the parliament today in order to bring about economic relief to the masses.Leader of the house minister Lakshman Kiriella said that the proposed interim budget would be presented in a form of a statement by the finance minister.The Finance Minister also expects to present a description about the current economy of the country.He also said a parliament debate on the Interim Budget would be held on February 5th and 6th.Several relief measures to the masses have been promised under the 100 day program presented by President Maithreepala Sirisena as a candidate of the recently concluded Presidential election.The waiving of import duty to reduce prices of 10 essential goods is one major step mentioned in the 100 day program. To double the Samurdhi benefit, 10 thousand salary increment to state workers and to provide interim allowance of 3500 rupees to retired persons until their salary anomalies corrected are major among the reliefs.In addition, the 100 day program has promised senior citizens to increase their fixed deposit interest rate up to 15% for the first million rupees.At the same time, the current monthly allowance given to senior citizens with abject poverty would be increased by 1500 rupees.

hits._id: Expenditure heads of 17 Ministries in parliament

_source.content:
Parliament Special Committee which was appointed to assess selected Ministries audit, submitted its report to the parliament today.
The report was submitted by the committee’s president minister Mahinda Samarasinghe.
The minister stated that 17 ministries were assessed by the special committee. He also stated that ministers were able to discuss cordially with the ministry officials regarding future work plans.

hits._id: Concessions to the public within a democratic structure - President

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena chaired a special progress review meeting at the Presidential Secretariat yesterday.The meeting was held to review the progress on the implementation of the government's 100-Days Programme and resource allocation and to receive the feedback from the senior government officials.Addressing the meeting, the President said the 100-day programme is not a policy of merely a political front but a national policy and the main objective of the programme is to grant relief to the people within a democratic frame work.Meanwhile, President Maithripala Sirisena said the government is looking forward to the assistance of World Bank for the selected development projects carried out by it, when World Bank Vice President for the South Asia Region Anette Dixon called on him yesterday.Responding immediately to the President's request, the World Bank Vice President expressed the global lending agency's readiness to provide financial assistance required by Sri Lanka.She commended the new government's efforts to strengthen democratic institutions and speed up development.President Sirisena thanked the World Bank for its assistance to Sri Lanka and emphasized the importance of Sri Lanka receiving the cooperation of the international community towards Sri Lanka as a middle income country in its efforts to elevate living standards of the people.

hits._id: Imported big onions to be taxed 100%

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has advised the Finance Ministry to impose a 100% tax on imported big onions.The President has given this directive, considering the problems faced by local big onion farmers.
The local farmers have been struggling to sell their produce due to cheap imports.

hits._id: Prime Minister arrives in island

_source.content: Prime minister Ranil Wickramasinghe arrived in the island in the morning concluding the China tour.The premier arrived in UL-142 airplane of Sri Lankan Airlines at about 5.30am today, according to our correspondent.

hits._id: Prime Minister hopeful of 3rd Line of Leadership

_source.content:
United National Party Leader, Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe stated that their Party needs a 3rd Line of Leadership.
The Prime Minister expressed these views addressing a group of party representatives in Matara yesterday.

hits._id: China optimistic about Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasingha’s visit

_source.content:
The Foreign Ministry of China announced today that Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe will pay an official visit to China from April 6th to 9th at the invitation of Chinese Prime minister Li Keqang of the State Council.
Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Hong Lei said at the regular press briefing yesterday, that during Prime Minister Wickremesinghe's visit, Chinese leaders will meet and hold talks with him.
The Spokesperson said the bilateral relations have been moving forward and the two sides will have an in-depth exchange of views on bilateral relations and issues of common interest.
Foreign Ministry Spokesperson said the Chinese Government commends the government of Sri Lanka for its positive policies towards China and would like to take the visit as an opportunity to consolidate traditional friendship, promote practical cooperation, and elevate China-Sri Lanka strategic cooperative partnership featuring sincerity, mutual assistance and long-lasting friendship to a new height.

hits._id: Under a Maithree regime construction work of Colombo port city will be halted: Ranil

_source.content: Opposition leader Ranil Wickramasinghe stated that they intend to suspend the construction work of the Colombo Port City under a Maithree regime.The Opposition leader stated this while speaking to a group of representatives of the Tourism sector this morning.He added that he intend to design a special tourism project aiming for 2025.One of the representatives present at the occasion inquired from the Opposition Leader if they intend to stop the construction work of the Colombo Port City under the Maithree regime.Meanwhile, a meeting was held between the Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena and University lecturers last evening.

hits._id: Ramazan is today

_source.content: Muslim devotees around the world celebrate the Ramazan Festival today, after ending a month long fast during the Islamic month of Ramazan, which began on May 27.  Sending a wish for the Ramazan Festival, President Maithripala Sirisena voices that mutual respect, equality, sacrifice and helping the poor, practiced by Muslims with devotion during Ramazan showed emancipation of humans depended on the feeling of others' welfare.  Moreover, the Premier Ranil Wickramasinghe in his message for Ramazan has mentioned that the physical and inner tranquility, restraint and the discipline that were developed in Muslims during the month of Ramazan through fasting would help build a better society.The fasting in the holy month of Ramazan is one of the five major obligations of Islam.The Premier, in his message further states that Muslims help build fraternity, equality and coexistence throughout this month by being sensitive to the sufferings and feelings of their brethren. Virtues developed by Muslims during the holy month of Ramazan help them to live a virtuous life throughout their life.

hits._id: UNP Ministers Hold A Special Meeting With Prime Minister

_source.content:
The ministers, state ministers and deputy ministers who represent UNP in the government engaged in a special meeting with Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe this afternoon.
A senior minister told our news team that special attention was drawn to the financial position of the government during the meeting.
The Prime Minister has enlightened the participants about the government’s future economic strategies.
In addition, another special meeting is scheduled to be held under the patronage of the Prime Minister at Temple trees this evening.
It is reported that all the members elected to parliament from the United National Front have been invited to this meeting scheduled to be held this evening.

hits._id: Hospital functions crippled due to GMOA strike

_source.content:
Hundreds of patients seeking treatment at government hospitals were disappointed this morning (Jan. 30) due to the strike launched by the Government Medical Officers’ Association.
 
Clinical and OPD services came to a standstill at many of the government hospitals.
 
The GMOA launched the token strike demanding that solutions be given to 10 issues including the abolition of SAITM.
 
However, Director of the Colombo National Hospital, Dr. W. K. Wickramasinghe told ‘Hiru News’ that steps would be taken to ensure that the emergency services were fully operational and that scheduled surgeries would take place without delay.

hits._id: Update : President empowered to appoint Opposition Leader and Ministerial Portfolios for SLFP: Mahinda, Susil, Anura Yapa absent at meeting

_source.content:
The SLFP Central Working Committee has delegated its powers to President Maithreepala Sirisena to take a final decision on Ministerial portfolios of the national government and the post of Opposition Leader.The SLFP central working committee met under the patronage of President Maithreepala Sirisena at his official residence last afternoon.Former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga was also present in the meeting.However, Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa and MP’s Susil Premajayanth and Anura Priyadharshana Yapa were absent at the meeting.Speaking after the discussion SLFP General Secretary Duminda Dissanayake stated that 3 committees were appointed to look in to the National government, rebuilding the party and party anniversary.The SLFP General Secretary also stated that there was no issue with allocating Ministerial portfolios.Meanwhile, S. B. Dissanayake speaking after the meeting stated that the President was empowered to decide on the Post of Opposition Leader and Ministerial portfolios.Update : Saturday, 29 August 2015 - 8:00-------------------------------------------------------------
SLFP central working committee delegates power to the President to decide on Ministerial portfolios and post of opposition leaderThe SLFP Central Working Committee has delegated its powers to President Maithripala Sirisena to take a final decision on ministerial portfolios of the national government and the post of Opposition Leader.The SLFP Central Working Committee met under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena at his official residence this afternoon.Our correspondent stated that former president Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga was also present during the meeting.Another member C.B. Rathnayake said that a decision was taken to appoint a committee for restructuring the SLFP.Meanwhile, two petitions filed against General Secretaries of the UPFA and the SLFP, Susil Premajayantha and Anura Priyadarshana Yapa were withdrawn today.The two petitions had been filed in the Colombo District court by Professor Vishwa Warnapala and Duminda Dissanayake after they were appointed to the two positions respectively.The petitions had requested the court to prevent both Premajayantha and Dissanayake not to obstruct the duties of the new General Secretaries.Meanwhile, Susil Premajayantha who functioned as the UPFA General Secretary in the past resigned from the position. Attorney-at-law appearing on behalf of the petitioners told our news team that the two petitions were withdrawn after Anura Priyadarshana Yapa announced that he would not intervene in the new SLFP General Secretary’s affairs.

hits._id: PM Modi arrives

_source.content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Sri Lanka this dawn.Indian Prime Minister Modi who came to Sri Lanka on a two-day official visit is the first Indian Prime Minister to visit Sri Lanka since 1987.While the special plane carrying the Indian Prime Minister touched down at the Katunayake Bandaranaike International Airport at about 5.20 a.m. today, he was welcomed by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.While officials of the Indian High Commission in Sri Lanka and a large number of Ministers and MPs had arrived at the Airport, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe introduced them to Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Prime Minister Modi will hold talks with President Maithripala Sirisena and his delegation, followed by an exchange or signing of agreements and press statements by the Prime Minister and the President.Prime Minister Modi will also visit the Maha Bodhi Society with which India has longstanding connections.Prime Minister Modi will be hosted for a lunch by Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe.The lunch is followed by a meeting with the Prime Minister.The Indian Premier is scheduled to deliver an address to the Parliament, a rare honor accorded to visiting Heads of Government and Heads of State.He will then visit the Indian Peace Keeping Force (IPKF) Memorial, and pay homage to the IPKF soldiers who sacrificed their lives to ensure the integrity of Sri Lanka.The Prime Minister will meet Opposition Leader Nimal Siripala de Silva and former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga.President Sirisena will host a dinner banquet in honor of the visiting Indian Prime Minister tonight.On the second day of his visit, Prime Minister Modi will fly first to Anuradhapura where he would see the Sri Maha Bodhi tree and visits the historic city.After visiting Anuradhapura, the Prime Minister will go to Thalaimannar where he will inaugurate the Thalaimannar pier railway station and flag off a train, opening the Thalaimannar-Madhu segment of the Thalaimannar - Medawachchiya Railway line reconstructed with Indian funds.

hits._id: All arrangements in place to welcome PM Ranil Wickramasinghe in India

_source.content:
All arrangements are in place by now to welcome Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe and his delegation who are scheduled to arrive in India today.
The Prime Minister and the delegation are scheduled to arrive in Indira Gandhi International Airport in New Delhi at 5.45 this afternoon. 
Our correspondent stated that Indian authorities have taken steps to hold a special welcome ceremony for the visiting premier.
Premier Wickramasinghe is visiting India on an invitation by his Indian counterpart Narendra Modi.
Meanwhile, the prime minister’s office stated that Prime Minister Wickramasinghe is scheduled to hold bilateral discussions with several leaders including Indian Premier Narendra Modi, President Pranab Mukerjee and Foreign Minister Sushma Swaraj.

hits._id: Decisions will not be taken merely to protect the government; says President-Video

_source.content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa stressed that the government has no necessity to hide the development process of the country.He said the government has perfectly put forward the development process to the country.While addressing the releasing ceremony of 2013 Annual Report of the Ministry of Finance in Colombo today, President stated that the government has made considerable changes in education and will not curtail free education.The President also emphasized that decisions are not taken with mere intention of protecting the government or power.He further stated that there have been protests against building the Norochcholai and Upper Kotmale Power plants, but the government acted with no consideration to retain the votes or safeguard the government.Speaking further at the ceremony the President asked the Ministerial Secretaries not to issue circulars arbitrarily and create inconveniences to the people.

hits._id: There is no change in the name ‘Samurdhi’- SB

_source.content:
No alterations will be made to the name ‘Samurdhi’, Minister of social services S.B. Dissanayake ensured.
He said during the budget debate in parliament yesterday.

hits._id: We give the fishing rod not the fish

_source.content: State Minister Eran Wickremaratne says the current Government will not take steps to deprive state employees of privileges offered by the Government.The State Minister made this statement while participating in the debate on the second reading of the budget yesterday.

hits._id: Deputy Minister Arundika removed

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena has removed Deputy Minister of Tourism and Christian Religious Affairs, Arundika Fernando with immediate effect.The President's Media Unit announced this a short while ago.Last week, he was among the group of SLFP Ministers that had a discussion with the President over the prevailing political situation. He also said that they will act independently in Parliament.

hits._id: Prime Minister Leaves For India

_source.content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe has left the island this morning (12) on a private tour to India, the Prime Minister’s Office said upon query by Hiru news.
However, he is expected to return to the country this afternoon.

hits._id: Different Views on national Gov. - BBS

_source.content: Various parties from the government as well as the opposition have been expressing different views about forming a national government before the 100 day plan is completed.The UNP and the JVP stressed that the government should be dissolved on April 23rd as promised to the people during the presidential election.They also stated that a new parliament should be formed according to the majority of the MPs elected in a future general election.At the same time, our news team enquired the views of certain political parties as they insist that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa should be fielded as Prime Ministerial candidate in the forthcoming general election.The NFF media spokesman Mohammad Musammil said that SLFP MPs who cannot live without ministerial positions, need an urgent national government.The Democratic Leftwing Front Leader Wasudeva Nanayakkara said that he is against a national government before or after a general election.The BBS General Secretary Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera said that the government should first explain what it expects from a national government.

hits._id: Country needs a true human being, not a king; says President addressing the Nation.

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena invited all the political parties representing parliament to join hands to form an All Party government.The President addressed the nation from the Paththirippuwa of the Sri Dalada Maligawa in Kandy.Addressing the nation President Maithripala Sirisena stated that as promised through the election manifesto, powers vested in the executive presidency will be transferred to the cabinet and the Parliament.He also stated that corruption and malpractices committed while initiating development activities will be eradicated.He added that the country needs a true human being, not a king” and vowed to serve as a true worker to the people.          Pix by - President's Media Unit & BBC

hits._id: President wants to re-impose tax on beer

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has instructed Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake to reinstate the reduced tax on beer with less than 5% alcohol content.
The tax on low alcohol beer was reduced in the budget 2016 recently to avoid discrepancy of tax in the importation of beers.
The tax on imported beer was reduced to Rs 160 per litre, however the President has ordered that it be increased to Rs 190 per litre.
The President has given this instruction, paying attention on a possible increase in the consumption of low alcohol beer.

hits._id: Don't consider the requests of people's representatives as political interventions; President informs government institution heads.

_source.content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday directed the Ministry Secretaries that the requests of the public to the people’s representatives, including the Ministers and Heads of Government institutions should not be considered as political interference.The President has directed the Ministry Secretaries that they should act on these requests on priority basis.Secretary to the President Lalith Weeratunga has informed the secretaries of the President’s directives in writing.The Secretary to the President in his letter to the Ministry Secretaries has stated that the President has received information that officials are in the habit of considering the requests received to the Ministers, Deputy Ministers, Parliamentarians, people’s representatives, Ministry Secretaries, heads of departments and statutory bodies from the public as political interference.The President views that the public representatives have a responsibility and duty to direct the public requests received to the relevant Heads of Government institutions.The Ministry Secretaries and Heads of Departments and governments institutions are bound to promptly respond to such requests.Therefore, such requests should be given priority.

hits._id: T 20 world champions meets President: felicitation in Parliament today. : Video

_source.content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday congratulated the members of the Sri Lankan Cricket team who became 20-20 world champions.That was at Temple Trees.The team that proceeded from Katunayake arrived at Temple Trees and met President Mahinda Rajapaksa.  Meanwhile it was decided at the party heads meeting yesterday to invite the Sri Lankan Cricket team to parliament and felicitate them in parliament.Accordingly the Sri Lankan team will arrive in parliament at 5 p.m. today.Similarly during the debate held in parliament yesterday Government and Opposition MPs congratulated the Sri Lankan Cricket team.On this occasion Deputy Finance Minister Sarath Amunugama said that Sri Lankan Cricket had become a prestigious international brand name.During the debate MP Gamini Jayawickrema Perera speaking on behalf of the UNP congratulated the Sri Lankan Cricket team as follows.

hits._id: MEP meets to take a decision on defected MP

_source.content:
Mahajana Eksath Peramuna is planning to take a decision on Digamadulla MP Sriyani Wijewickrama, following her announcement that she would support President Maithripala Sirisena.
 
A party spokesperson said that the decision will be taken by the MEP Central Working Committee, which will meet this afternoon (11) to discuss the matter.
 
MP Sriyani Wijewickrama met with President Maithripala Sirisena at the President’s official residence in Colombo yesterday before making her announcement.
 
Meanwhile, political sources revealed that MP Wijewickrama defected after a clash with Joint Opposition MP Wimalaweera Dissanayake over the preparation of nominations for the forthcoming Local Government election.
 
When our news team contacted MP Wijewickrama, she said that she decided to defect, after she was continuously sidelined by the Joint Opposition.
 
MP Wimalaweera Dissanayake told us that MP Wijewickrama defected to get personal benefits.

hits._id: Shangri La - Colombo declared open

_source.content: The Shangri La Hotel complex built at Galle Face was declared opened by President Maithripala Sirisena today (16). Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and many other Ministers and MPs attended the event. The hotel is the 101st hotel in the chain of Shangri-La Hotels worldwide.Shangri La Colombo consists of 541 rooms including 10 two bedroom apartments, 31 one bedroom apartments, 34 suites and 1 presidential suite. So far Shangri La has hired 700 workers from Sri Lanka and will look to hire more.Meanwhile, distribution of scholarships for the children affected by the collapse of Meetotamulla garbage dump was also held today under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena.

hits._id: No request to postpone the election, Election Commission

_source.content:
Election Commission Chairman Mahinda Deshapriya says no request has been made seeking the upcoming Local Government election to be postponed.
 
The Election Commission Chief stressed this, in response to a query raised by journalists at a media briefing held yesterday (Jan. 28).
 
The journalists questioned whether there would be an issue for the election being held as a result of Parliament being convened on 8th of February.

hits._id: Sub Committee Report on Provincial Councils to the Constitutional Assembly

_source.content:
The report compiled by the Sub Committee appointed by the Constitution Assembly to look in to the relations between the Parliament and Provincial Councils was presented to Parliament today by the Prime Minister.
Meanwhile, Speaker Karu Jayasuriya presented the Draft Bill on the Code of Ethics for Parliamentarians and Changes to Standing Orders, to Parliament today.
The voting on the 3rd reading of the Budget 2017 will be held in Parliament today.
Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayaka presented the budget to Parliament on the 10th of last month while the second reading was approved with a majority of 107 votes.
Meanwhile, Parliamentarian Chamal Rajapaksa also drew the attention of the house towards the incident where security force personnel had intervened to disperse a group protesting at the Hambantota Port.

hits._id: Commonwealth Heads of Government meeting commences today

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena arrived in London last night in preparation to attend the 2018 Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting.
The President was accompanied by a 10-member delegation.
This year's meeting is themed 'Towards a common future' and will conclude on 21st of this month.
The President is scheduled to meet with UK Prime Minister Theresa May and several other Heads of State.
The President is scheduled to address the Commonwealth Business Forum on 18th.

hits._id: TNA faces bribery charges

_source.content:
Tamil National Alliance MP Mavai Senathirajah says that he will complain to the Election Commission with regard to the allegation that TNA MPs were bribed with Rs. 20 million each in return for voting in favour of the Budget.
 
MP Senadhirajah said that another faction of the TNA has made this allegation targeting the forthcoming Local Government election.
 
This allegation was first made by EPRLF member and TNA MP, Shivashakthi Aanandan at an election rally held in Vavuniya recently.
 
MP Anandan said excluding him, the other 15 TNA MPs were bribed with Rs. 20 million each by the Government.
 
He also said that the initial plan of the TNA was to vote against the Budget. He said, however, 15 MPs voted in favour of the Budget after allegedly accepting the bribe.
 
Responding to these allegations, TNA MP S. Sridharan challenged MP Anandan to prove his allegations.
 
However, MP, Shivashakthi Anandan said that despite the excuses by accused TNA MPs, the truth is already unearthed.

hits._id: Dilan Perera who resigned from the Ministerial portfolio gives a reminder to President

_source.content: SLFP Media Spokesman Dilan Perera said that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa lost his post, for not appointing then Health Minister and current president Maithripala Sirisena as his Prime Minister.MP Dilan Perera expressed these views during a media conference held at the Opposition Leader’s Office to announce the resignation of the 4 ministers from the government.Addressing the media, the MPs said that they resigned from their positions as they cannot work under the circumstances prevailing in the government.Dilan Perera held the post of State Minister of Housing and Samurdhi while Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena held the post of Minister of Parliamentary Affairs. C.B. Rathnayake was the Minister of Public and Democratic Administration while Pavithra Wanniarachchi was the State Minister of Environment.MP Mahinda Yapa Abeywardana said that it is an outrageous lie to call the current government, a national government.MP Pavithra Wanniarachchi said that she resigned from the post over an issue regarding policies. Expressing his views regarding the resignation, MP C.B. Rathnayake stated that they cannot continue to work, while being unable to fulfill the requirements of the people at the divisional level.

hits._id: "One philosophy of a religion should not suppress another religious philosophy" - MS

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says the government will ensure all religious ideologies of the country are protected.
Speaking at a function held in Negombo, President Sirisena said one philosophy of a religion should not suppress another religious philosophy.
The President during the event stated there is nothing more beneficial than great religious philosophies to heal the society that is failing due to the commercialization.
The President said it is the duty of every citizen to work towards the betterment of the society by utilizing one’s knowledge and experience.
The President said the public should not work for personal development alone.

hits._id: Statement from the Opposition Leader

_source.content:
Opposition Leader Ranil Wickramasinghe states that free education has been curtailed during the last several years.
 
The opposition leader made this statement while speaking at a election rally held in the Nikawaratiya – Kobeigane town this afternoon.

hits._id: Finance Minister says appropriation bill does not forecast Budget 2017

Addressing the media at the Finance Ministry today, Minister Karunanayake said that the forthcoming Budget will surprise the Opposition.

hits._id: Do not be misled by false propaganda; a request from Common Candidate Maithri

_source.content: Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena made a request from the public not to fall prey to false propaganda carried out by the government.Addressing an election rally held in Kesbewa yesterday he said that nobody could reverse the victory of the common opposition.Addressing the same rally, UNP Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe said the new government to be formed after January 8th would shoulder the responsibility of creating a society with people who hold rich wallets.

hits._id: President to meet with UN Secretary General, Commonwealth Secretary General and Pakistan’s PM

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena who is currently in New York to attend the United Nations General Assembly is scheduled to engage in few high profile bilateral discussions today.
Accordingly President Sirisena will meet with UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon, Commonwealth Secretary General Kamalesh Sharma and Pakistan’s Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif.
President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday met with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Switzerland’s President Simonetta Sommaruga and the Chairman of the International Red Cross.
During discussions, Indian Premier Narendra Modi said that he supported the quest for justice, but also respected Sri Lanka’s sovereignty.
He added that a way could be found for a consensus between the Sri Lankan Government and the UNHRC.
The Swiss President had also assured of its support to programmes initiated through a new constitution.
The President’s Media Unit stated that President Maithripala Sirisena had emphasized during these discussions that shortcomings of the past will be addressed.
Update : Saturday, 26 September 2015 - 18:34-------------------------------------------------------
President to meet UN Secretary General todayThe 70th Session of the United Nations General Assembly commenced yesterday at the UN Headquarters in New York.
Inaugurating the session for 2015, the summit on Sustainable Development was begun with the key note address by the Pope Francis.
UN Secretary General Ban Ki Moon, Presidents of the two host countries as well as representatives of civil societies will address the Summit on Sustainable Development – 2015 today.
The Summit on Sustainable Development – 2015 which commenced parallel to the 70th Session of the UNGA will be held till September 28th.
President Maithripala Sirisena will address this summit.
President Maithripala Sirisena is scheduled to meet UN Secretary General Ban Ki Moon today.

hits._id: Joint Opposition goes to Court against VAT amendment Draft Bill

_source.content:
A fundamental petition has been filed with the Supreme Court requesting an opportunity to pass the VAT Amendment Draft Bill by two third majority in parliament.
The Joint Opposition, in its petition stated that the VAT mechanism declared in the past budget is not included in this Draft Bill.
The petitioner states that this Amendment should also be passed by two third majority as the past budget was passed with the same majority.
Joint Opposition MP Mahinda Yapa Abeywardana expressed his views about the fundamental petition they filed yesterday.
The Supreme Court issued on July 11th an interim injunction over the VAT which came to effect from May 2nd. The decree was issued after considering five fundamental petitions filed against the increase in VAT.
The Supreme Court also informed that the interim injunction will be annulled soon after the parliament passes the VAT amendment Draft Bill.
Accordingly the second reading of the VAT amendment Draft Bill will be held on July 20th and a vote taking will also be conducted later that evening.

hits._id: Former health official attached to the Ministry of Health involved in drug purchase scam; Minister of Health foils effort

_source.content:
An effort taken by a former senior health official attached to the Ministry of Health to import a stock of pharmaceutical drugs to the country illegally violating government's purchase protocols has been thwarted by Minister of Health Maithreepala Sirisena.
The government decided to implement a policy to directly purchase pharmaceutical drugs peer to peer from other governments in order to mitigate discrepancies which arise when drugs are being imported via pharmaceutical companies.
During a recent tour to India Minister of Health Maithreepala Sirisena had met his Bangladeshi counterpart.
The Bangladeshi Minister of Health had subsequently notified Minister Sirisena that his government had already reached an agreement with the Sri Lankan government's representative in order to facilitate the purchase of drugs.
In reply Minister Maithreepala Sirisena had notified the Bangladeshi Minister of Health that no representative had been sent to Bangladesh in order to discuss pharmaceutical drug supplies.
Subsequent revelations had brought to light that a former top official attached to the Ministry of Health had represented the island in Bangladesh stating that he was to facilitate the purchase of pharmaceutical drugs.
If the effort was fruitful the errant official is expected to have raked in a huge commission on the rogue deal.

hits._id: New Government Makes Significant Progress – Brad Adams

_source.content:
Sri Lanka’s government has ended the pervasive culture of surveillance and censorship and embarked on reforms aimed to undo years of increasingly authoritarian rule, the Human Rights Watch (HRW) said yesterday (Wednesday 27) in its World Report 2016.
While it opened dialogues both domestically and abroad, the government still faces key concerns, including wartime accountability and prolonged detention without trial, it said. “Sri Lanka’s new government has begun to address some of the country’s chronic human rights problems, but much remains to be done,” said Brad Adams, HRW Asia director.
 “The pervasive culture of fear is largely gone and positive measures have been adopted, but the previous government’s disastrous restructuring of independent state institutions needs to be fully dismantled,” The government of President Maithripala Sirisena promptly initiated a series of constitutional reforms including establishing a constitutional council and restoring the independence of the judiciary, police and human rights commissions.

hits._id: President says it is unethical to use war heroes to get political mileage

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says if a certain political party uses war heroes to gain their political mileage, it is unethical.
 
The President made these remarks unveiling the ‘Wayamba Rana Abhiman’ War Heroes’ monument in Kurunegala, yesterday (May 11).
 
The new monument was established to replace the previous war heroes’ monument which was removed due to the Kurunegala- Dambulla Main Road Development Project.
 
This war memorial displays all the names of the war heroes of the North-Western Province who sacrificed their lives to protect the motherland.
 
The entire project has been completed at a cost of 27 million rupees by the Army’s Engineering Services Corps.
 
President Sirisena addressing the gathering further said that the present government has not work to undermine the war heroes and always tries to ensure their rights are protected considering their services to the nation.
 
The President while rejecting the accusations against the government regarding the war heroes, said that all these statements are meant to make the government uncomfortable.
 
Even though the government is accused of soldier victimization the real soldier victimization occurred during the past régime, the President said.

hits._id: Christians celebrate birth of Jesus Christ

_source.content:
The Archbishop of Colombo, His Eminence Malcolm Cardinal Ranjith led last night's Christmas mass which was held at the church of Saint Peter and Paul on the eve of Christmas last night (24).
 
Delivering his Christmas message, the Archbishop of Colombo offered his best wishes of peace for the people in Sri Lanka as well as in the world.
 
President Maithripala Sirisena extended his warmest greetings to all the Christians on this Christmas day.
 
Christmas has often been depicted as a reunion of powerful divinity and fragile humanity.
 
The President, in his Christmas day message said that the glorious reunion occurred with the coming of Jesus Christ, who instilled the values of love, sacrifice, and justice in the society, marking a significant victory for humanity.
 
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said in a Christmas message that Christians in Sri Lanka and all over the world rejoice at Christmas which celebrates the birth of Jesus Christ, the Prince of Peace.
 
The message adds that the spirit of Christmas is shared universally and is a time to spread goodwill, love, and joy that the birth of Christ brings.
                     Photos - Ranjith Rajapaksha - Hatton

hits._id: President reiterates the importance of a social service on behalf of children

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena stated in his Universal Children's Day message that the government is committed to improve child nutrition and childcare.
He stated that we are universally bound to provide proper nutrition and healthcare to all children, ensure their right to education and create a space for them to be born and brought up in a safe environment.
However, as a nation, we cannot be satisfied about the ensuring of all these needs of our children.
Sri Lanka has to overcome the challenges in the areas of child nutrition, education, child abuse and violence against children.
President Maithripala Sirisena stated in a message to mark the International Day of Older Persons that It is our responsibility to ensure the freedom and protection and the esteem of the elderly people,
Issuing a message Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said children are our greatest asset; as a nation, the responsibility is ours to ensure the creation of an environment in which children can grow up to become confident, caring adults, conscious of their social responsibilities.
Today is not only the day the world celebrates children but also the day we remember our elders; The World Elders Day also falls today.
The Premier said “as a community, we have a social obligation to the children and to the elders among us to assure their well-being while attending to their needs”.

hits._id: Govt. To Protect Media Freedom - Media Minister

_source.content:
Sri Lanka has improved from its 165th to 141st in the world media freedom index. The Government would further improve on this positive development, Minister of Parliamentary Reforms and Mass Media and Co-Cabinet Spokesman Gayantha Karunathilaka said.
Addressing the weekly Cabinet press briefing held at the Government Information Department Auditorium yesterday (May 11), he said that under good governance practiced by this government, Sri Lanka was able to move forward by passing around 20 countries in the world media freedom index.
Health Minister and Co-Cabinet Spokesman Dr. Rajitha Senaratne said that during the past, the former President himself called newspaper editors and threatened them to publish or avoid publishing certain things, but it does not happen at present. Current President Maithripala Sirisena had cut down on his own powers.

hits._id: Hiru Prior to the Budget 2017- A platform for your voices to be heard

_source.content:
With just ten days remaining for the 2017 budget, we reflect on how budget report be formulated to predict the future of Sri Lanka’s economy.
Thus, the special budgetary programme ‘Hiru Prior to the Budget 2017’ will be brought to you from today.
Last year we came to you from Jaffna to Vavuniya through Anuradhapura to get your opinion about then budget.
This year we are coming to you to push for a populist budget on 20th this month.
You can also submit your proposals on www.hirunews.lk or social media sites. We will submit your thoughts to the Ministry of Finance daily.
So in the run-up to the budget we present to you ‘Hiru Prior to the Budget 2017’.

hits._id: SL Gifts Second 'Jumbo' To New Zealand

_source.content:
The Sri Lankan Government will gift a second elephant to the New Zealand and an agreement in this regard was signed yesterday (24) in the presence of President Maithripala Sirisena and visiting New Zealand Prime Minister John Key in Colombo.
President Maithripala Sirisena presented a deed of ownership for five-year-old "Nandi" during a red-carpet welcome in Colombo for Key, who arrived for a two-day official visit.
Prime Minister Key welcomed the signing of an agreement between Auckland Zoo and the Sri Lankan Government, which will see the zoo, gifted a second elephant, a statement from the office of the New Zealand Prime Minister said.
“New Zealand’s weather seems to agree with Sri Lankan elephants with the first, Anjalee, putting on 700 kilograms in her first year in Auckland,” Key said.
“The second elephant will prove a great draw-card for tourists and locals alike. This is another example of the close and growing relationship between our countries and I thank the Sri Lankan Government for entrusting us with her,” he stated.
In return Auckland Zoo will help with Sri Lanka’s management of its own elephant population, as well as help train Sri Lankan wildlife workers.
Sri Lanka has a long history of giving elephants as presents, with China gifted three over the years, and two each for Japan, South Korea, the Czech Republic and the United States.

hits._id: Journey is slow but never take a step back - President

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena said that although his journey for the future of the country is slow, it would never be reversed.

The President stated this while addressing the 64th anniversary commemoration of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party held at Rajarata Navodya sports ground at Kanduruwela in Polonnaruwa this afternoon.
 
The anniversary held under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena were participated by the Maha Sangha, leaders of other religious denominations, former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, party ministers and MPs, party senior members, electoral organizers and party members.
  
While delivering the welcome address, party General Secretary Duminda Dissanayake said that former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga was not present as she was out of the country.

Later, SLFP General Secretary handed over a SLFP publication – Siri Laka newspaper and the 64th anniversary souvenir to President Maithripala Sirisena.

The key note address of the 64th anniversary was delivered by the professor of the Sinhala unit of Colombo University Dr. Sarath Wijesuriya.

During his speech, Professor Wijesuriya highlighted two occasions where Sri Lanka Freedom Party committed mistakes.

Addressing the gathering, President Maithripala Sirisena stated despite changes that have taken place in politics within a year, it is a positive sign for all party members to throng around one platform.

Expressing his views the president reiterated that political enmity should be eradicated for the benefit of the country.
-------------------Update-------------------------------------Current President and the former get intimate – former lady President not yet reportedThe 64th SLFP anniversary commemoration is currently taking place at Rajarata Navodaya Stadium in Kanduruwela, Polonnaruwa, under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena.
This is the first Anniversary commemoration taking place in the party after the appointment of Maithripala Sirisena as Leader of SLFP as well as President. 
Many veterans in the party including the former President MP Mahinda Rajapaksa and former Prime Minister Dimu Jayaratne have also participated in the commemoration ceremony.
However it is reported that former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga is still notably absent.
 Former President MP Mahinda Rajapaksa has also participated in the commemoration ceremony.
Our correspondent stated that, Maha Sangha, priests of other religious groups, seniors of the party, Ministers and MPs, organizers, party members and a large number of people have attended the commemoration.          (Pix by Roshan Thushara))

hits._id: New Zealand PM John Key to visit Sri Lanka on 24th

_source.content:
New Zealand Prime Minister John Key will make the second official visit to Sri Lanka as the Prime Minister, on Wednesday the 24th, after the Commonwealth Heads of Government meeting in 2013.
The main purpose of this visit taking place during 24th to 26th February is to highlight the growing commercial and political ties between the two countries.
The New Zealand Premier will meet with Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena , Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and a number of local businesspeople to promote New Zealand’s interests in the Island nation.
John Key will also lead a business delegation to focus on the significant opportunities to diversify trade between New Zealand and Sri Lanka, which stood at 324 million dolllars in 2015.The New Zealand Prime Minister is also scheduled to visit the Temple of Tooth and Peradeniya Botanical Garden during his visit to Sri Lanka.

hits._id: Ex-PM Ratnasiri Wickremanayake passes away

_source.content: Former Prime Minister Rathnasiri Wickremanayake passed away this noon at a private hospital in Colombo.He was 83 years old at the time of his demise.Former Premier Wickremanayake functioned as a presidential advisor at the time of his death.He was educated at Millewa Primary School, Dharmapala Vidyalaya  Pannipitiya, Hartley College- Point Pedro and Ananda College- Colombo.Subsequently, he studied to become a Barrister of Law in the United Kingdom.He was elected to parliament in 1960 from Horana under the Lanka Sama Samaja Party.He joined the SLFP in 1962 and functioned as the party general secretary in 1978.He was appointed Prime Minister from 2000 to 2001 and from 2005 to 2010 and functioned in the Public Administration, Home Affairs, Buddha Sasana and Plantation ministry portfolios.The remains of former Prime Minister Rathnasiri Wickremanayaka will be placed at the parliament from 10.30am to 11.30am tomorrow for the parliamentarians to pay their last respects.Former president Mahinda Rajapaksa who visited the private hospital where former Prime Minister Wickremanayake had received treatment said that the death of late Wickremanayake was a great loss to the country and the nation.In addition, President Maithripala Sirisena has directed the relevant authorities to conduct the funeral of late Rathnasiri Wickremanayake with full state patronage.Meanwhile, MP Vidura Wickremanayake stated that the final rites of late Rathnasiri Wickremanayake will be held at Horana in the afternoon of December 31st.

hits._id: Seating in Parliament - Mahinda and Sambandan in adjoining seats

_source.content:
The Deputy Secretary General of Parliament Neel Iddawala says it has been decided to arrange the seating in Parliament according to the seniority. 
He said several leaders of different political parties of the government as well as the Opposition would be offered seating in the front. 
The Parliament is to meet today for the first time after the Cabinet was sworn in.
However the President, the Prime Minister, the Opposition Leader, the Leader of the House, the Chief Government Whip, the Deputy Speaker and the Chairman of Committees would be customarily offered the standard seating in Parliament.
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa would also function as an MP in new Parliament, and he has been offered the 9th seat of the first row.
It is the seat next to Opposition Leader R. Sampandan. 
Former Speaker Chamal Rajapaksa has been offered the 10th seat.
Chief Opposition Whips and JVP leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake has been offered 4th seat of the first row.
Political party leaders Wimal Weerawansa, Dinesh Gunawardana and Wasudeva Nanayakkara, though their parties are not among the 6 recognized parties, have been offered seating in the first row according to their seniority.

The remains of former Prime Minister Ratnasiri Wickremanayake were brought from a private funeral parlor to parliament complex this morning.

The statement was made whilst issuing a message of condolence following the passing of the former Prime Minister Ratnasiri Wickremanayake.
The President identified him as a leader, who as a man of strong principles, offered his fullest dedication towards the work of the SLFP whenever the party encountered challenges.
Former Prime Minister Ratnasiri Wickremanayake passed away yesterday at a private hospital in Colombo.
He was 83 years old at the time of passing.
The Former Premier was functioning as a presidential advisor at the time of his passing.
The remains of the former Prime Minister will be placed at the parliament from 10.30am to 11.30amtoday for the parliamentarians to pay their last respects.

hits._id: Impeachment report approved in parliament with a majority of 106 votes - 155 votes for and 49 votes against the report

_source.content:
The impeachment report against the Chief Justice has been approved in parliament by a majority of 106 Votes.

155 voted in favour of the motion, while 49 voted against it.

Thissa Witharana, Chandrasiri Gajadheera, DEW Gunasekara, Rajeev Wijesinghe of the ruling party were not present in parliament at the time of the vote.

Wasudewa Nanayakkara and Y G Padmasiri had voted in favour of the impeachment motion while J Sri Ranga had voted against.

The UNP and TNA MPs also voted against the motion.

The MPs of the Democratic National Alliance were not present in the parliament and TNA MP R. Sambandan and UNP MPs Thalatha Athukorala and Vijayakala Maheshwaran were also not present at the time of the vote.

According to our parliamentary correspondent UNP MP Lakshman Kiriella had raised concerns stating that the day’s parliamentary agenda had not contained in it an allocation for a ballot.

Accordingly a debate in this regard was held in parliament.


			   
			   		
	
			   

However speaker Chamal Rajapaksha stated that he would require 10 minutes to decide whether or not to hold a ballot and therefore, suspended parliamentary activities for 10 minutes.


			   
			   		
	
			   

Following the ballot the speaker Chamal Rajapaksha stated the results of the ballot in the following manner.

hits._id: UN expects assurance for a reliable internal investigation

_source.content:
The United Nations says that their aim is to ensure the conduct of a proper investigation with regard to the incidents related to the civil war in Sri Lanka.
Farhan Haq, the spokesperson of the UN Secretary General Ban Ki Moon, stated this while addressing a media briefing held at the UN Headquarters based in New York.
He added the UN would encourage Sri Lanka to specifically inquire into true accounts of the incidents that took place during the last phase of the civil war.
The Government - under the leadership of President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe - is currently taking efforts to hold the relevant investigations.
Expressing his views further, the Spokesperson of the UN Secretary General stated that it is the objective of the UN to observe these investigations being conducted with a true motive and extend their support and encouragement for the process.

hits._id: President begins bilateral discussions with Thai Prime Minister

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena who is on a four day state visit to Thailand met the Prime Minister of Thailand General Prayut Chan-o-cha at the official residence of the Prime Minister today.The President who arrived at the official residence of the Thailand Prime Minister was warmly welcomed by the Prime Minister Chan-o-cha.The welcome ceremony included a Guard of Honor.After the welcome ceremony, the two leaders commenced bilateral talks.The discussions focused on the fields of politics and culture of the two countries.President Sirisena stated that a government of good governance which gives priority to democracy has now been established in Sri Lanka.He said the aim of the new government is to take the concept of consensual politics forward.Prime Minister Chan-o-cha said the program of the new government of Sri Lanka is exemplary to the entire world.President Sirisena made a special request to the Prime Minister of Thailand to support Sri Lanka in technological and research work.Prime Minister Chan-o-cha stated Thailand investors are keen to invest in Sri Lanka in the fields of mineral oil, fishing and health.He added that a group of investors will come to Sri Lanka in the near future to explore possibilities for investment.

hits._id: SL determined to achieve Sustainable Development Goals - President

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena said Sri Lanka will act with determination as a pioneer of eco-sensitive civilization that is emerging in the 21st century to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals and targets adopted by the United Nations. 
President assured that the Government of Sri Lanka fully supports the Post-2015 Sustainable Development Agenda and the Sustainable Development Goals and targets that have been adopted by the Assembly.
Addressing the UNGA Session on Sustainable Development in New York yesterday, President Sirisena said sustainable development encapsulates the equilibrium between social and economic development and environmental protection.
President Sirisena assured the world leaders that the Government of Sri Lanka anticipates achieving these goals fully by 2030.
Parallel to this, while emphasizing on the protection of natural resources, President said the government will also formulate a state policy on resource consumption based on the sustainable capacity of the environment.
President said this indicates that even many centuries ago, our ancestors possessed the wisdom and awareness of the Sustainable Development Triangle.
As inheritors of this traditional knowledge and influenced by their ancient wisdom which will be adapted to meet the requirements of the modern era, Sri Lanka stands prepared to meet challenges successfully and march forward gloriously in the 21st century.

hits._id: Sri Lanka to launch a new economic plan

_source.content:
New economic plan from next week"National Economic Council has decided to introduce a new economic plan for the country next week, which will bring in speedy economic management changes.
 
The decision was reached when the National Economic Council met at the Presidential Secretariat.
 
President Maithripala Sirisena chaired the meeting.
 
The President's Media Division said that the NEC discussed short, medium and long-term strategies that are needed to transform the country's economy.
 
President Maithripala Sirisena established the National Economic Council last year and it met for the 8th occasion today.
 
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and Ministers Sarath Amunugama, Nimal Siripala de Silva, Mangala Samaraweera, W. D. J. Seneviratne, Sajith Premadasa, Rauff Hakeem, Malik Samarawickrema, Faizer Mustapha and Navin Dissanayake attended the discussion.
