hits._id: Prime Minister Leaves for Seoul

_source.content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe leaves Sri Lanka today to take part in Rotary International Summit held in Seoul, South Korea.
The Premier is scheduled to deliver a special speech addressing over 50,000 members of Rotary International from 160 countries.
The conference will start tomorrow and go until 01st of June.

hits._id: All measures taken with parliamentary consent - PM

_source.content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe says that all measures taken by the government will be in accordance with the parliament’s consent.  He stated this while engaging in an inspection tour for planning Colombo City this evening.Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe toured several streets around Colombo Fort and observed the condition of the buildings and constructions in the area.Later addressing the media, the Prime Minister stated that it is compulsory to obtain parliament’s consent to increase number of ministers under the national government.Accordingly, he stated that the relevant proposal will be presented to parliament on the 3rd of September.Expressing his views regarding the inspection tour in Colombo city, the Prime Minister stated that he has instructed to stop all constructions that would harm the city’s ancient structures.

hits._id: Rs. 100 Million allocated for Salawa

_source.content:
The Treasury has allocated a sum of Rs. 100 million that will be paid as a temporary compensation to the property owners affected following the explosion at Salawa army base in Kosgama.
Secretary to the Finance Ministry Doctor H.S. Samaratunga noted that the relevant funds have been handed over to the Disaster Management Ministry.
Meanwhile, 76 Government Assessors commenced valuations of the damaged houses yesterday.
After the final report is compiled, compensation is expected to be paid with effect from Tuesday (14).
Colombo District Secretary Sunil Kannangara stated that an allowance of Rs. 50,000 is to be provided for a period of three months to the families affected.
The Kosgama Government Hospital which was damaged by the recent explosion at the Salawa Army Camp will be handed over to health authorities tomorrow following repairs.
Also schools in the area which were temporary closed will be reopened tomorrow.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe is expected to once again visit Kosgama this afternoon.

hits._id: Cabinet to be reshuffled today?

_source.content:
Cabinet to be reshuffled today?"Sources say that the much anticipated Cabinet reshuffle would take place today (Feb. 23).
 
Meanwhile, media reports say that President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe have already discussed and finalized necessary changes.
 
The sources said that a number of Ministries hold by United National Party would be reshuffled this time.
 
Portfolios of Law and Order and Higher Education are among the Ministries to be reshuffled, the source said.

hits._id: Special commission to investigate Golden Key transactions

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena says a special commission led by a retired judge would be appointed to look into the injustice to the Golden Key depositors and whether the company assets had been siphoned.President expressed these views during an event to reimburse deposits of Golden Key investors held at the BMICH today.Addressing the event, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said that the common objective of all is to create a strong middle class society.

hits._id: JO wears black bands to parliament

_source.content:
Joint Opposition MPs wore black bands in parliament today in protest over the Draft Bill for setting up an office for missing persons.
This draft bill is to be debated in parliament today.
The Joint Opposition wrote to President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday requesting that he enquire about the Supreme Court’s opinion with regard to the Draft Bill. The letter also requested to suspend the passing of the Draft Bill with immediate effect.
The Joint Opposition’s Letter, with 22 MPS signatures, pointed out how the provisions of this new Bill will bring about a risk to national security and the unity of the country.

hits._id: A special cabinet meeting today for taking a final decision about the 20th amendment

_source.content: A special cabinet meeting has been convened under the chairmanship of President Maitripala Sirisena today.A Government Minister said that it would be held at the Presidential Secretariat at 6 p.m.Reports say that obtaining approval for the 20th constitutional amendment currently submitted to the cabinet is scheduled to take place at this special cabinet meeting.The President had submitted the 20th constitutional amendment cabinet paper to the cabinet on 13th of last month.At that meeting a sub-committee comprising nine Ministers was appointed for preparing a final report giving consideration to proposals submitted by political parties.However Government sources said further that if the 20th constitutional amendment received the cabinet nod today it was scheduled to be submitted to parliament within the next few days.

hits._id: Special Parliamentary session ends up in fisticuffs

_source.content: A tense situation erupted in Parliament today (Jan. 10) after the Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe made a special statement with regard to the Central Bank Bond Incident.Joint Opposition MPs walked to the well of the House and started to protest while displaying placards against the Prime Minister’s move.At that moment, the Government MPs also walked in and it led to heated arguments among them.It was reported several MPs have exchanged blows during the melee.Later, the main political parties had convened media conferences to express their views on the incident.

hits._id: Disaster Relief Mechanism Planned

_source.content:
Government is looking at introducing a new national policy and a better system to face disaster situations effectively and successfully.
The proposed policy will help to train people with necessary knowledge to reduce the effect of the disaster, conduct emergency missions, search operations, rescue operations, providing relief, reconstruction and rehabilitation.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe in response to a question raised by a UNP MP during the “Ask the Prime Minister” session explained the Parliament the urgent requirement to have a better and effective system in place to face disaster situations.

hits._id: Parliament: One Day in a week to Question PM

_source.content: The Prime Minister has decided to set apart a day per week for Government and Opposition MPs to voice their concerns.Reports say the Prime Minister hopes to give an opportunity for MPs to pose questions directly to him.This will take place every Thursday during a half hour time slot at the beginning of parliament proceedings.  Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has informed the Speaker in writing to officially allocate this time.The Speaker is due to inform MPs to submit their questions to the Prime Minister’s office the questions prior to the meeting.

hits._id: Both parties can move forward together on behalf of the country: says the President; ‘Proceed without contemplating the past’: Requests the Prime Minister

_source.content: The UNP’s 70th Anniversary Convention was held under the theme ‘come forth to progress in a new country’, at the Borella Campbell grounds in Colombo today. The ceremony was held under the patronage of party leader Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe. President Maithripala Sirisena attended the ceremony as the Chief Guest and former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaranatunga also participated at the event.The convention was held with the participation of leaders of all religions, parliamentarians as well as a large number of party supporters. Party Secretary Minister Kabir Hashim presented the manifesto comprising 9 proposals for the anniversary convention, while Chairman of the party Minister Malik Samarawickrama seconded it. Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe inquired the stance of the party supporters with regard to the proposals and announced that the proposals were passed unanimously. The anniversary convention proposals include several suggestions including equal treatment to everyone, offering equal opportunities, upgrading the state of women, eliminating poverty and offering new employment opportunities. Meanwhile, a special memento including an image of the founder of SLFP S.W.R.D. Bandaranaike was presented to the Chief Guest of the ceremony President Maithripala Sirisena by the Premier to mark the 70th anniversary of the party. In addition, a memento comprising an image of the first female prime Minister of Sri Lanka Sirimavo Bandaranaike was presented to former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaranatunga by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe. Addressing the ceremony, Minister Kabir Hashim noted that the aim of the UNP is to act as a party which respects its policies by evolving to suit the requirements of the country. Later President Maithripala Sirisena addressed the gathering, stating that SLFP and the UNP will be able to work in collaboration towards building a unitary nation.

hits._id: Prime Minister off to Singapore

_source.content:
Prime Minister (PM) Ranil Wickramasinghe left to Singapore today morning on a personal tour.
Hiru Airport correspondent reports that the Premier left at 7.40 am on U.L.303 Aircraft belonging to Sri Lankan Airline service.
The Premier is to return to the island on the weekend.

hits._id: "We All Know Who Was Criticized by the PM" – Rajitha

_source.content:
Cabinet Minister of Health, Nutrition & Indigenous Medicine Dr. Rajitha Senaratne today said that he had not been pulled up by Prime Minister (PM) Ranil Wickramasinghe for making comments on the Avant-Garde Security Company controversy.
Sending a special message from Brazil, the minister pointed out that he had come to know of several rumors that had been circulating which led many to believe that he had been criticized by the Premier.  
“I left for Brazil on Monday and didn’t have an opportunity to meet the Premier before I left. Even though some people may point to me as the one who was criticized we all know who was really criticized by the Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe for the comments they made on the Avant Garde,” Minister Rajitha Senaratne stated.

hits._id: The challenge is to build the Sri Lankan Identity; Opposition Leader

_source.content:
Leader of the Opposition Ranil Wickramasinghe states that the prime challenge faced by the country is to establish the identity of Sri Lanka.

Wickramasighe made this statement while taking part in a function held in Colombo today in lieu of the 61st remembrance of Sri Lanka’s first prime minister D. S. Senanayaka.

hits._id: A draft bill proposal to raise Treasury bill ceiling by 400 billion rupees to Parliament today

_source.content:
The proposal to increase the loan facility the government can obtain through treasury bills by 400 billion rupees will be presented to parliament today.
Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayka will present the proposal to parliament today.
When the same proposal was put forward on April 7th during the 100 day government, it was defeated by 21 votes.
31 voted for the proposal while 52 voted against.
However Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayaka speaking to our news team stated that the proposal will be passed in Parliament.

hits._id: Provide more relief to people affected by drought; instructions from the President.-Video

_source.content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa has instructed Economic Development Minister Basil Rajapaksa and Finance Ministry Secretary Doctor P.B. Jayasundara to distribute additional financial relief and dry rations to the people affected by the drought.President has stated to provide necessary relief to the residents of areas affected by the drought including Hambantota and Moneragala.He reiterated the importance of protecting wild animals in the Yala and Udawalawa national parks.The government and private sectors should act together and implement a systematic program to supply water for the animalsPresident has advised the Ministry of Wildlife to supply water for the animals by filling reservoirs and small tanks near forests using bowsers.President Mahinda Rajapaksa has also instructed to find if there’s a way to purify sea water and provide water for animals.

hits._id: Video : President Mahinda Rajapakse inaugurates

_source.content:
Investors The Agricultural and Trade Exhibition organized by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry and the ‘Our Village’ programme organized at the Jana Kala Centre, parallel to the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting was declared open today by President Mahinda Rajapakse.

MP R Dumindha Silva also participated in the inauguration ceremony along with President Mahinda Rajapakse.

hits._id: Update: President refuses giving nominations to the Former President Rajapaksa

_source.content:
UPFA party leaders’ meeting was held at the Presidential Secretariat this evening under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena.
Following the meeting, a political party leader stated that President Maithripala Sirisena has rejected giving nominations to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.
UPFA consists of 14 political parties while its Executive Council is represented by 58 members.Mahinda to contest separately; UPFA party leaders meet the President
Political sources stated that former president Mahinda Rajapaksa has decided to contest the forthcoming general election under a separate party ticket.
It is reported that the final decision would be taken at a meeting to be held under the patronage of the former president tonight.
When our news team contacted Pivithuru Hela Urumaya leader and member of Mahinda's faction Udaya Gammanpila, he told our news team that the former president’s approach to general election would be decided during today’s meeting.
Meanwhile, President Maithripala Sirisena is currently presiding a meeting of UPFA coalition party leaders at the President’s Secretariat. UPFA consists of 14 political parties while 58 members represent its Executive Council. 
More than half of the membership is from the SLFP, while President Maithripala Sirisena is the Chairman of the alliance and Susil Premajayantha is the General Secretary of the UPFA.
Former Minister Sarath Amunugama stated that a proposal has been made to invite former Speaker Chamal Rajapaksa to lead the UPFA election campaign.
This was revealed during a media conference held at the SLFP headquarters this morning.
Meanwhile, a meeting was held between the Election Commissioner and political party leaders at the Election Secretariat this morning. 
  MR makes a special statement  (01-07-2015)

hits._id: The beggars wound has been healed by removing Sri Lanka from the Geneva agenda; Says PM

_source.content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe says the aim of implementing a domestic mechanism is to divulge the truth, thereby helping to build reconciliation and national harmony.Participating in a ceremony organized by the National Movement for Peace in Colombo this afternoon, the premier said the government’s attempt to find the truth about what happened in the past, is not targeted at branding anybody.The Primer further said that the current government was able to heal the beggar’s wound by removing Sri Lanka from the UNHRC agenda in Geneva.Meanwhile, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe will leave for Japan tomorrow on a five day official tour on the invitation of Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe.Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe who will deliver a special lecture at the inaugural ceremony of Japan Science and Technology Association's annual sessions in Kyoto will later proceed to Tokyo where he is expected to address the Japanese Parliament.

hits._id: Cabinet erupts over Avant Garde; Special meeting convened

_source.content:
The Government sources stated that a special meeting of the Cabinet is scheduled to be called with regard to the Avant Guard incident.
This special cabinet meeting would be held with the patronage of President Maithreepala Sirisena in the next few days.
The Cabinet has discussed the investigations of the Avant Garde incident in length during its meeting yesterday.
A recent statement made by Law and Order Minister Thilak Marapana in parliament has taken centre stage at the Cabinet meeting yesterday.
Minister Marapana said in parliament that police engaged in the Avant Garde incident in order to impress the current government.
Several Ministers including Rajitha Senarathna and Champika Ranawaka have made dire criticism about Marapana’s statement.
The group of ministers have commented that a full investigation with regard to  incident should be conducted.
Meanwhile JVP leader and Chief Whip of the Opposition Anura Kumara Dissanayake expressed his views last Wednesday.
At the same time, Justice Minister Wijedasa Rajapaksa told parliament that certain factions proposed to arrest former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa in connection with the Avant Garde incident.
He said however he did not allow it to happen.
Law and Order Minister Thilak Marapana expressed his views in parliament with regard to the incident in this manner.

hits._id: The UK releases a Human Rights report on Sri Lanka, after January 8th

_source.content: The United Kingdom said following the election of President Maithripala Sirisena in January and the appointment of a new government, the human rights situation in Sri Lanka improved during the first half of 2015, although some concerns remain.In its update to the 2014 Human Rights and Democracy Report, the UK Foreign and Commonwealth Office said during the first half of 2015, Sri Lanka took a number of positive steps to address human rights and democracy concerns, including establishing new institutions and undertaking legal reforms.The FCO noted that among others, freedom of expression improved, with exiled journalists invited to return to the country and a number of banned websites unblocked.The democratic space has opened up with travel bans on foreign nationals visiting the north lifted, and the NGO Secretariat moved from the Ministry of Defence to the Ministry of Policy Planning and Economic Affairs.Local contacts in the north and east noted a significant reduction in surveillance by security forces with increased space for journalists and civil society activism.However, the report said challenges remained, including those related to high levels of militarization, such as military involvement in civilian life, and the continued occupation of land by the armed forces.

hits._id: Update : Prices of diesel, petrol, kerosene reduced: says President.-Video

_source.content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday said the Government has decided to reduce the price of fuel, and the electricity tariff from midnight yesterday.The President said as a result of the commissioning of the Norochcholai coal power plant, the electricity tariff can be reduced by 25 percent, with effect from midnight yesterday.In addition, the President said that the price of petrol will be reduced by 5 rupees per liter, kerosene by 20 rupees and diesel by 3 rupees respectively.President made the announcement during the ceremony held at the Presidential secretariat to welcome the Chinese President.Addressing the gathering Chinese President Xi Jin ping stated that China will render its continuous support to solve the power crisis in Sri Lanka.Update : Wednesday, 17 September 2014 - 8:32----------------------------------------Fuel Prices reduced.President Mahinda Rajapaksha says that the Diesel price is being reduced by 3 rupees per litre, Petrol price is being reduced by 5 rupees per litre, and the Kerosene price is being reduced by 20 rupees per litre from today.Electricity tariff is being reduced by 25 percent.

hits._id: President to visit Russia at the end of this Month

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena is to engage in an official tour to Russia at the end of this month.The President will be visiting Russia following an invitation extended by Russian President Vladimir Putin.The Ministry of External Affairs stated that attention will be drawn towards several matters of importance relating to Defence and Economy.Special attention will be drawn towards the potential for Sri Lankan products in the Russian market.

hits._id: Dispute over quorum during budget debate; decision changed.-Video

_source.content: Political Party Leaders agreed today to withdraw the previous decision that insisted to obtain prior approval if a vote taking is required and to continue the budget debate even without a quorum in parliament.The party leaders withdrew the decision after Galle District independent MP Ajith Kumara raised objections to the previous decision in parliament today.To reintroduce the live television broadcast during the budget debate has also been discussed during the party leaders meeting today.Political party leaders will take a final decision on live television debate when they meet again on the 23rd of this month.Meanwhile the draft bill which is restricting land transfer to foreigners will be taken for debate in parliament today.

However after Maithripala Sirisena’s appointment as President, Parliamentarian Dilan Perera has been appointed as the Party Spokesperson.Also President Maithripala Sirisena recently has taken steps to appoint Parliamentarian Dilan Perera’s father, President's Counsel Marshal Perera as the Governor of Uva Province.With the recent turn of events, today through ‘Hard Talk’, we will be candidly questioning Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) Spokesperson, Parliamentarian Dilan Perera

hits._id: No hike of emission certificates for three-wheelers, motorcycles

_source.content: Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake told Parliament a while ago that the proposed enhanced fee of Rs. 5,000 to issue the emission certificates for vehicles in the budget would not be applicable for three-wheelers and motorbikes.

hits._id: Batticaloa likely to lose 10 thousand jobs

_source.content:
The Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Ministry announced that it is likely to lose the proposed National Aquatic Cultivation Park at Nayaru in the Batticaloa district.
The project expected to create 10 thousand job opportunities.
This decision is to be taken on a report submitted by Ministry Secretary Mangalika Adhikari.
In her report, Ministry Secretary stated that several local politicians together with some NGOs are protesting against this project.
She informed subject minister Mahinda Amaraweera during a meeting yesterday, that it is difficult to launch this project due to such objections.
The government has planned to invest 4000 million rupees on this project.  The ministry is of the opinion that certain factions are protesting against the project due to false propaganda.

hits._id: Joint cabinet of UNP and SLFP to be sworn in on the 2nd of September

_source.content: The United States said that it wants to sponsor a resolution at next month’s U.N. human rights session that is supportive of Sri Lanka’s government, which wants to conduct its own investigation into alleged war crimes.The announcement by the visiting Assistant Secretary of State Nisha Biswal of a joint resolution with the Sri Lankan government presents a major shift by Washington on the South Asian island nation.The U.S was in the forefront in adopting three resolutions at the U.N. human rights session on Sri Lanka, the last of which last year called for an international independent investigation into the alleged abuses.Biswal said, however, the U.S. now supports a local investigation that the new Sri Lankan government of President Maithripala Sirisena has promised.Biswal did not say what the new resolution would contain, but said it will follow a report by the U.N. Human Rights Council scheduled to be released next month.

Former Minister Basil Rajapaksha has been arrested by FCID once again in connection to a land acquisition issue in Gampaha.

hits._id: Strike by lottery sellers called off

_source.content:
Lottery sellers and agents have called off their strike following discussions with President Maithripala Sirisena.
The strike launched against the Government's decision to increase ticket prices and not the commissions. It continued for five days.
Government took a decision to increase the price of a lottery to Rs. 30.
All Island Lottery Dealers Society Chairperson Krishantha Marambage said the discussion with the President was held at the Presidential residence this afternoon.
After the President agreed to give a favourable solution to their issue the strike was discontinued.

A youth had died and more than 50 people have been hospitalized due to a protest conducted yesterday by the residents of several villages including Weliweriya – Rathupaswala demanding clean drinking water.
 
However, several political parties had called press conferences today to express views regarding the incident that took place yesterday and during some of those press conferences questions were raised in relation to the incident in question.

hits._id: Death Penalty certain if obtained Parliament approval – President

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that a motion will be presented to the Parliament regarding the instigation of death penalty. He stated that it will be implemented from next year for severe crimes if the resolution received Parliament approval.
The President made these observations at the Second National Drugs Prevention Programme held in Galle today (18th).
The President revealed that there had been many requests for the implementation of capital punishment after the murder of Seya and that there were many requests made before too. He further pointed out that it is instigated in well-developed nations as well.

_source.content: Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena said the rule of law should be protected in order to safeguard freedom, democracy and equality of the people.He expressed these views during a conference under the theme of ‘Street’s protest against Frenzy’ organized by civil society representatives in Colombo today.Civil Organization representatives handed over draft resolutions comprising 17 factors including the annulment of Prevention of Terrorism Act to common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena during the meeting.Addressing the gathering common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena said that he is contesting the presidential election not to remain in the position but to abolish the executive presidency and build a people centric administration.Meanwhile common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena participated in the National conference of Journalists held in Colombo this morning.Addressing journalists, UNP National Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe said that the Right to Information Act would be enacted within 100 days after the common opposition forms a new government.

hits._id: Minister of Media claims that Media Secretary’s letter regarding the Joint opposition is not an announcement from the ministry

_source.content: Minister Gayantha Karunathilake states that the communiqué issued to the media , stating that the term 'Joint Opposition' not be used, was not an official statement from either the Government or the Ministry. the minister confirmed that is was  merely a request letter issued by the Ministry Secretary based on his personal views.Minister Gayantha Karunathilaka stated that he received the communiqué issued by the Mass Media Ministry Secretary only after it was issued  to the media.Ministry Secretary Nimal Bopage, in a media release, informed all media institutions and journalists that using the term 'Joint Opposition' to describe a group of parliamentarians in the Sri Lankan parliament is in violation of the law.The newly appointed Media Secretary warned the journalists that promoting a group of parliamentarians as 'joint opposition' while the ruling party and opposition party of the government are currently defined could make them liable.The joint opposition says that it also rejects the letter issued by the ministry of media.The representatives stated at a media briefing held yesterday, that the  announcement was issued as a threat to media. Meanwhile MP Wimal Weerawansa noted that the government fears even the name of their collective.Our news team inquired the Minister of mass media Gayantha Karunathilake regarding the matter.He stated that he received the announcement only after it was issued to media institutions.The announcement signed by the new secretary of mass media attorney at law, Nimal Bopage was released to the media last afternoon.The letter indicated the letterhead of the ministry of mass media and was titled as a media announcement.

hits._id: Former Prime Minister Rathnasiri Wickremanayake passes away

_source.content:
Former Prime Minister Rathnasiri Wickremanayake passed away this noon at a private hospital in Colombo.
He was 83 years old at the time of his demise.
Former Premier Wickremanayake functioned as a presidential advisor at the time of his death.
He was educated at Millewa Primary School, Dharmapala Vidyalaya  Pannipitiya, Hartley College- Point Pedro and Ananda College- Colombo.
Subsequently, he studied to become a Barrister of Law in the United Kingdom.
He was elected to parliament in 1960 from Horana under the Lanka Sama Samaja Party.
He joined the SLFP in 1962 and functioned as the party general secretary in 1978.
He was appointed Prime Minister from 2000 to 2001 and from 2005 to 2010 and functioned in the Public Administration, Home Affairs, Buddha Sasana and Plantation ministry portfolios.
The remains of former Prime Minister Rathnasiri Wickremanayaka will be placed at the parliament from 10.30am to 11.30am tomorrow for the parliamentarians to pay their last respects.
Former president Mahinda Rajapaksa who visited the private hospital where former Prime Minister Wickremanayake had received treatment said that the death of late Wickremanayake was a great loss to the country and the nation.
In addition, President Maithripala Sirisena has directed the relevant authorities to conduct the funeral of late Rathnasiri Wickremanayake with full state patronage.
Meanwhile, MP Vidura Wickremanayake stated that the final rites of late Rathnasiri Wickremanayake will be held at Horana in the afternoon of December 31st.

hits._id: President invites Malaysian investors to explore investment opportunities in Sri Lanka

President Maithripala Sirisena has invited leading Malaysian entrepreneurs to explore possibilities of expanding investment and trade and look at the potential in new trade opportunities here in Sri Lanka.
The President made the statement during a discussion with Datuk Ariffin, the CEO of Malaysia's petrochemical giant, Petronas.
He was accompanied by a delegation when he called on president Sirisena at the Presidential Secretariat yesterday.
The CEO of Petronas, the only Malaysian company to be listed in the Fortune 500, said his company has business interests and joint projects in more than 30 countries, and he would explore the possibility of long-term business with Sri Lanka.
President Sirisena said that the current political stability and peaceful environment is conducive for foreign investments and the government would welcome established companies to invest in Sri Lanka.

hits._id: Local Government Chairmen of the SLFP summoned to Colombo

_source.content:
The Central Working Committee of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party has decided to summon the 275 chairmen representing the SLFP of local government institutions to Colombo on the 31st of this month.
 
The central working committee convened yesterday at the party headquarters yesterday afternoon, and the issues pertaining to local government ministers was discussed in depth.
 
General Secretary of the SLFP Minister Maithreepala Sirisena stated that attention was paid to steps that need to be taken regarding local government ministers who have various allegations leveled against them.
 
He further stated that the objective of this is to ensure that the reputation of the government is not tarnished and that such incidents do not take place in the future.
 
Accordingly, on the 31st of this month, the SLFP is preparing to summon all of them to Colombo and advice them and also to take a decision regarding those who have been accused of various misdeeds.
 
The meeting will be held under the patronage of President Mahinda Rajapakse.

7:50----------------------------------------------------Commissions were not appointed due to foreign influence - says PresidentPresident Mahinda Rajapakse said that the fruits of peace earned from defeating terrorism can be reaped only when the future generation walks the right path.President Rajapakse further said that when the government takes measures towards the development of the Education Sector, it is the duty of students to study well and become productive citizens.  The president expressed his views after declaring open the Mahindodaya Technical Lab at Ulu-witike Dr. Richard Pathirana Maha Vidyalaya in Galle today.Meanwhile, while addressing the meeting organized at Ratmalana Railway grounds, the President reiterated that international community cannot change the current government as long as they have the support of people.President Rajapakse also declared open two other Mahindodaya Technical Labs at Kalahe Sri Sumangala Maha Vidyalaya and Dorape Maha Vidyalaya in Galle today.Following the opening, he also toured the two schools and according to Presidential media sources, the President also engaged in conversation with the participants.In addition, President Mahinda Rajapakse declared open the new Relic shrine, library and a 3-storey building at Jambu-kaetiya Sri Sugathaa-raama Maha Vihara, in Haaliwala, Galle this morning.

hits._id: Update: No room left for another war - says the President at the 6th anniversary of the end of war

_source.content: The 6th anniversary of the end of the 30 year bitter war and remembrance of war heroes was held this morning at Samudra Mawatha in Matara.President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and several distinguished guests participated in the ceremony.The ceremony was officially commenced with the hoisting of the national flag by President Maithripala Sirisena. After the recital of the national anthem, one-minute-silence was observed and, 21 gun salute was fired to pay tribute to the deceased War Heroes.Addressing the gathering, President Maithripala Sirisena said no room would be left for another war to destroy the country or terrorism to revive again.Later the ceremonial parade by the Tri-forces, the police and the Civil Defence force members began.Parallel to the security forces parade, a colorful air show was held in the sky over the ceremony ground while a fleet of navy vessels paraded in the sea off the coast near Samudra Mawatha. The army commando regiment members added color to the ceremony by performing parachute jump close to the site of the War Heroes Remembrance Day ceremony.  Update: Tuesday, 19 May 2015 - 18:35 ......................................................................Reconciliation did not take place properly during post war period: PresidentPresident Maithreepala Sirisena says that proper measures were not taken for reconciliation among communities during the post war period. He also said that the policy of the current government is to equally implement development and national reconciliation. The President was speaking at the 6th War Heroes remembrance ceremony held this morning at Samudra Mawatha in Matara.Government Ministers, MPs, PC members and state officers as well as foreign diplomats were first to arrive at the ceremony. After the arrival of the IGP and the tri forces commanders, the Chief of Defence Staff followed suit.  Later, the Defence Ministry Secretary, the State Minister of Defence and Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka arrived at the scene. Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga reached the ceremony later. The last to arrive at the ceremony was President Maithreepala Sirisena.The ceremony was inaugurated after the President hoisted the National flag amid the recital of the national anthem. Later a-minute-silence was observed and, a 21 gun salute was fired to pay tribute to the dead War Heroes.Addressing the gathering, President Maithreepala Sirisena thanked all former state leaders and service commanders for their contribution to end the 30-year war.During his speech, the President pointed out that national reconciliation was not taken place properly during the post war period.He also gave a pledge that he would not allow another war or LTTE terrorism to raise their head again in the country.3 thousand 255 army soldiers, 1 thousand 615 seamen, 916 airmen 955 policemen and 519 Civil Defence force members participated in the parade.Parallel to the tri forces and police parade, a colorful air show was held in the sky over the ceremony ground while a fleet of navy vessels paraded off the coast in the sea near the ceremony premises. The army commando regiment members added color to the ceremony by performing parachutes in the sky close to the scene of the War Heroes Remembrance Day ceremony.

hits._id: Ranil Jayawardena appointed as British PM’s trade envoy for Sri Lanka

_source.content:
British Prime Minister Theresa May has appointed Ranil Jayawardena, MP, as her trade envoy for Sri Lanka, the British High Commission in Colombo said. 
 
Jayawardena’s role as trade envoy will be to support and enhance the development of Britain’s trade and investment with Sri Lanka.
   
The Prime Minister’s Trade Envoy will be visiting Sri Lanka from 15th to 17th February to meet with senior members of the government and engage with British business’s working in Sri Lanka.
 
Jayawardena was elected as the Member of Parliament for North East Hampshire in May 2015 and was reelected in 2017. 
 
He has a degree in government from the London School of Economics. 
 
In Parliament, he is the chair of the All Party Parliamentary Group (APPG) on Sri Lanka. 
 
Jayawardena’s father is of Sri Lankan origin. 
 
Jayawardena said, “Given the shared history and close bonds of friendship between Britain and Sri Lanka – and with my family ties to Sri Lanka – I am looking forward to serving as the Prime Minister’s Trade Envoy at an exciting time for both our countries”.

hits._id: Update: SL is India’s closest neighbour & best trading partner - PM Modi

_source.content:
Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Sri Lanka this dawn.On his arrival at the Bandaranayake International Airport, Indian Premier Modi was welcomed by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.Later the state welcome ceremony for the Indian Premier commenced at 9.30 am at the Presidential Secretariat.President Maithripala Sirisena who welcomed Indian Premier Narendra Modi at the Presidential Secretariat, escorted the premier along the Red Carpet to a special podium.After the national anthems of the two countries were played, a gun salute was held in honour of the Indian Premier.Following the bilateral discussions between the two state leaders, 4 MOUs were signed.  Indian Premier today reiterated their stand for the implementation of the 13th Amendment to the Constitution and aiming for a united Sri Lanka for all communities.Delivering a statement during his visit to Sri Lanka on Friday, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi conveyed his admiration for Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena's efforts to build an inclusive future for Sri Lanka and offered "sincere" support for Sri Lanka's new journey of peace, reconciliation and progress.Modi also said India will extend the facility of "Tourist Visa on Arrival - Electronic Travel Authorization Scheme to Sri Lankan citizens from the Sinhala and Tamil New Year on 14th April 2015 and Air India will soon start direct flights between New Delhi and Colombo.In addition, the Indian oil company, Lanka IOC and Ceylon Petroleum Corporation have agreed to jointly develop the Upper Tank Farm of the China Bay Installation in Trincomalee on mutually agreed terms.A Joint Task Force will be constituted soon to work out the modalities.Update : Friday, 13 March 2015 - 7.10 PM------------------------------------------------Sri Lanka is our closest neighbor – PM Modi“Sri Lanka is one of our closest neighbors and a nation with which we share so much. I am truly honored by your warm welcome and friendship,” visiting Indian Premier Narendra Modi stated while speaking to Sri Lankan Parliament short while ago.
Indian Prime Minister was warmly welcomed by the current Speaker of the Parliament Chamalka Rajapakse.
This is how it should be between neighbor states. We should meet regularly. It supports us to understand each other better, find solution to mutual concerns with mutual respect and move our friendship forward.”
That is what we achieved in my meeting with Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena today,” he said, delivering a speech at the Parliament.
Update : Friday, 13 March 2015 - 4.00 PM-----------------------------------------Modi Arrived at Parliament Visiting Indian Prime Minister (PM) Narendra Modi arrived at Sri Lankan Parliament short while ago.

hits._id: Parliament passes Railway Gazette

_source.content:
The special gazette notice issued with the signature of President Maithripala Sirisena declaring railway services as an essential service, was passed in Parliament today (11) with majority votes.
 
52 MPs voted for it while 8 voted against.
 
Meanwhile, a special discussion is now taking place among railway trade unions about the strike.
 
The Railway Department also published a notice inviting retired staff to report to work to restore the train services.
 
Meanwhile, Transport Ministry Secretary, G. S. Withanage said that the Railway Department will inform the strikers, in writing today, that if they do not report to work, they will be considered as having vacated their posts.
 
The General Mager of Sri Lanka Railways, S. M. Abeywickrama told our news team that about 20 train journeys were carried out by 10 am today (11), despite the strike.

hits._id: Once again notices issued on the President and the Prime Minister

_source.content:
Notices were issued once again,  on President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe to appear before Court in connection with the Case against former UNP General Secretary Tissa Attanayake.
The Case against Tissa Attanayake for preparing forged documents was taken before Colombo High Court Judge Wikum Kalu-Aarachchi this morning.
At the same time the Court decided today that the case hearing would take place from December 4 to 12.
The Attorney General has filed Action against Tissa Attanayake on 3 counts of charges including making a statement that there was a secret agreement between the then Common Presidential Candidate Maithripala Sirisena and the then Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe.
Addressing a media conference held in December 2014 in Colombo, Tissa Attanayake produced forged documents before the media and revealed his secret.
However, the presidents counsel who appeared on behalf of the President and the Prime Minister told the Courts that his clients were not able to be present in Court due to their busy official schedules.
He also requested the Courts to allocate another day for his client’s case hearing, and not to issue notices again.

hits._id: New Constitution Report To President And PM

_source.content:
The report compiled by the Committee appointed to gather public opinion and suggestions on the formation of a new Constitution has been handed over to Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.
The report was handed over by Chairman Attorney Lal Wijenayake at the Temple Trees yesterday. The committee obtained opinions and suggestions in verbal and in written form from the public across the island.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said the committee was able to obtain the views and suggestions of the public in a short period of time.
The report will then be handed over to President Maithripala Sirisena on the 7th of June while it will also be given to religious leaders.

hits._id: New committee to observe implementation of SAITM recommendations

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has decided to appoint a new Committee comprising of all the relevant parties, to implement recommendations made by the previous Committee.The new Committee will also provide solutions if there are any issues which are not addressed by the previous recommendations.
                                                                           Media Release
The Committee appointed by His Excellency President Maithripala Sirisena and headed by the Hon. Harsha de Silva, Deputy Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to resolve the current issues related to the South Asia Institute of Technology and Medicine (SAITM) has made reasonable and acceptable recommendations. Various parties have suggested that further discussions should be held in this regard to enter into a further discussion regarding this matter to raise these recommendations to a higher level acceptable to all the students of the medical faculties of universities, lecturers of the universities, parents of the medical students as well as all the other relevant parties.
His Excellency the President has decided to appoint a new Committee comprising of all the relevant parties, to implement recommendations made by the previous Committee, and to provide solutions if there are any issues which are not addressed by the previous recommendations.
During a meeting held on Friday 3rd November 2017, between the His Excellency the President and the relevant parties including the Vice-Chancellors of the Universities, Deans of the Medical Faculties, representatives of the Government Medical Officers’ Association, further discussions were held regarding the proposed recommendations. The proposed new Committee has the responsibility of updating and implementation of the recommendations already made, while considering the facts presented in this meeting as well.  
Therefore, I must kindly inform that a large number of steps have been taken by the government to solve this issue.
After giving due consideration to the steps already taken by the government and the proposed recommendations, if any party/parties feel that there are further issues to be dealt with, they are invited for further discussions. His Excellency the President requests the parents of the students of the government medical faculties and all other parties to extend their cooperation without resorting to satyagraha, fasts or protests.
The President expects all students of the government medical faculties will take the above positive steps into consideration and will engage in their studies, for the sake of their future as well as the future of the country.
 
The committee appointed by the President to implement the proposed solutions regarding the SAITM and to consider the other arisen issues:
The committee consists of:

Harsha de Silva – Deputy Minister of Policy Planning and Economic Development (President)
Mr. Janaka Sugathadasa – Secretary to the Ministry of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine
Mr. D. C. Dissanayake – Secretary to the Ministry of Higher Education and Highways
Mohan de Silva – Chairman, University Grant Commission
Colvin Gunaratne – Chairman, Sri Lanka Medical Council
Lakshman Dissanayake – Vice-Chancellor, University of Colombo
Sampath Amaratunga – Vice-Chancellor, University of Sri Jayewardenepura
Jenifer Perera – Dean, University of Colombo
Nilanthi de Silva – Dean, University of Kelaniya

Observers (One representative each) 

Government Medical Officers’ Association
Medical Faculty Lecturers’ Association
Medical Students’ Parents Association

Acting Secretary to the President

hits._id: 19 persons including Keppetipola, named traitors by the British, declared as war heroes

_source.content:
Government cleared the names of 19 nationals described as “traitors” for leading an insurrection against colonial rule nearly 200 years ago. 
President Maithripala Sirisena has annulled the Gazette issued in 1818 listing 19 Wellassa heroes, including Keppetipola Disawe as being traitors. 
Keppetipola Disawe, who was a local leader, along with his men, were declared as being traitors, during the 1818 rebellion against British rule.
The Great Rebellion of 1817–1818, also known as the 1818 Uva–Wellassa uprising was the third of the Kandyan Wars against British colonial forces.

hits._id: Political parties oppose delay in establishing LG administrations

_source.content:
A number of political parties have opposed the delay in establishing Local Government administrations.
 
The Election Commission has requested the Ministry of Provincial Councils and Local Government to delay the process by a further one week.
 
Earlier, it was scheduled to establish the LG administrations on 6th of March.
 
UNP MP Kavida Jayawardena said it would take some time to make the LG system successful.
 
Meanwhile, Joint Opposition MP Keheliya Rambukwella said the delay in establishing administrations in LG bodies has created problems.
 
JVP Provincial Councillor Samantha Vidyaratne says this delay would further aggravate the issues of the rural people.
 
Meanwhile, the National Organizer of the SLFP, Susil Premajayantha said the legal aspects with regard to the establishment of LG administrations should be debated in Parliament.

hits._id: Packer's Crown pulls plug on $400m SL casino plan

_source.content: James Packer's Crown Group says it will not go ahead with a proposed plan to develop a $400 million luxury hotel and resort in Sri Lanka, following a decision by the government in Colombo to scrap tax concessions for the project.On Thursday Sri Lanka's new government decided to cancel generous tax concessions for three foreign resort developments – including Mr Packer's resort – and said it would not issue them licenses to run casinos.A spokeswoman from Crown said the company respected the decision and on that basis the project would not be going ahead.The concessions were given under the former government of Mahinda Rajapaksa but critics in Sri Lanka opposed the move to give tax breaks to foreign gaming ventures.Speaking to politicians, Sri Lanka's new Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said the government would withdraw the tax breaks for the developments with immediate effect."We will not allow casinos on their premises," he said.The previous government had offered the concessions in an effort to turn the Sri Lankan capital into a regional gaming hub.Mr Rajapaksa lost office last month.The new coalition government, which includes defectors from Mr Rajapaksa's administration, has announced a 100-day constitutional reform agenda which includes measures to increase transparency and end corruption. (ABC/AFP)

hits._id: Indian Ocean Region’s Senior Drug Enforcement Officials meet in Colombo

_source.content:
A group of representatives attached to the Sri Lanka Press Institute has engaged in a discussion with President Maithreepala Sirisena today.

The discussion was centered on actions that should be taken to strengthen self censorship by media.

President’s Media Unit stated that Media Minister Gayantha Karunathilaka was also present.

Meanwhile, The Meeting of Senior Drug Enforcement Officials of the Indian Ocean Region commenced under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena today in Colombo.

The United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime and the Global Maritime Crime Programme and the Ministry of Defence co-host the Meeting held from 13th to 15th October.

Over 60 delegates at the level of the head or deputy head from 21 countries in the Indian Ocean region and 7 organizations are participating in this meeting.

President Maithripala Sirisena has given his consent to appoint a national level Trade Union Advisory Committee under his supervision.

The Committee will be headed by the Secretary to the President and the relevant Ministers.

hits._id: UN General Secretary visits Jaffna today

_source.content:
UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon will be touring Jaffna today.
During the tour the UN Secretary General is expected to gain an insight into resettlement efforts being carried out in the north.
Meanwhile, the UN chief yesterday expressed his appreciation over the progress made by Sri Lanka over the last one and half years.
He also assured the continued assistance and support from the United Nations towards the efforts of the government.
Ban made these comments during talks with President Maithripala Sirisena at the President’s residence yesterday.
The two leaders discussed the ongoing development programmes, the progress of the programmes being implemented to strengthen reconciliation and the process of constitutional reforms.
The President briefed the visiting UN chief about the steps taken by the government with regard to constitutional reforms, devolution and structural reforms.

hits._id: Governors to run Sabaragamuwa, North-Central and Eastern PC’s until elections held

_source.content:
The Ministry of Local Government and Provincial Councils says that it does not hope to extend the tenure of office of Provincial Councils, which is scheduled to end soon.
Accordingly, the power of administration for Sabaragamuwa, North-Central and the Eastern Provincial councils will be vested with the Governors until elections are held.
The term of the Sabaragamuwa Provincial Council ends on 27th this month,   while the North-Central Provincial Council’s term ends on 30th this month.
In the 20th amendment, which was presented in parliament recently it had been proposed that powers of provincial councils be vested with the Parliament until the elections were held.
It had also been proposed in the amendment, that the election of all Provincial Councils be held on the same day and to vest with Parliament the power of extending their term.
However, the Supreme Court has informed the Parliament that the relevant draft amendment bill needs to be approved by a 2/3rd majority and a referendum.

hits._id: President requests Jaffna University students to return to studies as security is tightened

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has requested Jaffna University students to continue their studies without anxiety or suspicion as the security and safety at the university has been assured.
The President made this request when he met the Vice Chancellor and the academic staff along with a group of parents of the students at the Presidential Secretariat yesterday.
At the meeting the President said Police and security forces have been instructed to act sensitively in matters pertaining to students and the government is committed to increasing security to ensure the safety of the students.

hits._id: China Expresses Condolences Over Flood In Sri Lanka

_source.content:
President of China Xi Jingping has sent a message of condolence to President Maithripala Sirisena following the floods and landslides experienced in the island during the past two weeks.
President Xi said the Chinese government will fully support Sri Lanka’s disaster relief efforts, pledging assistance and support within China’s capacity to help with the relief and post-disaster recovery of Sri Lanka in accordance with its requirements.
The Chinese President voiced his belief that the Sri Lankan government and its people will overcome the natural disasters and rebuild their homes as soon as possible.
Earlier, Prime Minister of China Li Keqiang said China deeply sympathizes with the Sri Lankan people and will provide assistance and support within its capacity to help with the relief and post-disaster recovery.

The President expressed these views participating in the National Teachers’ Day festival which was held today at the BMICH, parallel to the International Teachers’ Day. The festival was organized by the Ministry of Education. Our staff reporter said that in addition, veteran teachers were awarded by the President on the occasion.

hits._id: Parliament approves U.S resolution on domestic mechanism

_source.content:
The U.S. Resolution which was submitted to UNHRC by supporting a domestic mechanism for Sri Lanka has been tabled in parliament by Foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera this morning.
However MP Dinesh Gunawardana told parliament just before the resolution was tabled that U.S. Resolution which was co-sponsored by Sri Lanka has not been presented to parliament yet.
At that time, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said that the U.S. Resolution has already been uploaded on the Foreign Ministry Website.
He also said that 47 countries including China and Russia have pledged their support towards this resolution.
At this juncture, leader of the house minister Lakshman Kiriella said that MP Dinesh Gunawardana is questioning the resolution even without reading its content.

hits._id: JO to bring 'No-faith motion' against PM

_source.content:
Joint Opposition's, UPFA MP Bandula Gunawardena says leaders of political parties of the Joint Opposition have unanimously decided to bring in a no-confidence motion against Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe in connection with the Bond scam.
He added that the decision was made at a meeting attended by the JO leaders which was chaired by former President Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday (Jan. 08).
The MP also said that leader of the Joint Opposition MP Dinesh Gunawardena sent a letter to the President, requesting a copy of the Bond Commission report for the reference of the opposition MPs.
 
Meanwhile, Acting Secretary General of Parliament, Neil Iddawela said that Speaker Karu Jayasuriya has summoned a special Parliamentary session at 10.30 am tomorrow (Jan. 10) at the request of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.
 
According to the Secretary-General, the Speaker, in pursuance of Standing Order Number 14 of Parliament requests, all Members of Parliament to attend this special sitting.
 
Sources said that the recently released Central Bank Bond Commission report would be presented to Parliament during this session.

hits._id: Disclosure about government’s economic policies under Prime Minister

_source.content:
It has been decided that disclosures relating to the Government’s economic policies and decisions that have an international impact should be determined by the National Policies and Economic Affairs Ministry Cabinet sub-committee alone.
The said decisions are due to be taken  by the National Policies and Economic Affairs Ministry Cabinet sub-committee that functions under Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe.
The Prime Minister has taken this decision as a result of various views expressed by several Government Ministers in the recent past about the methodologies followed with regard to the International Monetary Fund, the World Bank, and the Asian Development Bank.
The Prime Minister is scheduled to officially inform all ministers about the decision after the New Year holidays.

Different brands of European cars including Volkswagen will be assembled in this plant. It is expected to generate 3000 direct jobs and 10,000 indirect jobs through this assembly plant. Meanwhile, plans are afoot to set up a motor engineering training centre affiliated to the assembly plant.

hits._id: A bullet from an UNP MP in the chambers

_source.content:
Parliament convened today at 1pm under the patronage of Deputy Speaker Chandima Weerakoddy.
Addressing parliament UNP MP Ravi Karunanayaka raised a question regarding the Army.
In reply Chief government whip Minister Dinesh Gunawardana had this to say….

			   
			   		
	
			   
An adjournment debate is currently being held in Parliament regarding the Waliweriya incident.
While addressing the chambers UNP MP Ajith Mannaperuma presented a bullet to the Chambers.
Subsequently a heated situation occurred with the objection of several Government MP’s.
MP Sriyani Wijewickrama ordered Sergeant at arms to launch an investigation into the incident.

hits._id: Mahinda Rajapaksha's Withdrawn Army Security Replaced with Police STF

_source.content:
Sri Lanka Army Spokesperson Brigadier Jayanath Jayaweera states that Army security detail of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa withdrawn today was replaced with the police Special Task Force.
Brigadier Jayanath Jayaweera further noted that security measures restrict him from sharing accurate details on the withdrawn and replaced number of personals. 
According to the Private media secretary of Mahinda Rajapaksha- former MP Uditha Lokubandara, 50 out of 102 army personals had been withdrawn from ex-President's squad this morning.

hits._id: Cortege carrying the remains of late Mahanayake Most Venerable Davuldena Gnanissara Thera brought to Independence Square

_source.content:
The cortege carrying the remains of late Mahanayake Most Venerable Davuldena Gnanissara Thera is being escorted to the Independence Square.
Sri Lanka Army will receive the remains at the Lotus Junction and will escort it to Independence Square along Independence Avenue.
Independence Avenue and all roads to Independence Square was closed from 2.30 pm to perform the final rites.
The funeral will commence with the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe at 3.30pm.

hits._id: President appoints Champika, Amunugama and Anura to solve petrol crisis

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has appointed a Cabinet sub-committee comprising of Ministers Patali Champika Ranawaka, Dr. Sarath Amunugama, and Anura Priyadharshana Yapa to quickly solve the petrol crisis.
 
The President has also instructed to import petrol stocks from India to ease the shortage.
 
Although supplies have been increased, long queues could still be seen outside most of the fuel stations in many parts of the country.
 
During the last two days, 4,800MT of petrol have been issued to fuel sheds island-wide.
 
Our correspondents stated that the supply of petrol has been restricted to Rs. 1000 per car and Rs. 500 per motorcycle.
 
The Ministry of Petroleum Resources Development, however, stated that it has not instructed any petrol station owner to limit the amounts of petrol to be pumped per vehicle.
 
Meanwhile, it has been reported that cab operators have increased the fares as a result of the prevailing petrol shortage.The prevailing petrol crisis was also discussed in Parliament today (07). Here, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe revealed 2 petrol shipments will arrive on the island tomorrow and day after.He added then the prevailing issue will be normalized.Meanwhile, speaking here, Minister Arjuna Ranatunga said he's being influenced to release a substandard fuel shipment imported by Lanka IOC.He said he will not authorize the release, despite he's pressurized to do so.

hits._id: Australia steps up to assist with Dengue eradication

_source.content:
Australian Minister for Foreign Affairs Julie Bishop will visit Sri Lanka tomorrow with the objective of strengthening  bilateral ties, focusing on economic and security relations with Sri lanka.
Minister Bishop will meet President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, Sri Lankan Foreign Minister Ravi Karunanayake and other ministers to discuss security cooperation and explore new economic opportunities in science, resources and energy.
It is expected that President Sirisena and the Foreign Minister will announce Australia’s assistance to combat dengue fever in Sri Lanka and discuss progress on the implementation of Sri Lanka's reconciliation process, which is critical to its long-term security and prosperity.

hits._id: Mirigama budget also defeated for the second time - Chairman lost his post

_source.content: The 2014 budget of the UPFA controlled Meerigama Pradeshiya Sabha was defeated for a 2nd time with a majority of 21 votes.Only the chairman of the Pradeshiya Sabha Ananda Premachandra Ranaweera voted for the proposed budget.The Pradeshiya Sabha, is comprised of 23 members which include 12 government representatives and 11 opposition members.However, the member representing the JVP was absent from the chambers today.The proposed 2014 budget for the Meerigama Pradeshiya Sabha was defeated by a majority of 19 votes the first time when it was presented for the first time on the 20th of this month.

hits._id: President orders to provide relief to affected groups in Meethotamulla

President Maithripala Sirisena has advised relevant officials to submit a report regarding the Meethotamulla garbage disposal collapse within five days.
He said this during a meeting held regarding the issue at the Ministry of Disaster Management last morning.
The meeting was held to discuss matters regarding the relocation of the garbage disposal.
The President further advised the officials to aid affected people without thinking about funds.

hits._id: Common candidate Maithripala’s election manifesto to be launched this week.

_source.content: Common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena arrived at the UNP headquarters Sirikotha today to a rousing welcome by large crowds.UNP National Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe, party MPs, members representing Provincial and local government institutions and electoral organizers joined the reception.It was significant that Vanni district UPFA MP Hunaiz Farook from All Ceylon People’s Congress led by Minister Rishard Badiudeen joining the UNP during this meeting.Addressing the gathering UNP General Secretary Tissa Attanayake said that he would never quit the party.Defected former Minister Rajitha Senarathna described the government’s incapability to identify the common candidate at the outset.Meanwhile, addressing the meeting, common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena said his election manifesto which is to be released this week would convince people of his future vision for the country.

hits._id: No change in gold prices even though surcharge removed

_source.content: Through next year’s budget the surcharge imposed on gold imports has been removed and is in effect from yesterday.However, gold traders in seas street point out that there was a wrong impression among the public that gold prices have increased.A member of the Gold Traders Association stated that even though the surcharge imposed on gold imports has been removed, there will be no change in gold prices.Meanwhile, the government has also amended the SES tax on imports with the intention of promoting local production.Accordingly, Tax Advisor of KPMG Suresh Perera stated that there could be an increase in prices of certain goods.In the meantime Chairman of the Vehicle Importers Association Mahinda Satharasinghe stated that prices of new vehicles would also increase.

hits._id: Government is a pest to the people; says Opposition Leader.

Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremasinghe says that the Government has become a pest to people.

On this occasion the Opposition Leader asked for the reasons why the Government would not implement the LLRC  report, in case the Government intended not  to implement it.

hits._id: Democracy means not only holding Elections; says Ranil.-Video

_source.content: Opposition Leader Ranil Wickramasinghe states that democracy is not only about holding elections.He said this while attending a book launch held at the auditorium of Central Bank of Sri Lanka in Rajagiriya today.The Opposition Leader also said that any country should move forward while incorporating the modern as well as the ancient systems.

hits._id: All party conference inquiring political party views about Geneva resolutions today

_source.content: The all-party meeting that seeks views about the way the Government should act with regard to the Geneva resolutions is scheduled to be held today at the presidential secretariat with the President at the chair.Leaders of 21 political parties representing the parliament including, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and Opposition Leader R. Sampandan will participate.Three representatives from each party including the party secretary can participate in this forum.All party representative meeting chairman Professor Tissa Vitharana, Democratic Party Leader Sarath Fonseka, Pivithuru Hela Urumaya General Secretary Udaya Gammanpila, Workers National Front Leader P. Digambaran are expected to participate in the meeting.

hits._id: US$ 100 to be charged to enter casinos.--Budget 2015

hits._id: Land & houses for Estate People under 100 Day Programme - PM

_source.content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasingha states that under the 100 day programme of the government, it was possible to provide land ownership and houses to estate sector people.The Premier said it is the responsibility of the government to develop the infrastructure facilities in the estate sector.

hits._id: Action against corruption would not be halted - PM

_source.content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said that the government is not ready at all to halt the action against corruption.He stated this while accepting a report prepared by a three member committee, which was recently appointed to investigate the alleged corruption of the Sports Ministry during the past regime.Sports Minister Navin Dissanayake handed over the report to the Prime Minister at Temple Trees this afternoon.The report has probed 18 allegations including the bidding for tenders to lay 400 meters track at the Sugathadasa Stadium and the granting of broadcasting rights of international cricket tournaments.

hits._id: Uma Oya report handed to President shows No proper feasibility study is the reason for the destruction

_source.content:
The report compiled by Norwegian Expert Bent Agard who looked in to the leak in the main tunnel of the Uma Oya multipurpose project was handed over to President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday.
The report points out that the failure to conduct a proper feasibility study and environmental analysis was the reason for a leak in the main tunnel and the drying up of water sources in nearby areas.
It goes on to say that covering leakages with a special cement mixture alone would not help resolve the issue and a special method needed to be followed.
President Sirisena had recalled the issues faced by the people as a result of the project and also said that the government is committed towards resolving the issue.

hits._id: A message from President Sirisena to US President elect Donald Trump; plans to send a Special Representative as well

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena hopes US President-elect Donald Trump would grant Sri Lanka redress by not pursuing the human rights accountability charges against the country. International media quote the President as saying that he will write to President elect Donald Trump to ask him to free Sri Lanka from these accusations. The UN Human Rights Council allowed Sri Lanka more time to set rights accountability mechanisms to probe the alleged rights violations that took place in the country during the last phase of the military campaign that ended in 2009 with victory of government troops.

hits._id: Namal reports to Bribery Commission, Fresh petition against Ravi

_source.content:
Joint Opposition MP Udaya Gammanpila said that the 8th complaint under the “TOP TEN” corruption allegation move against the government will be filed with the Commission to Investigate Allegations on Bribery and Corruption, today.
Addressing a media conference held in Colombo today, Gammanpila said the petition will be filed against Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake.
He further said the petition charges that Sri Lanka Customs has lost 25,000 million rupees due to a proposal compiled by minister Karunanayake in the Budget 2017
The Joint Opposition has filed another petition under the “TOP TEN” move against the finance minister in the past.
Other petitions have been filed under the TOP TEN included those against Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, former Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran, Ministers Thalatha Athukorala, Malik Samarawickrama, Kabeer Hashim and P Harrison.
Meanwhile MP Namal Rajapaksa reported to the Bribery Commission this morning.

hits._id: Office of Missing Persons effective from Friday

_source.content:
Minister Mano Ganeshan says the Office of Missing Persons be established and functioned under the Ministry of National Integration and Reconciliation, which is coming under the purview of President, Maithripala Sirisena.This office will be operationalized from Friday.Addressing the 36th sessions of the UN Human Rights Council, its Commissioner Zeid Ra'ad al-Hussein urged Sri Lanka to establish the Office of Missing Persons without delay.
Meanwhile, President Maithripala Sirisena will leave the country on Sunday to participate in the 72nd UN General Assembly.
The session will be inaugurated on 19th and the President will address it on the same day.

hits._id: School 3rd term ends on Friday

Education Ministry says the 3rd term of government and government-approved private schools will end on 8th of December.

hits._id: Update : Modi insists on 13th or beyond

India expects early and full implementation of 13th amendment and go beyond that to find a solution within United Sri Lanka soon, Indian Prime Minister (PM) Narendra Modi emphasized this while speaking at Maha Bodhi Society short while ago.  Update : Friday, 13 March 2015 - 12:52---------------------------------------------Bilateral talks between leaders of Sri Lanka and India begin.4 Agreements were signed between Sri Lanka and India after bilateral talks held between the leaders of the two countries.The first agreement signed at the Presidential Secretariat was to offer visa-free entry for all diplomats and other official visitors to both countries.Another MoU was signed between the two countries on customs cooperation.The third MoU was on Youth Affairs while the 4th agreement to set up Ravindranath Thagore Memorial Hall at Ruhuna University.The Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in the country at 20 minutes past 5 o’clock in this morning. On his arrival at the Bandaranayake International Airport, Premier Modi was receipted by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.Later the state welcome ceremony for the Indian Premier started at 9.30 at the Presidential Secretariat.President Maithreepala Sirisena who welcomed Indian Premier Narendra Modi at the Presidential secretariat, conducted the latter on the Red Carpet to a special dais.After the national anthems of the two countries were played, a 21 gun salute was fired in honor of the visiting Indian premier.Later the government ministers including Premier Ranil Wickremesinghe and other government officials were introduced to visiting Indian Premier Narendra Modi.After bilateral discussions and signing of agreements, Sri Lankan President addressed the gathering. Update : Friday, 13 March 2015 - 12:50---------------------------------------------
Free On Arrival Visa for Sri Lankans to IndiaOn arrival Visa facility will be extended to Sri Lankan citizens from April 14, Sinhala and Tamil New Year, Indian Prime Minister (PM) Narendra Modi stated while meeting Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena short while ago.

hits._id: Reconciliation Program For School Children Commenced

_source.content:
The inaugural session of the national program “ Sisu Diviyata Nawa Aruthak” (New meaning to students’ life), which aimed at educating school children regarding the national reconciliation process in the country, commenced under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena at the BMICH on May 05.
The Ministry of National Integration & Reconciliation organized this event with the intention of to commence reconciliation from school as the first step.
The President presented certificates to students who presented their creations with the theme of reconciliation. He also launched the official website of the Ministry of National Integration & Reconciliation.

hits._id: UK All- Party Parliamentary Group meets President

_source.content:
The UK All- Party Parliamentary Group on Sri Lanka has met with President Maithripala Sirisena at the Presidential Secretariat.
 
The meeting took place last evening (Jan. 04).
 
The Members of the All-Party Parliamentary Group including its Chair Ranil Jayawardena, MP, House of Commons, who represent the Conservative Party of the UK, also participated in this meeting.
 
The President’s Media Unit said that the delegation arrived in the country with the aim of strengthening the relations with Sri Lanka as a Commonwealth country as well as to promote trade and investment relations between the 2 countries.
 
The delegation said to the President that there is immense progress in the programmes carried out by the Government during the past period to strengthen the democracy and the steps taken to develop the economy of the country, implementation of the special development projects as well as the promotion of foreign trade.   
 
The President has pointed out the importance of further strengthening the relations between the 2 countries to reap maximum benefits from the opportunities of new technology and promotion of employment opportunities.

hits._id: Indian Prime Minister arrives in the island

_source.content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in the island this evening to take part in the United Nations’ 14th Vesak Day celebrations. Our correspondent at the airport stated that the premier who arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport in a special aircraft, was welcomed by Premier Ranil Wickramasinghe. The police headquarters noted that the lanes in Katunayake Expressway towards Colombo, the stretch of baseline road from Peliyagoda  to D.S. junction, and the stretch of road through Nelum Pokuna, Library junction, Pittala junction, and Gangarama Seemamalaka was closed from 6.15 PM as the Indian Prime Minister will be taking part in religious observances in Colombo. Furthermore, the road from Nawam Mawatha to Galle Face roundabout will be closed at 7.15 PM. The police headquarters further noted that Galle Face road will be closed from 8.20 PM until 10.30 PM as the Indian prime minister is scheduled to meet President Maithripala Sirisena at the President’s House. Meanwhile, police announced that vehicles which transport people to watch Vesak Zones in Colombo will be seized if they are parked disturbing adjacent roads. In a communiqué issued today, police said such vehicles will be taken to nearby police stations. The owners will be compelled to pay the fee for towing, before they claim their vehicles from the respective police stations.
