hits._id: This time India supports SL at UN

_source.content: The Indian government took note of the resolution by the Northern Provincial Council internally, but officials said it was too early to gauge its importance to the reconciliation process already initiated by President Maithripala Sirisena’s new government.Officials are studying if the resolution would affect the Geneva conference of the UNHRC, where the U.N. special rapporteur is due to submit a report on a U.S.-sponsored “war crimes investigations” that could also lead to a resolution against Sri Lanka being tabled.India would be keen to see any such resolution put off, it is understood, so as to allow the new Sri Lankan government time to implement its promises to the Northern provinces.sources in New Delhi said any attempt to challenge the new government with an international genocide investigation at this point could “complicate matters.India has traditionally opposed any international investigation into war crimes in Sri Lanka, a position that led to India abstaining from the U.S.-backed resolution at the UNHRC in March 2014.The Hindu reports that the issue of reconciliation and rehabilitation for the Tamil-dominated areas will be a key issue when President Sirisena meets with Prime Minister Narendra Modi next week.The government will be keen to discuss the new government’s plans as well as the just-started talks on repatriation of 1 million Sri Lankan refugees living in India.”President Sirisena will visit India from February 15th to 18th, his first international engagement since he was sworn in.

Meanwhile, the Finance Ministry announced special hotline for the general public today to obtain information with regard to Budget 2017.  To obtain information in Sinhala and English language: Dial071- 0 24- 23- 14 071-0 24 -23 -1 0 ( zero ) And  071-0 24- 23- 11  To obtain information in Tamil language, dial 071 -0 24- 23- 12 And071-0 24 -23- 13

hits._id: Railway strike continues despite warnings

_source.content: Although the government announced that the railway workers who do not report to work today (12) would be considered to have vacated their posts, the railway workers are adamant that they would continue their strike until their demands are met.The Convener of the Railway Control Observation Officers' Union, Lal Ariyarathna said that the strikers are willing to discuss if a proper opportunity is given to explain their plight.Meanwhile, President Maithripala Sirisena appointed a Cabinet Sub-Committee to look into the ongoing railway strike. Minister Dr. Sarath Amunugama will chair the committee while Ministers Dr. Rajitha Senarathna, Ranjith Maddumabandara and Akila Viraj Kariyawasam are the other members of the Committee.Meanwhile, the Government Nursing Officers' Union said that its members would also demand a pay rise if railway workers’ salaries are increased.

hits._id: Visiting Malaysian PM calls on President

_source.content:
The official meeting between President Maithripala Sirisena and the visiting Prime Minister of Malaysia Dato’ Sri Mohd. Najib bin Tun Abdul Razak was held at the Presidential Secretariat, this morning (18).
 
The Prime Minister of Malaysia who arrived at the Presidential Secretariat was warmly received there by President Maithripala Sirisena and a special Guard of Honour with 21-gun salute was accorded.
 
The Malaysian PM is undertaking his official visit to Sri Lanka to mark the 60th anniversary of diplomatic relations between the two countries.
 
After a cordial meeting between the leaders, the bilateral discussions were held.
 
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe and several Ministers from both countries took part in the discussion.
 
Two MoU’s and another were signed between the two countries and a special commemorative stamp and a First Day Cover was issued to mark the 60th anniversary of diplomatic ties between Sri Lanka and Malaysia.

Perera intervened. hits._id: A European Parliament delegation to visit the island to review GSP+

_source.content:
A delegation from the European Parliament will arrive in the island on October 31st to carry out an assessment, in order to grant GSP+ to Sri Lanka.
The four member delegation will review the progress of reconciliation achieved in the country thus far. 
They will also draw attention to steps taken by the government to empower women politically and economically.
The delegation will be led by the chairperson of the South Asian Affairs Committee Gin Lambert where they will visit Colombo, Trincomalee and Batticaloa during their stay in the country until November 3rd.
The EU Colombo Office, in a communiqué stated that Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe met the foreign affairs committee of the EU parliament during his recent visit to Brussels and had discussions in relation to regaining GSP+ for Sri Lanka.

hits._id: Indonesian President to visit Sri Lanka

Several Memoranda of Understanding are to be inked between the two countries during the visit.Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe will also have discussions on economic, trade and investment cooperation with President Widodo at a breakfast meeting on 25th of January. Sri Lanka and Indonesia established diplomatic relations 65 years ago, and have been maintaining cordial bilateral relations since then.In 2016, President Maithripala Sirisena undertook a state visit to Indonesia.

hits._id: "We did not come to steal if we continue as a Unity Govt., one should commit to Good Governance" - President

_source.content:
"This destruction was caused within 3 months since forming government"
 "Those who responsible should bear responsibility"
"Commission appointed not targeting someone in government"
"Small group in government accusing me"
"Mud being thrown at me spending money on Facebook, websites, newspapers and media entities operated overseas"
President Maithripala Sirisena says the Presidential Commission of Inquiry to investigate the controversial bond issuance was appointed not targeting anybody.
He said this speaking at an event in 'Ape Gama' in Battaramulla this morning (08). It was held to coincide with foundation laying for the statue of the late Ven. Maduluwawe Sobitha Thera. 
"Some in the government are accusing me of appointing the Bond Commission and some are giving wrong impressions. There are campaigns in websites, FaceBook and in weekend newspapers. Those are done by spending money. Certain persons in the government are blaming me using media institutions being operated from outside the country. If Ven. Sobitha Thera was alive he would definitely felicitate me for appointing a Presidential Commission. Why did we come here? Did we come here to fill-up our pockets? I appointed the Presidential Commission not targeting someone in the government, not targeting ministers or MPs. The people of the country know the confusion prevailed due to the Central Bank incident. Just after 3 months since forming the government, this destruction was initiated. Those who are responsible for that should bear the responsibility".

hits._id: Bond Commission report presented to President

_source.content:
The final report of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry appointed to look into the Central Bank bond issue was handed over to President Maithripala Sirisena today (Dec. 30).
Speaking to our news team, the Secretary of the Commission, Sumathipala Udugamsuriya said that officials of the Commission including its Chairman, K. T. Chithrasiri handed over the report to President at the Presidential Secretariat.
He further stated that the report consists of more than 1,000 pages.
The President appointed the commission on the 27th of January this year to investigate into the Central Bank bond issue.
The tenure of the commission was scheduled to end tomorrow.
The Commission was appointed to look into alleged irregularities that were said to be taken place during the treasury bond issuance on the 27th of February 2015.
The special report produced by the Auditor General highlighted that no measure has been taken to avoid the loss of 1.6 billion rupees incurred to the government during the said bond issuance.
Based on the report of the Auditor General, the Committee on Public Enterprises also conducted an investigation and its report was produced to the Parliament on the 28th of October, 2016.
The Commission first convened on the 6th of February while the current Governor of the Central Bank, Dr. Indrajith Coomaraswamy was testified before the Commission on the 21st of February.
The Secretary to the Ministry of Finance, Chairman of the Committee on Public Enterprises, Auditor General, CEO of Perpetual Treasuries Kasun Palisena, Former Governor of the Central Bank Arjuna Mahendran are among those who were testified before the Commission.
Anika Wijesuriya who testified before the Commission revealed that a company owned by Arjun Aloysius paid the rent for a luxury apartment in which former Minister Ravi Karunanayake resided.
Following the revelation, a no-confidence motion was presented in parliament but Minister Ravi Karunanayake resigned from his portfolio before the motion was taken up for debate.
It is noteworthy that the owner of Perpetual Treasuries Limited, Arjun Aloysius refused to be testified before the Bond Commission.
The Presidential Commission forwarded a questionnaire with 48 questions to Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and the Prime Minister was called to the Commission on the 20th of November for clarifications on his response.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe was the last to be testified before the Bond Commission.
The Presidential Commission conducted its activities for 123 days and its tenure was extended on four separate occasions.
Meanwhile, Minister Chandima Weerakkody stated that the report will be forwarded to the Attorney General for further instructions.

hits._id: Update : US State Secretary John Kerry states that Sri Lanka is heading towards its goals

_source.content:
US Secretary of State John Kerry states that Sri Lanka should take measures to uphold the peace, which was won after ending a 30 years long war, for a long time.
He stated this while addressing a public meeting organized by the Lakshman Kadirgamar International Centre in Colombo this evening.
He also emphasized that it’s the responsibility of the country to protect its hard won peace for the young generation of the country.
US State Secretary also reiterated that his government believes that Sri Lanka has the potential to achieve lasting peace and strong democracy.
US Secretary of the State John Kerry arrived in the island on board a special flight at 7.50 this morning accompanied by a delegation of 35 persons.
The US delegation was welcomed by Foreign Affairs Minister Mangala Samaraweera.
During the media briefing held afterwards, the US Secretary of State stated that Sri Lanka is moving towards its goals while overcoming obstacles.
US Secretary of State John Kerry met Foreign Affairs Minister Mangala Samaraweera at the Ministry of foreign Affairs this morning.
During the media briefing which was held later, US State Secretary expressed his views regarding the talks held with the local foreign affairs minister, adding that he has observed the new government taking bold decisions.
He also stated that Sri Lanka, which is a significant country within the Asian region, will be strongly considered during the most important global decisions.
He also stated that his country is greatly pleased regarding the progress shown by Sri Lanka.
According to the Presidential media unit, US Secretary of State John Kerry met the President at the Presidential Secretariat.In addition, US Secretary of State also met Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe at the Temple Trees this afternoon, and held bilateral talks.
Meanwhile, the US State Secretary who is currently on a tour in Sri Lanka also visited Kelaniya Raja Maha Vihara this evening.
Update : Saturday, 02 May 2015 - 18:58------------------------------------------------US Secretary of State John Kerry arrivesUS Secretary of State John Kerry arrived in Colombo today for his first trip to the country.Kerry will pay a courtesy call on President Maithripala Sirisena and hold discussions with Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and Foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera.This is the first official visit by an US Secretary of State since that of William Pierce Rogers in 1972. Update : Saturday, 02 May 2015 - 8:10------------------------------------------------US Secretary of State John Kerry in Sri Lanka today: Special traffic plan in ColomboUS Secretary of State John Kerry will arrive in Colombo today for his first trip to the country.This is the first official visit by an US Secretary of State since that of William Pierce Rogers in 1972.Secretary of State Colin Powell visited Sri Lanka following the Indian Ocean Tsunami in 2005.Kerry will pay a courtesy call on President Maithripala Sirisena and hold wide ranging discussions with Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and Foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera.Meanwhile, Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekara stated that there will be a special traffic plan in view of the US Secretary of State’s visit.

hits._id: Video : UPFA controlled 4 local government institution budgets defeated at the 2nd vote taking: UNP wins in Passara.

At the same time, uncertainty prevailed about the vote taking of several local government institutions.  The Bulathsinhala Pradeshiya Sabha received only one vote while 11 other members voted against it. Chairman Thusitha Kularatna voted for the budget while all 8 other party members joined the 3 UNP members to defeat the budget. Hingurakkgoda Pradeshiya Sabha budget was also defeated with 3 majority votes and it was defeated with 6 majority votes during the first vote taking. Our correspondent said that 3 UPFA members joined their UNP counterparts to vote for the budget. However the UNP members have voted for the budget after its Chairman M.A. Cader agreed in writing in front of 2 Moulavies to hand over the post to the Deputy Chairman before the 31st March next year. He has stated that the particular agreement would be submitted to the Party General Secretary.

Central Province Chief Minister Sarath Ekanayake said that although this year’s session ended after the presentation of the provincial council budget, this session would be held to inform the Government of the provincial council’s perspective with regard to the super Minister post.

hits._id: Malaysia’s King praises Sri Lanka

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena will conclude his 3 day visit to Malaysia today.The President met with Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak and the King of Malaysia Sultan Mohommad as well.Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak had said that his country is ready to begin several new investments in Sri Lanka. Five MOU’s were signed between the two countries, covering the areas of tourism, youth development, culture, arts and heritage, foreign workers, as well as scientific and technical cooperation.Meanwhile, Malaysia’s King Sultan Mohommad praised the actions taken by the new government and extended his well wishes to Sri Lanka.President Sirisena had explained steps taken with regard to constitutional reforms and economic development while the Malaysian King had assured their fullest support towards Sri Lanka.

hits._id: Final Decision On 23 Local Government Bodies Today

The Ministry of Local Government and Provincial Councils says a final decision on the 23 Local Government bodies of which the official term comes to an end today, will be decided by midnight.
Accordingly a decision on whether the period will be extended or if it will be taken under the leadership of a special commissioner will be announced.
The Ministry said subject Minister Faizer Mustapha is due to engage in discussions with the President and Prime Minister in this regard.
The term of 23 Local Government Institutions comes to an end today.

_source.content: The government suffered a Rs. 236 crore loss due to rice imports in 2014, JVP MP Sunil Handunnetti pointed out in parliament today.

hits._id: President of SL meets PM of India

_source.content: The official meeting between HE the President Maithripala Sirisena who is on the official visit to India and the Prime Minister of India Hon.Naraendra Modi, held today (16) at Hydrabad House in New Delhi.Prime Minister Narendra Modi welcomed  President Maithripala Sirisena and the President accepted  the honour of the people of India.India and Sri Lanka will seek to open a new chapter in ties on Monday with a meeting between PM Narendra Modi and Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena who has chosen India for his maiden visit abroad as president. In a likely big takeaway from the visit, India and Sri Lanka will sign a civil nuclear cooperation agreement. India, TOI learned, has decided to go ahead with civil nuclear cooperation with Sri Lanka following its own "breakthrough understanding" over the same during US President Barack Obama's recent visit. The two countries in the past have held negotiations for a civil nuclear agreement but these lost steam last year under Sirisena's predecessor Mahinda Rajapaksa. With Rajapaksa gone, both India and the US are keen to wean away Sri Lanka from the influence of China.

Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa states that a government will be established sans the concept of National Government.

Former President made this comment during a public meeting held in Badulla yesterday.

hits._id: Several trade unions prepare for a strike

_source.content:
Several trade unions raise their objections for slashing the benefits of working community and imposing more taxes on the general public through the budget.
They are also preparing to launch a token strike on the 15th of this month in protest of these moves by the government.
Convener of the Joint Federation of Nurses, Para Medics and Supplementary health workers unions Saman Rathnapriya stated during a media conference held in Colombo this morning that members of 15 trade unions would join the proposed token strike.
Meanwhile president of the National Trade Union Center K.D. Lal Kantha told during a leaflet distributing campaign held in Colombo Fort this afternoon that trade union actions by his movement would be decided tomorrow.
The All Ceylon Private Bus Owners Association and Lanka Private Bus Owners Association also stated that they are preparing to stage an island wide strike on 15th of this month against the adverse effects befallen on the transport sector by the budget 2016.
Addressing a media conference held in Colombo this morning, General Secretary of the Federation of All Ceylon Bus Owners Association Anjana Priyanjith said that they will launch the strike on December 15th.
Meanwhile Executive officers joint committee which comprise 16 trade unions convened a media conference today to comment on the budget 2016.
Addressing the media, Secretary of the Government Medical Officers Association Dr. Naveen de Soysa said future course of action by his organization would be decided tomorrow.
Meanwhile workers association of the Department of Government Printing has also pledged to support the strike to be launched on December 15th.

hits._id: Petroleum trade unions threaten to strike after July 14th

_source.content: The Petroleum Trade Union Collective threatened to launch a wildcat strike if they are not granted the opportunity to meet with President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe before July 14th.Convener of the collective D.J. Raajakaruna said that the proposed strike is to voice their objections against Trincomalee Oil Tanks being leased to India, also to make it known that they are opposed to the takeover of Oil Tanks at Hambantota Harbour and the overhauling of Sapugaskanda Oil Refinery.

hits._id: "Kidney diseases to be prevented at any cost" - President

_source.content: Every measure to be taken to provide every facility to treat kidney patients as well as to prevent kidney diseases proliferation, stressed President Maithripala Sirisena. On this regard, the Government will take every possible action on behalf of people, without prostrating to multi-national companies (MNCs) or any other market force, he said.The President symbolically handed over the grants to some kidney patients at this occasion.The Preseident Sirisena stressed this while speaking at a ceremony held in Buddhi Mandapaya in Polonnaruwa yesterday (26th) to deliver grants of Rs. 3000.00 to kidney disease victims. The President symbolically handed over the allowances to some kidney patients at the occasion.President Maithripala Sirisena emphasized that the kidney diseases have been stretching its muscles not only in Raja Rata, but also in most rural areas in the country. He pointed out that he would take every possible action without any hesitation to provide quick solutions to this issue.The President pronounced that a sub-committee will be appointed on prevention of kidney diseases. The precautionary measures will be instigated based on the recommendations of the committee comprised of medical specialist, he added.

hits._id: LG polls: SLFP extends Olive branch to Joint Opposition

_source.content:
The Sri Lanka Freedom Party has decided to invite the Joint Opposition as well for the discussion to be held with regard to the forthcoming Local Government election.
The SLFP General Secretary Minister Duminda Dissanayaka said that the SLFP Central Committee has decided to invite all those who contested the previous election along with the SLFP, for the discussion.
The meeting, for which a date is, yet to be fixed, will be held under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena.
Meanwhile, addressing an event in Eppawala yesterday (13), Minister Duminda Dissanayake said that political divisions should be limited only to elections.

hits._id: Hotlines to inform about road blockages and displaced

_source.content:
The Road Development Authority (RDA) has introduced a hotline to report about road blockages, landslide situations near roads and other disasters taking place due to the severe weather conditions.
The RDA is requesting the public to call the hotline- 1968 to provide the information.
Meanwhile, the public can call hotline 1919 and inform President Maithripala Sirisena if government agents or officers have not reached disaster stricken areas yet.
Through ‘Tell the President’ steps will be taken to ensure immediate reliefs to those who affected under the direct intervention of the Secretary to the President P.B. Abeykoon, state media stated.

hits._id: Speaker signs the Right to Information Act

_source.content:
Deputy General Secretary of Parliament Neil Iddalwela stated that the right to information act which was passed in parliament was signed by the speaker this morning.
Minister of parliament reforms, Media, and Chief Government Whip Gayantha Karunathilaka stated at the media briefing that the speaker had signed the act last Tuesday.
Attending a media briefing held yesterday, Joint Opposition MP Dinesh Gunawardena pointed out that the speaker had not yet signed the act.
The right to information bill was passed in parliament on the 24th of June and will now be implemented as a lawful act, as the speaker signed the bill.
Meanwhile Western Provincial Council Chief Minister Isura Devapriya says that the government was able to safeguard the rights of the public by enacting the Right to Information Act.
Addressing an awareness workshop organized for the public officers in Colombo this morning, chief minister Devapriya said the national government concept helped much in getting the Right to Information Bill passed.

Minister Gayantha Karunathilaka stated to Hiru news that the premiere has given instruction to the ministers to do their official work as well in the parliament during the above time period.

hits._id: TNA To Meet President And Premier

_source.content:
A crucial meeting between the government and the main opposition party would be take place in the coming days, Tamil National Alliance (TNA) sources reports.
Tamil National Alliance leader R.Sampanthan led team will meet President Maithiripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wikramasinga and also said they would negotiate.
The Tamil National Alliance (TNA) has decided to exert pressure on the government, urging it to get its act together and stop dilly dallying on whether or not to permit foreign judges in a war crimes probe.
The TNA is of the view that this is the best time to raise this matter, especially as United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights Zeid Al-Hussein is scheduled to present his oral submissions on Sri Lanka on June 29, 2016 at the 32nd session of the UN Human Rights Council, in Geneva.

hits._id: Update: President arrives in India

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena arrived in New Delhi this afternoon for a four-day official visit on an invitation extended to him by the Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.This is President Sirisena's first visit overseas after assuming the office following the January 8th presidential election.In accordance with the usual practice for state visits, the Sri Lankan President will be given a ceremonial welcome by the Indian President at Rashtrapati Bhavan.He will have meetings with the leadership and will be hosted for a state banquet at Rashtrapati Bhavan.The President is scheduled to hold bilateral discussions with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the 16th across a spectrum of issues.Six Sri Lankan fishermen and 27 fishing boats were released from Indian custody in conjunction with President Maithripala Sirisena’s visit to India.87 Indian fishing boats which were seized by the local authority were also released yesterday.Indian government expects the state visit of President Maithripala Sirisena will strengthen India's" warm and friendly" ties to Sri Lanka.After the official discussions tomorrow, the Sri Lankan President is expected to undertake visits to places of religious importance outside New Delhi.   Update: Sunday, 15 February 2015 - 07:20 PM....................................................President arrives in IndiaPresident Maithripala Sirisena arrived in New Delhi this afternoon for a four-day official visit on an invitation extended to him by the Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.This is President Sirisena's first visit overseas after assuming the office following the January 8th presidential election.In accordance with the usual practice for state visits, the Sri Lankan President will be given a ceremonial welcome by the Indian President at Rashtrapati Bhavan.

Subsequently the GMOA will hold an emergency central committee meeting.

hits._id: Malaysia To Study SL's Request For Deportation Of Lankan Prisoners

_source.content:
The Malaysia government will look into Sri Lanka's request to have all Sri Lankan prisoners in Malaysia be deported to their country of origin, the Bernama news reported yesterday (21).
Malaysian Deputy Prime Minister Dr. Ahmad Zahid Hamidi, who is also Home Minister, said the Sri Lankan authority was still negotiating the matter with their Malaysian counterparts as there were 38 Sri Lankan prisoners currently serving their time in Malaysia under the Immigration Act, with 12 others still being held on remand.
"These 50 Sri Lankan nationals were mostly arrested for overstaying in Malaysia or probably for committing other offences under the Immigration Act," he told the Malaysian media in Colombo yesterday (21).
Dr Ahmad Zahid said the Malaysian Government had extended an official invitation to Sri Lanka President Maithripala Sirisena to visit Malaysia in December.

hits._id: No request to recall Sri Lankan High Commissioner

_source.content:
The Ministry of External Affairs states that no request has been intimated by the Indian Central Government to have Sri Lanka’s High Commissioner to India, Prasad Kariyawasam recalled.
 
The Ministry of External Affairs made this remark in reply to recent protest launched in Tamilnadu which urged the Indian Centre to expel the Sri Lanka’s ambassador to the subcontinent.
 
Moreover Director General of the Sri Lankan Ministry of External Affairs expressing his views to our news team noted that the government of Sri Lanka does not recognize the Tamilnadu provincial government on an official capacity.
 
Moreover Bishop of Mannar Rayappu Joseph issuing a release has denounced the recent attacks on Buddhist monks in Tamilnadu.

President Maithripala Sirisena has instructed authorities to complete identifying land for the resettlement of displaced persons in the North by Friday.

Secretary to the President PB Abeykoon, Secretary of Defence Karunasena Hettiarachchi and Secretary to the Ministry of Land IAK Mahanama were also present at the discussion.

Sec. Mahinda Amaraweera, SLFP Gen. Sec. Duminda Dissanayake, UNP Gen. Sec. Kabir Hashim, JVP Leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake, SLMC Leader Rauff Hakeem, Ministers Mano Ganeshan, Palani Digambaram, Faizer Mustapha and EPDP Leader Douglas Devananda took part in the discussion.Meanwhile, Minister Mustapha said the gazette notice establishing Local Government authorities will be issued next week.

hits._id: Dissolution of parliament after passing 20th amendment

_source.content: Government sources say that the President hopes to have the 20th constitutional amendment passed before dissolving parliament.There is speculation in the political circle whether parliament will be dissolved in the near future.However government sources said further that dissolution of parliament had become indecisive till the 20th amendment is passed.Reports say that lengthy discussion was held about this at the cabinet meeting held yesterday.However these sources said that the President was focusing on dissolving parliament soon.Different views are held in political circles on whether parliament will be dissolved or not. At the same time, SLFP Media Spokesman and former minister Dilan Perera said that the parliament should be dissolved after passing the 20th Amendment.He stated this during a media conference convened by Socialist People Front in Colombo last afternoon.

hits._id: Appointment of new CJ to take place tomorrow

_source.content:
Government sources state that the newly appointed Chief Justice would be sworn in tomorrow evening.

Accordingly former Attorney General Mohan Peiris is most probably set to be sworn in as the new Chief Justice.

The name of Mohan Peiris had been directed to the Parliamentary Council yesterday by President Mahinda Rajapaksa.

The parliamentary Council is set to discuss the matter tomorrow evening & notify of its decision subsequently.

Meanwhile according to emerging reports Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe and parliamentarian D.M. Swaminathan are unlikely to take part in tomorrow's parliamentary council sessions.

According to the 18th amendment to the constitution the composition of parliamentary council includes the Speaker, President, Premier, Opposition Leader and two MP's both from the opposition as well as the government representing minorities.

However it is reported that neither Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe nor parliamentarian D.M. Swaminathan have attended a single session of the parliamentary council.

However former Chief Justice Sarath N. Silva expressing his views to our news team stated that most probably a Supreme Court Magistrate would be appointed as the new Chief Justice due to the prevailing circumstances.

hits._id: Minister Wijedasa Rajapaksha attends UNP working committee meeting

_source.content:
Deputy minister of national policies and economic affairs, Dr. Harsha de Silva says the entire UNP working and parliamentary groups fiercely criticized minister Wijedasa Rajapaksha for his recent statements. The deputy minister said in a message appeared in his twitter account that UNP group criticized the minister for about two hours. But the minister has said that he did nothing wrong. Minister Wijedasa has told the gathering that he can do nothing to speed up legal action against corruption. According to the deputy minister no one had accepted the explanation. Minister Wijedasa has also said that he had never said that he would not look back until he cancels the 'Hambantota Port Deal'. The meeting of the UNP working and parliamentary groups began at the UNP headquarters, Sirikotha in Pita Kotte at around 10.30am today. Party leader prime minister Ranil Wickremesinghe chaired the meeting.updated on 17/08/17 at 3.56pm...
UNP central working committee and party parliamentary group meeting was held at party headquarters Sirikotha.
It was held under the patronage of party leader prime minister Ranil Wickremesinghe
A senior UNP minister said that minster Dr. Wijedasa Rajapaksha who were criticized by his party colleagues, over the last few days, was also present.

hits._id: Many proposals from doctors regarding SAITM - President appoints a committee of experts

_source.content: The GMOA at a press briefing convened after a meeting with President Maithripala Sirisena stated that several proposals were made to the president on the issue with regard to SAITM and protecting the rights of patients. Representatives from the Government Medical Officers’ Association and the Government Dental Surgeons’ Association met with President Maithripala Sirisena this morning at the President’s House. At the meeting, President Maithreepala Sirisena has stated that a committee of experts will be appointed to advice in order to solve the issue with regard to the Malabe- SAITM private medical university. Representatives of the associations have provided descriptive facts regarding the matter to the president. The President has assured to consider proposals and recommendations from all parties as well as opinions from scholars representing a spectrum of fields in proposing a solution to the matter. Accordingly, the president has noted that a decision will be made based on the recommendations of the committee of experts. Meanwhile, the GMOA had listed the proposals presented to the president under 6 main facts including the Minister of Health acting as per the Medical Ordinance respecting the technical decision of the Medical Council.  Furthermore, they have listed the duties of the medical council in protecting the rights of patients as well as the conduct of the ministers of Higher Education and Health with regard to the SAITM issue. The Government Dental Surgeons’ Association also has presented several long term and short term proposals with regard to solving these issues. The Minister of Highways and Higher Education, Lakshman Kiriella stated that the Medical Council was stubborn with regard to the SAITM issue. He expressed these views speaking to media following a ceremony held in Kandy today. The Inter University Students’ Federation and the Medical Faculty Student Activists’ Committee also expressed their views regarding the Malabe private medical college at a press briefing convened in Colombo today.

hits._id: Upcountry people's front divides.

_source.content: Leader of the upcountry people’s front Shanthini Chandrasekaran states that they would support President Mahinda Rajapakse in the forthcoming Presidential election.However, MP V Radakrishnan who represents the upcountry people’s front stated that they would support Common candidate Mathripala Sirisena.Workers National front and Upcountry people’s front decided to support common candidate Maithripala Sirisena on the 10th.Accordingly, deputy Minister’s Palani Digambaran and V Radakrishnan resigned from the portfolios.

hits._id: President to open tallest building in Jaffna

_source.content:
President Mahinda Rajapaksa will ceremonially open the Central Functioning Building complex built at Jaffna Teaching Hospital this morning on the invitation of Health Minister Maithripala Sirisena.

The building complex which cost 2,870 million rupees was built with the assistance of Japan International Cooperation Agency.

This is the second hospital project to be opened under the Health Ministry's 2013 - 2017 five year health development plan.

hits._id: Praises for Sri Lanka at UN General Assembly

_source.content:
At the 71st United Nations general assembly, the UN Secretary General and the USA offered accolades to the progress Sri Lanka has achieved under the current Government.
Reports from the UNGA state that, in addition, the Indian and the Canadian delegations participating in the session also praised Sri Lanka.
In addition during the discussion held with the US Secretary of State John Kerry, he promised President Maithripala Sirisena, that the US will continue to provide assistance.
Meanwhile, the Canadian delegation said that its attention had been drawn on the reconstruction activities currently taking place here in Sri Lanka.
It was also mentioned that the Canadian government had expressed its pleasure with the progress being made here.
The 71st United Nations general assembly will conclude on 28th this month, until which time the world leaders will continue discussions on sustainable development.

hits._id: One million dollars allocated for the conservation of Kapilavastupura

_source.content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe states that they will offer US$1,000,000 to Nepal for the conservation of Kapilavastupura Archaeological site.The amount will be offered from the cash received by renting out the Hambantota Port to a Chinese Company. The premier made this remark at a religious event held in a temple in Galnewa in Anuradhapura yesterday.

hits._id: A new controlled price on local rice

_source.content:
Minister of Industry and Commerce Rishad Bathiudeen stated that a controlled price for local rice will be decided on today.
It has been reported that several complaints were filed by consumers with regard to the sale of rice at exorbitant prices.
The government recently imposed a controlled price on imported rice but did not make changes to the price of local rice.
During a meeting held with President Maithripala Sirisena and rice producers, it was decided that two separate controlled prices would be imposed.
Accordingly, minister Bathiudeen noted that the controlled price on local rice will be decided on today.

hits._id: Petty Political Agendas Hinder Good Projects Under Any Regime – Says The President

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena stated that petty political agendas come into force under any government, whenever good projects are implemented.
The President stated this while addressing the opening ceremony of the special centre for organic farming at the Makandura Agricultural Research Centre in Pannala yesterday.
The program was initiated under the national program to produce toxic free foods.
Meanwhile, the government’s initiative to offer cash in place of fertilizer subsidy to the farmers, was also launched during this ceremony.
Addressing the gathering, Minister of Agriculture Duminda Dissanayake said that funds will be deposited to the respective accounts of 590,000 farmers by tomorrow.

Vigneswaran states that the dream of turning Sri Lanka to another Singapore can be realized, if steps are taken to build peace and harmony among Sinhalese, Tamils and Muslims.Speaking in Sinhala, the Chief Minister expressed his views at a ceremony held in Jaffna under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga.Quoting the popular statement made by Singapore Prime Minister Lee Kuan Yew in 1948, that he would turn Singapore into Sri Lanka, Northern PC Chief Minister stated that Sri Lanka can be taken to a good position if everyone would think in such manner.The residents of Jaffna warmly welcomed the political delegation led by President Maithripala Sirisena during the ceremony held today at Walalai in Jaffna.The ceremony was held to release 425 acres of land to their original owners under the first phase of releasing 1000 acres of lands that were held earlier by the army.

hits._id: New cabinet likely to take oaths tomorrow

_source.content:
It has been reported that the cabinet reshuffle which had been delayed over the last few weeks will take place tomorrow morning (May 01).
 
Government sources say that tomorrow the new cabinet is to take oaths before President Maithreepala Sirisena and the cabinet meeting will be held in the evening.
 
At a function held last Friday in Dambulla, the President had noted that the new cabinet will take oaths on International Labour Day.
 
The President had also stated that there will be a change in the Ministry of Buddha Sasana following the cabinet reshuffle.
 
He went on to say that after the cabinet reshuffle, there will be a scientific based allocation of subjects within the ministries.
 
The President had previously stated that following the Local Government elections on 10th of February, a cabinet reshuffle will take place, however, this was delayed by several weeks.
 
Meanwhile, 6 Ministers of the SLFP resigned from their portfolios two weeks ago.
 
Meanwhile, the General Secretary of the UPFA, Minister Mahinda Amaraweera attending a function held in Tangalle yesterday noted that he was alerted that the cabinet reshuffle might take place today.
 
Participating at a media briefing held in Hambantota yesterday, MP Wijepala Hettiarachchi said that the cabinet reshuffle would take place during next few days.
 
The JVP stated that the government was carrying out a cabinet reshuffle to distract and conceal the current economic crisis in the country.

hits._id: Hijacked vessel heading towards Bosaso port after it was released by Somali pirates; - Sri Lankan crew hale HIRU while sharing the ordeal

_source.content: The Sri Lanka crew of the hijacked vessel Aries-13 which was released by Somali pirates shared their ordeal with HIRU media. They joined in a telephone conversation with HIRU while the vessel was heading towards Bosaso port. Chief Engineer of Aries-13, Jayantha Kalubowila said that the pirates reached their vessel in the guise of fishermen and later overpowered the vessel. The crew of the hijacked vessel told our news team yesterday that nearly 70 Somali pirates were on board. The crew also requested our news team to inform the Sri Lankan government to intervene in the matter and talk to Somali government and urge Somali authorities to remove their security cordon from the hijacked vessel as it could risk the lives of the Sri Lankan crew as well. Later, President Maithripala Sirisena directly intervened in the matter and ordered the Navy Commander to take necessary action with immediate effect. Accordingly, Joint Naval Brigade communicated with the Somali Marine Police and informed to stop firing at the hijacked vessel. Sri Lanka Foreign Ministry also mediated in the efforts to rescue the Sri Lankan crew from the clutches of pirates. Chief Engineer of the Vessel Jayantha Kalubowila express his gratitude to the parties including HIRU News staff for taking prompt action to save them from an imminent calamity.

hits._id: Many relief from the budget; Prices of 11 essential goods including Gas, Kerosene and Local Milk Powder reduced

_source.content:
The budget 2016 presented to Parliament yesterday by Minister of Finance Ravi Karunanayake included many important line items.

The tax which is charged on transferring lands to foreigners will be removed completely, and the super tax would also be removed. 

The Vehicle Emission Test chargers has also been increased up to 5000 Rupees.

Several new proposals have been made to encourage the payment of revenue tax.

The prices of 11 essential goods have been reduced while the Special Goods Tax on Potatoes and Big Onions has been reduced by 25 Rupees.

The price of a domestic LPG gas cylinder has been reduced by 150 rupees, while the price of a litre of kerosene has been reduced by 10 rupees.

The budget also proposed to give a certified price of 50 rupees for a kilogram of Keeri Samba, 48 rupees for Samba and 38 rupees for a kilogram of Nadu.

However, a fertilizer subsidy of 25 thousand rupees would be introduced for small scale farmers and keeping it under a ceiling of one hectare per farmer.

The import duty on cranes and concrete mixtures will also be removed and a 10 thousand rupees allowance has been proposed to be paid for the trainees in the construction industry.

At the same time, 1500 million rupees would be granted to set up village development clusters at every Grama Seva division. 

The import tax on printed books and magazines has been completely removed and university students will be granted loans to buy laptop computers. 

It was also proposed to increase the number of Police stations from 428 to 600.

The Gaming tax has been increased up to 400 Million Rupees and the one day passport service fee has been increased from 7,500 Rupees to 10,000 Rupees.

A new proposal was included that every vehicle entering the city needs to carry a minimum of 4 passengers and failing which a tax will have to be paid while parking facilities is to be provided by the government in several locations.

Vehicle permits issued for Parliamentarians and State Officials cancelled
 
The budget 2016 presented to Parliament yesterday by Minister of Finance Ravi Karunanayake included many important line items.

A speciality was that the Tax Free permits issued for Parliamentarians and Government Officials has been cancelled.

hits._id: Rapid development of Dengue virus is due to the severe dry weather-Video

_source.content: The Epidemiology Unit stated that the reason for the rapid development of Dengue virus is due to the severe dry weather in Ratnapura urban area.Due to this reason, the water level of reservoirs has receded to an extremely low level and water has been collected in the midst of the reservoirs.According to the Entomological officers, these areas are turning into breeding grounds for the mosquitoes.Meanwhile, speaking during an awareness program for the North Western Province government officials, the Health Minister Maithripala Sirisena stated that the Dengue prevention programs should be essentially implemented in all schools at least once a month.

hits._id: Presidential Committee to probe power outage

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has appointed a special committee to probe into the sudden island-wide outage.
He recommended the government must take immediate action to rectify the situation.
The new committee comprises of Minister of Power and Renewable Energy Ranjith Siyambalapitiya and Minsiters Susil Premajayantha, Patali Chamika Ranawaka and Deputy Ministers Eran Wickramaratne and Ajith P. Perera.
Issuing a communiqué, the Presidential Media Division said that the committee’s first report is scheduled to be submitted to the President within a week.
The report should include recommendations necessary for carrying out services in a manner that public work is not negatively affected and rectifying the issues within the power sector.
While the special presidential committee is scheduled to perform necessary action within approximately three months, they are being encourage to obtain the assistance of experienced persons and experts in power and energy sector.
Meanwhile, the special presidential committee will be meeting at the ministry at 3.00p.m. today.
The CEB Chairman Anura Wijepala said that people will be notified if more power cuts would take place till Norochcholai Power Plant is fixed.

hits._id: President and the Prime Minister meet ahead of Cabinet reshuffle

_source.content:
A meeting between President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe was held ahead of the proposed Cabinet reshuffle tomorrow (May 01).
 
The two leaders met at the funeral of the father-in-law of UNP General Secretary, Akila Viraj Kariyawasam, and former Wayamba Provincial Councilor B. M. Wijenayake.
 
Having paid the last respect to the mortal remains of late Wijenayake, the President and the Prime Minister met in a separate room at the residence.
 
It is reported that UNP General Secretary, Akila Viraj Kariyawasam, and Minister Daya Gamage also participated in the meeting.
 
Meanwhile, political sources stated that the proposed Cabinet reshuffle will be conducted at 10 am tomorrow at the Presidential Secretariat.
 
All the ministers have been informed to be present at the Presidential Secretariat by 9:30 am tomorrow.
 
It is reported that the cultural portfolio currently being held by Akila Viraj Kariyawasam would be changed.
 
At the same time, political sources stated that Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe who was asked to resign from his ministry portfolio will be reappointed as a Cabinet Minister.
 
In addition, the ministry portfolios which fell vacant after the resignation of 6 SLFP Ministers will be filled tomorrow.

Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) Bikkhu Organization Chairman Rakava Jinarathana Thera called President Maithripala Sirisena to handover the leadership of the party to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.

Jinarathana Thera said that he has nothing against Sirisena functioning as the President of the country. His fear is for the party that might be divided due to the differences that have arisen, he added.

hits._id: Party leaders meet to take a decision on Navi Pillai's committee.-Video

_source.content: A special party leaders’ meeting is currently being held at the parliament complex.This meeting has been convened to fix a date to debate the government’s proposal whether the Navi Pillai’s UN Committee is allowed to enter the country in order to investigate the alleged human rights violation in Sri Lanka.The government sources stated that the debate will be included to the agenda and debated during the sessions to be commenced with effect from 17th of this month.A proposal signed by nine ruling party MPs to check the parliament opinion whether the Navi Pillai’s UN Committee is allowed to enter the country and investigate the alleged human rights violations was submitted recently to the Parliament Secretary General.Parliament Secretary General Dhammika Dasanayake said the proposal will be entered in to the parliament agenda list as soon as possible.He said it should remain in the list for five days and a date for debating will be decided during a party leaders’ meeting on the importance and necessity of the issue.Meanwhile JVP stated recently the government’s decision to check the parliament opinion over Navi Pillai’s Committee is an escape route to slip from the responsibility.The TNA also stated recently the government will have to face serious problems if parliament takes a decision to not allow the investigators to enter the country.Meanwhile UNP has also stated they have no objection over the government decision to check parliament opinion on the Pillai matter but first of all the government should announce its stand.However Opposition Chief Organizer MP John Amaratunga said the party will study the matter and take a decision when its parliamentary group meets on the 17th.

hits._id: Indian Premier Modi pledges full support to SL in its quest for justice: UN Secretary General request India to support the democratic transition

_source.content: UN Secretary General Ban Ki Moon has noted India’s influential role in Sri Lanka, during talks he had with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.The UN said that the UN Chief underlined India’s influential role in supporting the democratic transition in Sri Lanka.Meanwhile, President Maithripala Sirisena is scheduled to meet UN Secretary General Ban Ki Moon today.Noting a “sea change” in the approach of the new Sri Lankan government over the issue of alleged war crimes during the last phase of the war, India has said it supports the quest for justice while being respectful of the country’s sovereignty.The issue of human rights and the situation pertaining to the ongoing discussions on U.N. Human Rights Council came up during a meeting between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Maithripala Sirisena on the sidelines of the UNGA summit yesterday.External Affairs Minister spokesman Vikas Swarup said after the meeting the Sri Lankan Government is “engaging” with the UN Human Rights Council and there is a “sea change” in the approach of the new government.When asked about India’s position on hybrid court, Swarup said New Delhi would have to look at the final outcome of the draft resolution as he hoped that it would be a consensus and acceptable to the Sri Lankan Government.Complementing the Sri Lankan President on the two elections in the country, Modi said this revealed the deep rooted democratic traditions and the faith that the people of Sri Lanka had in the democracy.

hits._id: FM to discuss the report on Sri lanka with UNHRC commissioner today

_source.content:
Foreign minister Mangala Samaraweera is scheduled participate in a high level UN Human Rights Council session tomorrow. 

The foreign minister would also meet UN Human Rights Commissioner Seid Rad Al Hussein today.

Minister Samaraweera will be discussing the report prepared by the UNHRC with the UNHRC commissioner.

Meanwhile, The Hindu newspaper reported that the U.N. probe report on alleged war crimes committed during the final phase of the war has been handed over to the Sri Lankan government.

The report, scheduled for public release during the 30th Session of the UN Human Rights Council which kicks off tomorrow in Geneva, was received by the government day before yesterday.

The presentation of the report was deferred until this month by the UNHRC as a goodwill gesture towards the government of President Maithripala Sirisena.

The Hindu quoted sources saying that Sri Lanka has five days to make its response in writing.

The report and Sri Lanka’s response would be submitted at the UNHRC session only at the end of this month.

hits._id: HR Watch calls on SL to fulfil commitment to UNHRC

_source.content:
Human Rights Watch said the Sri Lankan government should fulfill its commitments to the United Nations Human Rights Council by ensuring that foreign judges and prosecutors play a significant role in the mandated accountability mechanism for wartime abuses.
On January 21st, President Maithripala Sirisena told the BBC, that he will "never agree to international involvement".
After adoption of the resolution, Sri Lanka told the council that it was pleased to join as a co-sponsor “as a further manifestation of Sri Lanka’s commitment to implement the provisions of the resolution, in a manner that its objectives are shared by the people and all stakeholders in the country, for their benefit".
Human Rights Watch, Asia director, Brad Adams said The Sri Lankan government sought international involvement to ensure justice and accountability so there’s no excuse for backtracking.

hits._id: Every possible step will be taken to overcome the challengers in the Health Sector -President

President Maithripala Sirisena said that the Government will take every possible step to provide a quality health service to all its citizens by overcoming the challenges in the health sector.
Participating in a ceremony to declare open the new seven-storey ward complex at the Kandy General Hospital, the President said the Government will provide required physical and human resources as well as take steps to implement the necessary policies to improve the health services in the country.
Health Minister Rajitha Senarathna states that there is no medicines scarcity in the country at present.
However, Minister Rajitha Senerathna stated that during the past even Polio vaccinations were not available due to mistakes committed by officials.
He made this comment participating in a ceremony to declare open the new seven-storey ward complex at the Kandy General Hospital.

He further revealed that discussions are ongoing to make Basil Rajapaksha the Prime Minister in near future.
According to the Minister, former Defense Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksha has flew overseas due to the disappointment caused by being acquainted with the plot which is still unaware by former president Rajapakha.

hits._id: President orders not to sell imported rice for more than 76 rupees per kilo.

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has reiterated that imported rice should not be sold at more than 76 rupees per kilogram.
The President has announced this at the meeting with the Presidential Special Task force he appointed to provide relief to those affected by the drought this afternoon.
He stated that price of rice cannot be increased according to the whim and fancy of private traders and millers thereby inconveniencing the masses.
He also reiterated that merchants should ensure to only import stocks which are suitable for human consumption.
The president also instructed officials of the Paddy Marketing Board to submit a report stating of the already released government buffer stocks have been milled and supplied to the market.
The president also revealed that Indonesian government has responded positively to his personal request and pledged to provide 10 thousand metric tons of rice to Sri Lanka within the next few weeks.
The short and long term agenda of the government to face the consequences from the impending drought were discussed during the meeting.
Meanwhile, President Sirisena requested all private sector business entities and other institutions to assist in saving energy by not illuminating propaganda and other entertainment devices.
He said it is the duty of all citizens to act responsibly in order to avoid an energy crisis that may occur in the future.

hits._id: SLFP Chairman is Mahinda Rajapaksa ; Says Anura yapa

_source.content: The Central Committee of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party convened today for the first time after the Presidential Election under the patronage of former President Mahinda Rajapakse.The meeting, commenced at 4.00pm today and several key issues including the party’s future course of action are likely to be discussed at the gathering. Former Ministers Anura Priyadarshana Yapa, Susil Premajayantha, Kumara Welgama, Rathnasiri Wickramanayaka, Dilan Perera, Dallas Allahaperuma, Mahinda Samarasingha and several chief Ministers were present at the meeting.Meanwhile former Ministers Sarath Amunugama , Piyasena Gamage , Faizer Mustapa , S.B. Nawinna , Reginold Corray , Vijith Vijyamuni Soysa , Jagath Pushpakumara , Janaka Bandara  and Athavuda Senevirathne including North Western Province Chief Minister Dayasiri Jayasekara , held a press briefing at the residence of President Maithripala Sirisena in Wijayarama Mawatta , Colombo .Speaking at the briefing former deputy minister Faizer said: "President of SLFP and Secretary of the party contested in the Presidential election and Secretary emerged victorious. According to this in the SLFP Central Committee meeting held today , President Maithripala SiriSena was appointed as the President of the party while President Mahinda Rajapksa and Chandrika Bandara Nayake Kumarathunga were elected to be the patrons of the party."He also added that Duminda Dissanayake to assume duties as the General Secretary of the SLFP.Duminda Dissanayake  and K.A.D.S. Gunawardana were also present at the briefing.

hits._id: President meets Malaysian PM

_source.content:
Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak officially welcomed President Maithripala Sirisena, who arrived in Malaysia on Thursday, for a three-day visit, at Perdana Putra in Putrajaya today.
Prime Minister Najib Razak greeted President Sirisena on arrival at 10 am on Friday and the national anthems of both countries were played respectively.
The Sri Lankan President then inspected a guard-of-honor mounted by 103 officers and men from the 1st Battalion Royal Malay Regiment.
President Sirisena, was then introduced to the cabinet ministers, senior government officials and foreign diplomats and both leaders held discussions to identify potential areas for future collaboration.
Five memoranda of understanding are to be signed between the two countries, covering the areas of tourism, youth development, culture, arts and heritage, foreign workers, as well as scientific and technical cooperation.
President Sirisena’s visit is expected to provide a new impulse to the bilateral cooperation that would strengthen and elevate relations between Malaysia and Sri Lanka.

hits._id: AUSTRALIA TO HELP SRI LANKA TACKLE DENGUE

_source.content: Australia has come forward to help Sri Lanka in combatting dengue menace, which has already killed over 275 persons in the country this year.The Australian support will be officially announced during Foreign Minister Julie Bishop’s visit to Sri Lanka later this week.She announced that will meet President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, Minister Ravi Karunanayake and other ministers during her two-day stay in Sri Lanka to discuss security cooperation and explore new economic opportunities in science, resources, and energy.She said, “President Sirisena and I will announce Australian assistance to combat dengue fever in Sri Lanka and discuss progress on the implementation of Sri Lanka's reconciliation process, which is critical to its long-term security and prosperity”.

hits._id: Local Government Ministry Confused Over A Letter From The Election Commission

_source.content:
The Ministry of Local Government and Provincial Councils released a communiqué today saying the Chairman of the Election Commission has made a false statement.
It stated that the Chairman of the Election Commission Mahinda Deshapriya has enquired in a letter addressed to the Secretary to the Local Government and Provincial Councils Ministry Kamal Padmasiri, regarding the divisions that have delimitation issues.
Reports indicated that the Election Commissioner has mentioned regarding the matter during a media conference held on the 20th of this month.
However, the Ministerial Secretary Kamal Padmasiri stated in his communiqué today that he did not receive such a letter from the Election Commissioner.
He says that he received only a copy of a letter addressed to the Chairman of the Delimitation Commission Asoka Peries.
When our news team contacted the Election Commission with regard to the matter, a Commission spokesman said various parties have enquired about the postponement of local government polls by the Election Commission.
Accordingly, the Election Commission’s Chairman has sent a letter to Delimitation Commission’s Chairman Asoka Peiris on June 11th.
In his letter to Asoka Peiris, Election Commission’s Chairman has asked Peiris to provide clear explanation regarding the divisions, where the investigations have been concluded over the previous disputes.
A copy of the letter addressed to the Delimitation Commission Chairman was also sent to Local government and Provincial Councils Ministry Secretary, asking him to provide the relevant information.
The Election Commission has not received any feedback although over a month has been lapsed already.
A spokesman from the Election Commission stated that the Commissioner has mentioned about the relevant letter and the officials to whom he sent copies of the letter.
He said that nothing else had occurred during the media conference held on June 20th.
Chairman of the Election Commission Mahinda Deshapriya told our news team that he is not ready to respond to communiqués issued by a public official.
He further said that he will discuss the matter with the members of the Commission and inform the respective authorities.Watch the video below...

hits._id: President talks about SL's war crime allegations with Al Jazeera

_source.content:
In an interview for a well known segment of the Al Jazeera media network- Talk to Al-Jazeera, the president Maithripala Sirisena has rather contradicted key findings of UN investigation into Sri Lanka’s civil war, the report released in September last year.
The report from the United Nations Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) investigated atrocities committed by both the Tamil separatists- the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) and the Sri Lankan Army during the 26-year-long conflict.
According to the President who was then a cabinet minister, the Sri Lankan government forces have always acted in adherence to international law and according to the laws of the government of Sri Lanka. While doing so, if a member or officer of the armed forces of the Sri Lankan government has committed offences, these investigations are aimed at finding out such instances. So if offences have been committed by an individual, we will clearly take legal action.
In detailing its principal findings, the OHCHR report stated: "If established before a court of law, many of these allegations would amount, depending on the circumstances, to war crimes and/or crimes against humanity."
Speaking to Al Jazeera's Hoda Abdel-Hamid, the Head-of-the-State has rejected the allegations.
According to International Media, President Maithripala Sirisena has stated: "I must say very clearly there are no allegations regarding 'war crimes', there were war crimes allegations during the early stages. But at the United Nations Human Rights Council in Geneva, mainly in the proposals presented in September, there were no 'war crimes' allegations against us.”
To clarify further, the president has continued to say: "they contained allegations of human rights violations only. When you consider the facts surrounding the allegations of human rights

hits._id: Investigations conclude in the Matara Hospital regarding amputation of law student's left arm

_source.content:
The inquiry regarding the amputation of the left arm of law student Achala Priyadharshani who was admitted to the Matara General  Hospital following a fracture has been concluded.

She was transferred to the Colombo General Hospital after she developed a severe pain in her arm which was bandaged at the Matara General Hospital.

Due to the nerve damage in her arm, the doctors in the Colombo   General Hospital had amputated her arm.

The ministry of health had appointed two teams to inquire into the incident and one team comprised of 3 specialist doctors.

Speaking to our news team Medical Services Director of the Ministry of health Dr. Lal Panapitiya gave the following update on the inquiry.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   

A group of law students from the faculty of law in the Colombo  University has lodged a complaint at the Human Rights Commission stating that her human rights were violated.

Senior Attorney at Law and Commissioner of the Human Rights Commission Prathiba Mahanamahewa provided the following update with regard to the investigation of the complaint.


			   
			   		
	
			   

Various parties are blaming the doctors who treated Achala Priyadharshani and holding them responsible for the amputation of her left arm.

However, the Government Medical Officers Association is stating that it is unfair to level accusations until the investigation is concluded.

The media spokesperson of the GMOA Dr. Naveen De Soyza expressed his views in the following manner.


			   
			   		
	
			   

Minister of health Maithreepala Sirisena had visited Achala Priyadharshani recently at the Colombo General Hospital and opposition leader Ranil Wickramasinghe had visited her today at the hospital.


			   
			   		
	
			   

Former vice chancellor of the Colombo University and former Dean of the Law Faculty Prof. G. L. Peiris' attention has also turned towards the plight of Achala Priyadharshani.

The Colombo Law Faculty Students union was scheduled to meet the minister today.

The Colombo law faculty has established a fund to obtain a prosthetic arm for Achala Priyadharshani under the theme An Arm for Achala, Justice for Negligence".

Those who wish to donate funds can do so by calling 071 51 14 139, 071 88 25 329 and 071 22 40 405.

hits._id: Budget 2017; State focuses on economic development

_source.content:
The anticipated Budget 2017 was presented in Parliament by Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake yesterday.
It was the second budget of the Good Governance government and the 70th one of Sri Lanka.
President Maithripala Sirisena was also present in the chambers as Minister Karunanayake announced the budget for over three hours.
At the conclusion of the speech he said that the government is focused on achieving a seven per cent economic growth next year.
Highlights of next year’s budget was the reduction of LP Gas by Rs. 25, a kilo of sugar by Rs. 2, kilo of dhal and green gram by Rs. 10 and Rs. 15 respectively. A kilo of sprats and potatoes were also reduced by Rs. 5 each.
The Finance Minister also said that an additional grant of Rs. 17.84 billion rupees was allocated for the education sector.
Meanwhile, government ministers were quoted saying that next year’s budget is focused on economic prosperity of the country.
Several MPs from other parties showed concerned about the budget stating that it would burden the people, especially the working class.Following is the summary of Budget 2017100% capital allowance on investment in sugar manufacturing factories2% CESS on import of Sugar, 5% on import of EthanolAdvanced Level students and Advanced Level teachers to receive Tablet ComputersRoC will be opened all 7 abolishedProposal to create a Real Estate investment trust Special board for listing of SMEs at CSE to be introducedA special SEC Act to be introducedRemove conditions applicable for foreigners on ownership of ground floor condominiumsA special Colombo Stock Exchange Act to be introducedForeigners eligible to buy condominiums with a loan of upto 40% of the valueHighway Toll charges to be reduced by Rs.50 between 9.00pm to 5.00amCapital Gains Tax to be introduced from April 2017PAYE tax will apply on earnings more than LKR 100,000 per month Withholding Tax on InterestIncome increased to 5 % Telecommunication Levy to be increased by 25%Corporate income tax comprises of three layers; 14%, 28% and 40% 14%- SME, Education, Agriculture, Export, Inv Funds 28%- Trade & Manufacturing, Banking & Finance, Insurance 40%- Tobacco & Liquor, Betting & Gaming, CasinoCarbon Tax will be introducedRevision in rate of Capital AllowanceTax on dividends increased to 14%A rebate will be given equal to 75% of income tax attributable to foreign currency earnings in excess of a 15% increase from Y/A 2016/17 vis-à-vis Y/A 2015/16WHT of 5% will be imposed on specified fee of more than LKR 50,000 per monthThe period of appeal hearing at the Tax Appeal Commission will reduce to 6 months from 24 monthsA Capital Gain Tax will be imposed at the rate of 10% on gains realized from disposable hits._id: President clarifies story behind National Economic Council

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says he has decided to set up a National Economic Council to streamline the management of the country's economy.
He said the objectives of NEC is to increase the country's export income by developing the local industries.
He expressed these views speaking at the annual Planning Award Ceremony of the Ceylon National Chamber of Industries, in Colombo.
The president said the World Bank, International Monetary Fund, local and international economic specialists have also recommended to set up this advisory council.
President Sirisena had emphasized that the government will not sign any free trade agreement that will affect the local industries and entrepreneurs negatively.
He said some groups that are not related to the business sector are instilling fear amongst business community by spreading false information.

hits._id: 22 million rupees from China to provide relief; An aircraft carrying relief items arrives in the island

_source.content: The Buddhist Association of China donated 22 million rupees to President Maithripala Sirisena this morning in order to provide relief to those affected by the inclement weather. President Maithripala Sirisena stated that the donation will be used to reconstruct the houses that were damaged due to the adverse weather conditions. The president has further stated that such supportive measures extended by the Chinese government strengthen the long standing bilateral relations between the two countries.  Meanwhile, a special aircraft carrying relief items from China for those affected by the inclement weather, arrived at Katunayake International Airport this afternoon. Our correspondent at the airport stated that the aircraft has brought relief materials worth over 2.2 million US dollars. 600 tents, 5,000 bed sheets, 20,000 life jackets and 1,000 safety shoes are among the relief items received. Minister of Foreign Affairs Ravi Karunanayake as well as the Minster of Disaster Management, Anura Priyadarshana Yapa were present at the airport to receive the relief materials. Our correspondent at the airport stated that the Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka was also present representing the Government of China. Meanwhile, the ships Chang Chun, Jing Zhou and Chao Hu of the Chinese Navy that carried relief materials for those affected by the inclement weather, departed the port of Colombo today.  Sri Lanka Navy stated that the ships brought 5 medical teams and 10 small boats to assist in disaster relief operations.

hits._id: This is how to take advantage from Mattala

_source.content:
The Prime Minister (PM) Ranil Wickramasinghe states that steps will be taken to take maximum benefits from Mattala international Airport and the Hanbanthota harbor.

hits._id: Service organizations can strengthen the government- PM

_source.content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe believes service organizations can play a vital role in government action.
Addressing the Rotary International Convention in Seoul, South Korea, the Prime Minister said that with many nations still recovering from the Great Recession, organizations like Rotary can help fill in the gaps.
He said that fiscal stress has led to cutbacks and uncertainty in government spending, particularly in the social sector.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe also said that another role that service organizations can play is to officially act as an oversight body on the function of a government establishment in their field of expertise.
By this he said that government establishments would need to pull up their socks, leading to greater efficiency and productivity.
Meanwhile, UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon said that Rotary has an invaluable partnership with the UN and expressed his gratitude for the efforts put in to eradicate polio.

hits._id: Reconsider the revision of VAT – a request from former President Mahinda

_source.content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says that the current government has oppressed the people by increasing the Value Added Tax. Releasing a communiqué, the former President further stated that the government has gazetted a Draft Bill to increase the current VAT by 36%.He also stated that the government still has time to reconsider the increase in VAT as it will oppress the masses, as it will add to the cost of private health services by 15%.The communiqué released by former President Mahinda Rajapaksa stated that VAT was charged only from super markets which recorded a daily turnover of Rs. 2.8 million during his rule, but the current government has extended it to small retail shops.

hits._id: Bangladesh To Send Aid For Sri Lanka Flood Victims

_source.content:
Bangladesh will send emergency relief aid to Sri Lanka in the wake of floods and landslides in the country as a follow-up to Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina’s directive.
“A special Bangladesh air force aircraft will carry the materials today (Friday). We are sending materials worth over Tk 100 million in line with the needs of Sri Lanka,” the minister, who did not wish to be named, told foreign media.
Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR) in a media invitation to cover the event later said a C-130 aircraft carrying emergency relief items would leave Dhaka on Friday morning.
The health ministry in a statement said it had prepared a list of drugs to be sent to Sri Lanka following the prime minister’s instructions.
The drugs include oral saline and water purifying tablets.
About 400,000 Sri Lankans have been affected by floods and landslides since last week. Over 200 people were killed.
The prime minister earlier extended her condolences in a message to President Maithripala Sirisena.
She reaffirmed Bangladesh's solidarity and support for the government as well as people of Sri Lanka.

Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe arrived at the Indira Ghandi International airport in Delhi last afternoon to begin his official visit to India. 
The premier was welcomed by a delegation that included High Commissioner of India to Sri Lanka, Tharanjith Singh and Delhi Sri Lankan high commissioner, Chithrangani Waagishwara.
Prime minister is scheduled to begin official discussions today.
