hits._id: Ryan Jayalath granted bail, decision on SAITM today

_source.content:
Colombo High Court has granted bail to Convener of the Medical Faculty Students' Action Committee, Ryan Jayalath this morning (23).He was in remand custody after being accused of entering the Health Ministry forcefully and damaging property there.The revised bail application filed by Ryan Jayalath was taken before Colombo High Court Judge A. A. R. Heiyantuduwa this morning.
The judge who released Ryan Jayalath on a personal bail of 500,000 rupees ordered that one of the sureties should be a parent of Ryan Jayalath.
At the same time, the High Court Judge who prohibited Ryan Jayalath to participate in any protest again said that bail will be cancelled and the suspect will be remanded again if he breaks any of those bail conditions.
Further, the Judge ordered the Director of the Colombo Crime Division to observe whether the suspect is honouring the court orders.
Meanwhile, Minister Lakshman Kiriella said that President Maithripala Sirisena will announce the stance of the Government on SAITM today (23).He said this following an event at the Kandy District Secretariat today.

hits._id: Increase in the water tariff stopped

_source.content: The proposed water tariff increase by 30 percent has been suspended by the Cabinet of Ministers. Addressing a media conference held this afternoon at the parliament complex; Minister Chandima Weerakkody said the decision was taken after lengthy discussions in the Cabinet. The National Water Supply and Drainage Board announced on Saturday that the water tariff will be increased by 30 per cent on average with effect from December 01st 2016.  President Maithripala Sirisena has pointed out that the increase in water tariff at this juncture is disputed. Meanwhile, speaking in parliament, Water Supply Minister Rauff Hakeem stated that the Cabinet decided to appoint a committee of three ministers to reconsider the increase in water tariff.

hits._id: Foreign Minister Of Canada Stéphane Dion To Visit Sri Lanka

_source.content:
The Foreign Minister of Canada Stéphane Dion will arrive in Sri Lanka on Wednesday (27) evening (27) on an official visit. Minister Dion’s official programme will be on July 28 and 29.
This bilateral official visit to Sri Lanka by a Foreign Minister of Canada takes place after thirteen- years, and within less than a year since the formation of Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s Government.
Foreign Minister Dion will hold bilateral discussions with Foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera on Thursday afternoon (28), at the Foreign Ministry, following which, both Ministers will address the media.
Minister Dion will call on President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and Leader of the Opposition R. Sampanthan on Thursday. He will also meet the Minister of National Co-existence, Dialogue and Official Languages, Mano Ganesan, on the same day, in connection with support extended by Canada for the National Languages Equality Advancement Project (NLEAP).
On Friday (29), Foreign Minister Dion will travel to Jaffna, where he will meet the Governor of the Northern Province Reginald Cooray, Chief Minister C. V. Wigneswaran and members of civil society. The Minister will also visit Canadian funded projects including the Jaffna Hospitality Training Centre and an Agro Economic Development Project (ADP) funded by Canada with the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) and the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) support, relating to agro economic cooperatives in the dairy and agriculture industries.
Minister Dion’s visit is expected to infuse new momentum to relations between the two countries.

hits._id: UN Political Affairs Envoy meets Foreign Min. Mangala Samaraweera

He will call on Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and also have meetings with the Office for National Unity and Reconciliation and meet the Governors of the Northern and Eastern Provinces as well as stakeholders in extending UN assistance for long term development and reconciliation.

hits._id: A resolution against Sri lanka at Indian Parliament.

_source.content:
As the DMK decided to withdraw support, the Indian government yesterday moved to bring a resolution on the Sri Lankan issue in Parliament in an attempt to placate the key ally which has set it as one of the conditions for reconsideration of its decision.

Sources said the Indian government is drafting a resolution to be brought in Parliament.

The decision was taken after the Congress core group meeting, hours after DMK chief M Karunanidhi announced that his party would withdraw support to the UPA.

However, the DMK has made it clear that it would reconsider its decision if India supports a strong resolution at the UN Human Rights Council and brings a resolution in Parliament on the issue.

hits._id: “Yowun Puraya 2016” Begins Today

_source.content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday declared open the “Lakmuthu Sevana” housing scheme at Mayura Place, Wellawatte, another effort by the Government to provide fully equipped and permanent homes to families living in makeshift settlements in the city.The housing units have a value of 8 million rupees each and the total cost of the project according to Urban Development Authority is over 800 million rupees.Ministers Susil Premajayantha, Dinesh Gunawardana, Wimal Weerawanse, Defence and urban development Ministry Secretary Gotabaya Rajapakse and Colombo District Parliamentarian R Dumindha Silva also participated in the occasion.Meanwhile, President Mahinda Rajapakse participating at the inauguration of the Sri Lanka Engineering Professionals Association held in Colombo yesterday stated that it is the responsibility of all to develop the country.

hits._id: President meets Indian President and PM today

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena arrived in New Delhi yesterday on a four-day official visit, his first foreign trip after he assumed office last month.India's Minister of State for Road Transport & Highways, Shipping, P. Radhakrishnan and India's High Commissioner in Sri Lanka Y.K. Sinha along with senior government officials warmly welcomed the President and his wife at the Indira Gandhi International Airport in New Delhi.President Sirisena was invited to visit New Delhi by Indian Prime Minister Modi when he called him congratulate on his election victory.President Maithripala Sirisena is scheduled to meet Indian President Pranab Mukherjee and Prime Minister Narendra Modi today.During his visit, the Sri Lankan President is expected to hold discussions with Indian leaders on a wide range of issues.During the Sri Lankan President's visit the two countries are scheduled sign several bilateral agreements including a Memorandum of Understanding on cooperation in the field of agriculture.While in New Delhi, the President will also discuss bilateral cooperation between the two countries in the fields of highways, higher education and investment promotion, and sign relevant agreements.Minister of External Affairs Sushma Swaraj and Finance Minister Arun Jaitly also are scheduled to call on the President.He will also have discussions with several other political leaders including Congress Party leader Sonia Gandhi and former Prime Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh.

L. Peiris.MoU on strengthening cooperation between Board of Investment of Sri Lanka and Ministry of Economic Development of Maldives was signed by Maldivian Minister of Economic Development.Arrangement on Search and Rescue was also signed by Maldivian Minister of Foreign Affairs and Minister Peiris.President Yameen and President Mahinda Rajapaksa were in attendance at the signing ceremony.

hits._id: Several Institutions Including CEB To Be Taken Under Direct Purview Of The PM

_source.content:
It has been decided to take several institutes facing various crises including the CEB and the Sri Lankan Airlines under the direct purview of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.
A senior spokesperson of the Prime Minister’s office stated that measures will be taken to place several ministries and state institutes under the purview of the Prime Minister.
Accordingly, the Ministry of Education, Ministry of Power and Renewable Energy as well as Ministry of Housing will be placed under the direct purview of the Premier.
It is reported that these steps have been taken due to the relevant institutes falling under strong bureaucracy, consequently interrupting their operations.
In addition, the institutes will be placed under the purview of the Premier, as their operations have decelerated, due to officers not supporting the activities of the government.  
Accordingly, the Ministry of External Affairs, which faced similar issues in the recent times, was taken under the direct purview of the Prime Minister, consequently resolving several problems.  
In addition, steps were taken to transfer several responsibilities overseen by the Ministry of External Affairs to the Ministry of Development Strategies and International Trade.

hits._id: Trade Union of Health, transport and professionals to strike on the 15th of December

_source.content:
The trade union of the Nursing sector, Para Medics and Supplementary health workers are preparing to launch an island wide token strike on the 15th of this month.
The strike will be staged against slashing government servants’ salaries and failing to add the 10 thousand rupee allowance to the basic salary through the budget 2016.
Convener of the Joint Federation of Nurses, Para Medics and Supplementary health workers unions Saman Rathnapriya stated during a media conference held in Colombo this morning that members of 15 trade unions would join the proposed token strike.
The Private Bus Association states that it would stage an island wide strike on 15th of this month against the potential negative impact of the budget 2016.
Association President Gemunu Wijerathna said that unprecedented fees for revenue license, emission assessment and valuation have been introduced by the budget.
General Secretary of the Federation of All Ceylon Bus Owners Association Anjana Priyanjith also expressed his views during the media conference held in Colombo this morning.
.

hits._id: President arrives in the island

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena arrived in the island this morning concluding a 2 day official visit to India.
President Sirisena attended the Mahakumbha in Ujjain yesterday and said the two countries have had extremely intimate bilateral relations for centuries and Indian Prime Minister's invitation for him to join the ceremonies is a "firm endorsement of goodwill and friendly attitude to each other."
The President thanked India for its commitment in socio-economic development of Sri Lanka.
At ceremony held in Sanchi of Madhya Pradesh to unveil the statue of Anagarika Dharmapala, who played a major role in the revival of Buddhism in India, the President praised the efforts made by Indian government to secure and develop Buddhist archaeological sites.
President Sirisena met Indian Prime Minister Modi on Friday in New Delhi and held discussions on a range of issues.
During the discussion, the Indian Premier assured to give every support to Sri Lanka to make the reconciliation program successful.

hits._id: MP Dayasiri Jayasekara resigns and joins government

He is scheduled to contest as the chief ministerial candidate from the United People’s Freedom Alliance for the North Western  Province.

hits._id: Update: Crossovers between UNP and the SLFP barred

_source.content:
The General Secretaries of UNP and SLFP signed an MoU today, to not allow their elected members to switch parties within two years.

UNP General Secretary Kabeer Hashim and SLFP General Secretary Duminda Dissanayake signed the agreement just after UNP Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe was sworn in as the new prime minister before the President.

The MoU which signed this morning to assure a stable government concludes 10 factors including efforts for economic growth, restore freedom, eliminate corruption, upgrade education and health, foreign relations, rights of women and children and enrich culture and art.

The new commissions proposed in the 19th amendment would be established soon to ensure good governance.

A government mechanism of compromise would be created to enable parliamentarians of all political parties to contribute their share.

A new electoral system of the mixture of first past the post and proportional systems would be introduced by allocating a permanent parliament representative to each electorate.

However, further discussions would be held after reaching an agreement with the first 10 factors that included in the MoU signed today.
Update : Friday, 21 August 2015 - 18:36------------------------------------------------
 
 SLFP and UNP sign an MOU for a government of compromiseA Memorandum of Understanding was also signed between the Sri Lanka Freedom Party and the United National Party to work together in the next Parliament.

The MoU was signed by UNP General Secretary Kabir Hashim and SLFP Acting General Secretary Duminda Dissanayake.

hits._id: Video : Damana PS Chairman collapsed before the vote taking – budget also defeated

_source.content: The budgets of the UFPA controlled Pradeshiya Sabhas in Ampara Damana and Homagama were defeated today for the second time.The Damana Pradeshiya Sabha budget was defeated unanimously as no member voted for the budget.All the 5 members including the deputy Chairman who voted against the budget were from the UPFA.  Another UPFA member abstained from voting while the 2 UNP members walked out during the vote taking.Meanwhile, Damana Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Mangala Mahinda Gunawardana collapsed just before he was about to address a crowd of his supporters in front of the Pradeshiya Sabha building.Later he was rushed to Ampara hospital, and a hospital spokesman said that the Chairman’s condition was not critical.Later the meeting was presided by the Deputy Chairman, and the budget for 2014 was presented.Meanwhile Homagama Pradeshiya Sabha budget was defeated with 2 majority votes during the second vote taking today.Ten members voted for the budget while 12 members voted against it when it was presented for the second time. One UPFA member abstained from voting while 9 of his fellow members and the Deputy Chairman joined their opposition counterparts to vote against the budget.

hits._id: Thai pongal festival falls today: Let's strengthen the walls of unity: best wishes from President Maithree.

_source.content: Issuing a communiqué to mark Thai Pongal President Maithripala Sirisena said Sri Lankan Hindus join their fellow Tamil religionists in most countries of the world today to celebrate Thai Pongal, the traditional Thanksgiving and Harvest festival of the Hindu religious calendar.The message said it is the tradition at this festival to offer thanks to Surya - the Sun God, for the blessings received for a successful harvest.This festival marks the traditional renewal of links between humans, the deities and nature and the unity of people in worship and thanksgiving for blessings received, with abundant hope for success in the future.President Maithripala Sirisena said he is pleased to issue this message at the very beginning of his term of office, with Metta, loving kindness and the cultivation of benevolence, for peace, unity and prosperity among our people.Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasingha issuing a Thai Pongal message stated that a political environment must be created that respect equality.           Pix by - Wanni - Romesh Madushanka--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------           Pix by - Ranjiht Rajapaksa

hits._id: A group of Anuradhapura SLFP politicians move a proposal expressing their displeasure against the President

_source.content:
Anuradhapura District organisation of the SLFP states that a proposal was passed to express their displeasure against President Maithripala Sirisena for not extending the tenure of local government bodies.
The proposal was passed during a special meeting held at the Anuradapura Buddha Jayanthi temple yesterday.
The meeting was held under the patronage of former Minister S M Chandraena who is also the chairman of the Anuradhapura District organisation of the SLFP.
The proposal was put forward by former councillor of the Mihinthale Divisional council Anil Pushpananda.
Official tenure of 3 municipal councils, 30 urban councils and 201 divisional councils came to an end on Friday.
Accordingly the administration of these bodies was taken over by the respective commissioners and secretaries.
Former Councillor Anil Pushpananada states that President as the chairman of the SLFP had the capacity to extend the official tenure of the local government bodies.

hits._id: UNP also prepares a budget.

_source.content: The UNP said that it will present a new budget if the party would win a forthcoming election.The party also stated during a media briefing held in Colombo today that the party shadow budget has already been prepared.UNP also stated that External Affairs Minister G.L. Peries should resign from his post after the revelation of LTTE links to the contractor who renovated the Sri Lanka’s permanent representative’s official residence in Geneva.Allegations were leveled against then Sri Lanka’s Geneva permanent representative and current External Affairs Ministry Secretary Kshenukaa Seneviratne.However Minister Peries said yesterday that Kshenukaa Seneviratne has no connection with the transaction.Meanwhile the UNP says it does not criticize Kshenukaa Seneviratne but it is compelled to criticize the transaction with the LTTE.The UNP also said that Minister Peries who is so interested in defending Kshenukaa Seneviratne did not speak a single word about the assault on Sri Lankan High Commissioner in the UK Dr. Chris Nonis.At the same time views were expressed about Sri Lanka’s foreign policy during a media conference organized by Frontline Socialist Party in Colombo today.Addressing the media, party Media Secretary Pubudu Jagoda said that the government should probe the financial irregularities committed by many Sri Lankan diplomats.

hits._id: A question to the Government from the Opposition Leader about the future of the youth.

_source.content:
Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremasinghe has queried the Government about the future of the country’s young generation.
 
The Opposition Leader asked this question while participating at a people’s rally held in Dambulla yesterday. 
 
Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremasinghe who expressed his views on that occasion points out that the current young generation are subjected to many pressures.

hits._id: President announces new measures to revive exports

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena says re-export of tea and pepper will be stopped from 10th of February.He added that the 50% concession given to farmers on seed potatoes will be increased to 100%.President Maithripala Sirisena said this addressing an election rally in Badulla this afternoon (Jan. 28).

hits._id: 52 arrested in Hambanthota for unruly behaviour; 23 imprisoned

_source.content: The Government Information Department says that 52 individuals were arrested by the police for unruly behavior during the inauguration ceremony of the Hambanthota – Mirijjawila Sri Lanka – China Industrial Zone. Hambanthota magistrate ordered 21 individuals who were produced before courts, to be remanded until tomorrow, while two others have been remanded until the 11th of January.  The Project was launched last morning under the patronage of Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe. A tense situation erupted in the vicinity of the premises when a group of MPs from the Joint Opposition along with several residents from the area engaged in a protest.The protestors arrived close to the premises despite security measures taken by security units.  With the tense situation further intensifying, Police had fired tear gas and water cannon at the protestors. IGP Pujith Jayasundara too arrived at the scene. 23 persons including 11 Police Officers were injured during the clash and they are receiving treatment at the Hambantota hospital.

hits._id: Rajagiriya flyover open for traffic

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister have declared open the Rajagiriya flyover a short while ago.  
 
The 533m long, 21.4m wide and 4 lane Rajagiriya flyover was built at a cost of Rs. 4.7bn mainly financed by Spain.
In parallel to this project, several roads around the Rajagiriya area will be developed and an alternative road towards Narahenpita will be developed as well as the road towards Buthgamuwa will be developed with 3 lanes.
Addressing the gathering, the President said that this flyover can be considered as one of the most significant road development projects expeditiously completed by the present Government for the benefit of the people.

hits._id: Muslims celebrate Hajj today

_source.content:
Muslims in Sri Lanka mark Hajj, also known as Eid-al-Adha, today.
It is the second religious holiday in the Islamic calendar and is celebrated by Muslims all over the world.
The Hajj festival is commemorated by many Muslims with a pilgrimage to Mecca during the Hajj week.
It is said that this is the largest gathering of Muslims in the world every year.
Issuing a communiqué President Maithripala Sirisena said in his Hajj message that the festival of Hajj is the most important annual event of the Muslims in the world, in which they pray to emphasize the importance of sacrifices in the name of Allah.
The government provides required facilities to Muslims of Sri Lanka to participate in the annual Hajj pilgrimage, where they renew their commitment to the teachings of the Quran and the Prophet Muhammed, and pray for peace, brotherhood and understanding among all people of the world.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasingha issuing a Haj message stated the ultimate bliss of life and spiritual advancement of people could be achieved only by disciplining oneself to lead a life of co-existence, devoid of cravings and sharing one's wealth with the less privileged.

hits._id: Ajith Mannapperuma to fill in vacant parliament seat of Dr. Jayalath Jayawardhana

_source.content:
UNP Western Provincial Councilor Ajith Mannapperuma, who is next in the list, to be picked to fill in the vacant parliament seat after the death of Gampaha District UNP MP Dr.Jayalath Jayawardana.
Mannapperuma was a former Mayor of Gampha, and he obtained 44 thousand 812 votes in the last General Election.
Dr.Jayalath Jayawardana and a former minister in the UNP regime who was receiving treatment in a hospital in Singapore died this morning.
Dr.Jayawardana made his debut in parliament as an MP for Gampaha district in 1994.
Later he won Ja Ela electorate in the General Election 2001 and became the Reconstruction and Resettlement Minister of the UNP government in 2002 – 2004.
Meanwhile UNP Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe during a meeting at Sirikotha today offered condolences on the death of late Dr.Jayawardana.

			   
			   		
	
			   
Sirikotha Officials stated that the funeral arrangement will be announced after the body of late Dr.Jayawardana is brought home.

hits._id: President Sirisena votes

_source.content: President Sirisena votes"President Maithripala Sirisena cast his vote this morning.He cast his vote at the polling station in Vidyaloka Vihara in Polonnaruwa-New town.

hits._id: Government hospitals to vaccinate children due to Midwives strike.

_source.content: Government Medical Officers’ Association stated that they will resort to a trade union action if the Health authorities do not immediately resolve the trade union action by the Government Midwifery Association.Speaking during a media briefing convened in Colombo today, the media spokesman of the government Medical Officers’ Association Dr. Navin de Soyza said that the authorities are afraid to resolve some of the issues cropped up in the health sector.The Health Ministry stated that children who could not receive vaccinations due to the trade union action of the Midwifery Association, can visit government hospitals and receive their vaccinations.The facility is available at all hospitals throughout the island.The ministry has taken this decision, after receiving several reports of children being unable to receive their vaccinations.

hits._id: Govt and opposition members in a dispute regarding the Supplementary estimate: A decision to be taken during party leaders meeting today

_source.content:
The JVP says that supplementary estimate proposed to parliament by the government yesterday was not approved.
MP Vijitha Herath stated that a decision will be taken at the party leaders meeting in parliament today.
A tense situation popped up in parliament during the approval of the estimate.
A debate was held with regard to the estimate and a voting was requested by the opposition.
However, during the voting a tense debate took place between the government and opposition ministers with regard to the number of MP’s present.
This was due to government MP’s arriving at the well of the house during the voting session. 
Following the voting MP Lucky Jayawardena issued the results of the voting.
Accordingly, 33 votes were received for the estimate while 31 votes were received against it.
Therefore, the supplementary estimate was approved with a majority of 2 votes.
However MPs of the joint opposition examined the video footage during the recounting of the votes.

hits._id: Former MP Tissa Attanayake request permission to go abroad

_source.content:
Colombo High court judge Wikum Kalu Aarachchi stated today that the motion filed by former UNP General Secretary Tissa Attanayake to travel abroad will be considered on April 3rd.
Tissa Attanayake sought Court permission to leave the county from April 10th to 28th   to visit his daughter in Australia.
The Attorney General has sued Tissa Attanayake on 3 counts of charges including bringing influence on the results of the past presidential election by announcing that there was a secret agreement between then Opposition leader Ranil Wickremesinghe and then common candidate Maithripala Sirisena.

hits._id: No need of 13th amendment - Minister says in Parliament

_source.content: Minister of National Languages and Social Integration Wasudewa Nanayakkara stated that certain demands made by the Northern Provincial Council are reasonable.The Minister stated that a broad dialogue was needed on the matter.However, Minister of Local Government A L M Athaulla stated in parliament that what the country needs is not a local government system.

hits._id: President joins inauguration of CHOGM

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena today (Apr. 19) joined the commencement of the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting at Buckingham Palace.
 
The Queen is hosting the event.
 
Queen Elizabeth, who has been the group’s symbolic figurehead since 1952, gave up long-haul travel in support of the biennial summit in 2013 and the 2020 gathering is set to be held in Malaysia.
 
On the closing day on Friday, leaders are expected to discuss who should follow Queen Elizabeth in the role.
 
The position is not hereditary, but Prince Charles, who is also the heir to the thrones of 16 Commonwealth nations, is expected to get the nod, despite some unease among ardent republicans.

hits._id: Minister Mervyn prepares to tell JVP a secret.

_source.content: Minister Mervin Silva said that he is ready to meet JVP central political bureau member and MP Sunil Handunnetti secretly, and whisper him about not granting bail to his son Malaka.Answering a question asked by MP Handunnetti, Minister Silva stated this during the budget debate in parliament today.

hits._id: Video: Fishermen protest against Minister's new penalty

_source.content: The fishing community including fishing trade unions objected Fisheries Minister Rajitha Senarathna’s proposal to impose penalty on the fishermen who violate international maritime boundaries.Addressing a media briefing in Colombo yesterday, Minister Senarathna said that he has decided to impose a penalty for 1.5 million rupees per fishing trawler that violates international maritime boundary.A new Act has also been passed in parliament on the 5th of this month to give legal teeth to this decision.The fishing community and the fishing trade unions claim that what the Minister should do instead is to impose this penalty on the Indian fishermen who intrude into our waters and poach our harvest.Fishing Trade Unions also object the Minister’s new penalty.The Expenditure heads of the Fisheries Ministry will be taken for debate in parliament today.Meanwhile fisheries community staged a protest in Galle town today.The protesters said that the concessions for fishermen have been axed by the budget of 2014.

hits._id: One hour delay to switch on Street lights; Existing bulbs to be replaced with LED

_source.content: The Ceylon Electricity Board has instructed all local government institutions to delay lighting of Street lamps by an hour in preparation to an imminent power crisis. Addressing a meeting with several ministry secretaries held in Colombo today, Power Ministry Secretary Suren Batagoda said instructions have already been given to local government authorities to delay switching on Street lamps. He further said that steps will be taken in the future to provide Led bulbs to households.

hits._id: President instructs to remove restrictions on FB

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has instructed the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission to remove the temporary ban on Facebook with immediate effect following discussions with Facebook officials.
The Facebook officials arrived in Sri Lanka yesterday (Mar. 14).
The Sri Lanka government instructed the TRCSL to block the social media sites last week after it was found social media platforms were being used to incite communal disharmony with the spread of clashes in Kandy.Meanwhile, a discussion between the 3-official from Facebook and Secretary to the President, Austin Fernando was at the Presidential Secretariat today (Mar. 15).
The talks had centred on how to prevent sharing communal and hate speech and restoration of the access to the social media site.
The team from the Facebook is scheduled to meet Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe later today.
Meanwhile, Facebook Sri Lanka Translation Group expressed its protest as the organization had not been invited to the discussion.
Chairman of the organization, Rajiv Yasiru Kuruvitage told our news team that his team has been translating the content for Facebook Sinhala users since 2014.
Other social media such as WhatsApp and Viber which were blocked after the Kandy riots have already been restored.

hits._id: Current Gvt is selling state property- former President

_source.content:
Moves were not made to sell state property during the previous government, former president Mahinda Rajapaksa says.
He said, however, the current government is venturing upon it.
He said this at an event held in Thunmulla Sambuddha Jayanthi Mandiraya.

hits._id: Susil and Anura Yapa to meet former President in Kandy

_source.content: Two General Secretaries of SLFP and UPFA Anura Priyadharshana Yapa and Susil Premajayanth are expected to meet former President Mahinda Rajapaksa in Kandy today.President of the 6 member committee appointed to coordinate between President Maithripala Sirisena and former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, W. D. J. Seneviratne says the two general secretaries have already left for Kandy.Opposition Leader Nimal Siripala de Silva, UPFA General Secretary Susil Premajayanth and SLFP General secretary Anura Priyadharshana Yapa met President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday to discuss the ways and means of contesting the forthcoming general election.It is said that the two general secretaries would inform the former president the conclusions those were made at the yesterday’s meeting, when they meet him in Kandy today.The report prepared by the 6 member committee to coordinate between President Maithreepala Sirisena and former President Mahinda Rajapaksa has not been handed over to the president as yet.When contacted the committee president W. D. J. Seneviratne told our news team that he has not received an appoint to meet the president.He further stated that they expect to hand over the report to the president after the two General Secretaries of UPFA and SLFP come to Colombo.Meanwhile, a supporter of Bring Back Mahinda group and former MP Ranjith de Zoysa said that Mahinda Rajapaksa would be nominated the UPFA prime ministerial candidate tomorrow at Madamulana.At the same time, former President’s media coordinator Rohan Weliwita stated that former President Rajapaksa is scheduled to make a special statement from Weeraketiya Madamulana tomorrow at 10 o’clock in the morning.Meanwhile, the SLFP nomination board met for the first time at its party headquarters this morning.A nomination board member told our news team that 182 prospective applicants from the Western and the North Western provinces would be interviewed today.

hits._id: Government is committed to safeguard coexistence and National unity- PM

_source.content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe says that the government is committed to safeguard co-existence and national unity. 
He was speaking at the World Muslim League summit held at Temple Trees this morning.

hits._id: A resolution on Sri Lanka passed in European Union parliament

_source.content: The European Parliament at its plenary session in Strasbourg passed a resolution asking the Sri Lankan government to implement the recommendation of the Lessons Learnt and Reconciliation Committee in full.Issuing a statement the European Parliament said the Members of European Parliament appreciate the restoration of peace and welcome the first ever elections in the Northern Province.Speaking at the debate on the current situation in Sri Lanka, British Conservative MP Geoffrey Van Orden raised the issue of the Tamils in Northern Sri Lanka.The EP in its resolution said the Sri Lankan government must intensify its efforts to fully implement the LLRC recommendations concerning credible investigations, demilitarization, and the establishment of land dispute resolution mechanisms, amongst others.

hits._id: Sri Lanka prepared to file reply during Geneva Summit

_source.content:
Minister Mahinda Samarasinghe states that the government of Sri Lanka is prepared to address all posers directed at the country during the next session of the United Nations Human Rights Council which is due to be held in March this year.

Addressing a media briefing held in Colombo today minister Samarasinghe noted that even officials at the Ministry of External Affairs were prepared to face this challenge.

Minister Samarasinghe also noted that plans were underway to submit a detailed report during the upcoming session of the UNHRC on how the Human Rights Action Plan had been implemented within the country.

Moreover during the media briefing journalists queried Minister Samarasinghe on how the government plans to justify the recent impeachment of the Chief Justice & amendments to the Criminal Law Special Provisions Act.

hits._id: Katagoda, a hurdle to Fonseka

_source.content: Democratic Party Leader Sarath Fonseka says that he is prevented from entering parliament as Jayantha Katagoda does not resign from his parliament seat.Fonseka said that both the Attorney General and the Election Commissioner have stated that there are no legal barriers for him to enter parliament.He also said the Jayantha Katagoda has also been educated on this matter.Jayantha Katagoda entered to parliament to fill the vacancy created after Sarath Fonseka was jailed.The vacant seat legally belonged to the JVP, but it was significant that the party did not accept to fill the vacancy with one of their members at that time.Democratic Party Deputy Leader Jayantha Katagoda pledged his support to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa during the last presidential election.However the barriers which prevented Fonseka to enter parliament were cleared after President Maithreepala Sirisena recently granted full pardon for Sarath Fonseka.

hits._id: Will be committed for a economic, social and political transformation; Will not contest for a second term; Assurance from President Maithri

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena says that he will certainly live up to the trust placed on him by the people of this country.Meanwhile President Maithripala Sirisena speaking on his policies said that no one should have hatred towards anyone.Addressing the nation further the President said that a cordial foreign policy will be adopted.

hits._id: Ban Ki-moon meets President today

_source.content:
The United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon arrived in Sri Lanka yesterday on a three-day visit.
Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs Dr. Harsha De Silva welcomed the UN Chief at the Bandaranaike International Airport.
Later Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe met with Ban Ki Moon over dinner.
The secretary general will meet with President Maithripala Sirisena today for bilateral discussions.
During his visit, UN chief will visit a resettlement site in Jaffna, and participate in an event in Galle focusing on the role of youth in reconciliation and coexistence.

hits._id: "National government is a complex task" - SLFP GN.Sec

_source.content: Chairperson of the SLFP President Maithripala Sirisena has decided to meet the representatives of the party individually in order to discuss about the upcoming general elections.National Organizer of the party MP Susil Premajayantha made this statement after he paid a courtesy call to the Chief Prelates of Asgiri and Malwathu Chapters.The National Organizer Susil Premajayantha, General Secretary Anura Priyadarshana Yapa and Treasurer S. B. Nawinna paid homage to the Temple of Tooth Relic before paying a courtesy call to the Chief Prelates.Responding to a question regarding an all-party government General Secretary Anura Priyadarshana Yapa said that it is a difficult target to achieve.

hits._id: Update: 19th constitutional amendment is postponed

_source.content: The Leader of the House and Minister Lakshman Kiriella stated that the government postponed presenting the 19th Amendment Bill to parliament until 27th of this month.He said that the parliament debate with regards to the new Bill would be held on April 27th and the voting will be taken on the following day.The government stated earlier that today and tomorrow had been reserved for the debate. The President was also present in parliament today to witness the debate over the new Bill.However, several opposition parties objected the debate over the new Bill, and later the speaker told Leader of the House Lakshman Kiriella to discuss the matter with the President and come to a conclusion.Later, Leader of the House Lakshman Kiriella read out the decision taken by the political party leaders’ meeting.Meanwhile our news team enquired leader of the house Lakshman Kiriella to describe the reasons to postpone the debate over the 19th Constitutional Amendment Bill. He said that certain opposition MPs wanted to study the Bill in depth.Update : Tuesday, 21 April 2015 - 18:37------------------------------------------------------ Parliament Adjourned untill April 27thThe Leader of the House and minister Lakshman Kiriella says that the presenting of the 19th Constitutional Amendment Bill to parliament has been postponed until April 27.The Leader of the House told in parliament today the debate with regard to the new Bill would be held on April 27 and the voting will be held on the following day.The government stated earlier that today and tomorrow had been reserved for the debate. Update : Tuesday, 21 April 2015 - 11:16............................................................................................................................................................Parliament adjourned for 15 minutesSpeaker Chamal Rajapakse ordered to adjourn Parliaments for 15 minutes to hold a party leaders meeting.Heated arguments were exchanged in parliament against the notice on former president Mahinda Rajapaksa to report to the Bribery Commission on April 24th.Meanwhile MP Bandula Gunawardana stated that a letter signed by 113 Opposition MPs to conduct an investigation against the Director General of the Bribery Commission will be handed over to the Speaker.Update : Tuesday, 21 April 2015 - 8:16............................................................................................................................................................Opposition MP's continue sit in protest against summoning former president to bribery commissionThe sit-in protest staged by a group of opposition MPs in the well of the house against the notice on former president Mahinda Rajapaksa to report to the Bribery Commission on April 24th is still continuing.Heated arguments were exchanged in parliament over this matter yesterday, and a group of Opposition MPs staged this protest as speaker Chamal Rajapaksa adjourned the house.Chairman of the Bribery Commission Jagath Balapatabadi met the speaker Chamal Rajapakse last evening.Deputy Speaker Chandima Weerakody stated that matters were discussed with regard to summoning Former President to the bribery commission and the activities of the commission.Deputy Speaker said Speaker Chamal Rajapaksa will make a special statement in Parliament today.Meanwhile a letter signed by 102 Opposition MPs has been sent to, requesting him to intervene to settle this dispute.

hits._id: Talks on Fishermen in Mid-March

_source.content: The Ministry of External Affairs is working on fixing a fresh date for holding third round of talks between fishermen of Sri Lanka and Tamil Nadu after the State government informed that it would be difficult to host it on March 11th as proposed by Sri Lanka.The Tamil Nadu government received a communication from the Ministry conveying Sri Lanka’s proposal to hold the talks in Chennai on March 11th.Replying to that, State Fisheries Secretary S Vijayakumar conveyed to Suchitra Durai, Joint Secretary, Ministry of External Affairs, that any date after March 15th would be convenient.Earlier, Tamil Nadu government has proposed the talks on March 5th However, Sri Lanka had sought more time as the new government was pre-occupied with its 100-day programme.Since the Centre was reportedly keen on scheduling the talks ahead of the visit of Prime Minister Narendra Modi to Sri lanka, the government had proposed March 11th as fresh date for talks.The first and second rounds of the talks were held in Chennai and Colombo on January 27th and May 12th, 2014 respectively following the initiative taken by former Chief Minister J Jayalalithaa.

hits._id: 3 ministries to combat kidney disease

_source.content:
The ministry of health states that a decision has been made to initiate an inter ministry program to combat the kidney disease that is spreading through the North Central province.

Accordingly the health ministry stated that several ministries including the Local government ministry, Ministry of Agriculture and the ministry of health are collaborating to initiate this program.

Each ministry will establish a board of officials to monitor the work assigned to each ministry.

hits._id: Video: Island-wide development has boosted the economy of rural people; President

_source.content: Speaking during a ceremony held at a government bank in Colombo today, President Mahinda Rajapakse expressed that island-wide development work has boosted the economy of rural people.The President further said that the Mahinda Chinthana policy saved all government institutions from privatization, and has even secured the local banking network.600 Banking Assistants newly recruited by the bank, received their appointment letters from the president today.

hits._id: Video : Report true facts - MP R Dumindha Silva

_source.content: MP R Dumindha requests journalists to report true facts leaving aside personnel ideologies.MP made this statement during the session where heads of expenditures of the mass media Ministry were taken for debate.Yesterday was the 9th day of the committee stage debate of the 2014 budget.

hits._id: IMPORTED RICE TO BE MARKETED NEXT WEEK ONWARDS

_source.content:
The essential food importers association says that imported rice could be bought from the market next week onwards.
The Special Goods Tax of 15 Rupees imposed on imported rice has been reduced to 5 Rupees with effect from last midnight.
The Finance Ministry noted that the concession will be applicable for Red Rice, Naadu and Samba rice.
President Maithripala Sirisena has also reiterated that a Kilogram of imported rice cannot be sold at more than 76 Rupees per Kilogram.

hits._id: President Visits Central Environment Authority

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena made an inspection visit to the Central Environment Authority (CEA) this (19) morning.   Signifying his first visit as the Minister of Environment, the President planted a sapling at the CEA premises.  The President met with the Directors and senior officials of CEA.Deputy Minister of Mahaweli and Environment Mr. Wasantha Aluvihare, Secretary Minister of Environment Mr. Nihal Jayaweera, Chairman of CEA Prof. Lal Mervin Dharmasiri and senior officials of the Ministry and CEA were present.

hits._id: Inability of the Opposition to win elections is not Government s fault - President.

_source.content:
President Mahinda Rajapaksa says that the Opposition to win elections honoring democracy is not Government’s fault.
 
Participating at a people’s rally held yesterday at Pooduluoya in Kotmaley to ensure the victory of UPFA Nuwara Eliya District candidates, the President said that the charges that some level saying that the country was moving away from democracy were false.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremasinghe says that the Provincial Council election this time is the first step in the battle for toppling the Government. 
 
The Opposition Leader said so while participating at a people’s rally held in Aanamaduwa yesterday in view of the North Western Provincial Council.

hits._id: Oppositions’ SLFP MP’s meet the President

_source.content:
MP Kumara Welgama says that a meeting on the budget will be held between President Maithreepala Sirisena and a group of SLFP Opposition MPs today.
A discussion between the President and SLFP parliamentarians was held yesterday.
Subsequent to the discussion, party general secretary Minister Duminda Dissanayake said that his party had decided to vote for the budget.
However MP Kumara Welgama said that 49 Opposition MPs including himself had not arrived at a consensus.
Accordingly MP Kumara Welgama said that another discussion will be held with the President at 11 a.m. today.

hits._id: President returns to island concluding a successful tour to Maldives and Seychelles.

_source.content: President Mahinda Rajapakse returned to the Island last night concluding a successful visit to the Maldives and Seychelles.The Governments of Sri Lanka and Maldives signed three very important agreements during the official visit of President Mahinda Rajapaksa to Male. The Government of Maldives and Sri Lanka held official talks, led by President of Maldives Abdulla Yameen Abdul Gayoom and President Mahinda Rajapakse.A Memorandum of Understanding on Health Cooperation, MoU on strengthening cooperation between Board of Investment of Sri Lanka and Ministry of Economic Development of Maldives and arrangement on Search and Rescue were signed.President Mahinda Rajapaksa after concluding a successful two-day state visit to Maldives arrived in Seychelles.Seychelles President James A. Michel, Vice President Danny Faure, High Commissioner for Sri Lanka warmly received President Rajapaksa at the airport.President Rajapaksa signed 6 agreements of bilateral importance and the President declared open the Sri Lankan Embassy in Seychelles.

hits._id: Sub Committee report on Uma Oya submitted to the cabinet

Minister Mahinda Amaraweera , A member of the Cabinet Sub-Committee appointed to look into the Uma Oya project issue, said that the committee report was submitted to the Cabinet today.
The Other members of the committee appointed by President Maithripala Sirisena are ministers Patali Champika Ranawaka and Vijith Vijayamuni Soyza.
It has been reported that a special Cabinet paper was presented today proposing how provide relief to the people who have been affected by the Uma Oya Project.

hits._id: President pays last respects to former Premier Ratnasiri Wickremanayake

_source.content:
Politicians of the ruling and the opposition parties are paying their last respects to the remains of former prime minster Ratnasiri Wickremanayake at his Horana Residence today as well.
Ratnasiri Wickremanayake died at a private hospital in Colombo after a brief illness on December 27th.
The funeral will be held under the State Patronage tomorrow.
Meanwhile President Maithripala Sirisena paid his last respect to the remains of late Ratnasiri Wickremanayake this morning.
Addressing the media, President Sirisena said that the former Premier had set a good example for politicians of the new generation.
Former president Mahinda Rajapaksa paid his last respect to the remains of late Wickremanayake yesterday.

hits._id: LG election on Feb. 10

hits._id: Sheela vyapara organized at all schools on the 21st - Teacher Service Unions Opposed

_source.content:
Several views were expressed during several media briefing today with regards to the planned general strike which is set to take effect on the 21st of this month.
 
Secretary of the Government Nursing Officers Association Gamini Kumarasinghe speaking during a media briefing which was held today noted that various issues were being experienced at hospitals due to the hike in electricity tariffs.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
However the government against this backdrop states that the aim of increasing electricity tariff was not to inconvienience the public.
 
Issuing a release today the Sri Lanka Freedom Party states that certain parties
are attempting to create a niche for themselves.
 
General Secretary of Ceylon Electricity Boards Joint Trade Union Alliance Ranjan Jayalal meanwhile hurled an accusation at the government during a media briefing which was held today.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
General Secretary of the Ceylon teachers Union Mahinda Jayasinghe meanwhile blamed the government of having organized a ‘seela viyapara’ at schools the day after tomorrow.
 
According to Jayasinghe this attempt by the government is to disrupt Tuesday’s planned general strike.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
Our news team obtained the views of the Secretary to the Ministry of education Ghotabhaya Jayarathana regarding these accusations.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
Meanwhile organized by the JVP, a petition was signed before the Nochchiyagama bus stand this morning denouncing the recent electricity tariff hike.

hits._id: Deputy Minister Cader before UNP disciplinary committee

_source.content:
The disciplinary hearing against the parliamentarians who contested under the elephant symbol of the UNP and who voted for the impeachment is scheduled for tomorrow.

Several court verdicts were issued with regard to this today.

Accordingly, a request made by the deputy minister Abdul Kader to issue an injunction against the disciplinary hearing was denied after it was taken up for consideration by Colombo District Court Judge Amal Ranaraja.

The judge also issued summons to the respondents of the petition, UNP party leader Ranil Wickramasinghe and party general secretary Thissa Attanayaka to appear before court on the 28th.

Upon inquiry by our news team deputy minister Abdul Kader stated that he will appear before the UNP disciplinary committee tomorrow.


			   
			   		
	
			   

However, after taking into consideration a petition filed by 5 UNP party members the Mount Lavinia District Court today issued an injunction against the party leader Ranil Wickramasinghe, UNP general secretary Thissa Attanayaka and the UNP disciplinary committee.

hits._id: CB Governor to take leave during investigations: PM

_source.content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe made a special statement in parliament with regard to the Treasury Bond issue of the Central Bank.During his statement, Prime Minister Wickremesinghe told parliament that he was informed by the Central Bank Governor that he would not report for duty until investigations are completed.Elaborating on the matter, the Prime Minister stated that due to past misdeeds, the Central Bank has been forced to embark on the task of rebuilding their credibility and standing as the country’s most credible financial institution.He added that they have been adopting a system of private placements of bonds, leaving behind a legacy of mismanagement and misrule.The criteria they have adopted allowed the central bank to cut deals with primary dealers.The Prime Minister also said that after the new regime came into power, the Central bank adopted a prudent system of calling for competitive bids, resulting government to raise funds at the most competitive rates.He added that the 20 year bond of June 2014 was issued at an average interest of 11.75%, and the latest bond was sold at 11.73%.This was slightly lower than the rate paid last year. He added that they were able to raise just over Rs. 10 billion at a rate cheaper than what the previous government paid.

hits._id: By 2020 a UNP government will be in power, says PM

_source.content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe says he's ready to form a United National Party government by 2020 by obtaining a majority power.The Prime Minister said this addressing an election rally in Kuliyapitiya.

hits._id: Opposition leader makes a statement about Asath Sally in Parliament; Prime Minister replies.

_source.content:
Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe made a special statement in parliament today about the former Deputy Mayor of Colombo Azath Salley who is currently detained by the CID. 
 
Prime Minister D.M.Jayarathne replied on behalf of the government.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
Director General of the Media Center for National Security Lakshman Hulugalle earlier stated that Salley has made some anti government statements and some provocative remarks which would lead to conflict among different ethnic and religious groups.
 
He said more allegations on fraud and criminal breach of trust against him have also come to light.
 
Meanwhile UNP General Secretary Tissa Attanayake questioned about Salley’s arrest at a media briefing held in Colombo today.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
The Hela Urumaya also convened a press conference in Colombo today. 
 
Replying to a question raised by our correspondent, Hela Urumaya leader Venerable Omalpe Sobhita Thera expressed his view on the arrest of Azath Salley.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
During the press conference Ven Omalpe Sobhitha Thera exposed information about activities of certain Muslim fundamental groups currently operating in Sri Lanka.

hits._id: Committee appointed on SAITM issue given 10 days

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has informed the Committee appointed to look into the future course of action on SAITM to submit their report within 10 days.
The Committee headed by Deputy Minister Dr. Harsha De Silva also includes Attorney General Jayantha Jayasuriya, Health Ministry Secretary Janaka Sugathadasa, Secretary to the Ministry of Higher Education D. C. Dissanayake and Chairman of the University Grants Commission Professor Mohan De Silva.
Meanwhile, the Movement against SAITM is continuing their protest in front of the Fort Railway station.
Another protest was held in front of the Ruhuna University yesterday (01) against the arrest of the Secretary of the University’s Students’ Union, Tharaka Sandaruwan.

hits._id: Don't approve gutters; President tells local government representatives.

President Mahinda Rajapaksa informed yesterday local government representatives not to approve equipping houses with gutters.

On this occasion the President instructed the local government representatives to take this action to eradicate the Dengue disease spreading in many areas these days.

hits._id: Gvt. is following the Mahinda Chinthana- JO

hits._id: Joint Opposition Parliamentarians write to President

The Joint Opposition has sent a letter to President Maithripala Sirisena last evening requesting for an opportunity present few facts, prior to signing the agreement pertaining to the Hambantota Port.
The Joint Opposition in its letter stated that although they looked forward to present facts to parliament regarding unfavourable clauses in the Agreement, the UNP did not allow it.
The letter also pointed out that the articles in the cabinet paper with regard to the agreement and actual clauses in the agreement to be signed were contradicting.

hits._id: Another 23 Sri lankan fishermen arrested by Indian Authorities.

_source.content: The Fisheries Ministry stated that only 39 Sri Lankan fishermen are under Indian custody for breaching Indian maritime boundary.Recently 23 fishermen were arrested and their 4 trawlers were seized by Indian coastal guards for breaching Indian maritime boundary.They have been taken to Kaaki-naada coastal belt.In addition, 16 Sri Lankan fishermen are kept in custody in Karnaataka.The Media spokesperson of the Fisheries Ministry Narendra Rajapaksha stated that they will take measures to immediately release this group of fishermen.Meanwhile, he further stated that an invitation has been extended to India to attend the bilateral meeting to be held in Sri Lanka, between the top level representatives to resolve the fisheries problem.

hits._id: Moral values are deteriorated to the extreme in the Current era: Maithripala.

_source.content: The Common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena says the moral values are deteriorated to the extremes in the present era.Addressing a businessmen forum in Colombo yesterday, Common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena said the safety of women and children have been gravely declined under the present government.

hits._id: Video : Opposition leader speaks about good governance.

hits._id: 6 killed and 48 injured in London attack, Foreign ministry say no Sri Lankans affected

hits._id: 8 new agreements signed between Sri lanka and Pakistan

The president said Pakistan has always been a steadfast friend of Sri Lanka.

hits._id: President of India extends greetings to Sri Lanka on Independence Day

_source.content: The President of India, Pranab Mukherjee has extended his greetings and felicitations to the Government and people of Sri Lanka on the eve of Sri Lanka's 67th Independence Day.In his message to President Maithripala Sirisena, President Mukherjee said the ties between India and Sri Lanka have matured over time to embrace all areas of contemporary significance and expressed confidence that the two nations' traditional bonds will "expand and flourish" to the mutual benefit in the years to come.He offered India's best wishes for the "continued prosperity and well-being of the friendly people of Sri Lanka" under the leadership of new Sri Lankan President.

hits._id: Update : Digambaran and Praba appointed as deputy ministers: Govet ministerial positions rise to 109 - video

Digambaram and Democratic People’s Congress Leader and Colombo district MP Prabha Ganeshan were sworn in as new deputy Ministers today before President Mahinda Rajapaksa.MP Digambaram took oaths as deputy minister of National Languages and Social Integration while MP Prabha Ganeshan took oaths as Telecommunication and Communication Technology deputy minister.After the swearing-in, Deputy Minister Prabha Ganeshan told our news team that with the new position, he will be able to serve the entire country.With the new deputy ministry positions created today, the number of ministerial positions rose to 109. There are 56 members of the present Cabinet of ministers including the President and the Prime Minister.In addition, there are 10 Senior Ministers, 40 deputy ministers, and two subject ministers.Out of 163 members of the ruling government, 56 still remain just parliamentarians.23 UNP MPs who defected the party and joined the government are currently holding ministry positions.Related story published below :http://www.hirunews.lk/89981/two-more-deputy-ministers-appointed

The Finance Ministry said after the draft bill was tabled in Parliament, several cases were filed in the Supreme Court against it.
The Finance Ministry said it is expected to add and introduce a number of revisions to the draft bill, based on the Supreme Court ruling and discussions the Ministry had with various other stakeholders.
The Ministry said that the PAYE threshold will be increased from 750,000 per annum to 1.2 million rupees through this new bill.

hits._id: Sri Lankan condemns terrorist attack on Afghanistan Parliament

hits._id: Japan offers higher education scholarships to Sri Lankan students

_source.content:
The Government of Japan will award scholarships to Sri Lankan students to pursue studies in Japanese Universities and Colleges for 2014 under the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology Scholarship scheme.
 
Under this scheme students may apply for College of Technology, Undergraduate or Post Graduate Research scholarships.
 
Clarifying the process of student selection, the Japanese Embassy in Colombo said in Sri Lanka the Japanese Government scholarship is channeled through the Ministry of Higher Education.

hits._id: Vasudeva uses derogatory language for the second time in Parliament

_source.content:
United People’s Freedom Alliance (UPFA) MP and former Minister of National LanguagesVasudeva Nanayakara was yesterday (01) accused of using un-parliamentary language.
Nanayakara had used un-parliamentary language on some ruling party Parliamentarians yesterday when they interrupted a privilege issue he raised with the Speaker.
During Parliament sittings yesterday, Parlaimentarian Nanayakara stated that a weekend newspaper had indicated that he was among the former Government members who had not returned his official residence.
Nanayakara rejected the allegations and demanded that the matter be taken up by the privileges committee.
However when he was speaking a few Government members continued to interrupt his speech and he reacted by using un-parliamentary language on them.
Government Parliamentarians objected to the language used and demanded that it be removed from the Parliament Hansard.

hits._id: Pakistani army chief arrives

_source.content:
Pakistani Army Commander Gen. Qamar Javed Bajwa has arrived in Sri Lanka for a 3-day visit at the invitation of his Sri Lankan counterpart Lt. Gen. Mahesh Senanayake.
 
Our airport correspondent said that the Pakistani army chief arrived here this afternoon (Jan. 15).
 
During his stay, Gen. Bajwa will hold talks with Sri Lankan authorities on matters of professional interests and other matters.
 
Gen. Bajwa will also call on Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe to discuss issues of regional security and matters of mutual interest.

hits._id: Prez and PM speaks at the death anniversary of late President Ranasinghe Premadasa

Lack of awareness among the public regarding work of the Good Governance is a shortcoming, President Maithripala Sirisena said.
He said this whilst attending the ceremony to commemorate the 23rd death anniversary of late President Ranasinghe Premadasa. The ceremony, which was organized by the Sucharitha foundation and his family, was held near the statue of him at Hulftsdorp.
Also speaking at the event Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said the country has achieved freedom of speech.
Late President’s son Minister of Housing and Samurdhi Sajith Premadasa was also present at the event.

hits._id: Assessment of damage to property in Meethotamulla begins today

_source.content:
Ministry of Home Affairs says that the assessment of property damage in the Meethotamulla garbage dump tragedy will begin today.
Issuing a communiqué, the Ministry pointed out that this assessment would be carried out by deploying staff from the Colombo District Secretariat and the Kolonnawa Divisional Secretariat.
The identification of residents living in dangerous zones and having them relocated to safe locations is also scheduled to begin today.
The communiqué also states that the Colombo District and the Kolonnawa Divisional Secretariats have been given necessary instructions.
Meanwhile President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday instructed officials to submit a report on the property damage, within five days.
Instructions were given at the relief provision discussion held at the Disaster Management Centre.

hits._id: Government To Set Up University For Police

_source.content:
Government will set up a university for the Police and Criminal Justice similar to that of the Deakin University in Melbourne, Australia, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said recently.
“We must not to look at the University Structure of Sri Lanka or UK when we design the structure of the proposed Police and Criminal Justice University but look at the structure of Deakin University in Melbourne, Australia which has a deputy Vice Chancellor for Academic Development and Staff programme,” the Prime Minister said.
Prime Minister Wickremesinghe was addressing the International Industrial Mathematics Conference 2016, organized by the Department of Mathematics, University of Sri Jayawardenapura held at Fingara Town and Country Club, Rattanapitiya, Boralesgamuwa.
The Prime Minister also asserted on the need to change the university structure.
“This is an ideal time to bring structural reforms to the country's higher education especially make changes in the ideology and structure of Sri Lanka's universities since we have a multi-party state,” the Prime Minister said.
The Premier also said that it was hard to bring reforms to the country's university education due to the interference of political parties with ideologies.
“Under the leadership of President Maithripala Sirisena, now we have a multi-party state. So this is an ideal opportunity for us to work for the country's development. So I invite university academics and other relevant authorities to join hands to bring reforms to country's university education by making the maximum use of this opportunity,” the Premier said.
He also emphasized the necessity of establishing language labs in universities.
The Prime Minister said the government has already paid attention towards the uplift of the country's school education system and added that the government has also taken measures to preserve the country's history by establishing a separate institution on history.

hits._id: Aloysius asked to get ready to be in prison for 9 months without bail ?

_source.content: A powerful individual from the government has asked Arjun Aloysius to get ready to be in prison for 9 months without bail.A very reliable source from the government said that Aloysius would be remanded for 9 months without bail over his alleged links with the Central Bank bond scam.The Bond Commission report recommended filing charges against 3 persons including the Perpetual Treasuries owner Arjun Aloysius via the Bribery Commission.Former Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake and the PTL CEO Kasun Palisena are the other 2.The Criminal Investigation Unit which was attached to the Bond Commission recorded statements from Aloysius for a period of 4 days.This is the statement made by President Maithripala Sirisena about the Bond Commission report.Meanwhile, former President Chandrika Kumaratunga at an event yesterday (Jan. 08) expressed views on the bond reports and the punishments needed to given to the perpetrators. Meanwhile, The Hindu reported that the Central Bank bond scam was the first major blow to the newly-elected government, especially to the UNP.Earlier, in October 2016, a parliamentary Committee on Public Enterprises ruled that Mahendran was “directly responsible” for the irregularities in the bond sale, it said.

hits._id: Former presidents makes appeal on behalf of Nation

_source.content: Former president Mahinda Rajapakse requested the government to continue the country’s development activities setting aside the disputes with him.

hits._id: Allied health science degree requires 120 credits Decision taken during discussion with President.-Video

_source.content: It was decided to offer degrees to Allied Health Science students on the basis of the completion of 120 credit marks.This decision was taken today during a discussion presided by President Mahinda Rajapaksa at Temple Trees this morning.However Court advice will be sought to implement this decision as the Allied Health Science dispute has already gone to court. Peradeniya University Vice Chancellor Professor Athula Senarathna said that an Allied Health Science student has to study at least four years to obtain 120 credit levels as one student can complete only 30 credit marks during one year.After today’s discussion, Professor Senarathna told our news team that there won’t be a three year degree program henceforth, and Allied Health Science students have to study for a four year degree instead.The Government Medical Officers Association, University Grants Commission, Higher Education Ministry, Health Ministry, Vice Chancellors of Ruhunu and Peradeniya Universities and Peradeniya University Allied Health Science Faculty Dean Dr. Mahinda Wickramarathna participated in the discussion.

hits._id: SLFP Ministers and MP's who voted for NCM to resign from posts tonight

State Minister Lakshman Yapa Abeywardene says 16 SLFP Ministers and MPs who voted for the NCM on PM will step down from their posts in the Unity Government from midnight today.
He also said that President Maithripala Sirisena gave his permission to the move during a meeting this evening (Apr. 11).
Altogether, 15 SLFP Ministers and Deputy Speaker Thilanga Sumathipala voted for the NCM on 4th of April.
S. B. Dissanayake, Dayasiri Jayasekera, W. D. J. Seneviratne, Sudharshani Fernandopulle, Susil Premajayantha, Anura Priyadharshana Yapa, Chandima Weerakkody, Lakshman Yapa Abeywardena, Dilan Perera, Anuradha Jayaratne, Sumedha G, Jayasena, T. B. Ekanayake, Lakshman Wasantha Perera, Susantha Punchinilame, Tharanath Basnayake and Deputy Speaker Thilanga Sumathipala voted for the NCM.

hits._id: Legal experts profess support for constitutional change with a public referendum

_source.content:
UNP said today that it would hold a referendum to get the new Draft Constitution passed within 6 months when it forms a new government.
 
The main feature of the UNP new Draft Constitution is its proposal to abolish the Executive Presidency while the preferential vote system and the provincial governor posts are also proposed to be annulled. 
 
It also suggests a separate Constitutional Court for the interpretation of the Constitution.
 
After distributing copies of the new Draft Constitution among civil organizations and party representatives, UNP Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe expressed his views on the new Draft.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
Commenting on the UNP move, Vice President of the Federation of University Teachers Association Venerable Dambara Amila Thera said that the approach to implementing the Constitution by different heads of state since 1978 is varied.

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
The Thera said that the mere change of the Constitution would not serve to resolve the prevailing problems in the country.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
Our news team contacted a Constitutional Law expert Senior Attorney Gomin Dayasiri to comment on the UNP’s attempt to hold a referendum to pass the new Draft Constitution.

			   
			   		
	
			    
Senior Lawyer Dayasiri said that a referendum could be held not only to pass a new draft constitution but also to amend the current Constitution as well. 
 
He said the government could set an example with this move and make any changes to the 13th Amendment.

			   
			   		
	
			    
The Soulbury Constitution which was effected in 1947 was in force at the time Sri Lanka was given ceremonial Independence in 1948.
 
In 1972, the Left Winged Samagi Peramuna Government led by the SLFP convened a Parliament Constitutional Board to pass the Socialist Republic Constitution, which was the first of its kind in the country.
 
Later in 1978, the UNP Government passed a new Constitution in which the current Executive Presidency was introduced.
 
President Chandrika Kumaratunga presented a new Draft Constitution in parliament in 2000 but her Government failed to pass the new draft.

hits._id: Update : Pictorial warning of cigarette packets reduced from 80 to  60 % Judgement of the appeal passed today.

_source.content: The Appeal Court informed today to limit the space of pictorial warning on cigarette packets between 50% to 60%.The Appeal Court passed the judgment after considering the case filed by Ceylon Tobacco Company against the Health Ministry Gazette notification.Earlier, the Health Ministry Gazette wanted tobacco companies to cover 80% of their packets with pictorial warnings.The Gazette on pictorial warning was approved unanimously in parliament in 2012.Later Appeal Court considered a case against the gazette notification filed by CTC and decided that it was legal to implement the gazette.However CTC challenged the gazette notification for the second time and the Appeal Court allowed the company to use 50 to 60% space on their cigarette packets.Update : Monday, 12 May 2014 - 13:31----------------------------------------------Court permits the Health Ministry to cover 50 to 60% of the cigarette packetCourt of Appeal today permitted the Health Ministry to cover 50 to 60% of the cigarette packet with a pictorial warning.The government issued a special gazette on August 8th, 2012 making it compulsory to display eight graphic warnings on cigarette packets.

The Joint Opposition, Tamil National Alliance and Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna have skipped the party leaders’ meeting convened by President Maithripala Sirisena at the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo.
 
The meeting began at 9 am this morning (Jan. 29).
 
Here, he drew the attention of introducing necessary laws to deal with the perpetrators named in the Bond commission report.
 
Representatives from the United National Party, leader of the Sri Lanka Communist Party, former Minister, D.E.W. Gunesekera and Jathika Hela Urumaya General Secretary, Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka were present.
 
In addition to the political party representatives, the Central Bank Governor, the Attorney General and Director General of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption attended the meeting.
 
Here, the President clarified the real story behind the charge that several pages of the Bond report have been removed before it was issued to the public domain.
 
The President reiterated that there were no pages missing from the report.
 
However, certain annexures have been withheld due to legal requirements.
 
Meanwhile, a party leaders meeting has been convened at 10 am tomorrow, to take a final decision as to when the Parliament should be convened, before the forthcoming Local Government election.

hits._id: Wimal Weerawansa Files FR Petition Against Increase Of Taxes

_source.content:
Parliamentarian Wimal Weerawansa today filed a Fundamental Rights petition against the increase of the VAT and NBT by the government, arguing that it violated the fundamental rights (FR) guaranteed under the articles 12 (1), 13 (1) and 14 (g) of the constitution.
The petitioner argued that the VAT and the NBT could not be increased without amending the relevant laws and presenting them to the Parliament for approval.
The petitioner seeks an interim order preventing the respondents from directing the public to pay the taxes and from collecting them.
The Finance Minister, The Secretary to the Finance Ministry, the Inland Revenue Commissioner General and the AG have been named respondents.

hits._id: Cabinet Approves Continuation Of Anti-Corruption Secretariat

_source.content:
The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the continuation of the Anti-Corruption Committee Secretariat.
The proposal tabled by Premier Ranil Wickremesinghe to continue the activities of the Anti-Corruption Committee Secretariat was accordingly approved by the Cabinet of Ministers.
The government intends to establish a body vested with powers to tackle fraud and corruption while formulating a new structure.

Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe is of the view that the continuation the Anti-Corruption Committee Secretariat is vital until such time Serious Fraud Office is established in Sri Lanka.

hits._id: Update: Process to destroy cocaine haul begins

_source.content:
Destroying of 928 kg of cocaine seized by Police Narcotics Bureau, commenced in Katunayaka.
President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe are attending the event.
Update:......................................................................Over 900 kg of cocaine to be destroyed
Over 900 kg of cocaine is to be destroyed today (Jan. 15) under the supervision of the Colombo Chief Magistrate in Katunayake.
 
The cocaine haul will be diluted, in public view, at the Katunayaka Board of Investment premises, and will then be burnt in Puttalam.
 
President Maithripala Sirisena will also be present to observe the procedure.
 
This is the first time that a haul of drugs that has been seized is to be destroyed in full view of the general public.
 
The Police Narcotics Bureau apprehended this haul of narcotics following a tip-off, which was concealed in a container on board the vessel, M.S.C. Pablo which had arrived in the Colombo harbor from Ecuador on its way to Belgium.
 
The ship had also been scheduled to dock at India’s Munra harbour.
 
The cocaine haul was seized during a raid on 9th of December 2016.
