hits._id: Indonesian President invites Sri Lankan President for a state visit

_source.content:
The President of Indonesia Joko Widodo has invited President Maithripala Sirisena for a state visit to Indonesia immediately after his scheduled participation at the Indian Ocean Rim Association Summit meeting to be held in Jakarta.
The Indonesian President's special envoy, Vice Minister of Foreign Affairs A M Fachir, delivered the invitation to President Sirisena at the Presidential secretariat yesterday.
President Sirisena will attend the IORA Summit which marks the 20th Anniversary of IORA, on 6th and 7th of March and pay a state visit on March 8th.
The President conveyed his thanks to President Widodo for the invitation and said he was looking forward to attending the Summit, and to meet the Indonesian President for discussions on furthering bilateral friendship and cooperation in trade, investment, tourism and other areas of common interest.
The Special Envoy, said that Indonesia has already dispatched the first consignment of the rice donation for drought relief announced by President Widodo.
President Sirisena conveyed his thanks to the President, the Government and the people of Indonesia for the donation.
He said the Indonesian donation of 5000 Metric Tons of rice symbolizes the strong friendship that exists between Indonesia and Sri Lanka.

hits._id: John Kerry Urged To Push Sri Lanka To Repeal PTA, Free Prisoners

_source.content:
US Secretary of State John Kerry has been urged to push Sri Lanka to repeal the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA), release political prisoners and return land held by the Army.
The Chairman of the US House Committee on Foreign Affairs Edward Royce has written to Kerry saying he supports the increased diplomatic engagement with the Sri Lankan Government.
He noted in the letter that the Government led by President Maithripala Sirisena had made several promises and continues to make “impressive, positive steps”.
Royce also urged Kerry to clearly outline steps the US will take to support reform in Sri Lanka, including implementing the recommendations of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Zeid Raad al Hussain and stressed on the importance of a clearly-articulated policy on Sri Lanka.
“I ask you to clearly outline the steps that the US Government will take to support reform, including efforts to implement recommendations from the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, and ensure that development and security assistance are in line with reform efforts. Secretary, I believe it is important that the US carry out a clearly-articulated policy to support reform in Sri Lanka,” he further wrote.

hits._id: 4 years with 120 credits necessary – AHC students continue protest until a written agreement is released

_source.content: The Inter University Students Federation says that they would not give up their struggle until a written agreement to not curtail education is issued.Responding to the government solution made yesterday, Convener of IUSF Najith Indika told our news team of the stand of his organization.It was decided to offer degrees to Allied Health Science students on the basis of the completion of 120 credit marks.This decision was taken yesterday during a discussion presided by President Mahinda Rajapaksa at Temple Trees.However Court advice will be sought to implement this decision as the Allied Health Science dispute has already gone to court.IUSF also says that it would also agree to the mechanism which requires to complete 120 credits.Peradeniya University Vice Chancellor Professor Athula Senarathna said that an Allied Health Science student has to study at least four years to obtain 120 credit levels as one student can complete only 30 credit marks during one year.After the today’s discussion, Professor Senarathna told our news team that there won’t be a three year degree program henceforth, and Allied Health Science students should have to study for a four year degree instead.The Government Medical Officers Association, University Grants Commission, Higher Education Ministry, Health Ministry, Vice Chancellors of Ruhunu and Peradeniya Universities and Peradeniya University Allied Health Science Faculty Dean Dr. Mahinda Wickramarathna participated in the discussion held at Temple Trees.

hits._id: 8 State and deputy ministers sworn in

_source.content: 4 new state ministers and 4 deputy ministers were sworn in before President Maithripala Sirisena today. Former Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs Dr. Harsha de Silva was appointed as the Deputy Minister of Economic Development and Policy Implementation, which is under the purview of Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe. Former Public Enterprise Development Deputy Minister Eran Wickramaratne was appointed as the State Minister of Finance while Lasantha Alagiyawanna, the former Deputy Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, has been appointed as the Deputy Minister of Finance and Mass Media. With the appointment of Lasantha Alagiyawanna, the post of Deputy Minister of Megapolis and Western Development remains vacant. Lakshman Yapa Abeywardane who formally held the post of State Finance Minister, was appointed as the State Minister of Public Enterprise Development.Wasantha Senanayake who was the State Minister of Irrigation was appointed as the State Minister of Foreign Affairs. It is significant that previously, state ministers were not appointed for the portfolios of foreign affairs and public enterprise development. It is also important to note that a deputy minister for foreign affairs has not been appointed. Palitha Range Bandara who previously held the post of State Minister of Skills Development and Vocational Training was appointed as the State Minister of Irrigation. Karunaratne Paranavithane who was the Deputy Minister of Parliamentary Reforms and Mass Media, was appointed as the Deputy Minister of Skills Development and Vocational Training. Meanwhile, during the previous cabinet reshuffle, the ministerial portfolios of Social Empowerment, Welfare and Kandyan Heritage were merged under one ministry. As such Ranjan Ramanayake who held the post of Deputy Minister of Social Empowerment and Welfare was sworn in as the Deputy Minister of Kandyan Heritage. Subsequent to the latest reshuffle, the number of deputy minsters has reduced from 25 to 24, while the number of state ministers has risen to 22 from the previous number of 21. Meanwhile, a senior minister speaking to our new team said there would be a reshuffle in the posts of ministry secretaries as well. He also stated that the gazette detailing the change in ministerial portfolios will also be issued this week.

hits._id: President orders to cancel Central Provincial Council’s trip to Russia

_source.content:
Governess of the Central Provincial Council Niluka Ekanayake has given orders to cancel the second group of councilors that was to go to Russia.
The decision was taken after President Maithripala Sirisena issued directive that the Treasury approval should be obtained by Provincial Councils before they organize such overseas trips.
A communiqué issued by the President’s Media Unit states that the President was unaware of the extravagant trips organized by the Central Provincial Council.
At the same time, our news team contacted Central Provincial Council Chief Minister Sarath Ekanayake to comment on the developments with regard to the matter.
Ekanayake said that he instructed the Provincial Secretary to prepare a full report on the controversial trip and submit it to the President.
He also said that necessary funds had been allocated for the trip by the council in its previous budget.

hits._id: Update: Ex-CJ Shirani was removed illegally - PM

_source.content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe made a special statement in parliament today on the removal of Mohan Peries from the Chief Justice post and inviting Dr. Shirani Bandaranayake to resume duties as the 43rd Chief Justice.Speaking further, Premier Wickremesinghe said that the Bar Association has been maintaining its stand stating the removal of Chief Justice Dr. Shirani Bandaranayake is illegal.Update: Friday, 30 January 2015 - 08:06 PM....................................................................................CJ Peiris wanted an ambassadorial post- PMPrime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe revealed in the Parliament that former Chief Justice Mohan Peiris demanded an ambassadorial position. He further confirmed that former Chief Justice Mohan Peiris was present at Temple Trees in the night of the Presidential Election Day.The Prime Minister further said Peiris, later expressed his willingness to step-down provided he gets a diplomatic posting. The Prime Minister revealed that there was an issue with regard to the manner in which Chief Justice Shirani Bandaranayake was flawed.Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said:“When I questioned as to what he was doing at Temple Trees at that hour, he humbly replied me that he was there to advice.During the speech, several opposition MPs including MP Wimal Weerawansa and MP Dinesh Gunawardene were seen disturbing Parliament. MP Dinesh Gunawardene stood by the statement of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, and emphasized that former Chief Justice never made such a request.Following the statement of PM Ranil Wickremesinghe, members present within the chamber began to speak out, it was then that Opposition Leader Nimal Siripala De Silva requested Speaker Chamal Rajapaksa to convene a party leaders meeting. PM Ranil Wickremesinghe further said he is poised to face any debate over the Chief Justice’s issue.  Update: Friday, 30 January 2015 - 04:39 PM....................................................................................Parliament AdjournedPrime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe made a special statement in the parliament today on the issue surrounding the position of Chief Justice.The Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe further said he is willing to face any debate over the Chief Justice’s issue.  Following the statement of PM Ranil Wickremesinghe, members present within the chamber had begun to protest over the statement. The speaker of Parliament then took steps to adjourn the Parliamentary proceedings for 20 minutes to conduct the Party Leaders meeting

hits._id: Update: Country would be developed while preserving good governance - PM

_source.content:
Leaders of the United National Front for Good Governance led by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe visited the Sacred Temple of the Tooth Relic today to receive the blessings of the Buddha before the launching of their election campaign.

The UNF delegation was received by the Chief Custodian Nilanga Delebandara.

Ministers Patali Champika Ranawaka, Arjuna Ranatunga, Lakshman Kiriella, Rajitha Senarathna, Ravi Karunanayake and UNP President Malik Samarawikcrama were among the delegation.

After participating in religious activities, the UNF delegation led by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe paid a courtesy call to the Malwathu Chief Prelate Most Venerable Tibbatu-waawe Sri Sumangala Thera.

During his discussion with the Nayake Thera, the premier stated that his goal is to implement the good governance program and increase the country’s economic growth.

Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe pointed out the need of a strong government to achieve his goal.

The Chief Prelate also stated that he has a good understanding of such goals. 

Meanwhile, former President Mahinda Rajapaksa also engaged in religious activities at the Sacred Temple of the Tooth Relic to receive the blessings of the Sacred Tooth Relic. 
Addressing the gathering later, he said that the government servants are facing a lot of problems, as more than 500 government servants have been questioned concerning various matters.
 Update: Tuesday, 14 July 2015 - 19:04-----------------------------------------------
United National front for good governance leaders led by the Prime Minister pay a courtesy call on Malwathu Chief PrelateLeaders of the United National Front for Good Governance led by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe visited the Sacred Temple of the Tooth Relic today to receive the blessing of the Buddha before their election campaign is launched.The United National Front for Good Governance delegation was received by the Chief Custodian Nilanga Delebandara.Ministers Patali Champika Ranawaka, Arjuna Ranatunga, Lakshman Kiriella, Rajitha Senaratne, Ravi Karunanayake and UNP Chairman Malik Samarawickrama accompanied in the delegation.After participating in religious activities, the UNF delegation led by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe is having a discussion with the Malwatu Chief Prelate.After participating in the inaugural UNP election rally in Kandy this afternoon, the delegation expect to pay a courtesy call on the Asgiriya Chief Prelate as well.

D. Laalkaantha challenged the UNP yesterday.That was to pledge, if he could, to re-acquire for the people, under a future UNP Government, all the people’s properties plundered by powerful elements of all Governments that ruled from 1948 to date.The former MP said so while participating at a seminar themed “ The New Challenge of the People’s Struggle” held in Colombo yesterday.

hits._id: Britain supports Sri Lanka

_source.content: British Minister of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Office Hugo Swire said that Britain has appealed against the de-proscription of the LTTE in the European Union.He said due to the appeal, the LTTE still remains a proscribed organisation in the EU, and added that the UK supports the belief that the LTTE should not be permitted to clear its name from the list of terrorists.The LTTE was first proscribed in the EU in 2006, months after the assassination of former Foreign Minister Lakshman Kadirgamar by an LTTE sniper.In October last year, the EU Court of Justice annulled the LTTE ban on procedural grounds, saying that a proper procedure was not followed in continuing the ban.The action would have unfreezed LTTE assets within the EU and removed its designation as a terrorist organisation, if not for the appeal.UK Foreign Minister Hugo Swire, who concluded his three-day visit to Sri Lanka yesterday, met with President Maithripala Sirisena and Foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera.This is the British Foreign Minister’s second visit to Sri Lanka and the first Ministerial visit since the formation of a new government in the island nation earlier this month.Swire welcomed the early commitments announced by President Sirisena to lead a more democratic and accountable government.

hits._id: Update: Sajin Vaas Gunawardana remanded

_source.content:
MP Sajin de Vass Gunawardana has been remanded until 20th of this month after he was arrested by the CID this afternoon.MP Gunawardana was remanded when he was produced before Colombo Chief Magistrate Gihan Pilapitiya in connection with the misuse of 20 vehicles belonging to the President’s Secretariat.MP Sajin de Vass Gunawardana reported to the CID this morning to give a statement with regard to misplacing of several vehicles that belonged to the President Secretariat.Police Media Spokesman ASP Ruwan Gunasekera said the MP was arrested after questioning him.
Update : Monday, 11 May 2015 - 19:50 ...........................................................................................................................................Sajin Vaas arrestedA controversial Sri Lankan MP and businessman Sajin de Vass Gunawardena has been arrested by Criminal Investigation Department (CID) over the allegation of misusing vehicles belongs to the Presidential Secretariat short while ago, Police sources stated.
A current Member of Parliament of Sri Lanka was the former CEO of Mihin Lanka government sponsored budget airline.
He has also served as coordinating secretary on trade and foreign affairs to the President of Sri Lanka. Prior to entering parliament in 2010 he was a member of the southern provincial council.
Sajin has been involved in several controversies, and was widely criticized for his role as CEO of Mihin Lanka and for his involvement in the bankruptcy and financial misfortune of the airline.
He also had served as the former foreign affairs monitoring minister during Ex-President Mahinda Rajapaksa regime.
Update : Monday, 11 May 2015 - 14:32...........................................................................................................................................Criminal Investigation Department (CID) currently recording a statement from MP Sajin Vaas Gunawardena over the misuse of vehicles belonging to the Presidential Secretariat, Police sources stated.

_source.content: The very first TV discussion in which Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe participated after the Presidential election was telecast last night through Hiru TV.That was through the Rata saha heta - The country and the Future programme.Expressing his views at the programme, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe stated that this was his first TV interview after the election.Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe expressed these views in reply to a question raised as to whether this political programme which is in a primitive state can be converted in to a more stable one.The future challenges to be encountered by the government were also explained byAnother question was directed at Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe if the government will actually be able to fulfill the pledges made in the 100 day programme.There were concerns from some factions on a delay in the relief provided to actually reach them.Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe in response stated that relief recived could be observed by the Sinhala New Year.Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe’s also spoke of economic goal of the government.He stated that 1 million jobs will be created and income of the public will be doubled.

hits._id: President to address UN today

_source.content:
The 72nd Session of the UN General Assembly will commence at the UN Headquarters in New York, today (19).
The General Debate is held under the theme, 'Focusing on People: Striving for Peace and a Decent Life for All on a Sustainable Planet'.
President Maithripala Sirisena is also due to address the General Assembly this evening.
This will be the third occasion that the President is addressing the UN General Assembly.
The President intends to brief the world leaders on consensual politics that is taking place in Sri Lanka, and reconciliation and peace being nurtured in the country.
In addition, the President will also share the initiatives taken by the government after declaring 2017 as the Year for Poverty Alleviation, and the concept of Green Development, mooted by the government.
The President has joined the United Nations Economic and Social Council, a high level discussion on political reforms.
He is also scheduled to hold bilateral discussions with several world leaders participating in the sessions.

hits._id: Ravinath is right – says the Foreign Ministry

_source.content:
The Foreign Ministry rejects the allegations that the views expressed by Ravinath Ariyasinghe, Sri Lanka's Permanent Representative in Geneva contradict with that of the Sri Lankan government.  Issuing a special communique the Foreign Ministry states that such records were publicized by certain parties. 
Ravinath Ariyasinghe, Sri Lanka's Permanent Representative in Geneva expressed his views at two conferences regarding the US Resolution on Sri Lanka. The media reported that certain statements he made are contradictory to the conventions of the Sri Lankan government. However the Foreign Ministry points out that he expressed those views under the guidance of the Foreign Ministry at those unofficial assemblies participated by countries under the UNHRC as well as representatives of civil society and non-governmental organizations.

hits._id: Results of all 22 districts released;Common Candidate Maithreepala's voter percentage exceeds 51%

_source.content: Results of all 22 districts have been released by now.According to the district results of Postal votes in Kegalle District, President Mahinda Rajapaksa obtained 278 thousand 130 votes, while Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena obtained 252 thousand 533 votes.According to the Postal votes in Wanni District, Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena obtained 141 thousand 417 votes while President Mahinda Rajapaksa obtained 34 thousand 377 votes.Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena won the Digamudulla district postal votes results by obtaining 233 thousand 360 votes while President Mahinda Rajapaksa obtained 121 thousand 27 votes.In Matara district, President Mahinda Rajapaksa led the district postal votes by obtaining 297 thousand 823 votes, while common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena obtained 211 thousand 895 votesIn Jaffna district postal votes, Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena led by obtaining 253 thousand 574 votes while President Mahinda Rajapaksa obtained 74 thousand 454 votesPostal vote results of Hambantota district, President Mahinda Rajapaksa led by obtaining 243 thousand 295 votes while Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena obtained 138 thousand 708 votesThe Colombo district postal votes was won by Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena by obtaining 725 thousand 73 votes, while President Mahinda Rajapaksa obtained 562 thousand 614 votes.In addition, Common Candidate Maithreepala Sirisena won the district postal votes of Batticaloa, Nuwara Eliya, Trincomalee, Matale and Kandy districts, while President Mahinda Rajapaksa won the district postal votes of Moneragala and Galle districts.

hits._id: Wimal meets President, raises concerns on issues of national importance

_source.content:
The leader of the National Freedom Front, MP Wimal Weerawansa and a group of the party of members met President Maithripala Sirisena at his official residence in Colombo last evening (11).
During the meeting, a letter was handed over to the President requesting his attention to 3 issues of national importance.
The interim committee report on the new constitution, the process followed by the government when passing certain acts and the international need to divide Sri Lanka were the 3 main issues highlighted in the letter.
The delegation also informed the President about the aggressive insult being directed at the Maha Sangha.
State Minister Dilan Perera was also present at this occasion.

hits._id: Austrian President Lauds Peace and Progress in Sri Lanka

_source.content:
Concluding his assignment as Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Austria, Ambassador A.L. A. Azeez paid a farewell call on Heinz Fischer, President of Austria, at Hofburg Palace in Vienna yesterday. 
Ambassador Azeez apprised the Austrian President of positive developments in Sri Lanka including progress in reconciliation, peace building and development improved bilateral relations between Sri Lanka and Austria as well as between Sri Lanka and the other countries in the region, possibilities that exist in Sri Lanka for promotion of trade, investment and tourism, under the new Government.
The Austrian President stated that he was pleased that Sri Lanka was going through a period of positive transformation under the leadership of President Maithripala Sirisena.

Addressing a media conference held in Colombo today, Aluthgamage said the Chinese company has informed the government that it will sign the agreement if only Sri Lanka Port Authority also signs the document. Meanwhile, the Joint Opposition filed a petition with the Bribery commission this morning alleging that state funds have been abused in transferring the Maagampura port to a Chinese company. MPs Mahinda Yapa Abeywardana, Ranjith Soyza, Pavitra Wanni Aarachchi and Piyal Nishantha were signatory to this petition. Minister of International Trade Malik Samarawickrama, Senior Advisor to the Prime Minister R. Paaskaralingam and ministry secretaries of Port and Shipping, International Trade and Finance have been named as respondents of this petition.

hits._id: Video: Government issues necessary visa to controversial Channel 4 film director

_source.content:
The government has issued necessary visa to controversial Channel 4 film director Callum Macrae to cover the CHOGM in Colombo.

Media and Information Ministry Secretary Charitha Herath said that Macrae was given visa on the recommendation of the Media and Information Ministry of Sri Lanka.
  
Macrae produced 2 documentaries of alleged war crimes during the last phase of the war in the North and Channel 4 telecast them at 2 occasions. The third anti-Sri Lankan documentary was arranged to screen in New Delhi tomorrow but Indian government has not given Macrae visa to enter India.

Meanwhile Radio New Zealand website stated that a New Zealand parliamentarian and a Malaysian parliamentarian together with an Australian Senate member will visit Sri Lanka before the CHOGM.

 The Australian Senator expects to submit a special report to its parliament on his visit to Sri Lanka.

His opinion is that the Colombo CHOGM will stand in good stead for peace and development in the Asia Pacific region.

The website further stated that another aim of the tour by the trio in Sri Lanka is to find out the true reasons for Canadian Prime Minister to boycott the Colombo CHOGM.
Update Wednesday, 06 November 2013 - 7:55 PM-------------------------------------------------No Visa issued for Channel 4 DirectorIndian government has denied visa for UK based Channel 4 television Director Callum Macrae preventing his attempt to screen an anti-Sri Lankan documentary in New Delhi. He had planned to screen the documentary on November 7, and he was expected to arrive in New Delhi tomorrow. However Macrae told the Times of India that he did not receive necessary visa at that time. Indian External Affairs State Minister E. Ahamad has stated the External Affairs Ministry does not intervene in issuing visa to individuals but it solely taking place under the general rules and regulations. Meanwhile Macrae has stated that India’s decision to deny him visa was not acceptable while Sri Lankan government has consented to issue him visa to cover forthcoming Commonwealth Summit in Colombo. Media and Information Ministry Secretary Dr. Charitha Herath stated recently that a Channel 4 television crew would be given necessary visa to cover CHOGM in Sri Lanka.

Meanwhile, in a twitter message he reaffirmed India's continued solidarity & support for Sri Lanka's peace, development & prosperity.Meanwhile, US Secretary of State John Kerry today said the U.S. looks forward to working with Sri Lankan president-elect Maithripala Sirisena, as he commended outgoing President Mahinda Rajapaksa for accepting the election results.The United States applauds the Sri Lankan Elections Commissioner, the security forces, Sri Lankan civil society, and the candidates themselves for making sure this election was not marred by unrest and for ensuring a significant drop in campaign-related violence.

hits._id: Dr. Coomaraswamy takes over his duties as the Central Bank Governor today

_source.content:
Dr. Indrajit Coomaraswamy who was appointed the new Central Bank Governor will hand over relevant documents of his position today.
He will take over his duties today.
The appointment was made following a lengthy discussion between President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.
After they made the selection public, Dr. Coomaraswamy met the island heads on Saturday (02).
He will replace former Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran whose duty period expired on 30th last month.
Dr. Coomaraswamy who was born in 1950, pursued his education at Colombo Royal College and Harrow College in England.
He holds a first class honours degree from the Cambridge University and obtained his PhD from the Sussex University.
After joining the Central Bank in the year 1973, he served as an officer attached to the sections of economic research, statistics and Bank Supervision until 1989.
He also served in the Ministry of Finance and Planning from 1981 to 1989.
Later he served as the Director of Economic Affairs at the Commonwealth Secretariat from 1990 to 2008.

hits._id: The Government in preparation for a reply to the UN statement abut impeachment.

_source.content:
Reports say that the Sri Lanka Government is getting ready to send an appropriate reply to the statement the UNO has made with regard to the impeachment against the Chief Justice.

A Foreign Affairs Ministry senior spokesman said that the Government would communicate its stance with regard to the subject to the UN.

UN's Independent Judges' and Lawyers' Special spokesperson Gabriel Knavul had recently made a statement with regard to the impeachment against the Chief Justice.

In this statement the special spokesperson had said that the UN was paying its attention on the impeachment.

The spokesperson had made a request to the Sri Lankan Government to reconsider the impeachment presented in parliament.

The UN representative has stated further that the report of the PSC on impeachment had become politicised.

A senior Foreign Affairs Ministry spokesman told our news team that the UN special spokeswoman had made the statement without proper inquiry into the impeachment brought forward against the Chief Justice.

Meanwhile the Appeal Court is scheduled to take up for hearing tomorrow the petition Chief Justice Dr. Shirani Bandaranayake had filed against the PSC on impeachment.

The Speaker and the members of the PSC on Impeachment have been noticed to appear before court tomorrow.

The petition will be taken up for hearing before a three-member bench of Judges comprising Appeal Court Justices S. Sri Skandaraja, A. W. A. Salaam and Anil Gunaratne.

hits._id: President meets Russian Prime Minister

_source.content:
Russian Prime Minister Dmitry Med-ve-dev stated that he would be committed to pass on the benefit of Sri Lanka-Russia relations to the people of the country.
He announced this during his meeting with visiting Sri Lankan President Maithripala Sirisena today.The two leaders drew close attention to further broaden bilateral relations on economic, trade as well as cultural sectors.
President Maithripala Sirisena has stated that Sri Lanka anticipates assistance from all friendly nations in its innovative journey towards development.
Meanwhile, Russia’s Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs, Igor Morgulov stated that the friendship between President Maithripala Sirisena and Russian President Vladimir Putin is a turning point for the bilateral relations between the two countries.
President’s Media Unit stated that the deputy minister made this remark at a special ceremony held last night to mark 60 years since establishing diplomatic relations between the two countries.
President Maithripala Sirisena graced the event as the chief guest.

hits._id: No more IMF loans - Says Central Bank

_source.content:
Government has decided not to pursue a fresh support facility form the International Monetary Fund but will continue to maintain the close relationship with the lender under standard consultation processes similar to many other member countries.

The Central Bank of Sri Lanka in a statement released today said since the completion of the 2.6 billion dollar Stand-by-arrangement in July 2012, Sri Lankan authorities and the IMF have been engaging in a dialogue on the future relationship between Sri Lanka and the Fund.

The Central Bank noted, Since Sri Lanka is in a better economic position now with gross reserves amounting to 7 billion dollars than with the 1 billion dollars of reserves it had when the SBA was approved in July 2009, there is very little need for the government to build up a further cushion in external reserves through traditional IMF Balance of Payment support programs.

Under these circumstances, Sri Lankan authorities had expressed their interest only in a future IMF support to finance the budget to achieve government target of 5.8 percent of GDP fiscal deficit in 2013 and below 5 percent in years ahead.

However, following discussion Sri Lankan authorities had with the visiting IMF delegation, the IMF has indicated that the Fund may not be in a position to consider any direct or indirect budget support to Sri Lanka, since the current improved state of the country does not warrant unconventional and exceptional financial support.

According to the Central Bank, the IMF is also of the view that Sri Lanka has now developed well-established access to international capital markets and therefore budget support if necessary, could be conveniently accessed from such markets.

Deputy Director of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka Prof. Nandalal Weerasinghe gave the following explanation as to why Sri Lanka refrained from taking part in the International Monetary Fund's new loan program.


			   
			   		
	
			   

The IMF had stated that Sri Lanka's financial base had stabilized and that funds cannot be provided to bridge the budget deficit.

Deputy Director of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka had the following to say in this regard.

hits._id: Task force to eliminate violence against women

_source.content: A task force has been appointed to implement the proposals of the Commission Report on the elimination of violence against women and female children.Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe stated this while attending the National Women’s Day celebration held in Anuradhapura today.Professor Savithri Gunasekara has been appointed as the Chairperson of the Task Force, while Doctor Selvi Thirichelwam has been appointed as the Executive Director.This commission was established by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, while he was serving as the Opposition Leader.The report of the commission was presented to the parliament by Minister of Women’s Affairs Chandrani Bandara on the 6th of this month.While attending the national celebration, the Prime Minister reiterated that the responsibility of the task force is to implement the recommendations of the report within one year.The Prime Minister stated that sufficient attention has not been given to violence committed against women in the country, and that relief measures are taken only after the offence has been committed.He emphasized that legal and administrative action should be taken to prevent violence against women.He added that Commission Report on elimination of violence against women and female children was presented to the parliament on the 6th of this month.Speaking further regarding the matter, he stated that women will represent the state council established by the 19th amendment which is to be presented to the parliament in future.In addition, measures will be taken to increase the women representation at local government institutes by 25%.

Meanwhile the Fruits Week inauguration celebration at the Fruits Research and Development Centre in Kananvila in Horana  took place under the patronage of President Mahinda Rajapaksa yesterday.

hits._id: President to arrive in France shortly

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena will arrive in France today to participate in the United Nations Climate Change Summit.

This is after concluding his visit to Malta during which he participated in the Commonwealth sessions.

The UN Climate Change Summit is scheduled to commence tomorrow with the participation of nearly 80 State Leaders.

President Sirisena also participated in the Commonwealth Climate Change summit which was held as part of the sessions in Malta.

Meanwhile, President Maithripala Sirisena met with French President François Hollande on the sidelines of the Commonwealth leader’s summit.

President Sirisena stated that Sri Lanka will continue to assist France to stand strong against terrorism.

Meanwhile, President Maithripala Sirisena also met with British Prime Minister David Cameron, Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull and Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudo.

Meanwhile, Sri Lanka also joined as a founding member of a new 1 billion US Dollar Commonwealth Green Finance Facility to support environmental projects within the 53-nation bloc as the race against climate change intensifies.

hits._id: Persuade SL to release Tamil prisoners: Karunanidhi

_source.content:
DMK leader M Karunanidhi on Monday urged Prime Minister Modi to put pressure on the Sri Lankan government to release political prisoners as promised by President Maithripala Sirisena during the Presidential elections.
He said “The Sri Lankan government is breaking its promise in the matter of the release of the Tamil political prisoners. During the 2015 Presidential elections, Tamils overwhelmingly voted for Hon. Maithiripala Sriseana as he had promised that Tamil prisoners will be given general amnesty and released immediately after his swearing in.” Sirisena went back on the promise given by him and released only 31 prisoners on conditional bail.
The prisoners had refused to accept the conditional bail and gone back to the prison, he said, in a letter to Modi. “More than 200 prisoners are now on a fast-unto-death struggle inside the prisons.
Tamils have begun peaceful protests. On November 13 the entire Tamil-homeland consisting of the Northern and Eastern Provinces protested by observing a harthaal, responding to a call by all political parties of the Tamils including the TNA.
All shops were closed. Schools did not function. Buses did not run. By breaking their promises, Sinhalese are pushing the Tamils to a struggle-mode, largely non-violent,” Karunanidhi said.

hits._id: ‘Footsteps of Reconciliation’- the war victory celebrations will be held tomorrow

_source.content:
The seventh war victory celebrations will be held under the theme of ‘Footsteps of Reconciliation’ (Sanhindiyawe Piyasatahan), the Ministry of Defence has decided.
The event is due to be held on May 18 at the Parliamentary Grounds in Battaramulla. President Maithripala Sirisena will grace the event as the chief guest.
It will begin at 4.00 p.m. opposite the War Heroes Memorial with the participation of the President, Prime Minister, Commanders of the Tri Forces, Parliamentarians, members of the Tri Forces, Sri Lanka Police, Civil Defence Department along with War Heroes’ family members.

hits._id: JHU and NFF Stand on UNP no confidence motion against the government will be announced tomorrow.

_source.content: The no confidence motion brought against the government by UNP is scheduled to be debated in parliament tomorrow and day after tomorrow.Two government coalitions JHU and NFF stated that their stand on the no confidence motion will be announced tomorrow.The no confidence motion was submitted to parliament over the government’s failure to stop large scale smuggling of heroin and other dangerous drugs into the country.Twenty six MPs put their signatures to this no confidence motion and government collation JHU severely criticized various parties allegedly linked to these drug rackets. However JHU Media Spokesman Nishantha Sri Warnasinghe said that a decision with regard to the no confidence motion will be taken when the party central committee meets this afternoon.In addition, another government coalition NFF also expects to hold a discussion with regard to the no confidence motion.NFF Media Spokesman and Central working Committee member Mohammad Musammil had this to say.Meanwhile addressing a media briefing held in Colombo yesterday, UNP Media Spokesman MP Gayantha Karunatilaka invited JHU and NFF to support the no confidence motion against the government and prove their patriotism.The JVP is also expected to announce the party stand on the proposed no confidence motion.

hits._id: Ranil sets conditions on Rathana Thera's proposed constitution

_source.content: Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe questioned in parliament today about the 19th Amendment to the Constitution proposed by JHU MP Athuraliye Rathana Thera.He told parliament that his party would support the 19th Amendment if it is not rushed but presented after wide discussions.

hits._id: "Will Decide on Next step after Meeting Finance Minister" - GMOA

_source.content:
Even though the outcome of the meeting with the President and the Health Minister was positive, the Government Medical Officers Association (GMOA) stated today its future action would be decided based on the outcome of the next meeting with the Prime Minister and the Finance Minister between December 10 and 19.
GMOA Secretary Dr. Nalinda Herath said the President’s response was positive when they pointed out that most of their concessions had been cut down in the budget.

hits._id: MR makes a revelation on Shadow Cabinet

_source.content:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa stated that the team of parliamentarians appointed as monitoring MPs during the budget reading have been nominated as the shadow cabinet of the Joint Opposition. 
He stated this in response to the questions raised by reporters, following a ceremony held at Wennappuwa yesterday.

hits._id: UNHRC raises concerns over situation in Sri Lanka

_source.content:
UN High Commissioner for Human Rights, Zaid Al Rad Hussein says he's alarmed by the current situation in Sri Lanka.
 
He mentioned this while delivering his message to the member countries at the 37th session of the UNHRC.
 
Prince Hussein said the UN member states would be encouraged to explore the use of universal jurisdiction in the absence of progress in accountability and transitional justice.
 
He added, "There should be no impunity either for the incitement that led to the violence or the attack themselves"
 
At the same time, the European Union issuing a communiqué said that the criminals who engaged in malicious crimes should be brought to book with immediate effect.
 
The communiqué added, "The EU trusts that any actions taken under the State of Emergency will be proportionate and respect constitutional rights and freedoms".
 
The EU said that it is vital that all political leaders, religious and other community leaders condemn violence and make every effort to promote understanding and harmony between communities.
 
Meanwhile, Chinese Foreign Affairs Ministry spokesperson, Geng Shun said the Sri Lankan government and its people have the ability to control the existing situation in the country.
 
Expressing his views on the current situation, he said that he is confident the Sri Lankan Government will take steps to ensure the safety of Chinese expatriates in Sri Lanka.
 
Meanwhile, the Curfew imposed in Kandy on last afternoon (Mar. 07) was temporarily lifted at 10 this morning.
 
The Government Information Department stated that President Maithripala Sirisena had decided to lift curfew after receiving several requests from the public to do so.
 
It was announced that the curfew will be re-imposed at 6 this evening.
 
Earlier, it was announced that the curfew imposed at 4 last evening would continue until 4 this evening.

hits._id: Dullas says that Speaker Karu Jayasuriya disappointed the joint opposition

_source.content:
The Joint Opposition says that all its fresh hopes have been rendered void due to the Speaker’s current line of action.
MP Dullas Alahapperuma said so while participating at a media briefing held in Colombo yesterday.
A tense situation erupted in parliament yesterday when passing the draft local government election amendment Act.
Subsequently MPs representing the Joint Opposition called an emergency media briefing to say that the passing of the draft Act was illegal.
However on this occasion the Joint Opposition MPs pointed out that they didn’t get their due opportunity in parliament.
Meanwhile journalists inquired from the Joint Opposition with regard to the action that would be taken if the current situation prevailed in the future as well.
MPs Dinesh Gunawardhana and Dullas Alahapperuma who participated in the media briefing responded as follows:
Pivituru Hela Urumaya general secretary Udaya Gammanpila who participated in the media briefing said that the Government was not giving the joint opposition its due place in parliament hoping to make it submissive to the Government.

hits._id: Seventh War Victory Celebration On A Simple Manner

_source.content:
Seventh war victory celebration 2016 will be held on 18th May evening at the Parliamentary Grounds in Battaramulla under the patronage of the President Maithripala Sirisena.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, Commanders of tri forces, Parliamentarians, war heroes from tri-forces, Sri Lanka Police, and the Civil Defense Department, and the family members of the war heroes will be participated this national event.
On the same day, a reconciliation themed cultural show has also been organized at the Independence Square premises.
This year the war victory celebration will be organized in a simple manner reducing the huge unnecessary expenses, reportedly.

SLFP General Secretary Minister Duminda Dissanayake while explaining to our news team about the Central Committee meeting stated that those who created issues at the SLFP Political Council were not in their proper senses.

hits._id: No confidence motion against Finance Minister to be submitted to the Speaker today

The Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake said that the proposed no confidence motion against him is not a challenge for him.
The finance minister made this statement to media after participating in a religious event held at the Sri Bodhi Samudraramaya in Kotahena.
Earlier the Joint Opposition stated that they plan to move a no confidence motion against the finance minister, as he has misled parliament by presenting exaggerated statistics in his budget.
Accordingly, MP Bandula Gunawardana is scheduled to hand over the no confidence motion to the Speaker when parliament meets today.

hits._id: China says Sri Lanka loans made "based on consensus"

_source.content: The Chinese Foreign Ministry said China's loans to Sri Lanka were made based on consensus through talks between the two countries and at Sri Lanka's request, after Sri Lanka's foreign minister expressed concern about the loans.Foreign Affairs Minister Mangala Samaraweera speaking in Beijing over the weekend, said finance minister Ravi Karunanayaka would visit Beijing to discuss the roughly 5 billion dollars owed to China.Chinese Foreign Ministry spokeswoman said the loans were made on the principle of mutual benefit and would help promote development in Sri Lanka.President Maithripala Sirisena has unnerved China with his re-examination of certain projects that China has invested in, including a 1.5 billion dollar "port city" in Colombo.

hits._id: Dinesh requests additional security for MR

_source.content:
Joint Opposition's group leader Dinesh Gunawardena requested that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa should be given additional security during the election period.
 
He made this request from Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe while making a special statement in Parliament today (08).

In response, PM Wickremesinghe said already necessary steps have been taken on former President's security.

hits._id: Director General of Bribery Commission resigns; President’s and PM’s stance on independent commissions unchanged; statement from Speaker

_source.content: The Director General of the Commission to Investigate allegations on bribery or corruption Dilrukshi Dias Wickramasinghe has resigned from her post. She had tendered her letter of resignation to the President. She was appointed to the post by President Maithripala Sirisena on February 11th. Several attempts made by our news team to contact her failed. Meanwhile, speaker Karu Jayasuriya issued a statement and said that the President or the Prime Minister are neither uncertain nor contradict facts over the stance of the functions of independence commissions. The statement also said the stance of the president and the prime minister is that no force should be allowed, to intimidate the independence commissions in the future. Speaker Karu Jayasuriya further said in his statement that the independence commissions were set up to safeguard the democratic rights of people and such commissions should perform their national mission with confidence.

hits._id: Qatar and Sri Lanka to enhance development ties

_source.content:
Qatar and Sri Lanka agreed to appoint a joint committee to boost bilateral ties.
 
This was agreed upon during the bilateral discussions held between President Maithripala Sirisena and the Emir of Qatar Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani, in Doha yesterday (26).
 
The Qatari government also agreed to extend assistance to develop the ports in Sri Lanka and other infrastructure facilities.
 
The Emir of Qatar had also agreed to invest for a natural gas power plant in Sri Lanka and he had also agreed to extend assistance for development activities in Sri Lanka through Qatar Development Fund.
 
The two countries also signed seven new agreements following the bilateral talks between the two leaders.

hits._id: Prez to attend the Anti-corruption Summit in London

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena will leave on Wednesday (11) to attend the Anti-corruption Summit in London.
Prime Minister in Britain David Cameron has invited the president when they met at the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting held in Malta last year.
It was reported that the summit, a first of its kind, will bring together world leaders, business and civil society to agree a package of practical steps to expose corruption, punish the perpetrators and support those affected by corruption and drive out the culture of corruption wherever it exists.
After his return from his London trip the president will visit India to meet its Prime Minister Narendra Modi on May 13 and 14.

hits._id: Maithripala Sirisena, Sri Lanka's new president

_source.content: The newly elected President of Sri Lanka Maithripala Sirisena took oaths as the 6th Executive President of Sri Lanka at a ceremony held at Independence Square yesterday.Maithripala Sirisena was born on 3 September 1951 in Pulathisipura, Polonnaruwa.He was the son of World War II veteran Albert Sirisena. His mother was a school teacher.When Maithripala was only 17 years old he was chosen as the secretary of the SLFP Youth Organization in Polonnaruwa Sirisena obtained the SLFP membership in 1978 and started his long political carrier and yesterday he became the 6th Executive President of Sri Lanka.

_source.content:
19 State Ministers and 21 Deputy Ministers took oaths today (9th). Accordingly the total number of State and Deputy Ministers sworn-in today is 40. 3 Deputy Minsters were not present to take oath. The absentees are Siripala Gamlath, Anuradha Lanka Jayaratne and Sarathee Dushmantha.

The Swearing-in ceremony was held this aftrenoon at the Presidential Secretariat presided by President Maithripala Sirisena. State Ministers swore-in first.
The list of State Ministers:
1. H. M. Fowzie – National Integration and Reconciliation 2. Dilan Perera – Highways  3. T. B. Ekanayake – Lands  4. Priyankara Jayaratne – Law and Order & Prison Reforms 5. Lakshman Yapa Abeywardena – Finance  6. Ravindra Samaraweera – Labour and Trade Union Relations  7. V. Radhakrishnan – Education  8. Palitha Range Bandara – Skills Development & Vocational Training  9. Dilip Wedaarachchi – Fisheries & Aquatic Resources  10. Niroshan Perera – National Policy and Economic Affairs  11. Ruwan Wijewardene – Defence 12. M.L.A.M. Hizbullah – Rehabilitation and Resettlement  13. Mohan Lal Grero – University Education  14. Sujeewa Senasinghe – International Trade 15. Wasantha Senanayake – Irrigation and Water Resource Management  16. Vijayakala Maheswaran – Child Affairs  17. Wasantha Aluwihare – Agriculture  18. Sudarshani Fernandopulle – City Planning and Water Supply  19. Champika Premadasa – Industries and Commerce
                       
 List of Deputy Ministers:
1. Sumedha G. Jayasena - Sustainable Development & Wildlife2. Susantha Punchinilame – Public Administration and Management 3. Ameer Ali – Rural Economy4. Lasantha Alagiyawanna – Megapolice and Western Development 5. Indika Bandaranaike – Housing and Construction  6. Dulip Wijesekara – Post, Postal Services and Muslim Affairs  7. Lakshaman Wasantha Perera – Plantation Industries  8. Nishantha Muthuhettigama – Ports and Shipping  9. Faizal Kasim – Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine  10. Dunesh Gankanda – Disaster Management  11. Dr. Harsha de Silva – Foreign Affairs  12. Ashoka Abeysinghe – Transport  13. Arundika Fernando – Tourism Promotion and Christian Affairs 14. Ranjan Ramanayake – Social Empowerment & Welfare 15. Ajith P. Perera – Power and Renewable Energy  16. Nimal Lansa – Home Affairs  17. Anoma Gamage – Petroleum and Petroleum Gas 18. Eran Wickramaratne – State Enterprise Development  19. Tharanath Basnayake – Telecommunication and Digital Infrastructure  20. Karunarathna Paranawithana - Local Government and Provincial Councils  21. Mohamed Haris – Sports 
          

3 more cabinet Ministers and 40 state and deputy ministers sworn in todayThree more cabinet ministers and 43 State and Deputy Ministers were appointed today. 
 Vijith Vijayamuni Soyza who was appointed the Irrigation and Water Management Minister said that he would use his ministry to serve the people.

Meanwhile, Deputy Minister of Power and Renewable Energy Ajith P Perera said that he was offered a ministry where he can serve the people.

Deputy Minister of Disaster Management Dunesh Gankanda said that he would be able to render a great service to the people of Ratnapura.
--------LIVE --------UPDATE ----------------------------------3 more cabinet ministers were sworn in this morning before President Maithripala Sirisena.
Accordingly, Vijith Vijayamuni Zoysa, Faizer Mustafa and Malik Samarawickrama took oath as Irrigation and Water Management, Provincial Council and Local Government and Development strategies and International Commerce ministers respectively.
Meanwhile 45 state ministers will be sworn at 2 o’clock this afternoon at the Presidential Secretariat.
The Parliament had approved 48 Cabinet portfolios and 45 state and deputy ministers only, and 47 ministers have already taken oaths by this morning.
One more ministry still remains vacant to complete the 48 numbers of cabinet portfolios of the new government. If the President’s ministerial portfolio is ignored, two more could be sworn in as cabinet ministers.
Earlier the president said at the cabinet ministers swearing in ceremony that 15 cabinet portfolios are entitled to SLFP. 11 ministers representing the SLFP swore in that day and the total number of SLFP ministers is 12. Vijith Vijayamuni Zoysa and Faizer Mustafa who took oath today represent the SLFP and accordingly the number of ministerial portfolios claimed by the SLFP is 14. Therefore most probably the remaining one or two ministerial portfolios could go to MPs of the SLFP.
At the same time, 33 UNP cabinet ministers including the Prime Minister and Malik Samarawickrama have taken oaths so far.

Minister of Irrigation and Water Management – Vijith Vijithamuni Soysa
Minister of Provincial Councils and Local Government – Fyzer Musthafa
Minister of Development Strategies and International Trade – Malik Samarawickrama

hits._id: President Invites Expatriates To Return Home

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena extended an open invitation to all Sri Lankans in Germany who went there as refugees during the conflict to return to the motherland to enjoy the freedom and reap benefits of the ongoing development activities.
The President extended this invitation responding to a question by a journalist at the media briefing held following the official talks with the Federal Chancellor Dr. Angela Merkel, Yesterday (17). The President commended the assistance given by the Government of Germany for the development work in Sri Lanka for over past five decades. He said his aim is to develop the long–standing partnership between the two countries into new areas of cooperation.
Addressing the press briefing the Chancellor said she is happy with the democratic changes which took place in Sri Lanka under the leadership of the President Maithripala Sirisena and expressed her satisfaction over establishing peace in the country. Chancellor pledged every possible assistance that she can provide for the future plans of Sri Lanka.
She further said that the German Government will provide assistance to prevent renal disease and also pledge to provide assistance for the construction of water purification system. She also promised to send a representative team of German experts to conduct experiments on people suffering from kidney problems.
The German Chancellor said Sri Lanka is a country which has tourist attraction and expressed her willingness to further improve the tourist relations in the two countries. She also stated that the actions will be taken to further send German investors to Sri Lanka by enhancing the trust and awareness of those investors on Sri Lanka.

hits._id: President commences state visit to Japan

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena arrived in Japan today (12) with the aim to further strengthen long-standing bilateral relations between Japan and Sri Lanka.The President, after successfully concluding the 2-day official visit to India, commenced his visit to Japan. A special delegation of the government of Japan warmly welcomed the President and the Sri Lankan delegation at the Narita International Airport in Tokyo.During this visit, the President is scheduled to meet Emperor Akihito and Empress Michiko and the official welcome ceremony for President Sirisena will be held at Japan’s Prime Minister’s Office on Wednesday.Later, the President will hold bilateral discussions with the Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe and during this meeting, comprehensive attention will be paid to further strengthen the trade and cultural ties between the two countries.The President Sirisena will participate in a special business and investment conference and the President of Japan International Cooperation Agency, as well as the representatives of organizations such as Japan Business Council and Japan Foreign Trade Council, are scheduled to hold discussions with the President.

hits._id: India sets aside more funds to negate region’s Chinese influence

_source.content:
The Indian Government has increased its budget allocations for its neighbours including Sri Lanka to counter the rising Chinese dominance in the region.
 
Other nations to receive increased benefits under the new measures are Seychelles, Mauritius and the Maldives.
 
Accordingly, India has planned to provide financial aid of 150 Indian Crores to Sri Lanka.
 
This is double the funds received by Sri Lanka compared to last year.
 
India has expressed a special desire to renovate Kankesanthurai Port this year.

hits._id: Government notice on SAITM released, GMOA requests to inform the stance to Supreme Court

_source.content:
The government stance over Malabe Private Medical School has been announced.
Presidential Secretariat, ministry of Higher Education and the Health Ministry have jointly announced the stance.
The notice issued by the government has further described the policy measures that have been taken to ensure standards of medical education and the freedom of education.
A decision has been taken to provide clinical training to students who passed the final examination at  Malabe Private Medical School in Homagama and Avissawella government hospitals.
It was also stated that it is mandatory for these students to sit an examination conducted jointly by the Sri Lanka Medical Council and University Grants commission.
Meanwhile, recruitment to Malabe Private Medical College should be suspended until the Government policy decisions are implemented.
In addition, the government has decided to take over Malabe Neville Fernando Private Hospital and provide healthcare services to the public.
Meanwhile, the GMOA is having an emergency executive committee meeting to discuss several important issues including the government’s stance.
GMOA Assistant Secretary Dr. Haritha Aluthge told our news team that his organization has not received any notice from the government citing its stance will be submitted to the Supreme Court.

hits._id: Egalitarian society is established - President

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena says that democratic freedom, peace at the workplace and legal rights to organize and act have been established in the country by now.The President in his May Day message stated that unity was a must to safeguard the victories achieved through sacrifices.Meanwhile, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe in his May Day message stated that a political environment where we have freedom, has been established at the end of a massive social struggle against dictatorial rule.The Prime Minister also stated that we must line-up to build our country, through a sustainable development process and to make the lives of our people prosperous.Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa in his message in view of the May Day stated that with the end of the 30 year war the rights of the people which had been limited were restored not only in the North and East but in the entire country.Meanwhile, Opposition Leader Nimal Siripala De Silva stated that attention should be paid to uplift the living standards of people in the estate areas and those engaged in farming.

hits._id: Joint Opposition writes to the President

_source.content:
The Joint Opposition MPs have addressed a letter to President Maithripala Sirisena requesting that steps be taken to seek Supreme Court opinion on the bill for setting up the Office of Missing Persons.
They have requested by this letter that passing the draft bill due to be taken up for debate in parliament today be stopped immediately and thus action be taken to seek Supreme Court opinion on the bill.  
The letter signed by 23 MPs representing the joint opposition points out that the provisions of the bill pose a huge threat to national security and sovereignty.

hits._id: Urgent meeting of the SLFP parliament group to discuss about the 13th  amendment

_source.content:
An urgent meeting of the SLFP parliament group is being held to discuss about the 13th Amendment and the forthcoming Northern Provincial Council election.
 
A Government Senior Minister told our news team that the meeting being held at Temple Trees is chaired by President Mahinda Rajapaksa.
 
He said all SLFP parliamentarians are attending the meeting today.
 
Addressing a media briefing held in Colombo today, UNP MP Lakshman Kiriella said that the government should take immediate actions to fulfill the promises it gave to the international community with regard to the 13th Amendment.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
Former Chief Minister of the Eastern Provincial Council and Provincial Councilor Sivanesaturai Chandrakanthan alias pilleyan says he is ready to join hands with any forces raising against the repealing of the 13th Amendment.
 
The Sabaragamuwa and Southern Provincial Councils passed resolutions yesterday in support of the government’s move to repeal 2 provisions of the 13th Amendment.
 
The new changes are supposed to prevent two or more provincial councils to be merged themselves into one administrative unit and enabling Parliament to make laws on subjects only with the approval from majority of the provincial councils instead of approval from all of them as set out in the present constitution.

hits._id: Protest march demanding PM to resign reaches Mawanella

_source.content:
The first phase of the protest march organized by United Nation Freedom Front demanding Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe to resign ended at Mawanella this evening (Mar. 31).
It began from Gatabe  Temple this morning with the participation of UNFF's Secretary Maithri Gooneratne.
The march reached Mawanella through Peradeniya and Pilimathalawa and it is scheduled to continue its journey to Colombo tomorrow.
Meanwhile, General Secretary of the Tamil National Alliance, Parliamentarian Mavai Senathirajah said that the TNA wishes to hold discussions with President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe about the 'no-confidence motion'.
The MP said that the discussion will be held on the 3rd of April or a closer date.
However, Parliamentarian, Venerable Athuraliye Rathana Thera revealed that the Tamil National Alliance which represents the Leader of the Opposition will fulfil the duties of a true opposition during this decisive moment.

hits._id: Minister Navin Dissanayake resigns from government to support common candidate

_source.content: Navin Dissanayake has resigned from his Ministerial posts and the UPFA District organizer position of Nuwara-eliya.He held the post of Minister of State Administration and Reforms and was the organizer for Nuwara-eliya.Navin Dissanayake has therefore decided to support Common Opposition Candidate Maitreepala Sirisena in the forthcoming Presidential Election.He said has sent his letter of resignation which focused on 3 points, to the President last night.In the letter Navin Dissanayake said that being unable to serve the rural communities in Nuwara-eliya as a Minister of the district, abolishing of the executive presidency and not being able to bear the corruption taking place in development work.Navin Dissanayaka in his letter had thanks the President in the attempts made to eradicate terrorism and also said that he had no personal grudge with the President.Following the announcement of the Common Candidate 10 Ministers or Parliamentarians of the government have defected to support common candidate Maithripala Sirisena.

hits._id: Seating issue in Parliament

_source.content:
Parliament authorities are facing a crisis situation in arranging the seating facilities for the 16 Sri Lanka Freedom Party parliamentarians who had quit the Unity Government recently.
 
They say they would sit in the Opposition when the House is reconvened.
 
However, they have not yet informed the Parliament staff of their intentions.
 
In such situations, the MPs who intend to cross over to the Opposition should officially inform the Speaker.
 
The Deputy Secretary-General of Parliament, Neil Iddawela told us if any MP wants to crossover to the Opposition without an official announcement, he or she can do so by crossing the Well of the House and sit with the Opposition when parliament meets again.
 
Meanwhile, a former State Minister, T. B. Ekanayake who resigned from the Government along with 14 other Ministers told us that their group has already discussed the seating procedures with the Leader of the Joint Opposition Group Dinesh Gunawardena.

hits._id: Video : Update :The search for missing plane extended to Sri lankan air space

_source.content: The External Affairs Ministry stated that the search operation teams were allowed to use the Sri Lankan airspace to extend their rescue operations for the missing plane.Accordingly, Air Force teams of America, Australia, Malaysia and New Zealand are permitted to use the Sri Lankan airspace in order to carry out search operations for the MH370 aircraft which went missing with 239 passengers and crew.Ministry Public Relations Director Prabhashini Ponnamperuma further described the government permission given for search teams.However parliament drew its attention to this matter as a UNP MP asked a question with regard to the government decision to permit foreign air force teams to use our air space.The search for the missing plane has already been extended throughout two million square miles with the support of 26 countries.However Malaysian authorities have not so far asked any active assistance from Sri Lanka.Update : Tuesday, 18 March 2014 - 7:15-----------------------------------------The External Affairs Ministry stated that the Malaysian government has sought permission to use the Sri Lankan airspace to extend its search operations for the missing plane.An External Ministry senior spokesman said that permission was granted for Air Forces of America, Australia, Malaysia and New Zealand to use the Sri Lankan airspace in order to carry out search operations for the missing plane.Tuesday, 18 March 2014 - 13:21-----------------------------------------Permission sought to use Sri lankan air space in search of missing plane.The External Affairs Ministry stated that the Malaysian government has sought permission to use the Sri Lankan airspace to extend its search operations for the missing plane.An External Ministry senior spokesman said that permission have been sought for Air Forces of America, Australia, Malaysia and New Zealand to use the Sri Lankan airspace in order to carry out search operations for the missing plane.Meanwhile, Malay daily sources revealed that Investigations into the flight simulator taken from the missing pilot's home showed a software for five practice runaways, including one belonging to the United States, Male International Airport in Maldives, three airports in India and Sri Lanka, and one belonging to the US military base in Diego Garcia.Police seized the flight simulator from pilot Captain Zaharie Ahmad Shah's house last Saturday before reassembling it at the federal police headquarters in Bukit Aman, where experts were conducting checks.After 10 days of searching for the missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370, investigators have now conducting extensive background checks on the 239 people on board the plane, including the pilots, crew and passengers.

hits._id: Petition on SLFP Chairmanship: Respondents ordered to submit objections

The Colombo Chief Magistrate ordered the respondents today (29) to file written objections against a petition, which seeks to reappoint former President Mahinda Rajapaksa to the post of SLFP Chairmanship, replacing President Maithripala Sirisena.
The written objections should be presented on the 4th of September.
Two members of the SLFP All Island Committee, former Chairman of Borelasgamuwa Urban Council, Aruna Priyashantha and Asanka Srinath had filed this petition.

hits._id: Update: Avant gaurd agreements abolished on Presidents instructions

At the same time, Rehabilitation, Resettlement and Hindu Affairs Minister D.M. Swaminadan was sworn in as the Prison Reforms Minister.Both of them received the new portfolios in addition to their existing ministerial posts. The two ministers were sworn in, in the new positions after Thilak Marapana resigned from the Law and Order and Prison Reforms portfolios due to the Avant Guard controversy.Update: Thursday, 12 November 2015 - 07:52---------------------------------------------------------President Maithripala Sirisena has decided to annul the agreement with Avant Garde.Cabinet Spokesperson Minister Rajitha Senarathna stated that the decision was taken at a special meeting this evening.Accordingly the weapons held by Avant Garde are to be handed over to the Sri Lanka Navy.

hits._id: UNP’s 70th Anniversary Convention commences - The President and the former President Chandrika also participates in the ceremony

_source.content: The UNP’s 70 Anniversary Convention is currently held at the Campbell grounds in Colombo.President Maithripala Sirisena is participating as the Chief Guest of the ceremony.According to our correspondent, Leader of the UNP Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe as well as former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaranatunga are also participating in the convention.Minister Rajitha Senaratne and Minister Arjuna Ranatunga as well as several parliamentarians, provincial and pradeshiya sabha councillors representing the UNP have arrived at the Campbell Park to participate in the ceremony.Deputy Leader of the party Minister Ravi Karunanayake delivered the welcome address.State Minister Vijayakala Maheshwaran addressed the gathering in Tamil, and stated that all communities are living in harmony in the country at present.Currently the UNPs 70th anniversary convention is held at the Campbell grounds in Colombo, where leader of the party Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe enquired the participants their views on the ‘Apey Mathawaadaya’ (Our stance) included in the party report.All participants expressed their support towards the stance.  Accordingly, the Prime Minister announced that the stance was passed unanimously.Consequently a special magazine of the party was handed over to the President and the dignitaries.Meanwhile, a memento including a photograph of the Founder of SLFP S.W.R.D. Bandaranaike was presented to President Maithripala Sirisena.In addition, a memento comprising a photograph of former Prime Minister Sirimavo Bandaranaike was presented to former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaranatunga by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.

hits._id: Prime Ministers of Sri Lanka and Japan reach agreement on strengthening ties

_source.content: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has proposed to establish an active group comprising high ranking Ministers and Officials to further strengthen the relationship with Sri Lanka.The Japanese Prime Minister had echoed these sentiments when he met with visiting Sri Lankan Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe on the sidelines of the Science and Technology Summit in Kyoto.Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe expressed confidence that Sri Lanka would experience a rapid growth under the current government and said that Japan will extend their fullest support.Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe had emphasized that the government’s policy was to work cordially with all countries alike.Premier Wickremesinghe also stated that the national government allows Sri Lanka to face challenges more confidently and appreciated the support offered by Japan.The official round of discussions between the two Prime Ministers will be held on the 06th in Tokyo.Meanwhile, the Key Note address at the Science and Technology Summit in Kyoto was made by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.The Premier emphasized that the new government is committed to ensure that the benefits of development are passed on to the people who went through sufferings in the past.

hits._id: Presidential Order to reinstate Brigadier Priyanka served to two ministries

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena today (Feb. 07) ordered to reinstate the Defence Attaché to the Sri Lankan High Commission in London, Brigadier Priyanka Fernando with immediate effect.It is stated that the Presidential Order was served in writing to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Ministry of Defence.A group of LTTE proxies staged a demonstration in front of the Sri Lankan High Commission in London on Independence Day.The High Commission staff came out of the premises when the demonstration was underway.Thereafter, a video depicting Brigadier Fernando making gestures towards the protestors was circulated on social media.A group of British Parliamentarians have also written to the UK Foreign Secretary raising their concerns over the incident.Later, Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced that it suspended Brigadier Fernando from his responsibilities with immediate effect.However, today President has ordered to reverse the Foreign Ministry’s decision.

hits._id: President leaves for France today

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena will leave for France today to participate in the United Nations Climate Change Summit.This is after concluding his visit to Malta during which he participated in the Commonwealth sessions.The UN Climate Change Summit is scheduled to commence tomorrow with the participation of nearly 80 State Leaders.President Sirisena also participated in the Commonwealth Climate Change summit which was held as part of the sessions in Malta.Meanwhile, President Maithripala Sirisena met with French President François Hollande on the sidelines of the Commonwealth leader’s summit.President Sirisena stated that Sri Lanka will continue to assist France to stand strong against terrorism.Meanwhile, President Maithripala Sirisena also met with British Prime Minister David Cameron, Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull and Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudo.Meanwhile, Sri Lanka also joined as a founding member of a new 1 billion US Dollar Commonwealth Green Finance Facility to support environmental projects within the 53-nation bloc as the race against climate change intensifies.

former president Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga, British State Foreign Affairs Minister Hugo Swire, Northern Provincial Chief Minister C.V. Wigneswaran, ministers D.M. Swaminadan and /Saagala Rathnayake also participated.
