hits._id: Japan proposes solutions to Meethotamulla garbage mound - Protests held in Ja Ela as well today against dumping garbage

_source.content:
The Japanese research team which arrived here to make recommendations for the Meethotamulla garbage mound met President Maithripala Sirisena at the latter’s residence this morning.
President’ Media Unit quoted the recommendation report saying that the garbage mound should be reshaped before the next rainy season.
The Japanese research team comprising 13 experts arrived in the country on April 17th.  Having studied the incident at Meethotamulla, the leader of the team Mitshutake Numahata handed over their recommendation report to the president this morning.
The report recommends that the foundation of the garbage mound should be reinforced and covered with polythene before the advent of the next monsoon.
It also recommends that the garbage mound should be reshaped to balance with gravity.
The team has recommended long term solutions as well.
Among them are to reduce the quantity of garbage by recycling, generating energy and manufacturing compost.
The Japanese team leader also stated that Sri Lanka can learn lessons from similar experiences of Japan where Japan took remedial measures after its people protested against waste in the 1960s.
Recognizing the swift action taken by Japan, President Sirisena said that Sri Lanka expects help from the Japanese government to settle the solid waste issue in the country.
The expert recommendation report has been handed over to Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe as well.
Meanwhile, search operations at the collapse site of Meethotamulla continued for the 11th day today.
At the same time, our correspondents stated that protests were held in several places against transporting garbage from Colombo to the suburbs.
Residents at Nugape in Ja Ela engaged in a protest today against dumping city garbage in Muturajawela as well.

hits._id: Advising people to evacuate is the responsibility of officers; To follow instructions is Estate owner's duty; says President. #‎KoslandaLandslide‬

_source.content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa said that the responsibility of the government officers is to advise to evacuate people from disaster prone areas, and to follow such instruction is the duty of estate owners.The President stressed that the lives of innocent people cannot be taken as scapegoat for mere negligence.The President expressed these views during his inspection tour in the landslide-hit Meeriyabedda this morning.The President visited the Sri Ganesha Tamil Vidyalaya where the displaced people are sheltered, and he monitored the progress of relief distribution as well.The President then instructed the relevant authorities to take prompt action to resettle the affected people. He directed the officials to put into action a special program to look after the children who lost their parents in the landslide.Recalling the Tsunami devastation, President told the officials to take extra caution as fraudulent parties could claim the hold of the affected children.He has also informed to look after the children in a common place until they are given over to their true relatives or a proper program is initiated for their future wellbeing.#‎KoslandaLandslide‬      ...................................................................................................................................................................                     pic by - Ranjith Rajapaksha#‎KOSLANDALANDSLIDE‬Related story published below :http://www.hirunews.lk/95879/president-inspects-landslide-hit-haldumulla-meets-displaced-people-in-welfare-centres-koslandalandslide

hits._id: Sri lanka has achieved rapid progress; Kean Envoy : Video

_source.content: Special representative of the South Korean government Yu Myung Hwan states that Sri Lanka has achieved significant progress on all fronts following the cessation of hostilities.He made this statement when he met with President Mahinda Rajapakse at Temple Trees yesterday.Elaborating further the special representative of the South Korean government had stated that the Sri Lankan government has achieved merit for holding free and fair elections in the North and for establishing a presidential commission with regard to missing persons.President Rajapakse also invited Yu Myung Hwan to tour the North.Meanwhile, the special representative of the South Korean government had engaged in discussions yesterday with Minister of External Affairs Prof. G. L. Peiris as well.During discussions with the Sri Lankan Minister of External Affairs, the Special representative of the South Korean government Yu Myung Hwan had pledged further support of the South Korean government to Sri Lanka’s economic development through trade, investment and tourism.

hits._id: Don’t hesitate to take decisions to fulfil duties; A statement from President

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that one shouldn’t retreat when exercising responsibilities rightfully.
The president stated this at the National anti-corruption summit.

hits._id: Government cant abolish 13th Amendment; UNP

_source.content:
The Department of Elections has formulated a new mechanism to provide information to government servants who expect to obtain postal voting rights on behalf of the upcoming polls in the North, North West & Central provinces.
 
According to Elections Commissioner Mahinda Deshapriya those interested are able to obtain information in this regard by contacting the Government Information Centre on 1919.
 
Meanwhile UNP MP Lakshman Kiriella states that certain government Ministers have applauded the upcoming provincial polls which in turn would make it impossible for the government to abolish the 13th amendment to the constitution even if the requirement persists.
 
Addressing a function held in Suduhumpala-Kandy yesterday UNP MP Lakshman Kiriella expressed the following views in this regard.

hits._id: Did not join the government for personal gain- Min. Amaraweera

_source.content:
UPFA’s General Secretary Mahinda Amaraweera says that members of the SLFP, including him, did not join the government to fuel their interests.
He said this participating at a SLFP meeting in Puduwasnuwara, Hettipola yesterday

hits._id: UN Secretary General to the Country at the end of this month

_source.content: Government sources revealed that UN Secretary General Ban Ki Moon is due to visit Sri Lanka by the end of this month. A UN envoy has already held talks with the government concerning the security to be provided for the UN Secretary General’s visit. It was announced at the last Geneva Human Rights Council session held in June, that UN Secretary General Ban Ki Moon intends to visit Sri Lanka during this year. Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe stated this while addressing the LAW ASIA Summit held in Colombo yesterday.

hits._id: President to leave for US

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena will leave for New York, US this today (17) to attend the 72nd United Nations General Assembly.
This is the 3rd time that President Maithripala Sirisena is addressing the UN General Assembly.
The 72nd Regular Session of the UN General Assembly convened at UN Headquarters on 12th of September.
The General Debate will open on Tuesday (19), under the theme, ‘Focusing on People: Striving for Peace and a Decent Life for All on a Sustainable Planet’.
The President will address the Assembly on Tuesday.

hits._id: Mahanayakes of Malwathu and Asgiri Chapters extend gratitude to President

_source.content:
Mahanayake of the Malwathu Chapter Most Ven. Thibbatuwawe Sri Siddhartha Sumangala Maha Nayaka Thera and the Mahanayake of the Asgiri Chapter Most Venerable Warakagoda Dhammadassi Gnanaratne Thera have extended their gratitude to President Maithripala Sirisena for donating funds to renovate the Golden Canopy of the Sri Dalada Maligawa.
They have extended their gratitude issuing a joint statement which was also signed by Diyawadana Nilame, Pradeep Nilanga Dela.
President Maithripala Sirisena recently donated 45 million rupees to renovate the Golden Canopy of the Sri Dalada Maligawa.

hits._id: PM urges supermarkets to introduce 'Fair Price Shops'

_source.content:
It was decided at a meeting chaired by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesing to establish 'Fair Price Shops' with the support of private sector in order to control the rising Cost of Living during the festive season.
 
Through those shops, a 'Budget Pack' will be sold to the consumers for a concessionary price.
 
The 'Budget Pack' will include rice, dhal, sugar, sprats, onions, potatoes and canned fish.
 
The mechanism will be introduced to supermarket chains and Lak Sathosa outlets.
 
Meanwhile, at another meeting, Prime Minister urged the university authorities to concentrate on improving the quality of higher education instead of prioritizing constructing buildings at universities.
 
The meeting was attended by Vice Chancellors of universities.
 
The PM also said steps should be taken to get rid of ragging in universities.

hits._id: 48 more UNP LG representatives in discussions to join Govt; 6 UNP members in Panduwasnuwara defect with Dayasiri

_source.content:
After MP Dayasiri Jayasekara announced his resignation from his parliament post, he called a special media conference in the parliament complex, along with Ministers Dallas Alahapperuma, Rohitha Abeygunawardana and MPs R. Dumindha Silva and Manusha Nanayakkara.
 
Journalists questioned Dayasiri Jayasekera if he is to contest in the North Western Provincial Council election as the UPFA Chief Ministerial candidate.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
Later Jayasekera said that 48 UNP PS members have discussions with him in order to join the government.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
Our news team reported several times in the past about former UNP MP Dayasiri Jayasekera’s plan to join the government.
 
However when contacted on the 16th of July to verify the speculations about his plans to change sides MP Jayasekera responded to our news team in this manner.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
Later UNP MP Hareen Fernando appearing in the ‘Balaya’ political program on Hiru TV reaffirmed that MP Jayasekera would not defect. 
 
At that moment Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage confirmed Dayasiri’s decision to join the government.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
Addressing another media conference held by the UNP today, MP Hareen Fernando recollected about his assertions made public about MP Dayasiri Jayasekera.

hits._id: India assures to strengthen the friendship and rapport with Sri Lanka in the future

_source.content: Indian External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj stated that the Indian government would commit itself to further strengthen the friendship and rapport with Sri Lanka in the future. The Indian External Affairs Minister has stated this during her meeting with visiting Sri Lankan Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe today. She has also stated that swift action should be taken to settle the Indo- Sri Lanka fishermen’s issue.  Meanwhile, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has stated that Sri Lanka will make its full commitment towards regional peace. Meanwhile, former Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh stated that one of the greatest victories that has achieved by Sri Lanka is to form a national government thereby creating an environment to work in harmony with other political parties such as the TNA and JVP. Former Premier Manmohan Singh stated this during a meeting he had with the visiting Sri Lankan Premier Ranil Wickremesinghe today.  Indian Congress leader Sonia Gandhi who was also present at the meeting has inquired about the new development agenda of Sri Lanka and its regional relations.

hits._id: JO to reconvene tomorrow

_source.content:
The Parliamentary group of the Joint Opposition will reconvene tomorrow(Feb.19) under the patronage of Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.
A Joint Opposition Parliamentarian said that attention will be drawn towards the manner in which they would support an SLFP Government.
Meanwhile, the SLFP said that the prevailing political uncertainty will be addressed by tomorrow.
A Spokesperson said that if the Joint Opposition was willing to accept few Ministries there was no issue in forming a stable government.
Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna said that preventing the forming of a UNP government should be given priority at this moment.

hits._id: The Commission meets today for the final decision on local government election

_source.content:
The Election Commission meets today to discuss about holding the local government election.
 It is also said that at this discussion the time frames relevant to holding the election and calling nominations are to be decided.  
 Meanwhile further hearing of the writ petition filed requesting an injunction order nullifying the special gazette notification issued recently specifying the limits of the local government bodies and the number of members in them was postponed to 22nd this month.
 However Election Commission Chairman Mahinda Deshapriya told our news team that the commission would meet today to discuss about the local government election.

hits._id: UNP passes resolution on 'no-confidence motion'

_source.content:
The United National Parliamentary group has passed a resolution to defeat if a 'no-confidence motion' is moved against the Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe in Parliament.
 
The decision was taken during a meeting held at Temple Trees yesterday (Mar. 19).
 
The main focus of the meeting was the proposed 'no-confidence motion'.
 
The Joint Opposition say they have already begun the process to muster signatures for the motion against the PM.They will meet today to discuss further course of action.The meeting will be chaired by former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.
 
The UNP restructuring committee report was also presented to the PM at this meeting.
 
Meanwhile, Rosy Senanayake was sworn-in before PM Ranil Wickremesinghe and Western Province Governor K. C. Logeswaran yesterday as the Mayor of Colombo.
 
She is the first woman Mayor to be elected to the CMC.
 
The other councillors took their oaths thereafter.

hits._id: Thissa withdraws his question in Parliament.

_source.content: All Ceylon People’s Congress member Ameer Ali took oaths as a National list MP in parliament today.He succeeded former national list MP A.H.M. Azwer who resigned from the post recently.Earlier 3 members of All Ceylon People’s Congress in the Eastern provincial Council including Ameer Ali withdrew from the government to remain independent.Meanwhile several provisions under the Special Trading Tax Act were also taken for debate today.In addition UNP former General Secretary Tissa Attanayake withdrew a question he had presented to the government seeking oral answers.

hits._id: Northern Province Chief Minister entrusted with more ministries

_source.content:
Northern Province Chief Minister C. V. Vigneshvaran has taken over a few more ministries.
Accordingly the Chief Minister has taken over the Resettlement Ministry, Social Services Ministry and the Women’s Affairs Ministry.
He took the oaths before Northern Province Governor Reginald Cooray yesterday at the Governor’s office in Jaffna.
In addition to these ministries, the Northern Province Chief Minister holds the ministries of Local Government, Public Administration, Finance and Planning, Power, Law and Construction and Rehabilitation, Tourism, Industry and Enterprise Promotion.

hits._id: "Development was withheld during the 100 day programme" #GenElecSL

_source.content:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says that the current Government has stopped the development programme and commenced taking revenge.
The former president said so while participating at a people’s rally held in Weeraketiya yesterday.

hits._id: Video: National Olympic Committee should be brought before COPE Committee - requests government and opposition MPs

_source.content: The heads of expenditure of the Sport, Local Government and Land & Land Development ministries are being debated in Parliament today.During the debate both government and opposition MPs requested that the National Olympic Committee should be brought before the COPE Committee.During the debate Minister of Foreign Employment Promotion and Welfare stated that the NOC should be brought before COPE for auditing.Meanwhile, DNA MP Arjuna Ranatunga stated that mafias are dominating sports and that they need to be dealt with as it was done with Football.

hits._id: President meets with parents of SAITM students

_source.content: Following a meeting held with the parents of SAITM medical students, President Maithripala Sirisena said that he will soon take a decision prioritising the country and the productivity.

hits._id: Update: Deforestation in Wilpaththu banned following Hiru TV CIA revelation

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has ordered an immediate halt to deforestation and proposing land lots near the Wilpattu National Park.
The Presidential Media Division said that the President has instructed relevant authorities to implement the law against any person responsible for such illegal acts while the Secretary to the Ministry of Environment has also been instructed to take necessary action in this regard.
Hiru CIA TV program also revealed the attempt on building communities by deforesting Wilpattu sanctuary forest reserve.
Strong objection was raised against this attempt through social media sites, following the Hiru CIA revelation.
The President also has taken steps regarding the matter following the program.
Meanwhile, representatives of the JVP also visited the controversial site at the Wilpaththu sanctuary.
At the time they arrived in Marichchikattuwa, Minister Rishard Badiudeen who is accused of being instrumental behind the illegal settlements within Wilpaththu was also present.Update: Sunday, 10 May 2015 - 07:14 AM---------------------------------------------------Government will take measures to probe regarding the deforestation of Wilpattu sanctuary – BBS
Bodu Bala Sena Organization states that the government will take measures to probe regarding the deforestation of Wilpattu National Park sanctuary and its surrounding reserve and bring the offenders to justice.
The President’s Media Unit stated that the President has instructed the Environment Ministerial Secretary today, to probe into the deforestation of the sanctuary.
Hiru TV CIA continuously revealed the massive destruction caused to Wilpattu by settling people there.
Strong objection was raised against this attempt through social media sites, while the President also has taken steps regarding the matter following the Hiru CIA revelation.
The CEO of the organization Dilantha Vithange told our news team that his organization has revealed several facts regarding the matter since 20th of March 2014.
Despite officially informing the matter to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, no steps were taken to resolve the issue.
Dilantha Vithanage also stated that his organization believes that an investigation will be conducted regarding the construction of houses and settlement of people in the sanctuary and the offenders will be brought to justice.
JVP too was engaged in an inspection tour today at Wilpattu sanctuary to inquire regarding the deforestation.
Western provincial councillor Lalkantha and provincial councillor Attorney-at-law Sunil Watagala also joined this inspection tour.
Meanwhile, Mannar District secretary, Environment State Ministry secretary and Minister Rishard Badiudeen also held an inspection tour at the Wilpattu sanctuary today.
Regarding the alleged deforestation at Wilpattu sanctuary, a group of youths in Diyatha Uyana, Battaramulla distributed some leaflets today.

hits._id: Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasingha to meet Emperor of Japan today

_source.content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasingha is scheduled to call upon the Emperor of Japan today. 
Meanwhile, Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has agreed to provide aid to Sri Lanka to develop infrastructure and strengthen maritime security during a meeting with Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe yesterday.
The Japanese Premier has pledged 45 billion Yen in infrastructure aid to Sri Lanka.
Prime Minister officially met his Japanese counterpart yesterday in Tokyo and held discussions on strengthening bilateral ties.
This was stated in a joint declaration issued yesterday after the official bilateral discussions between the two prime ministers of Sri Lanka and Japan.       .
Premier Wickramasingha has promised that his government would create a more favourable investment climate by ensuring transparency and good governance to attract investment from Japanese companies.
Meanwhile, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe delivered a special speech before Japanese parliamentarians.
During his one hour speech, Premier Wickremesinghe said that Japan is expected to provide a pioneering contribution at a time the current government of Sri Lanka has reached before the economic transition of South East Asia.

hits._id: President to visit Thailand

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena will undertake an official visit to the Kingdom of Thailand from the 1st to the 4th November on the invitation of the Prime Minister of Thailand, General Prayuth Chan-o-Cha.
This visit also coincides with the celebrations of the 60th Anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between Sri Lanka and Thailand.
During the visit, President Sirisena will be received in audience by Her Royal Highness Crown Princess Maha Chakri Sirindhorn.
Bilateral discussions will also be held between President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Chan-o-Cha.
The discussions will focus on areas of mutual interest to enhance closer links and cooperation between the two countries.
During this visit, President Sirisena will launch the exposition of the Sacred Relics from the Mahiyangana Raja Maha Viharaya in Putta -Mon-thon.

hits._id: Government sees positives in the opposition

_source.content:
Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe yesterday requested for a 50 member strong working committee to be appointed in order to enact the recommendations of the Lessons Learnt & Reconciliation Commission.

According to Wickremesinghe's proposal, the working committee appointed in this regard should comprise of 25 government members as well as opposition party members each.


			   
			   		
	
			   

UPFA General Secretary Minister Susil Premajayantha stated that the Opposition leaders proposal was seen as a positive one.


			   
			   		
	
			   

However, JVP Parliamentarian Sunil Handunneththi stated that the government and the UNP had the same agenda during such instances.

hits._id: Dayasiri to take legal action against the 250 million story

_source.content:
Former Parliamentarian Dayasiri Jayasekara stated today that he would file legal action against those who state that he obtained money in order to join the government.
 
This was at a media briefing that was held at residence of SLFP Leader of Kurunegala Senior Minister S B Nawinna.
 
Ministers Jayarathna Herath, Salinda Dissanayake and MP’s Neranjan Wickramasinghe and Tharanath Basnayaka were also present at the media briefing but Former Chief Minister of Athula Wijesinghe’s absence was a speciality.
 
Dayasiri Jayasekara stated on the 24th of this month that he would leave the UNP and would join the government.
 
At that moment UNP Parliamentarian Hareen Fernando stated that Dayasiri Jayasekara crossed over after having obtained a substantial amount of money.
 
UNP National Organizer Daya Gamage speaking at a media briefing that was held yesterday expressed similar views.
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
When journalists inquired regarding this from Dayasiri Jayasekara during today’s media briefing in Wariyapola he stated that he would take legal action against those making such statements.

hits._id: Gov. Should Come Forward To Assist Victims Of Landmines In The North And East

_source.content:
TNA’s parliamentarian and Deputy Chairman of the committees Selvam Adaikkalanathan said in the Parliament that he extends his condolence to those who died in the end phase of the armed conflict on behalf of all the people.
He made this statement addressing on the debate when the house adjourned on Tuesday (May 17).
Selvam stated that the Government should come forward to provide assistance for victims of landmines in the North and East. This is a key issue in the reconciliation process of the government. Government should pay attention on the matter.
When the appointments of Principals, priority should be given to those who have being serviced as deputy Principals, he added.

hits._id: Update: Sri Lanka is ready to change its traditional economy; says Prime Minister in Japan

_source.content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe says that steps would be taken to attract Japanese private investors to Sri Lanka.The Premier further said in a discussion held in Tokyo today that Sri Lanka is ready to start economic reconstruction of the next level of development.The discussions were held targeting the development of business activities of Sri Lanka. During the discussions, President of Japan - Sri Lankan Entrepreneurs Cooperation Committee Tadayuki Seki said a clear road is visible for Sri Lanka to achieve rapid development.At the same time, Premier Wickremesinghe told the meeting that a new political culture simultaneously with a new economic policy has been implemented under the new government.Meanwhile, the Prime Minister met the Sri Lankan domiciled in Tokyo today.The premier told the gathering that his government is ready to change the traditional economic system of the country, in the manner, the conservative politics was changed.Premier Wickremesinghe also met Japanese Deputy Prime Minister and Finance Minister of Japan, former Prime Minister Taro Aso this afternoon.He also had discussions with deputy chairman of the ruling party of Japan Liberal Democratic Party Masahiko Komura and Internal Affairs and Communication Minister of Japan Sanae Takaichi.Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake and Technology, Technology Education and Employment Minister Susil Premajayantha were also present.Update: Monday, 05 October 2015 - 19:09---------------------------------------------A pledge from Premier to JapanToday is the second day of Premier Ranil Wickramasinghe’s official tour of Japan. Meeting the Japanese Foreign Minister this morning, the Premier stated that Sri Lanka will support Japan in obtaining a seat representing Asia at the UN Security Council which will be held next month. Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe informed the Japanese Foreign Minister that the Sri Lankan security forces are always ready for peacekeeping activities. The Premier also participated in the Japan-Sri Lanka Business Forum.

hits._id: Video : CHOGM is an investment for the future - President.

_source.content:
President Mahinda Rajapaksa says that all expenses incurred for the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting were investments for the country’s future.

The President said so while participating in the inauguration of the Bandaranaike Memorial International Conference Hall reconstructed in view of the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting.

The President said on this occasion that it was the Government’s duty to build a country suitable for the future generation that would have to cope up with high cost of living.   

Sri Lanka acts with dignity as a country to provide maximum facilities for the foreign government heads and representatives gracing the CHOGM.

On this occasion President Mahinda Rajapaksa pointed out that the benefits of the development programme that the Government was carrying out in the country amidst various criticisms would accrue to the future generation.

On this occasion the President said further that similarly due to the Governement’s development programme a huge revolution had also taken place in all sectors of the country and that Sri Lanka had become a fully fledge country.

hits._id: Update: PM Pays Last Respect to Former Speaker and Minister Late M.H. Mohamed

_source.content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe paid last respect to the remaining of the Former Speaker and Minister M.H. Mohamed who passed away this morning.
Minister Rauf Hakeem and MP Dinesh Gunawardena were also among many politicians who paid last respect to late M.H.Mohamed at his residence in No. 513, Bauddaloka Mawatha, Colombo. 
Late M.H. Mohamed was born on 15th June 1921 and received his education in Wesley College, Colombo.
He was the Mayor of Colombo in 1960-62 and later was elected to parliament and has written history as the first Muslim Mayor of Colombo.
Being the 14th Speaker of Sri Lanka Parliament, he played a prominent role in the impeachment motion against former President Ranasinghe Premadasa.The burial ceremony of late M.H. Mohamed will be held at Kuppiyawatte Muslim cemetery, Colombo 08. Updated: 26th April 2016, 1.12 pm--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

His remains lie at No. 513, Bauddaloka Mawatha, Colombo and Janaza (burial ceremony) will be held at 3.30 pm today.

hits._id: Prime Minister Convenes Meeting On New Economic Projects

_source.content:
The government has set its sights on the implementation of special economic development projects aiming several areas including Moneragala, Embilipitiya and Hambantota district.
A special meeting on the matter was held at Hambantota Ports Auditorium under the patronage of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe today (15).
Attention was drawn to the new industrial zones constructed in a land of 3000 acres near Hambantota Port.
The project is funded by the Chinese government.
In addition, the meeting also focused on promoting tourism in Hambantota and Moneragala districts as well as Embilipitiya area.

Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe states that the parliament which was elected subsequent to the war has failed in providing issues for the countries burning issues.

Delivering a special oration during the final session of the Youth Parliament which was held at the premises of the National Youth Centre in Maharagama Wickremesinghe made the following observations.

The Joint Opposition will decide on supporting the government based on its policy to ensure national security, former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.
He said this after a meeting with the Chief Incumbent of Getabe Rajopawaramaya in Kandy.

hits._id: Speaker to make a statement on national government

_source.content: Speaker Karu Jayasuriya says he has not been informed of whether the National Government continues or not.He said this in response to an oral question posed by UPFA MP Dullas Alahapperuma in Parliament this morning (Feb. 20).The Speaker also said that he will make a statement regarding that tomorrow.

hits._id: Serve the public without idling – says the Archbishop to Politicians

_source.content: The Archbishop of Colombo, his eminence Malcom Cardinal Ranjith stated that the parliament and local government institutions are not for politicians who were elected with the people’s mandate, to idle.His eminence Malcom Cardinal Ranjith expressed these views at a dengue eradication programme held this morning at St. Lucia’s Cathedral in Kotahena.

hits._id: State celebrations barred for politicians till end of elections

_source.content: The Election Commissioner has barred politicians from participating in State Celebrations from today till end of elections.Accordingly no candidate is permitted to participate in State functions like foundation stone laying for new projects of provincial council or local government bodies or handing over completed projects for people’s use.The Election Commissioner has informed State institution heads not to get any candidate contesting at the election or provincial council or local government representative to participate in such functions.Similarly reports say that the Election Commissioner has in writing informed ministry secretaries, provincial council chief secretaries, Government Agents, provincial council ministry secretaries and State institution heads that it is illegal to solicit politicians’ participation in public or religious functions organized by State Institutions.Meanwhile a few hours have been set apart today as well for State employees who could not cast their postal vote.Accordingly Additional Election Commissioner M. M. Mohamed told our news team that postal vote could be cast between 8. 30 a.m. to 2.30 p.m. today.

hits._id: Government expects to reduce fuel prices next month; Min Patali

_source.content: Power and Energy Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka says that the government expects to reduce fuel prices next month.Having assumed duties at his ministry this morning, the minister paid courtesy calls to the Chief Prelates of the Malwathu and Asgiri Chapters.

hits._id: Sri Lanka to proceed with Port City

_source.content: The Cabinet Spokesman minister Rajitha Senarathna said that the Cabinet has approved the National Pharmaceuticals Draft Bill.The media briefing to inform the Cabinet decisions was held at the Information Department this morning.The Cabinet has also approved to continue the construction of the Colombo Port City project.Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Rajitha Senarathna said the Prime Minister informed the Cabinet that there are no defaults found in the Environment report on the Colombo Port City project.Meanwhile the government has decided to offer 130 million rupees to the national team if they win the Cricket World cup.At the same time, the Cabinet has decided to transfer the broadcasting rights of the Cricket World Cup from CSN channel to Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation.This decision was taken after CSN has informed the government that it is not possible to pay the special tax imposed recently on sports channels by the Interim Budget.

hits._id: Consideration of the petition against the local government demarcation gazette today

_source.content:
The Writ petition filed by a group of voters from six local bodies pleading for an injunction order nullifying the very special gazette notification issued recently, deciding the demarcation of the local government bodies and the number of members in them, is scheduled to be taken up for hearing at the appeal court today.
The court will consider today whether to allow proceedings to the interim petitions filed by the Podujana Front Secretary and an attorney requesting that they too be permitted to intervene in the above-mentioned petition.
 While a group of residents from Kandy, Elpitiya, Colombo, Matara and Haali Ela have filed the petition, minister of provincial council and local government Faizer Mustafa and the Ministry secretary have been named in the petition as the defendants.
The petition first filed was taken up for hearing yesterday before the bench of Appeal Court judges L. T. B. Dehideniya,  Kumudinee Wickremesinghe and Srilal Gunaratne.
However PAFFEREL charges that there is an attempt to postpone the local government election by filing this petition .
Expressing his views to our news team PAFFEREL Executive Director Rohana Hettiarachchi said that PAFFEREL too would intervene at the time the petition would be taken up for hearing.
We inquired from Election Commission chairman Mahinda Deshapriya whether the local government election would be postponed because of this petition.
The Election Commission chairman said in response that he was not a defendant in the petition.

hits._id: President meets David Cameron

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena, who is on an official visit to the United Kingdom, is due to hold bilateral discussions with British Prime Minister David Cameron on Tuesday.

hits._id: Video : Solutions to cost of living problem only from the current government : says President.

_source.content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa says that only the current Government can provide solutions to the cost of living problem.Participating at a people’s rally held in Katunayake yesterday the President said that by now many groups were expressing varied views about cost of living.However on this occasion the President said further that only the current Government could solve also the cost of living problem just as it ended the war.

hits._id: Update: Maithripala's election manifesto released: Many concessions from the interim budget of the Common Candidate. -Video

_source.content: The election manifesto of common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena was released yesterday in front of the Buddha statue at Viharamahadevi Park in Colombo.The manifesto named as a compassionate governance and stable country, is comprised of 11 major factors.The first action to be implemented under its 100 day action plan is to appoint UNP Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe as the Prime Minister.The new manifesto also proposes to abolish the current executive presidency and introduce a new system of governance with a parliament with presidential powers.It also proposes to annul the 18th amendment and enact independent commissions.In addition, the common candidate’s manifesto proposes to gain development dimension 10 times more than that of the current development by halting mega type corruption that gripped in the ongoing projects.Special rehabilitation centers are proposed to be set up to cure the drug addicts, and pictorial warnings on cigarette packets will be increased upto 80%.It proposes to prohibit the import of pesticides that lead to kidney disease and the farmer pension payment will be increased.Among the proposals is an allowance of 20 thousand rupees to be paid to each pregnant mother to enable her to provide a nutritious meal to the new born baby.At the same time, the common candidate’s manifesto proposes to allocate 6% of the GDP for education sector, and Mahapola scholarship allowance to be increased upto 5 thousand rupees.Among the other relief and incentives are: special tax holidays for local entrepreneurs, one million new employment, remove 400 million rupees tax on oil to reduce fuel prices and provide relief to buy vehicles for public transport sector including three wheelers and motor cycles.Addressing the gathering during the launch of his election manifesto this morning common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena said that he would march forward without vengeance.Update: Friday, 19 December 2014 - 6:58 PM---------------------------------------------------------Election Manifesto of the Common Candidate Maithripala Sirisena released.The election manifesto of common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena was released today in front of the Buddha statue at Viharamahadevi Park in Colombo.The manifesto named as a Maithree palanayak stavara ratak or a compassionate administration and stable country, comprises of 11 major factors.A Constitutional amendment ensuring to restore democracy, rising economy, decent society, decontaminated foods and sustainable farming system are among them.Common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena engaged in religious observances in front of the Buddha Statue at Viharamahadevi Park this morning.Later the election manifesto was handed over to all religious representatives including president of the National Movement for a Just Society Maduluwawe Sobhitha Thera.Later common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena handed over copies of the manifesto to the political party leaders.Addressing the gathering UNP Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe said Maithree administration would mean an advent of another Lichchavi democratic system.Meanwhile a power failure was experienced at the time of the launch of the common candidate’s election manifesto.Our correspondent said however the organizers were able to restore electricity by a generator.

hits._id: Singapore To Contribute US $ 100,000 For Sri Lanka Flood Relief

_source.content:
Singapore said on Monday (May 23) that it will contribute US$100,000 (S$137,868) in support of immediate relief efforts in Sri Lanka where hundreds of thousands of people were forced into shelters after major floods hit the island.
"The Singapore Government extends its condolences to the government and people of Sri Lanka over the loss of lives and unprecedented destruction caused by the floods and landslides over the past week,'' the Ministry of Foreign Affairs said in a statement.
"Singapore stands by Sri Lanka during this difficult period. Minister for Foreign Affairs Dr Vivian Balakrishnan has also written to Minister of Foreign Affairs Mangala Samaraweera to convey his condolences."
The ministry said the funds will be channelled through the Singapore Red Cross (SRC).
In a separate statement on Monday, the SRC said the government contribution is part of US$150,000 in humanitarian aid that it will send to survivors of Cyclone Roanu in Sri Lanka. (The Straits Times Reports)

hits._id: 2018 Budget introduces a wide range of reforms

_source.content:
The Budget 2018 is expected to keep the Budget Deficit in 2018 at 4.8% of the Gross Domestic Product.
 
While presenting the Budget, the Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera said it is time Sri Lanka introduce required reforms to achieve an upper-middle income level.
 
Youth entrepreneurship, digital transformation, IT industry and education are among the top areas looked at through the Budget.
 
Samaraweera said that the government will drive a comprehensive “Multi-National Corporation Outreach” programme (MNC Outreach) to attract global Electronic and Electrical Machinery (EEM) players into the country to create value chain linkages or joint ventures with Sri Lankan EEM exporters.
 
The Finance Minister also said that Bank of Ceylon and People's Bank will be allowed to raise both debt and equity capital.
 
"In raising equity capital, the State will not relinquish the controlling ownership but is willing to allow the divestitures, provided that the depositors and the employees are given the option of becoming shareholders. However, in the interim, we will infuse Rs. 5 billion as equity to BoC in 2017 and a further Rs. 5 billion in 2018. We will also infuse Rs. 2.5 billion as capital into the Pradeshiya Sanwardana Bank in 2017", Mangala Samaraweera said.
Blue - Green development strategy
The Budget 2018 also proposes to introduce a carbon tax where the applicable rates for a motorcycle, car and a passenger bus will be around 17 Cents, Rs. 1.78 and Rs.2.74 per day, respectively.
 
It is expected to raise Rs. 2.5 billion through this tax and the funds will be channeled to protect the environment.
 
Incentives will also be provided to encourage the use of off-grid solar power in establishing electric car charging stations and in agriculture and agro-processing including drip irrigation, poultry, canning, plantation and, in the hotel industry.

hits._id: Intl. rating agency Fitch comments on Sri Lanka’s 2018 Budget

_source.content:
International rating agency Fitch says Sri Lanka's budget for 2018 sticks broadly to the targets for fiscal deficit reduction under its 3-year IMF programme, which began in June 2016.
 
However, high government debt and the large cost of debt servicing weigh heavily on Sri Lanka's credit profile and will require sustained fiscal consolidation over the long term, said Fitch Ratings.
 
The recently announced budget targets a fiscal deficit of 4.8% of GDP in 2018, which is only slightly above the 4.7% target agreed with the IMF and continues the consolidation that began in 2016.
 
Floods and drought weighed on the economy and public finances during 2017 and contributed to the government missing its initial 2017 fiscal deficit target of 4.6% of GDP.
 
Fitch added, “Nevertheless, the authorities still expect the 2017 deficit outturn to fall to 5.2% of GDP, from 5.4% in 2016”.
 
Consolidation in 2017 has been driven by measures to boost tax revenue, including a hike in the value-added tax (VAT) to 15% in November 2016 from 11%.
 
The government expects revenue to rise strongly again in 2018, to 15.7% of GDP, from 14.7% in 2017.
 
Revenue should be supported by an Inland Revenue Act passed in September 2016, provided implementation is effective. The act, which will come into effect from 1 April 2018, aims to simplify the tax laws and improve the efficiency of the system.
 
Despite these positive reforms, Fitch said they see downside risks to the government's revenue projections, given a GDP growth assumption of 5%-6% for next year, compared with Fitch’s assumption of 4.5%.
 
On the expenditure side, the government expects public investment spending to rise by 20% in 2018, while recurring spending is forecast to decline.
 
Interest payments are expected to account for more than one-third of total revenue, which is a key weakness in the fiscal profile.
 
Fitch also said Sri Lanka faces a challenging external debt service schedule in the near term, with very large external debt maturities coming up over 2019-22.

hits._id: President Pledges To Safeguard Sri Lankan Film Industry And Artistes

_source.content:
A discussion between President Maithripala Sirisena and the members of the Association of the Sinhala Film Artists was held on Tuesday (23) at the Presidential Secretariat.
The discussion was based on the current issues of the film industry in Sri Lanka.
The artists who pointed out that the Sinhala film industry has been protected even at a grass root level for more than six decades, due to the state patronage and the encouragement, stated that the Government’s assistance is essential to produce a quality film and to screen them.
They also drew the President’s attention about the issues arisen due to contradicting of the relevant policies in governing the screening, importation and distribution of the films.
The Government will not hesitate to take necessary actions to protect the film industry of the country and the artists, the President said requesting the artists to submit their suggestions in writing to him.
Expressing his views regarding excluding the taxes on imported films and Tele-dramas the President emphasized as the Government working in this regard paying their special attention, they will not allow any room to do injustice for local artists.

hits._id: UPDATE: Video: 'Mihindu Sethpura' mega housing scheme vested on public

_source.content:
President Mahinda Rajapaksa says whatever charges are leveled against the Government, all should acknowledge the improvement Sri Lanka has achieved.

Participating at the inauguration of the ‘Mihindu-Senpura’ housing complex constructed in Demotagoda for low income earners yesterday the President said that certain groups that cannot acknowledge the country’s improvement were trying to bring war crime charges against the Government.

On this occasion the President said that although foreign journalists were trying to remove the ‘Rajapaksas’ from the country’s administration by creating an opinion that the ‘Rajapaksas’ were behind every affair of this country, the people of this country will not allow this.

On this occasion the President also pointed out the Government had created a country where life could be led without hatred and in peace.
  
On this occasion the President also said that the Heads of government who came to this country for CHOGM this time expressed views about Sri Lanka with great pride.

Several Ministers, parliamentarians and government officers including Minister Basil Rajapaksa, Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa and Colombo District parliamentarian R. Dumindha Silva participated in the ceremony.
UPDATE Tuesday, 19 November 2013 - 8:26--------------------------------------------------The President declares open Mihindu-Senpura Urban Housing SchemeDematagoda Mihindu-senpura Urban Housing Scheme built for the low income group families were declared open by President Mahinda Rajapaksa this afternoon.

The new scheme was built to provide housing for the low income families under the Mahinda Chintana future vision.

The government has started a project to build 70,000 housing units for the low income families living in the city.

The Mihindu-Senpura that comprised 500 housing units is the first project under this mass housing scheme.

Estate residents of Dematagoda Aarama Road, Dematagoda Railway Housing, Castle Street and Narahenpita have been provided with housing units in Mihindu Senpura.
  
Several Ministers, parliamentarians and government officers including Minister Basil Rajapaksa, Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa and Colombo District parliamentarian R. Dumindha Silva participated in the ceremony.
Update : Monday, 18 November 2013 - 6.55 PM------------------------------------------------------Mihindu-senpura Urban Housing Scheme declared openDematagoda Mihindu-senpura Urban Housing Scheme build for the low income group families were declared open by President Mahinda Rajapaksa a short while ago.

Several Ministers, parliamentarians and government officers including Minister Basil Rajapaksa, Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa and Colombo District parliamentarian R. Dumindha Silva are participating in the ceremony.

Our correspondent stated that the ceremony is still going on at this moment.

hits._id: JVP Charges That The 1180 Million Rupees Supplementary Estimate Violates Good Governance Policy

_source.content:
The Opposition is objecting to the government’s proposal to parliament of a supplementary estimate of one thousand 180 million rupees to purchase vehicles for 30 ministers, state ministers and deputy ministers of 22 ministries.
The Opposition argues that allocating such a huge amount of money at a time when the country has faced monetary strain is unjustified.
On behalf of the Finance Minister, chief government whip minister Gayantha Karunathilaka presented the estimate.
Under this supplementary estimate, the value of the vehicle allocated for Minister Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka is 70 million rupees.
Minister Mahinda Samarasinghe has also asked for another 70 million rupees for his vehicle.
Ministers Rauff Hakeem, Sarath Amunugama, Vijayamuni Soyza and Ranjith Siyambalapitiya have also asked for 3.5 million rupees each to purchase vehicles.
 In addition, several other Cabinet ministers including
Anura Priyadarshana Yapa, Palani Digambaram, Gamini Jayawickrama Perera, Chandima Weerakkody, Wijayadasa Rajapaksa and D.M. Swaminadan have asked for financial provisions to purchase new vehicles.
At the same time, a group of state ministers and deputy ministers including Sumeda G. Jayasena, Dushmantha Mithrapala, M.L.M. Hisbullah, Sujeeva Senasinghe, Champika Premadasa, T.B. Ekanayake and Indika Bandaranayake have also asked provisions.
Meanwhile the JVP says that this government is also using public money extravagantly, for the government ministers, similar to that of the Rajapaksa government.  JVP Propaganda Secretary MP Vijitha Herath said that wastage of public money in this manner is violating the good governance policy.
The minister of Sustainable Development and Wildlife, Jayawickrama Perera has asked for 70 million rupees provisions to purchase vehicles for him and his deputy minister.

Health Minister Dr. Rajitha Senaratne, and representatives from the Ministry of Higher Education, Attorney General's Department and Sri Lanka Medical Council were also present.
Later speaking to us, the GMOA secretary, Dr. Haritha Aluthge said that they are hopeful that they would get a solution for the SAITM issue by next Monday.
Meanwhile, the convener of Medical Faculty Students’ Activists’ Committee Ryan Jayalath was further remanded until 7th of September.
In addition, Magistrate Dulani Weeratunga ordered to produce Ryan Jayalath before the Maligakanda Magistrate on 28th of August in connection with the allegation of forcibly entering the Health Ministry premises and causing damage to public property.

hits._id: Germany Assures More Assistance To Sri Lank

_source.content:
German Chancellor Dr. Anjela Merkel assured to send a high level business delegation including the Economic Affairs Minister of Germany to seek about the opportunities to improve economic investments and trade relations between Germany and Sri Lanka.
She made these remarks when she met President Maithripala Sirisena yesterday (Feb. 17) at the Office of the German Chancellor.
The President who arrived in the Federal Chancellor’s Office was received by the German Leader. A Guard of Honour was also held to welcome President Sirisena, who is on a 3-day state visit to Germany. After the Guard of Honour, two national anthems were played.
Subsequently, the Chancellor Merkel and President Sirisena started bilateral discussions. The discussion was focused on strengthening of bilateral relations of the two countries. The special attention was paid on promoting of the economic and trade activities between Germany and Sri Lanka.
Dr. Merkel expressing her satisfaction about the reconciliation process in Sri Lanka stated she heard that the people both in the South and the North are living contentedly. She also pledged the assistance of the Government of Germany for the welfare of the northern people. The German chancellor expressed her willingness to grant funds for the improvement of fields of vocational training and renewable energy in Sri Lanka.
Commenting on the ban imposed on Sri Lankan fish exports to Europe, Dr. Merkel said a committee has been appointed to investigate that matter. She said the actions will be taken according to the report by the committee.
When President Sirisena requested the assistance to regain the GSP+ to Sri Lanka, the German Chancellor said she would seek for the possibility over that.
The President invited the German Chancellor to make a visit to Sri Lanka and she accepted the invitation.
Ministers Mangala Samaraweera, Ravi Karunanayake, Mahinda Samarasinghe, Daya Gamage, Malik Samarawickrama and the Sri Lankan Ambassedor in Germany Karunathilaka Amunugama also were present at this occasion.

hits._id: Sri lanka's displeasure at death sentence being meted out to Rizana; Saudi ambassador recalled to the island.

_source.content:
Sri Lanka has recalled its Ambassador in Saudi Arabia Ahamed A Javaad with immediate effect to express the country’s displeasure over the execution of Sri Lankan house maid Rizana Nafeek.

External Affairs Ministry Secretary Karunathilaka Amunugama said they expressed displeasure to the Saudi Arabian government for beheading Nafeek on Wednesday.

President Mahinda Rajapaksa appealed twice to the Saudi King to release Rizana, who had been held in a Saudi prison for seven years.

She was beheaded by Saudi authorities under the Sharia law.

Amunugama said the External Affairs Ministry, through its embassy in Riyadh and lawyers requested Saudi authorities to pardon Nafeek on the grounds that she was under-age and that she was not trained to look after an infant.

Meanwhile, EU foreign affairs head Catherine Ashton said The European Union too expresses its dismay that Saudi Arabia had beheaded a Sri Lankan maid convicted of murdering her employer’s baby, despite repeated appeals for a stay of execution.

hits._id: Former MP’s given one more month to hand over their official residences

_source.content:
The Ministry of Public Administration has informed former parliamentarians to vacate the government houses in which they are currently occupied even after they lost their parliamentary seats in the last general election.

A senior ministry official told our news team that all former MPs have already been informed in writing they should vacate the houses within a month.

It is reported that 25 former MPs have not vacated their official residences by the end of last week.

The Public Administration Ministry has decided to take legal action if such MPs do not vacate their official houses by obliging to the ministry notice.

Assistant doctors and radiologists are engaged today in a work to rule campaign in government hospital throughout the island.

Meanwhile Secretary of the Government Radiologists and Technical Officers Association Dharmaratna Epa said that the government radiologists too started a work to rule campaign today demanding a risk allowance.


			   
			   		
	
			   

When our news team contacted the Ministry of Health, its top official said the assistant doctors’ issue is nearly solved.

He also said a special meeting will be held this evening to discuss the existing career problem of the radiologists.

hits._id: Sri Lanka condemns attack on Karachi International Airport

_source.content: Sri Lanka vehemently condemned the terrorist attack at the Jinnah International Airport in Karachi that killed 23 people mostly security forces personnel and civilian employees, and injured several others.Issuing a statement, Sri Lanka's external Affairs Ministry said the Government of Sri Lanka vehemently condemns the heinous terrorist attack as a "deliberate attempt to cause mayhem and damage critical infrastructure which services international travel and commerce."The Sri Lankan government commended the Pakistani security forces for thwarting the attack.

hits._id: University students urge authorities to restore academic activities

_source.content:
The activities at the state universities have been stalled for 21 days now due to the ongoing strike by the non-academic staff.
 
Even the examinations of the universities have been affected.
 
Meanwhile, the undergraduates of the Sabaragamuwa University staged a protest in the Pambawinna Junction yesterday (Mar. 19), demanding the authorities to restore the academic activities.
 
They said that the authorities should soon address the issues of the non-academic staff.
 
Meanwhile, the Ministry of Higher Education yesterday said that they would make an attempt to solve the non-academic strike today.
 
However, the Co-chairman of the University Joint Trade Union Committee Edward Malwaththage said they do not expect a fair solution from the authorities.
 
They are planning to stage a protest march from Rajagiriya to Parliament Roundabout this afternoon (Mar. 20).
 
Meanwhile, the discussion between Government Surveyors Union and Minister of Land Gayantha Karunathilaka ended without an agreement last afternoon.
 
Union President Duminda Undugoda said that the surveyors will continue their strike.
 
The surveyors are opposing a planned move by the government to handover land mapping in Sri Lanka to an American company.

hits._id: Korean Embassy condoles Koslanda landslide victims

_source.content: The Embassy of the Republic of Korea in Sri Lanka extends its deepest condolences to the Government and people of Sri Lanka and those bereaved families affected by the recent tragic landslide in Koslanda. The Embassy wishes that the efficient and speedy measures taken by the Government of Sri Lanka and its armed forces to rescue the distressed, treat the injured and mitigate further damage would help the people of Sri Lanka overcome this difficult time and establish normalcy in the affected areas. Accordingly, H.E. Mr. Chang Won-sam, Korean Ambassador to Sri Lanka, met with Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, Minister of Disaster Management, on 1st November 2014 at the Ministry. As a contribution towards the emergency relief efforts, Ambassador Chang handed over a cheque to Hon. Minister Amaraweera in the amount of 2.23 million rupees which is profit raised from broadcasting the drama Dae-jang-geum (Sujatha Diyani) in corporation with Rupavahini Corporation. The Korean Embassy sincerely hopes that the injured people and affected villages would be recovered and reconstructed as soon as possible.

hits._id: PM wants explanations from Media Secretary concerning the media statement

_source.content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has called for explanations from Mass Media Ministry Secretary Nimal Bopage about a communiqué issued to media institutes about the internal affairs of the parliament.
The communiqué released to the media on the 28th this month, under the theme ‘Leave no room for the misuse of noble media freedom’, caused a great controversy.
The communiqué has stated that it is illegal for a group of MPs in the opposition to refer to their faction as the Joint Opposition.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has noted that by releasing such a letter to the media, the Media Secretary has acted beyond his capacity concerning the internal parliamentary affairs. 
Accordingly, the Prime Minister has summoned the Media Secretary to Temple Trees on Monday to provide explanation with regard to the matter.
However, Media Secretary Nimal Bopage has convened a media briefing in Colombo yesterday, to express his views over releasing the communiqué to media.

hits._id: Constitutional Council nominates members to 4 commissions

_source.content:

All ten members of the Constitutional Council had assembled this morning at the Parliament premises and reached a final decision regarding the members of the Commission to Investigate Allegation of Bribery or Corruption, Human Rights Commission, Public Service Commission and National Police Commission.
A decision was taken to immediately forward the recommendations to the President, the Office of the Speaker said in a statement.
The Constitutional Council is set to reconvene on November 04 while a final decision on the remaining independent commissions is to be taken on that date.

hits._id: The Government always acts fairly towards all; Minister Nimal Siri pala tells Yashushi Akaashi

_source.content: Minister Nimal Siripala de Silva says that no other country in the world had taken the steps the Sri Lankan Government had adopted for bringing about reconciliation after concluding the war.The Minister said so when he met Japanese Government’s senior diplomat Yashushi Akaashi yesterday who is currently on a five-day official visit to the island.Minister de Silva said that the Sri Lankan government treats all citizens in an equal manner and do not bow to the threats extended against Sri Lanka. He stressed that the policy of the Sri Lankan government is to cooperate with all foreign countries while safeguarding the country's soveringty.On this occasion the Minister also pointed out that, when dealing with foreign countries, it was the Sri Lankan Government policy to act in a manner that always cordial relationship as well as the country’s sovereignty was safeguarded.In the presence of Yashushi Akaashi the Minister said that through the Northern Provincial Council election the Government was able to show to the international community the democracy existing in the country.Yashushi Akaashi is scheduled to meet Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe tomorrow.

hits._id: Tense situation in parliament over Uva Chief Minister’s bank account

_source.content:
A heated argument emerged in parliament today over a bank account used by the Uva Provincial Council Chief Minister. 
The question with regard to the matter was raised by Badulla District MP Chaminda Wijesiri. 
The prime minister, the minister of Local Government and JVP leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake also intervened in the argument.

hits._id: Several cross over’s today as well;New party from a group of NFF members

_source.content: Investment Promotions deputy minister Faizer Mustafa pledged his support today to common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena.The deputy minister joined the common opposition at a women’s conference held at Viharamahadevi Park in Colombo.Later Mustafa joined a media conference held at the Opposition Leader’s office in Colombo.During the meeting, journalists reminded him of his remarks about the Bodu Bala Sena organization and questioned him of his cross over to the common opposition.Meanwhile 19 UPFA Pradeshiya Sabha members of the North Western Provincial council pledged their support to common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena during another media conference held at the Opposition Leader’s officeThe UPFA PS members are from Panduwasnuwara, Bingiriya, Nikaweratiya, Udubaddawa, Kobeigane, Narammala and Alawwa.At the same time, UPFA Ambilipitiya PS vice chairman Chandrasiri Munasinghe, UPFA Pannala PS member Piyal Devapriya, UPFA Minuwangoda PS member Desmond Gunawardana, and Eravur Urban Council member Ameer Asad pledged their to common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena.Meanwhile former parliamentary affairs secretary of NFF leader minister Wimal Weerawansa and 3 other party activists also pledged support to common candidate Maithreepala Sirisena today.At the same time another 6 PS members belonging to several upcountry minority parties, now with common candidate, have pledged their support today to President Mahinda Rajapaksa.Meanwhile over 100 Muslim members representing local government institutions have pledged their support to President Mahinda Rajapaksa.

hits._id: doctors on strike today

_source.content:
Over a thousand doctors attached to the Colombo National Hospital will stage a 24 hours strike today demanding the government to resolve irregularities in their annual transfers.
the Government Medical Officers' Association stated doctors apply for transfers when the Ministry of Health advertises vacancies and openings in other areas, and such advertisements are placed every year.
However, this year, the vacancies that are available were hidden from the doctors by the ministry, a GMOA office bearer said.
The strike action will commence at 8:00 a.m. and continue till 8:00 a.m. tomorrow. According to the GMOA official, only the Colombo National Hospital will engage in the trade union action, but other hospitals around the island will join in, depending on the government's response.

hits._id: No local government election this year, says Election Commission Chairman

_source.content:
The National Election Commission says they are not in a position to hold the Local Government election this year.
After the passing of the Local Government Election Amendment Bill, the Election Commission was planning to hold the local government election on or before the 9th December.
However, the Election Commission Chairman, Mahinda Deshapriya told our news team that he had been informed by the Examinations Department that the G.C.E. O/L examination will begin on the 12thDecember, therefore government school premises will not be able to release for the purpose.
The Chairman said that the Election Commissioner General had informed this to him in writing.
Since the election could not be rescheduled to an alternative date in December, the election would be postponed till next January.

hits._id: Every Sri lankan visit a hospital 6 times per year.

_source.content: The health Ministry states that in year 2013, 115 million patients have come to hospitals for various treatments.70 million patients have obtained services from government hospitals while 45 million patients have gone to private hospitals.The health Ministry further stated that 70 percent of the patients have obtained treatment for non communicable deceases.It is further revealed that an individual has gone to a hospital 6 times per annum.

hits._id: 65% of Executive President's power reduced - 19 A committee head

_source.content: A media conference was held at the Department of Information today to educate the public regarding the changes that have taken place under the 19th Amendment.Addressing the media, President Counsel Jayampathi Wickramarathna, the Head of the Committee which prepared the 19th Constitutional Amendment Draft Bill, stated that 60% to 65% of powers of the post of the Executive President have been reduced by the new amendment.At the same time, Deputy Foreign Minister Ajith P. Perera stated that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa put his full weight through his favorite MPs to defeat the move until the last moment.As full impunity enjoyed by previous Presidents has been limited by the 19th Amendment, a fundamental case could be filed against an official act of the current President.However, the President will enjoy the powers further as the Head of State, Head of the Executive, Head of the Government, Head of the Cabinet as well as the Commander of the Security Forces.The term of office of a president has been reduced to 5 years from the previous 6 years, while a President cannot dissolve parliament on his or her own accord until the parliament completes a term of 4.5 years since inauguration.In addition, the President will appoint a Prime Minister after considering the MP who has won the trust of the majority.  The President also cannot remove a Prime Minister from his position except by a no confidence motion passed in parliament with the simple majority.However, in the event, either the government manifesto or the budget is defeated, the entire Cabinet, including the Prime Minister would lose their posts, and the president would appoint a new MP to the Prime Minister’s post and name a new Cabinet as well.The President would consult the Prime Minister to appoint Cabinet Ministers, State Ministers and Deputy Ministers.  The number of Cabinet Ministers has been limited to 30 while the number of State Ministers and Deputy Ministers has been limited to 40.A President can stay in office for two terms, while candidates should complete 35 years to qualify to contest for a presidential election.If the post of Executive President falls vacant, the Prime Minister would automatically become the acting President.  The Previous Clause which cited that a MP would be elected to the President’s post has not been changed in the 19th Amendment.At the same time, a person who holds dual citizenship is disqualified to contest for a parliamentary election under the 19th Amendment.The right to information has been made a fundamental right under the 19th Amendment, and this would be fully implemented after the Right to Information Draft Bill is passed in parliament.President Counsel Jayampathi Wickramarathna further said that he is satisfied the ability to get the new bill passed at least with these changes.

hits._id: SL to get three more Field Marshals?

_source.content: General Secretary of the Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) Ven. Galagodaaththe Gnanasara Thera stated at a press conference yesterday that Ex-Defense Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa, then Navy and Air Force Chiefs too should  receive equitable promotion, since General Sarath Fonseka is promoted as Sri Lanka's first ever Field Marshal in the history of Sri Lankan military.Ven. Gnanasara pointed out that Gotabaya Rajapaksa played the major role and also supported the war against the LTTE and deserves to be promoted equally.Thera state:"The BBS is not against the five-star promotion given to General Sarath Fonseka but we demand that the newly appointed government hands out equitable promotions to soldiers who fought in the war because it would otherwise not be fair by them," he said.General Fonseka will be officially promoted to the rank of Field Marshal tomorrow by the President Maithripala Sirisena.

hits._id: UPDATE : Video: Work in corporation with the government - India tells Northern Cheif Minister.

_source.content:
Indian Foreign Minister Salman Kurshid says that the Northern Chief Minister will help people attain reconciliation and prosperity.
 
The Indian Foreign Minister currently on a on a two-day official visit to the island said so when he met people of Mannar in Jaffna yesterday. 
  
Similarly a pow-wow was also held between Indian Foreign Minister Salman Kurshid and Northern Province Chief Minister C. V. Vigneshvaran yesterday. 
 
After the pow-wow Northern Province Chief Minister C. V. Vigneshvaran said that at that occasion the Indian Foreign Minister had requested the CM to work cooperatively with the Government.

UPDATE Wednesday , 09 October 2013 - 7:50 AM
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
India applauds the valour of the President.     
India has applauded President Mahinda Rajapaksa’s valiant decision to hold an election in the North and his leadership given towards the process. 
Visiting Indian External Affairs Minister Salman Khurshid expressed these views during his meeting with President Mahinda Rajapaksa at the President’s House this afternoon. 
Minister Khurshid has stated that the Northern Provincial Council election was an important step in the forward march. 
It was also stressed that the decision to hold discussions among the fishing community was a practical step to settle the dispute between Indian and Sri Lankan fishermen. 
President Mahinda Rajapaksa said that the Parliament Select Committee would be the best platform to settle issues that erupted regarding the 13th Amendment. 
The President said that he would trust more on a home-grown mechanism to be worked out by the Parliament Select Committee.








Tuesday, 08 October 2013 - 06:50 PM
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Indian foreign Minister meets the President.
Tuesday, 08 October 2013 - 01:07 PM
President Mahinda Rajapaksa said that the Parliament Select Committee would be the best platform to settle the issues that have erupted with regard to the 13th Amendment.
 
When the President met Indian External Affairs Minister Salman Khurshid at the President’s House this morning, the President has told the latter that he would trust more on a home-grown mechanism to be worked out by the Parliament Select Committee.
 
President’s Media Spokesman Mohan Samaranayake said that the meeting between the President and Indian External Affairs Minister was one step of the Indian Minister’s tour in Sri Lanka.
 
The President and the visiting Indian Minister have had lengthy discussions on economic and bilateral ties between the two countries during this meeting.
 
It was also decided to organize meetings between the officials of the respective fields of both countries in order to reduce trade imbalances.
 
Indian Minister Khurshid has told the President that India would always appreciate the democratic steps taken by the Sri Lankan government.
 
Meanwhile the two countries agreed to have a series of discussions to settle the fishermen disputes between the two countries in a peaceful manner.
 
The President and the Indian Minister have exchanged views on the regional issues with regard to the two countries during the meeting held this morning.
 
Afterward Indian Minister Khurshid has had discussions with Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe.
 
Later Minister Khurshid was to begin a tour in Jaffna, and he is scheduled to meet Governor G.A. Chandrasiri and Chief Minister C.V. Wigneswaran of the Northern Provincial Council.
UPDATE Tuesday, 08 October 2013 - 1:07 PM
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Indian foreign affairs minister meets President

Indian foreign affairs minister Salman Kurshid met president Mahinda Rajapakse at the presidential house this morning. The foreign affairs minister who arrived in the island yesterday is scheduled to visit Jaffna today where he will meet with the northern province chief minister C.V. Wigneshwaran and the northern province governor major general G.A. Chandrasiri.
Tuesday, 08 October 2013 - 10:31 AM
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Let s solve fishermen issues amicably - says Indian foreign Minister.

Indian foreign Minister Salman Kurshid addressing a joint media briefing held in Colombo yesterday stated that the fishermen issue must be solved amicably.
 
Professor Peiris stated that In this regard, the 2 parties agreed to encourage fishermen’s associations on both sides, which had met in the past and reached certain understandings, to meet again to work on developing on this trend further.
 Tuesday, 08 October 2013 - 07:50 AM
-----------------------------------------------------------------

Devolution should be on constitutional limits and people s aspirations.
Monday, 07 October 2013 - 07:25 PM

Visiting Indian External Affairs Minister Salman Khurshid held a joint press conference at the External Affairs Ministry this morning.
 
Speaking to journalists, Indian Minister Khurshid stressed that power should be devolved on the constitutional limits and the people’s aspirations.
 
Meanwhile the agreement for the Sampur Coal Power plant was signed between Ceylon Electricity Board and Indian National Thermal Power Corporation this afternoon.

_source.content: Trade unions say that the strike that was commenced by Nurses Trade Unions will be continued today as well as no solutions were received for the midwifery training issue.Chairman of the Government Nursing Officers Association Saman Ratnapriya stated that around 28,000 nurses at 650 hospitals have gone on strike.The State Services United Nurses Association and All Island Nurses Association also stated that they too would continue with this strike.Several in-house patients were inconvenienced as a result of the strike at hospitals island-wide.Although trade unions say that essential services were conducted some patients said that it was not so.However, Secretary to the Ministry of Health Dr Nihal Jayathilaka stated that this strike should be brought to a halt by reaching a consensus.Minister of Health Maithreepala Sirisena requested nursing staff to return to work.

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has made a surprise visit to the Sri Lanka Freedom Party headquarters on T. B. Jayah Mawatha.
 
An SLFP spokesperson said that the President arrived there this morning (Jun 05) and thereafter had discussions with new office bearers of the party including its General Secretary, Professor, Rohana Lakshman Piyadasa and National Organizer, Minister, Duminda Dissanayake.
 
The UPFA General Secretary, Minister, Mahinda Amaraweera, SLFP Assistant Secretaries, Deputy Minister, Lasantha Alagiyawanna, Western Provincial Chief Minister, Isura Devapriya and Group of 16 members - MPs Dayasiri Jayasekera and Sumeda G Jayasena were also present.
 
Meanwhile, the SLFP Central Committee is scheduled to meet this Thursday night at the President’s official residence.

hits._id: President and PM summoned to testify in the case against UNP former General Secretary Tissa Attanayake

_source.content:
The Colombo High Court issued summons against President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, requesting that they appear in Courts on July 17th.
The summons were issued when the Case against former UNP General Secretary Tissa Attanayake was taken before High Court Judge Wikum Kaluarachchi today.
Former UNP General Secretary Tissa Attanayake has been accused of three counts of charges including preparing forged documents.
The President and Prime Minister have been named as first and second witnesses of this Case.
They had been summoned before Courts today but their lawyers informed Courts that their clients were not able to appear due to their schedules.
Another witness for the Case, UNP General Secretary Kabeer Hashim was present before Courts this morning.
