hits._id: Fate of petition on SLFP Chairman Post to be decided on 29th

_source.content:
The case involving a petition, which seeks to issue an order to remove President Maithripala Sirisena from the Chairmanship of SLFP and replace him with former President Mahinda Rajapaksa was taken up at the Colombo District Court today (04).
Today, the respondents presented their written objections against the petition when the case was taken up by the Colombo Chief Judge.
Two members of the SLFP All Island Committee, former Chairman of Boralesgamuwa Urban Council, Aruna Priyadharshana and Asnka Srinath had filed this petition.
The Judge noted that he will give a ruling on the 29th of this month, whether this case should be continued or not, after considering the written objections.

hits._id: Sri Lanka celebrates her 67th National Independence Day today

_source.content: Sri Lanka will celebrate her 67th National Independence Day at the Parliamentary Sports Grounds in Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte with the participation of President Maithripala Sirisena.President Sirisena will pay floral tributes at the foot of the statue of Sri Lanka’s first Prime Minister D.S. Senanayake at Independence Square, with the participation of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, ministers, religious dignitaries and special guests including Ambassadors and High Commissioners.President Maithripala Sirisena will arrive at the venue of the main ceremony around 8.45 a.m. and will be received by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and Home Affairs and Fisheries Minister Joseph Michael Perera.He will be conducted to the main flag post by the Chief of the Defence Staff, Three Service Commanders and the Inspector General of the Police.Amidst the beating of magul bera and blowing of conch shells, President Sirisena will hoist the National Flag.President Maithripala Sirisena in his Independence Day message stated that the celebration of this 67th anniversary of our Independence is of special significance as it sees the launch of a new era of good governance in the country.This comes with a new commitment to the unity of our people, to safeguard freedom and democratic rights, and proceed to a future that moves further from the re-emerging forces of colonialism.The strengthening and progress of peace in our country requires social, political and economic policies that give the highest priority to the needs of the people.This includes social welfare, economic progress, and a determined move towards good governance, which is in keeping with the traditions of tolerance and understanding of our country.The continuing strength of our freedom that was won 67 years ago requires the advance of our youth through the acquisition and development of new skills, access to new knowledge and technology, and re-kindling the spirit of freedom throughout our land.This celebration of freedom is the time to pay our tribute to the security forces that defended our sovereignty and territorial integrity with great sacrifice in the battle against terrorism.As we move forward in freedom, let us ensure the strengthening of peace and harmony to bring every success to our children and future generation who will inherit this land. Let us join in a pledge to build a future of peace, freedom and prosperity in the shining light of honesty of purpose and Good Governance.Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasingha in his Independence Day message said today, we are celebrating the 67th anniversary of Independence while a civilized political culture is being created in our beloved motherland.When the Father of the Nation, D.S. Senanayake, the first prime minister of Sri Lanka launched the independence struggle, the main weapon he used was the unity and brotherhood among the communities that lived in harmony in our country.Groups that represent diverse communities, following different religions, political parties, civil organizations and various groups came together onto one platform, shedding their differences to achieve a common objective for the benefit of the nation.

hits._id: Government discloses a premeditated conspiracy

_source.content: The President’s Media Unit stated in a communiqué today that the commotion in front of the Presidential Secretariat yesterday was premeditated to inconvenience the government. The government has already taken action to solve the disabled war hero’s problems and the yesterday’s conspiracy attempted to make a division between the government and the war heroes. The government intends that the disabled war heroes were ignorant of the elements operating behind them amid steps had been taken to solve their problem. Therefore the government assumes that an anti government group used disabled war heroes as cat’s paw. The President in his capacity as the subject minister had submitted a Cabinet paper seeking approval for their demand 4 months ago. Later the Treasury decision with regard to the matter had also been informed to the Ministry of Defence at the time of the commotion yesterday. The communiqué further stated that certain monks attached to several anti government organizations and their supporters backed this commotion intending to fulfil narrow political needs. The government communiqué further stated that police had to control the unruly protestors’ attempt to enter the Presidential secretariat forcefully as a group of foreign representatives were engaged in a discussion inside the secretariat at that time.

An SLFP special central committee meeting will be held this afternoon at the president’s official residence with President Maithripala Sirisena at the chair.

hits._id: Government Doctors carry out an overnight protest at Isurupaya

_source.content:
GMOA doctors continue to stage a protest at the Mministry of Education premises demanding that their children be granted admission into popular schools.
The Government doctors who went to Isurupaya last afternoon requesting a meeting with the Minister of Education, chose to stage an overnight protest at the Education Ministry premises.
At this time about 200 Government doctors remained at the premises.
However, GMOA Central Committee Member Dr. Prasad Ranaveera said that action had been taken to disconnect electricity in the ministry of education auditorium where the doctors spent the night. 
The Education Ministry Media Unit issued a communiqué with regard to this yesterday.
It was stated that the GMOA was insisting that the Ministry grant their children admission to the most popular schools in the capital and suburbs.  
Expressing his views with regard to this Education Minister Akila Viraj Kariyawasam said that the demand being made by the GMOA was unfair.
Meanwhile the GMOA will stage token strikes from 8 a.m. to 12 noon today in hospitals in the Kurunegala, Kandy and Matara districts.

hits._id: Government postpones debate on Enforced Disappearances Bill

_source.content:
The government has decided to refrain from holding the debate on the International Convention for the Protection of All Persons from Enforced Disappearances Bill.
The debate was scheduled to be held on Thursday.
It has been reported that the ruling party arrived at this decision following lengthy discussions on this bill.
The Chief Government Whip, Minister Gayantha Karunathilake said still no decision has been taken on a new date .
Meanwhile, the government has directed its concerns on presenting a new bill to replace the 20th amendment to the constitution.
The amendment proposes to hold the Provincial Council elections on the same day.
Still few Provincial Councils are to ratify the resolution.
Therefore, the government is planning to present a new bill with amendments.
A discussion regarding the matter is scheduled for today (19) at the party leaders’ meeting.
The government had initially scheduled to debate and vote on the 20th amendment to the constitution in parliament tomorrow.
However, the view of the Supreme Court on the respective bill will be announced by the speaker today.

hits._id: Minister Ravi meets the President and the Prime Minister; Decision on no confidence motion today

_source.content:
Minister of foreign affairs, Ravi Karunanayake met with the president and prime minister at the president’s secretariats office yesterday.
In addition to our news team receiving confirmation of this meeting taking palace from State Minister Lakshman Yapa Abeywardena, our correspondents personally witnessed Minister Ravi Karunanayake , Rajitha Senaratne and  Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe enter the premises of the Presidents Secretariats Office yesterday.
It was noted however that Minister Karunanayake was not present at the cabinet meeting that was held at the Presidents Secretariats Office on Wednesday morning.
Government ministers of the SLFP had met with the President and Premier  earlier in the day, and had requested that Minister Ravi Karunanayake be asked to resign or have him removed from the post.
Meanwhile, with regard to the no confidence motion filed against minister Karunanayake, the date that the debate will take place,  is to be decided at the party leaders meeting today.
Ruling party Chief Convener Minister Gayantha Karunathilaka noted that the party leaders meeting will be held at 4 pm today.
The leader of the Joint opposition MP Dinesh Gunawardena says that he hopes to express his views regarding the no confidence motion filed against the  Minister at the meeting today.

hits._id: President left to Singapore this morning

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena left to Singapore this morning, Hiru airport correspondent said.
Meanwhile, Prime Minister of New Zealand John Key also left the country following his three-day official visit.

hits._id: Civil defence force personnel will not be used for Political activities: says President

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena states that Civil defence force personnel will not be used for Political activities in the future.The President made this comment addressing a ceremony held in Polonnaruwa yesterday.

hits._id: The Government cannot be distanced from the people : says President.

_source.content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa says that nobody will be able to distance the Government from the people as the government has brought about the country’s development unprecedented in history.The president said so while addressing a people’s rally held subsequent to declaring the Veyangoda flyover and the Veyangoda Divisional Council Building Complex open for public use last afternoon.On this occasion the President pointed out that today the Opposition being unable make promises for development , was engaged in mudslinging politics.

hits._id: Video : No need of gimmicks for victory - President emphasizes.

_source.content:
President Mahinda Rajapaksa asserted that UPFA Government which enjoyed a huge popularity did not need computer gimmicks. 
 
The President said so while addressing a people’s rally held at the Kuliyapitiya Industrial College premises yesterday. 
 

			   
			   		
	
			   
 
Meanwhile another people’s rally of the UPFA was held at the Puttalam Urban Town Council auditorium yesterday. 
 
On this occasion the President asserted that there were minorities in the country and that the Government had made many sacrifices on behalf of the Muslim community.

hits._id: President contacts Maldivian counterpart via phone

_source.content:
President Mahinda Rajapaksa has engaged in a telephone conversation with his Maldivian counterpart Mohammed Waheed.

According to government sources the President had phoned his counterpart in order to ascertain the political situation in the Maldives.

Political tension in the Maldives has been rife since recent times with its former President Mohammed Nasheed seeking refuge at the Indian embassy in male.

However Maldivian government forces have confirmed that it has no intention of arresting the former President.

hits._id: An alternate Opposition - 5 Parties commence discussions

_source.content:
Leader of the National Freedom Front Wimal Weerawansa stated that discussions have been held with 5 Political parties representing the Parliament on forming a common opposition.

He further stated that discussions will be held next week with regard to forming a new political front to contest future elections.
 
Apart from the SLFP, constituent parties of the UPFA such as Mahajana Eksath Peramuna, National Freedom Front, Communist Party, Democratic Leftist Front and the Pivithuru Hela Urumaya are represented in Parliament.

EPDP and CWC are already supporting the government.

hits._id: Spain to Assist Various Projects in SL

_source.content:
Minister of Finance Ravi Karunanayake, on Monday, met with the Spain Embassy Officials.
The meeting was held at the Ministry of Finance in Colombo. Minister of Finance, Ravi Karunanayake stated that Spain Government is willing to assist various development projects in Sri Lanka.

hits._id: New issue for Minister of Education

_source.content:
Education Minister Bandula Gunawardana said today that he cannot make any appointment or transfer without the prior approval of the Government Service Commission.
 
Addressing a media briefing held at the Education Ministry today he said that this hurdle has baffled him as well.

hits._id: President makes a request from public servants

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena requests the public servants to concentrate on development and economic stability of the country without paying attention to the politics of the country.
President Sirisena said this addressing the 35th meeting of the Sri Lanka Administrative Services Association held in Nelum Pokuna Theatre, Colombo, yesterday (Mar. 26).

hits._id: 3 demands from the Intercompany employees' union

_source.content: Intercompany employees’ union requests the Government for three demands including the formulation of laws necessary for the increase of private sector employees’ salaries proportionate to the increase of salaries of public sector employees.Intercompany employees’ union  chairman Wasantha Samarasinghe said so while participating at a media briefing held in Colombo yesterday.Expressing his views further on the occasion the Inter company employees’ union chairman said further that the Government should draw its attention appointing a separate Minister for the Labour Ministry as well.

hits._id: President participates in several programmes in Canberra

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena who is in a three day State visit in Australia participated in several programmes held in Canberra today.First, President Sirisena observed the Science and Innovation Centre and then has visited the Food Research Centre established in Australian State University, according to the president's Media Division.President Sirisena has further stated during these visits that Sri Lanka would be benefitted by the novel techniques used by Australia to increase food production.

hits._id: Abbott's close bond with MR was 'a mystery' - PM

_source.content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has claimed that the Australian government's silence on Sri Lanka's alleged human rights abuses was the price it paid to secure cooperation of the previous Rajapaksa government on stopping asylum-seeker boats.In an exclusive interview with The Australian, Prime Minister has said his Australian counterpart Tony Abbot's close relationship with former President Rajapaksas was "a mystery" to Sri Lankans, and that Australia's new Immigration Minister, Peter Dutton, would be unlikely to get the warm welcome received under the previous government.Australian government provided around $2 million in materiel support for the Sri Lanka Navy and gifted two Bay-class patrol boats to the navy to intercept asylum-seeker boats before they leave Sri Lankan waters.Prime Minister Wickremasinghe has confirmed to The Australian that "people connected to the previous government" have been involved in people-smuggling operations.The Prime Minister however, has said that his government would continue to crack down on asylum seekers leaving the island as it is a major issue for Australia.

hits._id: SLFP CC meets today after positions changed

_source.content:
The Sri Lanka Freedom Party Central Committee meets today (Jun 07) for the first time after the temporary appointment of the new office-bearers.
 
The meeting will take place in the afternoon, at the President’s official residence, with President Maithripala Sirisena at the chair.
 
The SLFP temporary office bearers were appointed last Sunday, where Prof. Rohana Lakshman Piyadasa was appointed the new General Secretary.
 
The President was re-appointed as the party Chairman, former Presidents, Mahinda Rajapaksa and Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga, as well as the former Prime Minister D. M. Jayaratne, were re-elected as advisors of the party.
 
Similarly, Minister Duminda Dissanayake was elected the party’s National Organizer.

hits._id: 20th amendment is gazetted

_source.content: The 20th Amendment which includes the new electoral system has been gazatted last night.Acting government printer W.A.A.G. Fonseka said the English version of the gazette has already been printed. He said the Sinhala and the Tamil versions of the gazette would be released within today.Our news team contacted a member of the committee which prepared the new electoral system, Ashoka Abeysinghe to comment on the future line of action with regard to the new electoral system.He said the gazette could be presented to parliament by June 30th. After it is presented to parliament, the opinion of the Supreme Court should be sought, and at that point, objections could be filed if any.He also said that a special parliament session could be summoned with regard to this as the next parliament is to meet on July 3rd.When the Supreme Court opinion is informed to parliament, the 20th Amendment could be debated and passed in parliament.

hits._id: President questions how the country was freed and developed if there is no good governance.

_source.content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa questioned how his government was able to bring freedom to the country and subsequently massive development if there is no good governance.He was speaking at several election rallies organized in Maharagama and Homagama areas today.

hits._id: A general election following the Presidential Election.There is no referendum; says Government.

_source.content: According the government, a General Election will be held following the Presidential Election.The Minister of Disaster Management Mahinda Amaraweera said this while addressing a media briefing held in Colombo today.During the media briefing, a journalist raised a question regarding the date of the upcoming Presidential ElectionIn response when Minister Mahinda Amaraweera expressed his views, Minister Anura Priyadarshana Yapa also shared his views.

hits._id: Norway appreciates government's efforts to restore normalcy in the North

_source.content: The Ambassador of Norway to Sri Lanka Grete Lochen paid a courtesy call on President Mahinda Rajapaksa at the President's House in Colombo this morning.During the friendly discussion, the President and Lochen exchanged views on current developments in Sri Lanka.The Norwegian Ambassador expressed satisfaction over the measures taken by the government under the leadership of President Rajapaksa to restore normalcy in the North after the end of the war.She also said that her government was pleased with the decision by the Sri Lankan government to hold Provincial Council elections in the region.President Rajapaksa said his government is ready to work with the newly elected Northern Provincial Council to ensure economic and social progress of the people living in the area.

hits._id: Parliament adjourned as tension erupted during the vote taking on the decree to make oil supply an essential service

_source.content:
Tension erupted in parliament a short while ago as the government attempted to pass a Presidential decree, making the distribution of petroleum an essential service.
Vote taking was initiated to this effect under the Essential Public Service Ordinance.
The house was adjourned by speaker karu jayasuriya as ongoing protests were voiced by the Opposition MPs.

hits._id: Video :  President and his Maldivian counterpart commence discussions.

_source.content: President of Maldives Abdulla Yameen arrived in Sri Lanka yesterday for a three day official visit on an invitation extended by President Mahinda Rajapaksa.President Yameen is currently engaged in a cordial discussion with President Mahinda Rajapaksa and the senior government officials.Sri Lanka and Maldives will sign several Memoranda of Understanding on a variety of issues during the Maldivian President Abdulla Yameen's state visit to the island.

hits._id: President visits Uganda

_source.content:
President Mahinda Rajapaksa left the island last night on a 4 day official visit to Uganda.
 
The President is due to hold discussions with his Ugandan counterpart Yoweri Musaweni.
 
The President’s spokesperson stated that President Mahinda Rajapaksa would also participate at the opening ceremony of the Commonwealth Local Government Summit.
 
The President is also expected to visit the Masuleeta Vocational Training institute and the Uganda Sugar Company.

hits._id: Solving problems of the public cannot be delayed: says President

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena states that solving problems faced by the public cannot be delayed.President made this comment while reviewing the progress of development activities in the Pollonnaruwa district.

hits._id: Update :Video: Let us gather the opposition - says Opposition Leader during 55th UNP Convention

_source.content: Opposition Leader Ranil Wickramasinghe states that everyone, including opponents should band together, putting aside their differences, in order to obtain power from the government.The Opposition Leader made this statement while speaking during the 55th annual convention of the UNP which was held at the party headquarters in Sirikotha today.The 4 proposals which were presented during the convention which comprised of obtaining approval for the mechanism of the leadership council, abolishing the executive presidency, easing the cost of living and the establishment of a government that treats the public fairly, were unanimously adopted.Close to 5800 UNP members including the leadership council members, parliamentarians and local government ministers took part during the convention.UNP parliamentarians Sajith Premadasa and Thalatha Athukorala who refused to join the leadership council also took part in the convention.In addition chairman of the leadership council Karu Jayasuriya, parliamentarians Gamini Jayawickrama Perera and Harin Fernando also addressed the gathering.Update : Saturday, 21 December 2013 - 7:50 PM---------------------------------------------------55th UNP Convention begins - 4 Proposals including those relating to leadership board approvedThe 55th Annual convention of the UNP is currently being held at Party Headquarters Sirikotha.4 proposals including those pertaining to the composition of the leadership board, abolishing the executive presidency, reducing the cost of living and the instating of a people friendly government were presented and approved at the convention.Around 5800 party members were invited for today’s UNP Convention.Update : Saturday, 21 December 2013 - 12:58---------------------------------------------------UNP Convention to approve 4 proposals todayThe 55th Annual convention of the UNP will be held at Party Headquarters Sirikotha at 9am today.UNP General Secretary MP Tissa Attanayake stated that 4 proposals with regard to the composition of the leadership board shall be presented at the convention.Around 5800 party members have been invited for today’s UNP Convention.Meanwhile, Member of the UNP Leadership Board Kabir Hashim stated that although MP’s Sajith Premadasa and Thalatha Athukorala were invited to take part in the leadership board meeting yesterday, they had been absent.

hits._id: Mano Ganeshan replies Wannila Aeththo

_source.content:
Minister of National Co-existence Dialogue and Official Languages, Mano Ganeshan remarks that his ministry is bound to look into matters of our Vedda community.
He made this remark in response to the remark made by Veddha Chieftain Uruvarige Wannila Aeththo yesterday.Veddha Chieftain said that government should assign the matters concerning the indigenous community to a separate ministry.
He stated this at the indigenous community day celebrations in Mahiyanganaya- Morabedda yesterday.

hits._id: Program to inspect licenses of Expressway Buses

_source.content: The Ministry of Highways together with the Ministry of Private Transport Services has launched a new program to inspect the licenses of private buses operating along the Highways.Therefore, the Government Information Department stated that they will only allow the holders of permanent or temporary licenses to enter the highways.The buses engaged in tours can obtain a temporary license from the National Transport Commission to operate along the highways.

hits._id: World Press Freedom Day A Reminder Of What's At Stake

_source.content:
World Press Freedom Day is celebrated the world over today.
The theme for World Press Freedom Day 2016 is ‘Access to information and fundamental freedoms: This is your right’. Sri Lanka will host two main events for World Press Freedom Day.
President Maithripala Sirisena will attend an event at the National Library and Documentation Services Board at 1 this afternoon.
A proposal will be handed over to the Head of State with the objective of creating a good media culture in Sri Lanka.
Meanwhile, an event at the Lakshman Kadirgamar Institute will be held under the patronage of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe at 3 this afternoon.
A report on media responsible for the people will be handed over to Premier Wickremesinghe.

hits._id: Media has a greater responsibility for the country- President

_source.content:
Media has a greater responsibility towards the country, President Maithripala Sirisena said at an event held in Battaramulla yesterday.
He said media should send the message of going ahead as one nation.

hits._id: I am unbiased as a President: President Maithripala Sirisena

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena stated that though he had a certain political ideology, he acts in an unbias manner as the President.The President expressed these views at a function held in Galle yesterday.

hits._id: A pledge from Common candidate Maithripala not to allow another war.

_source.content: Common Candidate Maithripala Sirisena stated that no room will be kept for a war to take place once he is elected as the President.This was at a meeting held in Aranayake yesterday.

hits._id: Grade one admissions from today

_source.content:
The admission for grade one students to government schools will commence today. Accordingly, the national event will be held at the Kotte President’s College from 8.30 this morning.
The Ministry of Education has introduced a new curriculum for grade one students from this year.
The Education Ministry in a statement noted, new guidelines pertaining teachers, teaching assistants and education officers have also been complied in line with a new education policy.
Deputy Minister of Education V.S. Radhakrishnan and Education Ministry Secretary W.M. Bandusena will be participating at the event.

hits._id: A statement from Indian Premier that he awaits Sri lankan tour with pleasure and hope

_source.content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi says that he is looking forward for the Sri Lankan tour with great interest and hope.The Indian Premier said so releasing a message through his twitter account.The Indian Prime Minister points out in his message that it will be possible to further strengthen the relations between the two countries during the next several years.Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi who arrives in the island for a two-day official visit on 13th March is scheduled to tour Jaffna as well. Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi will undertake an official visit to Sri Lanka from 13th to 14th March 2015 at the invitation of President Maithripala Sirisena.During his visit to Sri Lanka next week, Indian Prime Minister will flag off the first train signifying recommencement of the Thalaimannar - Medawchchiya sector of the train service to Colombo, following the rehabilitation work carried out with Indian credit assistance.Upon his arrival on 13th March, Prime Minister Modi will be accorded a ceremonial welcome including a Guard of Honour and Gun Salute.President Maithripala Sirisena will hold bilateral discussions with the visiting Prime Minister and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe will host a lunch in honor of Prime Minister Modi.The Indian Prime Minister will address a Special Sitting of Parliament. He will also lay a wreath at the IPKF Memorial and visit the Mahabodhi Society.During the visit, the Indian Premier is expected to travel to Anuradhapura, Thalaimannar and Jaffna.In Anuradhapura, he will visit the sacred Sri Maha Bodhi.While in Jaffna, the visiting Prime Minister will unveil a plaque at the site of the proposed India- funded Jaffna Cultural Centre and also hand over to beneficiaries, houses built with Indian assistance.

hits._id: President at Women’s Day national event, as ex- First Lady makes a plea to deities

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says it is the responsibility of the government and the general public to safeguard women in Sri Lanka.
Speaking at the Women’s Day national event held at H.M. Weerasinghe Sports Ground in Ampara he cited the important role women play in the society.
Women and Child Affairs Minister Chandrani Bandara, Minister Daya Gamage and Deputy Minister Anoma Gamage also took part in the event.
Meanwhile, a separate event organized by the SLFP Women’s Front was held under the patronage of former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga at the party headquarters.
Joint Opposition members of the Women’s Front engaged in an appeal before deity at the Navagamuwa Paththini Devalaya. They called on Paththini (goddess) to create an environment for women to engage in activities without any intimidation.
Former First Lady Shiranthi Rajapaksa and several MPs including Pavithra Vanniyaarachchi participated at the event.

hits._id: Japanese Prime Minister arrives in Sri Lanka on September 7th

_source.content: Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe will arrive in Sri Lanka with a special delegation on an official visit on September 7th.His visit is in response to an invitation extended by President Mahinda Rajapaksa during his official visit to Japan.The Japanese Prime Minister and his delegation will be received at the Bandaranaike International Airport by President Mahinda Rajapaksa and a special government delegation.

hits._id: Several parties celebrate May Day, disregarding date revision

_source.content:
Marking May Day today, in a statement President Maithripala Sirisena said he salutes the working force of the country for its relentless struggle to intelligently and collectively work towards the economic progress of the country, while leaving aside communal and religious differences, working for the betterment of all people.He went on to say, the human civilization evolved with the courage of the people who did not surrender when faced with challenges.
May Day reminds us of the fact that the freedom we enjoy today is because of the sacrifices, the blood and sweat shed by those great people, he added.
Marking May Day today, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe called on all workers to be radical in the accomplishment of their responsibilities and commitments, in order to rewrite a history for Workers’ Day.
Human labour is widely recognized and valued with the communication and technological advancements in the present world, he noted.
Though today is international labour day, the government decided to postpone May-day celebrations to the 7th of May, as it coincides with Vesak week.
In spite of this, certain political parties and trade unions have organized celebrations today.
The JVP has scheduled its May-day celebrations at the Jaffna Municipal Council ground today.
The Tamil National Alliance has also organized its May-day celebrations in Jaffna- Vadamaarachchi.
In addition, the Frontline Socialist Party and Socialist People's Front have also scheduled their May-day celebrations for today.

hits._id: School uniform vouchers to be distributed next week

_source.content:
The Ministry of Education says school uniform vouchers will be distributed next week.
 
It said vouchers have already sent to provincial authorities.
 
The government allocated Rs. 2370 million to distribute uniform vouchers among 4.2 school children.
 
Rs. 75 million was set aside for piriven students.

hits._id: Joint Opposition reveals that a change taking place in September

_source.content:
Joint Opposition MP  Rohita Abeygunawardhana says that certain groups that joined the ‘Good Governance’ government will join the former president Mahinda Rajapaksa next September.
The MP said so whilst participating at the Sri Lanka Podujana party Yatiyantota electorate council meeting yesterday.

hits._id: Kandy branch of NIBM opened

_source.content:
The Kandy branch of the National Institute of Business Management was declared open by President Mahinda Rajapaksa today(19).

Several High profile government delegates as well as the Chief Minister of the Central  Province had been present during the occasion.

hits._id: Wigneshwaran does not bother about reconciliation A statement from the government regarding declining the invitation.-Video

_source.content: Minster Mahinda Samarasingha states that the TNA and the Chief Minister of the Northern Province does not have a real need to achieve lasting reconciliation.Northern Provincial Council Chief Minister C.V. Wigneswaran said yesterday that he was unable to accept the External Affairs Ministry invitation to join the delegation to be led by the President to the swearing-in ceremony of India’s new Prime Minister Narendra Modi.In a letter to External Affairs Minister G.L. Peries, NPC Chief Minister Wigneswaran thanked the Minister for his initiation and said he had a lengthy discussion over the matter with his ministers.The Chief Minister further stated that if he accepts the invitation, such an act would prove that there is a strong relationship between the government and the Northern Provincial Council; therefore he rejected the invitation.The swearing-In ceremony of the Indian Prime Minister will be held in New Delhi next Monday, and President Mahinda Rajapaksa confirmed his participation in the event yesterday.

hits._id: Special officer appointed to resolve issues in the North

_source.content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe states that Civil Administration in the North should be strengthened.The Prime Minister stated this today while attending a meeting held at Kilinochchi Secretariat during his Northern provincial tour.He also revealed that a special officer will be appointed at the Prime Minister’s Office to resolve the issues of the people of the North.Meanwhile, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe paid his last respects to the brother of President, Maithreepala Sirisena, who passed away following an axe attack.According to our correspondent, the Prime Minster paid his last respects at the residence of Priyantha Sirisena in Athumalpitiya, Polonnaruwa this evening.

hits._id: UPFA controlled Medawachchiya Pradeshiya Sabha budget also defeated

_source.content: UPFA controlled Medawachchiya Pradeshiya Sabha budget for 2014 was also defeated by 7 majority votes today.Only the PS Chairman voted for the budget while other 6 UPFA members including its Deputy Chairman joined the 2 UNP members to vote against the budget.

hits._id: President leaves for Japan today

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena, who leaves for Japan today, will be the first leader of the country to take part in the G-7 summit to be held in Ise-Shima tomorrow and the day after.
Apart from President Sirisena, Prime Ministers of Bangladesh, Laos, Papua New Guinea and Vietnam and Presidents of Chad and Indonesia are expected to participate in the outreach meeting during the G-7 summit.
India’s The Hindu newspaper reported that the invitation extended to President Sirisena symbolises the positive attitude of the international community towards Sri Lanka’s way forward as a sustainable democracy and a potential economic hub in Asia.
Meanwhile, President Maithripala Sirisena has given out instructions to give priority for the safety of women and children affected by the recent disaster situation at a special discussion held at the Presidential Secretariat yesterday.

hits._id: Recommendation to take Neville Fernando hospital under the government

_source.content:
The Supervisory Working Board on education and human development has recommended taking over Malabe Neville Fernando private hospital.
A member of this working board MP Ashu Marasinghe expressing his views over the report in parliament today said the working board has recommended setting up a separate institution to supervise Malabe Private Medical School.
Today is the 4th day of the committee stage budget debate and the heads of Higher Education and Highways, Science, Technology and Skills Development will be taken up for debate.

hits._id: The UNP decision about those who opposed the impeachment and new posts today.

_source.content:
The UNP working committee that would take several special decisions including new party positions for 2013 take place today.

That will be at the Sirikotha party headquarters.

Accordingly appointment of persons to the positions of party deputy leader, Assistant Leader and national organiser is due to be held at the meeting.

Reports say that party leader Ranil Wickremasinghe is scheduled to appoint MP Sajith Premadasa for the post of Deputy Leader, MP Joseph Michael as Assistant Leader and Dayaa Gamage as National Organiser .

Meanwhile UNP political sources pointed out that most probably there was no chance for the name MP Sajith Premadasa to be proposed for the post of Deputy Leader today.

The reason for this is that even now an investigation is being held with regard to the way MP Sajith Premadasa had behaved at the recently held debate on impeachment.

However reports say that working committee members are scheduled to propose several more names for the posts of Deputy Leader and National Organiser.

Accordingly if several names are proposed for a post, election is also scheduled to be held according to the party constitution.

In addition a special decision is scheduled to be taken at the working committee today with regard to MPs who had voted for the impeachment although they had joined the Government after being elected on the UNP ticket.

Prior to the recent impeachment the MPs concerned had been informed by a special letter to vote against the impeachment.

Accordingly legal action is due to be taken at the working committee meeting today with regard to MPs who had voted for the impeachment contrary to party decision.   

Currently 18 MPs who entered parliament on the UNP ticket at the 2010 general election support the Government.

Meanwhile Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremasinghe says that the expiry of the tenure of office of the current Government is due in 2014.

The opposition leader said so while participating at a people's rally held at Dombagolla in Ridigama last afternoon.

hits._id: President leaves to Indonesia

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has left to Indonesia at 7.35 this morning.
He is to take part in the Indian Ocean Rim Association’s Summit meeting scheduled to be held in Jakarta, Indonesia.

hits._id: Leaders of BJP meets Opposition Leader

_source.content:
Leaders of the touring Bharathiya Janatha Party who are on a 4 day visit to the island met Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe in parliament today.
 
Discussions between visiting representatives of the BJP & Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe had touched on the country’s current political atmosphere.
 
According to the UNP’s media unit the TNA would be briefed in future with regards to the contents of the discussion.

hits._id: A revelation made by the president

_source.content: Presudent Maithripala Sirisena says 46% of the prisoners in 2015 have pleaded guilty for cases regarding drugs.President Sirisena made this remark at an event held in Colombo in order to celebrate the 100th anniversary of Sri Lanka Prisoners' welfare association.Meanwhile, Chief of Naval Staff of the Pakistan Navy, Admiral Muhammad Zakaullah who is in Sri Lanka on an official visit, met with President Sirisena yesterday.

hits._id: Two Court of Appeal judges sworn-in (Photos)

_source.content:
High Court judge M. A. Samayawardene and Senior Solicitor General Arjuna Obeysekere today (Apr. 23) took oaths as judges of Court of Appeal.
They took oaths before President Maithripala Sirisena.

hits._id: Dumping garbage on UDA lands prohibited from May 1st

_source.content: Megapolis and Western Development Ministry stated that it has banned dumping garbage in any land belonging to Urban Development Authority with effect from 1st of May. The ministry, in its communiqué stated that local government authorities should find places to dump their garbage at their own expense hereafter. At the same time, the Ministry has extended its deepest sympathy to the families of those who died under tragic circumstances in the Meethotamulla garbage mount collapse. The ministry communiqué further stated that it presented a special Cabinet paper with regard to Meethotamulla garbage mount last February. Accordingly, the ministry has instructed Colombo Municipal council to stop dumping garbage in Meethotamulla and find alternative locations.

hits._id: China 'appreciates' Lanka's stance on Dalai Lama

_source.content: China said it appreciated Sri Lanka’s stance on the Dalai Lama, as it seems unlikely their government would grant him a visa to visit.Chinese foreign ministry spokesperson told Reuters the government “may not grant a visa” even if certain factions invited the Dalai Lama.He added that Sri Lanka has not changed its stance on its “One China” policy.Sri Lanka is a traditional friendly neighbor of China while the China-Sri Lanka relationship has always developed smoothly.Sri Lanka fully understands and respects China’s concerns on the relevant issue.Chinese Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Hua Chunying told a regular briefing in Beijing that China appreciates the Sri Lankan stance and are willing to work together with Sri Lanka to constantly strengthen the traditional friendly partnership.

hits._id: Charges read in courts against State Min. Fowzie

_source.content:
Case filed against State Minister A.H.M. Fowzie was taken before Colombo Chief Magistrate Lal Ranasinghe today.
Bribery Commission has filed this Case against Minister Fowzie for misusing a government vehicle.
Our correspondent stated that 4 counts of charges had been read before Court today.
Minister Fowzie has been accused of incurring a loss of one million rupees  to the government by taking for personal use, a 20 million worth vehicles donated by the Netherland to the then Disaster Management Ministry in 2012.

hits._id: Local government polls will be held as scheduled in March.

_source.content:
The Provincial Council and Local Government Minister Faizer Mustafa said that local government polls would be held as scheduled, next March.
The minister stated this during the first session of the five member committee, which was appointed to settle the disputes of the gazette published with regard to the de-limitation of wards held in Colombo today.
Representatives from UNP, UPFA, JVP and TNA have been named to the committee which is chaired by a former secretary of the Land Ministry Ashoka Peries.

hits._id: 2000 dog bites per day.

_source.content:
The rabies division of the health Ministry states that 2000 dog bites are reported per day.
 
On average 50 deaths are reported per year due to rabies and the health Ministry points out that there is a considerable increase over the past couple of years.
 
According to the rabies division there are about 3 million stray dogs in Sri lanka.
 
The government spends 50 million rupees per annum for rabies vaccinations.

hits._id: Min. Kariyawasam speaks about GMOA demands

_source.content:
Minister of Education Akila Viraj Kariyawasam said that the demands of the Government Medical Officers' Association cannot be approved.
He was speaking about the requests made by the GMOA in parliament yesterday.
He added the Secretary of the association Dr. Nalinda Herath has enrolled his son into Royal College, Colombo by using his professional status.

hits._id: Video: Act approved despite quorum not being met - revelation in Parliament

_source.content: Parliament convened today under the patronage of Deputy Speaker Chandima Weerakkody.Independent MP Ajith Kumara, stated today in Parliament, that the act to obtain legal permission to build the medical faculty was passed in parliament at a moment when there was no quorum.This act which was presented by the Minister of Health Maithreepala Sirisena was passed with a majority of 15 votes yesterday.When the MP raised the question, Deputy Speaker and opposition leader also joined the debate.

hits._id: President exposes a mud-slinging contract

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has said that a group, led by former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, had contracted a private propaganda institution to initiate a mudslinging campaign against him.
 
President Sirisena revealed this addressing a public rally organized the Pettah Traders Association last evening (Jan. 23).
 
Addressing the gathering, the President said that he would personally take responsibility to ensure the perpetrators of the bond scam and other massive frauds are punished.
 
President also said there's no reduction of pages in the bond report which was published online.
 
He, however, said that certain annexures were not published to ensure confidentiality until the investigations are over.It is found that the Annexure III of the report which contains transcripts of telephone conversations was not released to the public on the Presidential Secretariat website.
 
If those were released the accused persons will try to take undue advantage, the President said.

hits._id: PM says education should not be turned into a political fiasco

_source.content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe says that the aim of the current Government is not to turn education into a political fiasco but to overcome its shortcomings.
Accordingly the Prime Minister said that action should be taken to provide education students up to grade 13.
He made this statement whilst participating at the Muslim Ladies’ College Bambalapitiya annual prize-giving.

hits._id: A programme to educate parents before scholarship exams.

_source.content:
Minister Maithreepala Sirisena states that a methodology should be developed to educate parents regarding the results of the year 5 scholarship exam before the results are released.
 
The minister also stated that the proposal regarding this has already been presented to the ministry of education.
 
Elaborating further while speaking at a function held in Aralaganwila, Minister Sirisena stated that this proposal was put forth after taking into consideration difficulties faced by children due to the behaviour of parents following the release of the results of the year 5 scholarship exam.
 
Meanwhile, The Sri Lanka Human Rights Commission stated that it issued instructions to the National Education Commission to make changes with regard to the methodology of the year 5 scholarship exam and the issuing of results to coincide with the World Children’s Day.
 
35 government officials including the examinations commissioner were summoned before the human rights commission today to provide an explanation with regard to issuing the results of the year 5 scholarship exam on the 1st of October which is the World Children’s Day.

hits._id: Govt. to import rice until April 2018

_source.content:
The government has decided to import rice stocks until April of 2018.
Accordingly, 100,000mt of rice will be imported each month to ensure smooth supply of rice to the market.
The decision was taken at the Cabinet Committee on Economic Management headed by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.  Related story: PM urges supermarkets to introduce 'Fair Price Shops'

hits._id: PM reveals of a revolution in National Government

_source.content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe says that the main objective of the national government is to realize the 4th revolution.
He stated this while attending a meeting with the Kurunegala district representatives of UNP held in Kuliyapitiya this evening.
Expressing his views, the Prime Minister stated that, three revolutions have already taken place in 1948, 1956 and 1977.

hits._id: Special resolution to UNP 70th anniversary central working committee meeting

A special UNP Central Working Committee meeting will be led by party leader, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe on the 70th anniversary which is today. 
UNP General Secretary and Minister Kabeer Hashim told our news team that a special resolution with regard to the future of the party will be passed today when the Central Working Committee meets at 6 o’clock at Sirikotha the party headquarters.
Meanwhile, a Joint Opposition parliamentary group has met with the patronage of former president Mahinda Rajapaksa in the parliament complex this morning. 
Joint Opposition MP Dinesh Gunawardana said that he expects to ask the Prime Minister about the assault on the Sri Lankan High Commissioner to Malaysia.

hits._id: Video : Serve the public, President tells local government representatives

_source.content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa tells the local government representatives that they should dedicate themselves at maximum level to public service thinking anew about people’s needs. The President points out that people’s representatives are appointed for taking action for the wellbeing of the people and not for one’s own personeel wellbeing. President Mahinda Rajapaksa said so while inaugurating the new Veera-kaetiya Divisional Council office complex last afternoon.

hits._id: Ranil, Karu and Sajith meet this week - Working Committee final decision on Nov 4.

UNP General Secretary Tissa Attanayake said that Party Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe, MPs Karu Jayasuriya and Sajith Premadasa will meet this week and have another round of discussions to resolve the existing party crises.

He also said that the UNP Working Committee will study the outcome of the trio’s meeting and take a final decision when it meets on November 4th.

UNP General Secretary also charged the government for its failure to disclose its expenditure on the CHOGM.

He further said that the UNP has organized a protest on November 7th demanding the government to withdraw the Casino gazette notification.

hits._id: Protest in London against recalling Brig. Priyanka (Photos)

_source.content: A group of Sri Lankans staged a demonstration in front of the British Parliament yesterday (Feb. 24) against recalling of Brig. Priyanka Fernando, the Defence Attache of the High Commission in London.He was recalled over an incident which occurred during a protest staged by a group of LTTE supporters on 4th of February.Following that incident was widely publicized by Social Media, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs directed the High Commissioner in London to terminate the service of Brig. Priyanka Fernando.However, he was reinstated following a direct order by President Maithripala Sirisena.Despite, this, the Sri Lanka Army recalled the Brigadier last week, citing it was done to ensure his security.Our correspondent said a large number of Sri Lankans living in the UK attended the demonstration held in London.

hits._id: A decisive discussion between the Prime Minister and Trade unions

_source.content: Representatives of many trade unions are currently engaged in a meeting with Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe at temple trees.Our correspondent stated that the meeting commenced at 3 pm.The discussion will look to obtain the views of the Trade Union Leaders regarding the budget and steps that can be taken to address any concerns.The proposed trade union action on the 15th of this month will also be taken up for discussion.However the National trade union centre affiliated to the JVP is not attending the discussion.

_source.content: JVP announced today that it would not accept any ministerial portfolios in the President Maithripala Sirisena's National Unity Government.Speaking at a media briefing held today Leader of the JVP Anura Kumara Dissanayake said; "We got invitation from the government to join , but we will never be attached to the government and we will not  join the cabinet. "He also questioned what can be done within 100 days and noted that one cannot expect big changes within 100 days which is very minimal.  He also expressed views on former ministers attempting to crossover in anticipation of ministerial portfolios.

hits._id: Ready for a transformation era; a statement from Common candidate Maithripala Sirisena.

_source.content: Common candidate for the Presidential Election Maithripala Sirisena states that an exemplary political campaign will be initiated to create a transformation era.Maithripala Sirisena made this statement during a discussion held with members of the people’s movement for a just society held at Kotte, Sri Naga Viharaya.Former Minister Rajitha Senarathna and several UNP representatives also participated in the discussion.

hits._id: Top UN official to arrive in Sri Lanka

_source.content:
The UN Under-Secretary-General for Political Affairs, Jeffrey Feltman will arrive in the country on Friday for a special tour.
 
He is scheduled to have discussions with President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, political party leaders and the civil organization representatives.
 
Addressing the journalists at the daily media briefing held yesterday, Media Spokesperson of the UN Secretary-General, Stephane Dujarric said that the Under Secretary for Political Affairs will engage in the tour despite the prevailing state of emergency in the island.
 
He will stay in the country until 11th of March.
Meanwhile, the special envoy of the Anti-Personnel Mine Ban Convention, Prince Mired Al-Hussein of Jordan engaged in an inspection tour in Muhamalai in Jaffna yesterday (Mar. 06).
Prince Mired has said that in comparison to other countries, Sri Lanka has been ahead in clearing anti-personnel mines.
Security Forces’ Commander in Jaffna, Major General Darshana Hettiaarachchi joined the visiting special envoy.
Prince Mired Al Hussein is scheduled to meet Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe today.

hits._id: UNP decision on minister Wijedasa to be announced this afternoon

_source.content:
Ministerial Committee appointed by the UNP Central Working Committee to make recommendations on actions to be taken on Justice Minister Dr. Wijedasa Rajapaksha is scheduled to hand over their report to Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe today (21).
Deputy Minister Ajith P. Perera told our news team that the said recommendations will be presented probably by this afternoon.
Meanwhile, the UNP group meeting will be held with the patronage of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe at Temple Trees this afternoon.
Although Minister Wijedasa’s issue was not on the agenda, it is reported that the matter will definitely be taken up at the meeting.
The UNP Central Working Committee meeting discussed the Wijedasa Rajapaksa issue in detail when it met at Sirikotha last week (17).
A resolution citing that Minister Wijedasa has breached the party’s faith, was also passed at the Central Working Committee meeting.
Later, a committee was appointed comprising of party Chairman Malik Samarawickrama, Minister of Finance and Media, Mangala Samaraweera and State Minister Ravindra Samaraweera.
The committee has already met several occasions to discuss the issue.

She urged Manmohan Singh to instruct the external affairs ministry to summon the Sri Lankan high commissioner to lodge a protest against.

The Ministry stated that the development of the school will take place under its 3 key facts.

hits._id: International intervention will be opposed irrespective of party differences: UNP

_source.content: The United National Party says that international intervention will be opposed irrespective of party differences and such a threat could be avoided only by safeguarding democracy, human rights and law and order.Chief Opposition Whip John Amarathunga meanwhile stated that they abstained from voting on the proposal brought by the government against an international inquiry by the UNHRC, as the government had not responded to the amendments proposed by them.However, the Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs W D J Seneviratne stated that the Oppositions amendments were not included as they were not relevant to the Proposal submitted to parliament.

hits._id: A celebration devoid of ethnicity, caste or community; President says in New Year Message

_source.content:
President Maithripala Sirisena in his message for the Sinhala and Tamil New Year said that what is special in this New Year celebration is the spread of festivity that transcends differences of ethnicity, caste and community, with important strides being taken to realize the need for unity among everyone.
This is a time to realize that throughout history our strength as a nation has come from the mutual understanding and co-existence that made us rise together to defend our Motherland.
The President also stated that as part of the Government’s vision to rid the country from drugs and alcohol, he anticipates that people would refrain from partaking or offering alcohol and tobacco during this festive occasion.
Meanwhile, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe in his Sinhala and Tamil New Year message stated that it is a privilege for all people, being able to celebrate the New Year as a community which respects democracy, humanity and cultural values.
He stated that a peaceful environment is prevalent in the Country to celebrate the Sinhala and Tamil New Year freely.
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa issuing a New Year message said that all citizens are fortunate to celebrate the New Year in a country where there are no gun shots fired.

hits._id: Budget proposes a Controlled price for rice;  Tax concessions for foreign investors

_source.content:
Presenting the maiden budget of the unity government to parliament this afternoon, Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake announced that prices of 11 essential consumer items have been reduced. In addition, the special levy on potatoes and big onions has also been waived.

Meanwhile the price of a domestic LPG gas cylinder has been reduced by 150 rupees,  while the price of a liter of kerosene has been decreased by 10 rupees.

The finance minister said that the new budget has focused on building a strong middle class by generating one million job opportunities, developing infrastructure and building a sound rural Economy.

He said that an authority would be set up to regulate micro financial institutions.
  
Accordingly, all micro financial institutions should pay an annual fee and obtain registration from the regulatory body. At the same time a joint program would be set up to grant loans for small and medium entrepreneurs.

The budget also proposed to give a certified price of 50 rupees for a kilogram of Keeri Samba, 48 rupees for Samba and 38 rupees for a kilogram of Nadu. The government expects that ,  price control will benefit the consumers to buy rice at around 65 rupees a kilogram.

At the same time, a fertilizer subsidiary of 25 thousand rupees would be introduced for small farmers and keeping it under a ceiling of one hectare per farmer.

Import tax on fruit and vegetable processing machinery would be waived and a 30 rupees subsidiary would be granted for production of powered milk,  thereby reducing the price of a 400 gram packet of powdered milk from 325 rupees to 295.
  
The budget also proposes to give one million rupees insurance cover for fishermen.

At the same time, 1500 million rupees would be granted to set up village development clusters at every grama sevaka divisions. 

The tax which is charged on transferring lands to foreigners will be removed completely, and the super tax would also be removed.  One hundred thousand houses will be built in the next five years to shelter families in the low income bracket.
  
The tax on gold import has been removed and 50 permits will be issued to import gold under this scheme.

The import duty on cranes and concrete mixtures will also be removed and a 10 thousand rupees allowance has been proposed to be paid for the trainees in the construction industry.

Tax on steel, tile, and sanitary wear would be reduced , while tax on 15 items including garments, shoes and electrical equipment will be removed. 
The charge for a Bank Draft will be reduced from 250 rupees to 150 rupees.

The Finance Minster also proposed to amalgamate the Divi Neguma Fund and the National Savings Bank.  At the same time, concessions have been proposed for private banks when they open their branches overseas.

Meanwhile the budget has proposed to amend the Security and Exchange Comission Regulatory Act to develop the Colombo Share Market. 

 a separate institution will be set up for the clearing activities of Treasury bonds.

The import tax on printed books and magazines has been completely removed and university students will be granted loans to buy laptop computers. 

 At the same time, the Finance Minister announced that a new university to be  name of Mahapola will be set up in Malabe.

hits._id: One-hour cleaning period from today help prevent the spread of Dengue

_source.content: Presidential Task Force on Prevention of Dengue and the Ministry of Health have set up a program where they have made it a compulsory requirement that all private residences, public institutions, and private company’s dedicate one hour a week to “clean up”,The program, aimed at reducing breeding sites for dengue mostiques,  will be implemented from 9.30 to 10.30 a.m. every Friday. health officers and Tri- Forces personnel will be carrying out inspections .A three month Dengue prevention program is already in progress, a directive from  President Maithripala Sirisena and Health Minister Rajitha Senaratne.the Health Ministry stated that the subject minister, Rajitha Senarathna has requested the President to declare it a disaster situation to manage garbage dumping, which has been a main cause for spread of dengue. 62 thousand 857 dengue cases have been reported so far this year, making it  the highest number of cases ever reported within a year.

hits._id: President addresses the UN General Assembly today.

The Presidential Media Division said that the President would deliver his address during the slot between 7.30 and 8. 30 tonight local time.
Meanwhile, US President Barak Obama commended the commitment and efforts taken by President Maithripala Sirisena to strengthen good governance and democracy in Sri Lanka.
The US President met President Sirisena on the sidelines of 70th United Nations General Assembly sessions in New York yesterday.
The US President expressed his happiness over the changes that took place in Sri Lanka.
President Maithripala Sirisena in turn said that his expectations were to build reconciliation in the country in the future.
President Sirisena sought US assistance in alleviating poverty in Sri Lanka.
US President Barack Obama promised his country’s fullest support to President Sirisena’s request.

hits._id: Update : Video : President Rajapakse pays last respects to Nelson Mandela

_source.content: President Mahinda Rajapaksa has paid his last respects to South Africa’s first black president Nelson Mandela today where the latter’s body was laying, at the Union Building in Pretoria.Nelson Mandela was also sworn-in as the first black president of South Africa in the same building in 1994.The Presidents Media Unit stated that President Rajapaksa also participated in the mass memorial service held for Mandela at the FNB Sports ground in Johannesburg yesterday. Meanwhile, President Mahinda Rajapaksa will undertake a four day official visit to Kenya today.During this visit the President will hold bilateral discussions with Kenyan President Uhuru Kenyata.The President during this visit will also attend a round table conference with the officials of the UN environmental programme and the UN habitat programme.Update : Wednesday, 11 December 2013 - 6:53 PM-----------------------------------------------------------------------------President pays his last respects to Nelson Mandela's remains today.President Mahinda Rajapaksa who has gone to South Africa to participate in former South African President Nelson Mandela’s funeral will proceed to the city of Pretoria today to pay his last respects to the late South African President’s remains.President’s media Unit said that President Mahinda Rajapaksa would pay his last respects to the former South African President’s remains lying in state at the Union Building in Pretoria.The President also participated in the official religious memorial ceremony held at the FNB stadium in Johannesburg yesterday.  Wednesday, 11 December 2013 - 8:03 AM-----------------------------------President Rajapaksha participates in the Mandela memorial service.Tens of thousands of South Africans have joined dozens of world leaders for the national memorial service for former President Nelson Mandela. President Mahinda Rajapaksha also participated in the memorial service along with 91 head of states. The service was held in front of a voluble crowd in the FNB stadium in Johannesburg. US President Barack Obama said Mandela was a "giant of history", adding: I quote "The world thanks you for sharing Nelson Mandela with us". UnquoteThe memorial service is one of the biggest gatherings of international dignitaries in recent years. The country is observing a series of commemorations leading up to the funeral on Sunday.

hits._id: Sri Lanka ready to lead the business innovation in the region, President says at Asia Cooperation Dialogue

_source.content: President Maithripala Sirisena said that Sri Lanka is ready to be the leading force of science and technology and innovation in the Asian region. Addressing the Asia Cooperation Dialogue being held in Bangkok this morning, President Sirisena said that the emerging Asia will become the global economic and financial hub within the next few years. He further said that Asian nations should implement a program to share knowledge in several sectors among fellow countries.  President Sirisena also said that the vision and the road map of the Asia Cooperation Dialogue 2030, to be passed during the summit will help immensely to achieve sustainable development in the region. Meanwhile, visiting President Maithripala Sirisena met his Iranian counterpart Dr. Hassan Rouhani in Bangkok this afternoon. Dr. Rouhani extended an invitation to President Sirisena to visit Iran during their meeting.  He also said that his country expects to streamline the supply of oil to Sri Lanka in order to contribute to its economic development. In addition, Iranian President Rouhani has proposed to President Sirisena to improve the current export import business between the two countries.  Responding to Dr. Rouhani, President Sirisena said that Iran and Sri Lanka maintain bilateral relations with a great understanding of the internal issues of both countries.

hits._id: Wildlife Conservation officers go to Wilpaththu in search of more facts after Hiru CIA revelation

_source.content:
A group of officers from the Wildlife Conservation Department engaged in an inspection tour in Wilaththikulam area adjoining Wilpaththu today, for further investigations on the deforestation activities taking place in the area which were exposed by Hiru, CIA in the past few days.
The officers stated that a report on the current situation in the area around the Wilaththikulam forest reserve will be produced to the Director General of the Wildlife Conservation Department.
In the past few days, Hiru CIA revealed about the illegal forest clearing and construction activities taking place in Wilaththikulam forest reserve adjoining Wilpaththu national park.
Responding immediately, President Maithripala Sirisena issued directives to the respective authorities to immediately investigate into the matter.
The President furthermore ordered the authorities to broaden the borders of Wilpaththu National Park, including all the adjoining forest reserves and to gazette it.
The President also instructed the authorities to appoint a special inspection team including journalists, to compile a report on the constant deforestation activities taking place in Mannar and Puttlam districts.
Accordingly, a special inspection team from the Wildlife Conservation Department was dispatched to the area of concern today.
Hiru CIA and Venerable Pahiyangala Ananda Sagara Thera of the Environmental Organizations Collective too joined the inspection team and witnessed the construction and infrastructure development activities in the area being expedited.   
These illegal forest clearing activities are taking place in woods designated as a reserved forest under extraordinary gazette number 1759 / 2 dated 21st May 2012.
President Maithripala Sirisena once stated that this illegal resettlement carried out based on political requirements of the previous government sets a wrong example.
However, it can be seen that the president’s name has been used in providing infrastructure facilities such as electricity. 
We further observed that construction activities are taking place in the area disregarding the orders made by President Maithripalaa Sirisena in May last year.

hits._id: Croton and Jak leaves exhibited at the Nugegoda joint opposition rally

_source.content: An agitation rally organized by the Joint Opposition titled “Peraliyaka Arambuma” is now being held at the Ananda Samarakoon open Theatre in Nugegoda.The rally is being held against the proposed new constitution, cost of living, theft and corruption, delay of local government polls and selling off of public enterprises.Members of parliament, provincial councils and former local government institution members who represent the Joint Opposition are participating in the rally.Our correspondents state that several leaders of political parties and artistes are also present on the stage.It has been observed that some participants had brought Croton and Jak leaves to the meeting premises.Meanwhile, heavy traffic was reported in Nugegoda and in surrounding roads due to the ongoing rally.Addressing the rally, MP Rohitha Abeygunawardana said it was the historic rally which heralds the downfall of the current government.

hits._id: Seating Indefinite Till Speaker's Appointment.

_source.content:
The Secretary General of Parliament Dhammika Dasanayake said, according to parliament standing orders,  a MP elect for the new parliament can sit anywhere inside the chambers until a speaker is elected.
The 8th parliament is scheduled to be inaugurated at 9.30 tomorrow morning. 
Parliament Secretary General Dasanayake told our news team that seating arrangements have not yet been finalized although the new parliament begins tomorrow morning.
However seating have been already arranged for the president, the prime minister and the three ministers who have already been sworn in.
All MPs elect to be sworn in after a speaker is elected for the new parliament tomorrow. 
Parliament Secretary General Dasanayake said that a deputy speaker and deputy chairman of committees would be elected thereafter.
Later when house sits in the afternoon, President Maithreepala Sirisena is to present the government’s policy statement to parliament.

hits._id: “2018 Budget to empower private sector” - Mangala Samaraweera tells IFC Director

_source.content:
Minister of Finance and Media, Mangala Samaraweera says that 2018 Budget is aimed at creating a robust, flourishing and modern economy and will focus on a start-up culture of “empowering the private sector”.  
The Minister disclosed this during a meeting with the Director for South Asia of the International Finance Corporation of the World Bank, Mengistu Alemayehu, in Washington.
The Minister is in Washington to attend the Annual Meeting of the International Monetary Fund and World Bank.
The discussion was focused on ways and means of enhancing mutual cooperation between Sri Lanka and the IFC to promote private sector contribution to the economic development of Sri Lanka.
Minister Samaraweera commended the cooperation extended by the IFC towards promoting the private sector contribution to the development of the country’s economy at a time where the government has accorded high priority to private sector involvement in the economy by way of Public-Private Partnerships.
Minister Mangala Samaraweera, who is scheduled to present his maiden Budget Speech on 9th of November.

hits._id: National Government Ministers pledge to safeguard collective responsibility; Code of Ethics for Ministers

hits._id: President directs speedy action to contain viral flu in South

hits._id: US House Committee delegation meets President and PM

_source.content:
A delegation from the US House Committee on Armed Services met President Maithripala Sirisena at the President’s Official Residence in Colombo, today (May 30).  
 
The delegation comprised of Chairman of the US House Committee on Armed Services, Mac Thornberry, Henry Cuellar, Vickie Hartzler and Carol Shea-Porter.
 
During this meeting, the President said that Sri Lanka is a country, which will work with the cooperative and friendly manner with the international community.
 
He recalled the assistance given by the US in training Sri Lankan forces.
 
President Sirisena said that the cooperation of the United States Security forces is important to control the ways that drugs smuggled into the country.
 
The Congress committee members who agreed to provide assistance to prevent drug trafficking in Sri Lanka mentioned that it is their country’s policy to give necessary assistance in order to build Sri Lanka as a strong and prosperous country.
 
The US delegation also met with Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.
 
The meeting took place at Temple Trees this morning (May 30).

hits._id: CCTV cameras to monitor ballot paper printing

_source.content:
Acting Government Printer Lalith de Silva says that special security measures have been provided in printing ballot papers for the upcoming Provincial Council elections.
He told our news team that apart from police protection, a network of CCTV cameras has been installed to monitor the printing process.
However UNP Kurunegala District MP Gamini Jayawickrema Perera told Parliament yesterday that the Government Press was not following the stipulated regulations and procedures in printing ballot papers.
He said police protection was not provided in printing ballot papers.
When our news team contacted Acting Government Printer Lalith de Silva, he said that he would clarify the matter if MP Jayawickrama Perera is connected to him.
Accordingly, our news team connected via conference call both Government Printer Lalith de Silva and UNP MP Jayawickrama Perera and this was there recorded conversation.

			   
			   		
	
			   
The printing of over 500,000 ballot papers for the upcoming Provincial Council elections commenced today and printing should be completed by the 24th of this month.

hits._id: PM Promises To Fight Corruption, Strengthen Economy, Develop The Country

_source.content:
Prime Minister (PM) Ranil Wickremesinghe yesterday (May 01) vowed to fight corruption, strengthen the economy, and develop the nation into a high income country by 2020.
Addressing a massive crowd in the United National Party's (UNP) May Day rally held in Campbell Park, in Colombo the Prime Minister said the government is committed in to strengthen the island's economy and bring down the high cost of living.
He said the government is determined to seek assistance from the international community to develop the country and take adequate measures to double the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of Sri Lanka by 2020. According to him the government will present a new developed nation by 2020 and had already launched a megapolis development program, which would transform the capital and its suburbs.
Prime Minister Wickremesinghe assured that the government will not privatize state owned enterprises. He said the government would create an independent fund to manage all profits made by state owned enterprises. "We will work towards getting these profits back to the people. We will not privatize any state enterprise," he said.
The UNP Leader said the government's main goal is to deliver on the promise of creating one million jobs and also the government is working towards a fairer pay model for all workers by 2020.

hits._id: Is Govt. Attempting to Threaten Electronic Media via New Independent Media Regulation Authority?

_source.content:
National Freedom Front leader MP Wimal Weerawansa says that the Yahapalana government is plotting to overly scrutinize electronic media by establishing an independent media regulation authority.
This remark was made in a press conference held in Colombo yesterday.
He further accuses the government for attempting to cover the true facts, figures and news about the current government in name of an independent media regulation authority framework.   Wimal Weerawansa further unveiled that a powerful minister’s verbal threatening to an owner of one of Sri Lanka’s leading media organizations to publish news in favour of the government or to get their media license cancelled.
The MP severely criticized this government’s vivid hostility towards electronic media where as media organizations are condemned inside the parliament and ministers threaten media organizations while establishing an independent media regulation authority to fulfill their media aspirations by impeding true service of media.Scroll down to listen MP Wimal Weerawansa'a comments on the government's newest trick on media...

hits._id: Government tables in Minimum Wage Bill

_source.content:
A Bill was presented in Parliament yesterday (10th) to set the national minimum monthly wage for all workers in any industry or service at Rs. 10,000, while the national minimum daily wage of a worker will be Rs. 400.
Once passed in the Parliament, the law will have retrospective effect from January 1st, 2016.
According to the parliament, the national minimum wage is the pay after deducting all contributions of all sorts.
Parliamentary sources reveal that along with the minimum wage bill, the government also tabled in a Bill for the payment of a Budgetary Relief Allowance up to Rs. 2,500 to each private sector employee who draws a salary less than Rs. 40,000 per month.
